IAST: somasya mā tavasaṁ vakṣy agne vahniṁ cakartha vidathe yajadhyai
Griffith: THOU, Agni, who wilt have the strong, hast made me the Soma's priest, to worship in assembly.
Devanāgarī: सोमस्य मा तवसं वक्ष्यग्ने वह्निं चकर्थ विदथे यजध्यै
pada pāṭha: somasya | mā | tavasam | vakṣi | agne | vahnim | cakartha | vidathe | yajadhyai || devān | accha | dīdyat | yuñje | adrim | śam-āye | agne | tanvam | juṣasva ||3.1.1||

IAST: devām̐ acchā dīdyad yuñje adriṁ śamāye agne tanvaṁ juṣasva
Griffith: Thou shinest to the Gods, I set the pressstones. I toil; be joyful in thyself, O Agni.
Devanāgarī: देवाँ अच्छा दीद्यद्युञ्जे अद्रिं शमाये अग्ने तन्वं जुषस्व
pada pāṭha: somasya | mā | tavasam | vakṣi | agne | vahnim | cakartha | vidathe | yajadhyai || devān | accha | dīdyat | yuñje | adrim | śam-āye | agne | tanvam | juṣasva ||3.1.1||

IAST: prāñcaṁ yajñaṁ cakṛma vardhatāṁ gīḥ samidbhir agniṁ namasā duvasyan
Griffith: East have we turned the rite; may the hymn aid it. With wood and worship shall they honour Agni.
Devanāgarī: प्राञ्चं यज्ञं चकृम वर्धतां गीः समिद्भिरग्निं नमसा दुवस्यन्
pada pāṭha: prāñcam | yajñam | cakr̥ma | vardhatām | gīḥ | samit-bhiḥ | agnim | namasā | duvasyan || divaḥ | śaśāsuḥ | vidathā | kavīnām | gr̥tsāya | cit | tavase | gātum | īṣuḥ ||3.1.2||

IAST: divaḥ śaśāsur vidathā kavīnāṁ gṛtsāya cit tavase gātum īṣuḥ
Griffith: From heaven the synods of the wise have learnt it: c'en for the quick and strong they seek advancement.
Devanāgarī: दिवः शशासुर्विदथा कवीनां गृत्साय चित्तवसे गातुमीषुः
pada pāṭha: prāñcam | yajñam | cakr̥ma | vardhatām | gīḥ | samit-bhiḥ | agnim | namasā | duvasyan || divaḥ | śaśāsuḥ | vidathā | kavīnām | gr̥tsāya | cit | tavase | gātum | īṣuḥ ||3.1.2||

IAST: mayo dadhe medhiraḥ pūtadakṣo divaḥ subandhur januṣā pṛthivyāḥ
Griffith: The Prudent, he whose will is pure, brought welfare, allied by birth to Heaven and Earth in kinship.
Devanāgarī: मयो दधे मेधिरः पूतदक्षो दिवः सुबन्धुर्जनुषा पृथिव्याः
pada pāṭha: mayaḥ | dadhe | medhiraḥ | pūta-dakṣaḥ | divaḥ | su-bandhuḥ | januṣā | pr̥thivyāḥ || avindan | ūm̐ iti | darśatam | ap-su | antaḥ | devāsaḥ | agnim | apasi | svasr̥̄ṇām ||3.1.3||

IAST: avindann u darśatam apsv antar devāso agnim apasi svasṝṇām
Griffith: The Gods discovered in the midst of waters beautiful Agni with the Sisters' labour.
Devanāgarī: अविन्दन्नु दर्शतमप्स्वन्तर्देवासो अग्निमपसि स्वसॄणाम्
pada pāṭha: mayaḥ | dadhe | medhiraḥ | pūta-dakṣaḥ | divaḥ | su-bandhuḥ | januṣā | pr̥thivyāḥ || avindan | ūm̐ iti | darśatam | ap-su | antaḥ | devāsaḥ | agnim | apasi | svasr̥̄ṇām ||3.1.3||

IAST: avardhayan subhagaṁ sapta yahvīḥ śvetaṁ jajñānam aruṣam mahitvā
Griffith: Him, Blessed One, the Seven strong Floods augmented, him white at birth and red when waxen mighty.
Devanāgarī: अवर्धयन्सुभगं सप्त यह्वीः श्वेतं जज्ञानमरुषं महित्वा
pada pāṭha: avardhayan | su-bhagam | sapta | yahvīḥ | śvetam | jajñānam | aruṣam | mahi-tvā || śiśum | na | jātam | abhi | āruḥ | aśvāḥ | devāsaḥ | agnim | janiman | vapuṣyan ||3.1.4||

IAST: śiśuṁ na jātam abhy ārur aśvā devāso agniṁ janiman vapuṣyan
Griffith: As mother mares run to their new-born you ling, so at his birth the Gods wondered at Agni.
Devanāgarī: शिशुं न जातमभ्यारुरश्वा देवासो अग्निं जनिमन्वपुष्यन्
pada pāṭha: avardhayan | su-bhagam | sapta | yahvīḥ | śvetam | jajñānam | aruṣam | mahi-tvā || śiśum | na | jātam | abhi | āruḥ | aśvāḥ | devāsaḥ | agnim | janiman | vapuṣyan ||3.1.4||

IAST: śukrebhir aṅgai raja ātatanvān kratum punānaḥ kavibhiḥ pavitraiḥ
Griffith: Spreading with radiant limbs throughout the region, purging his power with wise purifications,
Devanāgarī: शुक्रेभिरङ्गै रज आततन्वान्क्रतुं पुनानः कविभिः पवित्रैः
pada pāṭha: śukrebhiḥ | aṅgaiḥ | rajaḥ | ā-tatanvān | kratum | punānaḥ | kavi-bhiḥ | pavitraiḥ || śociḥ | vasānaḥ | pari | āyuḥ | apām | śriyaḥ | mimīte | br̥hatīḥ | anūnāḥ ||3.1.5||

IAST: śocir vasānaḥ pary āyur apāṁ śriyo mimīte bṛhatīr anūnāḥ
Griffith: Robing himself in light, the life of waters, lie spreads abroad his high and perfect glories.
Devanāgarī: शोचिर्वसानः पर्यायुरपां श्रियो मिमीते बृहतीरनूनाः
pada pāṭha: śukrebhiḥ | aṅgaiḥ | rajaḥ | ā-tatanvān | kratum | punānaḥ | kavi-bhiḥ | pavitraiḥ || śociḥ | vasānaḥ | pari | āyuḥ | apām | śriyaḥ | mimīte | br̥hatīḥ | anūnāḥ ||3.1.5||

IAST: vavrājā sīm anadatīr adabdhā divo yahvīr avasānā anagnāḥ
Griffith: He sought heaven's Mighty Ones, the unconsuming, the unimpaired, not clothed and yet not naked.
Devanāgarī: वव्राजा सीमनदतीरदब्धा दिवो यह्वीरवसाना अनग्नाः
pada pāṭha: vavrāja | sīm | anadatīḥ | adabdhāḥ | divaḥ | yahvīḥ | avasānāḥ | anagnāḥ || sanāḥ | atra | yuvatayaḥ | sa-yonīḥ | ekam | garbham | dadhire | sapta | vāṇīḥ ||3.1.6||

IAST: sanā atra yuvatayaḥ sayonīr ekaṁ garbhaṁ dadhire sapta vāṇīḥ
Griffith: Then they, ancient and young, who dwell together, Seven sounding Rivers, as one germ received him.
Devanāgarī: सना अत्र युवतयः सयोनीरेकं गर्भं दधिरे सप्त वाणीः
pada pāṭha: vavrāja | sīm | anadatīḥ | adabdhāḥ | divaḥ | yahvīḥ | avasānāḥ | anagnāḥ || sanāḥ | atra | yuvatayaḥ | sa-yonīḥ | ekam | garbham | dadhire | sapta | vāṇīḥ ||3.1.6||

IAST: stīrṇā asya saṁhato viśvarūpā ghṛtasya yonau sravathe madhūnām
Griffith: His piles, assuming every form, are scattered where flow sweet waters, at the spring of fatness;
Devanāgarī: स्तीर्णा अस्य संहतो विश्वरूपा घृतस्य योनौ स्रवथे मधूनाम्
pada pāṭha: stīrṇāḥ | asya | sam-hataḥ | viśva-rūpāḥ | ghr̥tasya | yonau | sravathe | madhūnām || asthuḥ | atra | dhenavaḥ | pinvamānāḥ | mahī iti | dasmasya | mātarā | samīcī iti sam-īcī ||3.1.7||

IAST: asthur atra dhenavaḥ pinvamānā mahī dasmasya mātarā samīcī
Griffith: There stood the milch-kine with full-laden udders, and both paired Mighty Mothers of the Wondrous.
Devanāgarī: अस्थुरत्र धेनवः पिन्वमाना मही दस्मस्य मातरा समीची
pada pāṭha: stīrṇāḥ | asya | sam-hataḥ | viśva-rūpāḥ | ghr̥tasya | yonau | sravathe | madhūnām || asthuḥ | atra | dhenavaḥ | pinvamānāḥ | mahī iti | dasmasya | mātarā | samīcī iti sam-īcī ||3.1.7||

IAST: babhrāṇaḥ sūno sahaso vy adyaud dadhānaḥ śukrā rabhasā vapūṁṣi
Griffith: Carefully cherished, Son of Strength, thou shoncst assuming lasting and refulgent beauties.
Devanāgarī: बभ्राणः सूनो सहसो व्यद्यौद्दधानः शुक्रा रभसा वपूंषि
pada pāṭha: babhrāṇaḥ | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | vi | adyaut | dadhānaḥ | śukrā | rabhasā | vapūṁṣi || ścotanti | dhārāḥ | madhunaḥ | ghr̥tasya | vr̥ṣā | yatra | vavr̥dhe | kāvyena ||3.1.8||

IAST: ścotanti dhārā madhuno ghṛtasya vṛṣā yatra vāvṛdhe kāvyena
Griffith: Full streams of fatness and sweet juice descended, there where the Mighty One grew strong by wisdom.
Devanāgarī: श्चोतन्ति धारा मधुनो घृतस्य वृषा यत्र वावृधे काव्येन
pada pāṭha: babhrāṇaḥ | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | vi | adyaut | dadhānaḥ | śukrā | rabhasā | vapūṁṣi || ścotanti | dhārāḥ | madhunaḥ | ghr̥tasya | vr̥ṣā | yatra | vavr̥dhe | kāvyena ||3.1.8||

IAST: pituś cid ūdhar januṣā viveda vy asya dhārā asṛjad vi dhenāḥ
Griffith: From birth he knew even his Father's bosom, he set his voices and his streams in motion;
Devanāgarī: पितुश्चिदूधर्जनुषा विवेद व्यस्य धारा असृजद्वि धेनाः
pada pāṭha: pituḥ | cit | ūdhaḥ | januṣā | viveda | vi | asya | dhārāḥ | asr̥jat | vi | dhenāḥ || guhā | carantam | sakhi-bhiḥ | śivebhiḥ | divaḥ | yahvībhiḥ | na | guhā | babhūva ||3.1.9||

IAST: guhā carantaṁ sakhibhiḥ śivebhir divo yahvībhir na guhā babhūva
Griffith: Knew him who moved with blessed Friends in secret, with the young Dames of heaven. He stayed not hidden.
Devanāgarī: गुहा चरन्तं सखिभिः शिवेभिर्दिवो यह्वीभिर्न गुहा बभूव
pada pāṭha: pituḥ | cit | ūdhaḥ | januṣā | viveda | vi | asya | dhārāḥ | asr̥jat | vi | dhenāḥ || guhā | carantam | sakhi-bhiḥ | śivebhiḥ | divaḥ | yahvībhiḥ | na | guhā | babhūva ||3.1.9||

IAST: pituś ca garbhaṁ janituś ca babhre pūrvīr eko adhayat pīpyānāḥ
Griffith: He nursed the Infant of the Sire and Maker: alone the Babe sucked many a teeming bosom.
Devanāgarī: पितुश्च गर्भं जनितुश्च बभ्रे पूर्वीरेको अधयत्पीप्यानाः
pada pāṭha: pituḥ | ca | garbham | janituḥ | ca | babhre | pūrvīḥ | ekaḥ | adhayat | pīpyānāḥ || vr̥ṣṇe | sapatnī iti sa-patnī | śucaye | sabandhū iti sa-bandhū | ubhe iti | asmai | manuṣye iti | ni | pāhi ||3.1.10||

IAST: vṛṣṇe sapatnī śucaye sabandhū ubhe asmai manuṣye ni pāhi
Griffith: Guard, for the Bright and Strong, the fellow-spouses friendly to men and bound to him in kinship.
Devanāgarī: वृष्णे सपत्नी शुचये सबन्धू उभे अस्मै मनुष्ये नि पाहि
pada pāṭha: pituḥ | ca | garbham | janituḥ | ca | babhre | pūrvīḥ | ekaḥ | adhayat | pīpyānāḥ || vr̥ṣṇe | sapatnī iti sa-patnī | śucaye | sabandhū iti sa-bandhū | ubhe iti | asmai | manuṣye iti | ni | pāhi ||3.1.10||

IAST: urau mahām̐ anibādhe vavardhāpo agniṁ yaśasaḥ saṁ hi pūrvīḥ
Griffith: The Mighty One increased in space unbounded; full many a glorious flood gave strength to Agni.
Devanāgarī: उरौ महाँ अनिबाधे ववर्धापो अग्निं यशसः सं हि पूर्वीः
pada pāṭha: urau | mahān | ani-bādhe | vavardha | āpaḥ | agnim | yaśasaḥ | sam | hi | pūrvīḥ || r̥tasya | yonau | aśayat | damūnāḥ | jāmīnām | agniḥ | apasi | svasr̥̄ṇām ||3.1.11||

IAST: ṛtasya yonāv aśayad damūnā jāmīnām agnir apasi svasṝṇām
Griffith: Friend of the house, within the lap of Order lay Agni, in the Sister Rivers' service.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य योनावशयद्दमूना जामीनामग्निरपसि स्वसॄणाम्
pada pāṭha: urau | mahān | ani-bādhe | vavardha | āpaḥ | agnim | yaśasaḥ | sam | hi | pūrvīḥ || r̥tasya | yonau | aśayat | damūnāḥ | jāmīnām | agniḥ | apasi | svasr̥̄ṇām ||3.1.11||

IAST: akro na babhriḥ samithe mahīnāṁ didṛkṣeyaḥ sūnave bhāṛjīkaḥ
Griffith: As keen supporter where great waters gather, light-shedder whom the brood rejoice to look on;
Devanāgarī: अक्रो न बभ्रिः समिथे महीनां दिदृक्षेयः सूनवे भाऋजीकः
pada pāṭha: akraḥ | na | babhriḥ | sam-ithe | mahīnām | didr̥kṣeyaḥ | sūnave | bhāḥ-r̥jīkaḥ || ut | usriyāḥ | janitā | yaḥ | jajāna | apām | garbhaḥ | nr̥-tamaḥ | yahvaḥ | agniḥ ||3.1.12||

IAST: ud usriyā janitā yo jajānāpāṁ garbho nṛtamo yahvo agniḥ
Griffith: He who begat, and will beget, the dawnlights, most manly, Child of Floods, is youthful Agni.
Devanāgarī: उदुस्रिया जनिता यो जजानापां गर्भो नृतमो यह्वो अग्निः
pada pāṭha: akraḥ | na | babhriḥ | sam-ithe | mahīnām | didr̥kṣeyaḥ | sūnave | bhāḥ-r̥jīkaḥ || ut | usriyāḥ | janitā | yaḥ | jajāna | apām | garbhaḥ | nr̥-tamaḥ | yahvaḥ | agniḥ ||3.1.12||

IAST: apāṁ garbhaṁ darśatam oṣadhīnāṁ vanā jajāna subhagā virūpam
Griffith: Him, varied in his form, the lovely Infant of floods and plants the blessed wood hath gendered.
Devanāgarī: अपां गर्भं दर्शतमोषधीनां वना जजान सुभगा विरूपम्
pada pāṭha: apām | garbham | darśatam | oṣadhīnām | vanā | jajāna | su-bhagā | vi-rūpam || devāsaḥ | cit | manasā | sam | hi | jagmuḥ | paniṣṭham | jātam | tavasam | duvasyan ||3.1.13||

IAST: devāsaś cin manasā saṁ hi jagmuḥ paniṣṭhaṁ jātaṁ tavasaṁ duvasyan
Griffith: Gods even, moved in spirit, came around him, and served him at his birth, the Strong, the Wondrous.
Devanāgarī: देवासश्चिन्मनसा सं हि जग्मुः पनिष्ठं जातं तवसं दुवस्यन्
pada pāṭha: apām | garbham | darśatam | oṣadhīnām | vanā | jajāna | su-bhagā | vi-rūpam || devāsaḥ | cit | manasā | sam | hi | jagmuḥ | paniṣṭham | jātam | tavasam | duvasyan ||3.1.13||

IAST: bṛhanta id bhānavo bhāṛjīkam agniṁ sacanta vidyuto na śukrāḥ
Griffith: Like brilliant lightnings, mighty luminaries accompany the light-diffusing Agni,
Devanāgarī: बृहन्त इद्भानवो भाऋजीकमग्निं सचन्त विद्युतो न शुक्राः
pada pāṭha: br̥hantaḥ | it | bhānavaḥ | bhāḥ-r̥jīkam | agnim | sacanta | vi-dyutaḥ | na | śukrāḥ || guhā-iva | vr̥ddham | sadasi | sve | antaḥ | apāre | ūrve | amr̥tam | duhānāḥ ||3.1.14||

IAST: guheva vṛddhaṁ sadasi sve antar apāra ūrve amṛtaṁ duhānāḥ
Griffith: Waxen, as 'twere in secret, in his dwelling, while in the boundless stall they milk out Amrta.
Devanāgarī: गुहेव वृद्धं सदसि स्वे अन्तरपार ऊर्वे अमृतं दुहानाः
pada pāṭha: br̥hantaḥ | it | bhānavaḥ | bhāḥ-r̥jīkam | agnim | sacanta | vi-dyutaḥ | na | śukrāḥ || guhā-iva | vr̥ddham | sadasi | sve | antaḥ | apāre | ūrve | amr̥tam | duhānāḥ ||3.1.14||

IAST: īḻe ca tvā yajamāno havirbhir īḻe sakhitvaṁ sumatiṁ nikāmaḥ
Griffith: I sacrificing serve thee with oblations and crave with longing thy good-will and friendship.
Devanāgarī: ईळे च त्वा यजमानो हविर्भिरीळे सखित्वं सुमतिं निकामः
pada pāṭha: īḷe | ca | tvā | yajamānaḥ | haviḥ-bhiḥ | īḷe | sakhi-tvam | su-matim | ni-kāmaḥ || devaiḥ | avaḥ | mimīhi | sam | jaritre | rakṣa | ca | naḥ | damye-bhiḥ | anīkaiḥ ||3.1.15||

IAST: devair avo mimīhi saṁ jaritre rakṣā ca no damyebhir anīkaiḥ
Griffith: Grant, with the Gods, thy grace to him who lauds thee, protect us with thy rays that guard the homestead.
Devanāgarī: देवैरवो मिमीहि सं जरित्रे रक्षा च नो दम्येभिरनीकैः
pada pāṭha: īḷe | ca | tvā | yajamānaḥ | haviḥ-bhiḥ | īḷe | sakhi-tvam | su-matim | ni-kāmaḥ || devaiḥ | avaḥ | mimīhi | sam | jaritre | rakṣa | ca | naḥ | damye-bhiḥ | anīkaiḥ ||3.1.15||

IAST: upakṣetāras tava supraṇīte 'gne viśvāni dhanyā dadhānāḥ
Griffith: May we, O Agni, thou who leadest wisely, thy followers and masters of all treasures,
Devanāgarī: उपक्षेतारस्तव सुप्रणीतेऽग्ने विश्वानि धन्या दधानाः
pada pāṭha: upa-kṣetāraḥ | tava | su-pranīte | agne | viśvāni | dhanyā | dadhānāḥ || su-retasā | śravasā | tuñjamānāḥ | abhi | syāma | pr̥tanā-yūn | adevān ||3.1.16||

IAST: suretasā śravasā tuñjamānā abhi ṣyāma pṛtanāyūm̐r adevān
Griffith: Strong in the glory of our noble offspring, subdue the godless when they seek the battle.
Devanāgarī: सुरेतसा श्रवसा तुञ्जमाना अभि ष्याम पृतनायूँरदेवान्
pada pāṭha: upa-kṣetāraḥ | tava | su-pranīte | agne | viśvāni | dhanyā | dadhānāḥ || su-retasā | śravasā | tuñjamānāḥ | abhi | syāma | pr̥tanā-yūn | adevān ||3.1.16||

IAST: ā devānām abhavaḥ ketur agne mandro viśvāni kāvyāni vidvān
Griffith: Ensign of Gods hast thou become, O Agni, joy-giver, knower of all secret wisdom.
Devanāgarī: आ देवानामभवः केतुरग्ने मन्द्रो विश्वानि काव्यानि विद्वान्
pada pāṭha: ā | devānām | abhavaḥ | ketuḥ | agne | mandraḥ | viśvāni | kāvyāni | vidvān || prati | martān | avāsayaḥ | damūnāḥ | anu | devān | rathiraḥ | yāsi | sādhan ||3.1.17||

IAST: prati martām̐ avāsayo damūnā anu devān rathiro yāsi sādhan
Griffith: Friend of the homestead, thou hast lightened mortals: carborne thou goest to the Gods, fulfilling.
Devanāgarī: प्रति मर्ताँ अवासयो दमूना अनु देवान्रथिरो यासि साधन्
pada pāṭha: ā | devānām | abhavaḥ | ketuḥ | agne | mandraḥ | viśvāni | kāvyāni | vidvān || prati | martān | avāsayaḥ | damūnāḥ | anu | devān | rathiraḥ | yāsi | sādhan ||3.1.17||

IAST: ni duroṇe amṛto martyānāṁ rājā sasāda vidathāni sādhan
Griffith: Within the house hath sate the King immortal of mortals, filling full their sacred synods.
Devanāgarī: नि दुरोणे अमृतो मर्त्यानां राजा ससाद विदथानि साधन्
pada pāṭha: ni | duroṇe | amr̥taḥ | martyānām | rājā | sasāda | vidathāni | sādhan || ghr̥ta-pratīkaḥ | urviyā | vi | adyaut | agniḥ | viśvāni | kāvyāni | vidvān ||3.1.18||

IAST: ghṛtapratīka urviyā vy adyaud agnir viśvāni kāvyāni vidvān
Griffith: Bedewed with holy oil he shineth widely, Agni, the knower of all secret wisdom.
Devanāgarī: घृतप्रतीक उर्विया व्यद्यौदग्निर्विश्वानि काव्यानि विद्वान्
pada pāṭha: ni | duroṇe | amr̥taḥ | martyānām | rājā | sasāda | vidathāni | sādhan || ghr̥ta-pratīkaḥ | urviyā | vi | adyaut | agniḥ | viśvāni | kāvyāni | vidvān ||3.1.18||

IAST: ā no gahi sakhyebhiḥ śivebhir mahān mahībhir ūtibhiḥ saraṇyan
Griffith: Come unto us with thine auspicious friendship, come speeding, Mighty, with thy mighty succours.
Devanāgarī: आ नो गहि सख्येभिः शिवेभिर्महान्महीभिरूतिभिः सरण्यन्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | gahi | sakhyebhiḥ | śivebhiḥ | mahān | mahībhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ | saraṇyan || asme iti | rayim | bahulam | sam-tarutram | su-vācam | bhāgam | yaśasam | kr̥dhi | naḥ ||3.1.19||

IAST: asme rayim bahulaṁ saṁtarutraṁ suvācam bhāgaṁ yaśasaṁ kṛdhī naḥ
Griffith: Grant us abundant wealth that saves from danger, that brings a good repute, a glorious portion.
Devanāgarī: अस्मे रयिं बहुलं संतरुत्रं सुवाचं भागं यशसं कृधी नः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | gahi | sakhyebhiḥ | śivebhiḥ | mahān | mahībhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ | saraṇyan || asme iti | rayim | bahulam | sam-tarutram | su-vācam | bhāgam | yaśasam | kr̥dhi | naḥ ||3.1.19||

IAST: etā te agne janimā sanāni pra pūrvyāya nūtanāni vocam
Griffith: To thee who art of old these songs, O Agni, have I declared, the ancient and the later.
Devanāgarī: एता ते अग्ने जनिमा सनानि प्र पूर्व्याय नूतनानि वोचम्
pada pāṭha: etā | te | agne | janima | sanāni | pra | pūrvyāya | nūtanāni | vocam || mahānti | vr̥ṣṇe | savanā | kr̥tā | imā | janman-janman | ni-hitaḥ | jāta-vedāḥ ||3.1.20||

IAST: mahānti vṛṣṇe savanā kṛtemā janmañ-janman nihito jātavedāḥ
Griffith: These great libations to the Strong are offiered: in every birth is Jatavedas stablished.
Devanāgarī: महान्ति वृष्णे सवना कृतेमा जन्मञ्जन्मन्निहितो जातवेदाः
pada pāṭha: etā | te | agne | janima | sanāni | pra | pūrvyāya | nūtanāni | vocam || mahānti | vr̥ṣṇe | savanā | kr̥tā | imā | janman-janman | ni-hitaḥ | jāta-vedāḥ ||3.1.20||

IAST: janmañ-janman nihito jātavedā viśvāmitrebhir idhyate ajasraḥ
Griffith: Stablished in every birth is Jatavedas, kindled perpetual by the Visvamitras.
Devanāgarī: जन्मञ्जन्मन्निहितो जातवेदा विश्वामित्रेभिरिध्यते अजस्रः
pada pāṭha: janman-janman | ni-hitaḥ | jāta-vedāḥ | viśvāmitrebhiḥ | idhyate | ajasraḥ || tasya | vayam | su-matau | yajñiyasya | api | bhadre | saumanase | syāma ||3.1.21||

IAST: tasya vayaṁ sumatau yajñiyasyāpi bhadre saumanase syāma
Griffith: May we rest ever in the loving-kindness, in the auspicious grace of him the Holy.
Devanāgarī: तस्य वयं सुमतौ यज्ञियस्यापि भद्रे सौमनसे स्याम
pada pāṭha: janman-janman | ni-hitaḥ | jāta-vedāḥ | viśvāmitrebhiḥ | idhyate | ajasraḥ || tasya | vayam | su-matau | yajñiyasya | api | bhadre | saumanase | syāma ||3.1.21||

IAST: imaṁ yajñaṁ sahasāvan tvaṁ no devatrā dhehi sukrato rarāṇaḥ
Griffith: This sacrifice of ours do thou, O Mighty, O truly Wise, bear to the Gods rejoicing.
Devanāgarī: इमं यज्ञं सहसावन्त्वं नो देवत्रा धेहि सुक्रतो रराणः
pada pāṭha: imam | yajñam | sahasā-van | tvam | naḥ | deva-trā | dhehi | sukrato iti su-krato | rarāṇaḥ || pra | yaṁsi | hotaḥ | br̥hatīḥ | iṣaḥ | naḥ | agne | mahi | draviṇam | ā | yajasva ||3.1.22||

IAST: pra yaṁsi hotar bṛhatīr iṣo no 'gne mahi draviṇam ā yajasva
Griffith: Grant us abundant food, thou priestly Herald, vouchsafe to give us ample wealth, O Agni.
Devanāgarī: प्र यंसि होतर्बृहतीरिषो नोऽग्ने महि द्रविणमा यजस्व
pada pāṭha: imam | yajñam | sahasā-van | tvam | naḥ | deva-trā | dhehi | sukrato iti su-krato | rarāṇaḥ || pra | yaṁsi | hotaḥ | br̥hatīḥ | iṣaḥ | naḥ | agne | mahi | draviṇam | ā | yajasva ||3.1.22||

IAST: iḻām agne purudaṁsaṁ saniṁ goḥ śaśvattamaṁ havamānāya sādha
Griffith: As holy food, Agni, to thine'invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels.
Devanāgarī: इळामग्ने पुरुदंसं सनिं गोः शश्वत्तमं हवमानाय साध
pada pāṭha: iḷām | agne | puru-daṁsam | sanim | goḥ | śaśvat-tamam | havamānāya | sādha || syāt | naḥ | sūnuḥ | tanayaḥ | vijā-vā | agne | sā | te | su-matiḥ | bhūtu | asme iti ||3.1.23||

IAST: syān naḥ sūnus tanayo vijāvāgne sā te sumatir bhūtv asme
Griffith: To us he born a son, and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward.
Devanāgarī: स्यान्नः सूनुस्तनयो विजावाग्ने सा ते सुमतिर्भूत्वस्मे
pada pāṭha: iḷām | agne | puru-daṁsam | sanim | goḥ | śaśvat-tamam | havamānāya | sādha || syāt | naḥ | sūnuḥ | tanayaḥ | vijā-vā | agne | sā | te | su-matiḥ | bhūtu | asme iti ||3.1.23||

IAST: vaiśvānarāya dhiṣaṇām ṛtāvṛdhe ghṛtaṁ na pūtam agnaye janāmasi
Griffith: To him, Vaisvanara, who strengthens Holy Law, to Agni we present our praise like oil made pure.
Devanāgarī: वैश्वानराय धिषणामृतावृधे घृतं न पूतमग्नये जनामसि
pada pāṭha: vaiśvānarāya | dhiṣaṇām | r̥ta-vr̥dhe | ghr̥tam | na | pūtam | agnaye | janāmasi || dvitā | hotāram | manuṣaḥ | ca | vāghataḥ | dhiyā | ratham | na | kuliśaḥ | sam | r̥ṇvati ||3.2.1||

IAST: dvitā hotāram manuṣaś ca vāghato dhiyā rathaṁ na kuliśaḥ sam ṛṇvati
Griffith: With thoughtful insight human priests bring him anear, our Herald from of old, as an axe forms a car.
Devanāgarī: द्विता होतारं मनुषश्च वाघतो धिया रथं न कुलिशः समृण्वति
pada pāṭha: vaiśvānarāya | dhiṣaṇām | r̥ta-vr̥dhe | ghr̥tam | na | pūtam | agnaye | janāmasi || dvitā | hotāram | manuṣaḥ | ca | vāghataḥ | dhiyā | ratham | na | kuliśaḥ | sam | r̥ṇvati ||3.2.1||

IAST: sa rocayaj januṣā rodasī ubhe sa mātror abhavat putra īḍyaḥ
Griffith: He made the heaven and earth resplendent by his birth: Child of two Mothers he was meet to be implored,
Devanāgarī: स रोचयज्जनुषा रोदसी उभे स मात्रोरभवत्पुत्र ईड्यः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | rocayat | januṣā | rodasī iti | ubhe iti | saḥ | mātroḥ | abhavat | putraḥ | īḍyaḥ || havya-vāṭ | agniḥ | ajaraḥ | canaḥ-hitaḥ | duḥ-dabhaḥ | viśām | atithiḥ | vibhā-vasuḥ ||3.2.2||

IAST: havyavāḻ agnir ajaraś canohito dūḻabho viśām atithir vibhāvasuḥ
Griffith: Agni, oblation-bearer, gracious, ever-young, infallible, rich in radiant light, the guest of men.
Devanāgarī: हव्यवाळग्निरजरश्चनोहितो दूळभो विशामतिथिर्विभावसुः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | rocayat | januṣā | rodasī iti | ubhe iti | saḥ | mātroḥ | abhavat | putraḥ | īḍyaḥ || havya-vāṭ | agniḥ | ajaraḥ | canaḥ-hitaḥ | duḥ-dabhaḥ | viśām | atithiḥ | vibhā-vasuḥ ||3.2.2||

IAST: kratvā dakṣasya taruṣo vidharmaṇi devāso agniṁ janayanta cittibhiḥ
Griffith: Within the range of their surpassinq power, by might, the Gods created Agni with inventive thought.
Devanāgarī: क्रत्वा दक्षस्य तरुषो विधर्मणि देवासो अग्निं जनयन्त चित्तिभिः
pada pāṭha: kratvā | dakṣasya | taruṣaḥ | vi-dharmaṇi | devāsaḥ | agnim | janayanta | citti-bhiḥ || rurucānam | bhānunā | jyotiṣā | mahām | atyam | na | vājam | saniṣyan | upa | bruve ||3.2.3||

IAST: rurucānam bhānunā jyotiṣā mahām atyaṁ na vājaṁ saniṣyann upa bruve
Griffith: I, eager to win strength, address him, like a steed, resplendent with his brilliance, with his ample light.
Devanāgarī: रुरुचानं भानुना ज्योतिषा महामत्यं न वाजं सनिष्यन्नुप ब्रुवे
pada pāṭha: kratvā | dakṣasya | taruṣaḥ | vi-dharmaṇi | devāsaḥ | agnim | janayanta | citti-bhiḥ || rurucānam | bhānunā | jyotiṣā | mahām | atyam | na | vājam | saniṣyan | upa | bruve ||3.2.3||

IAST: ā mandrasya saniṣyanto vareṇyaṁ vṛṇīmahe ahrayaṁ vājam ṛgmiyam
Griffith: Eager to gain, we crave from him the friendly God strength confident, choiceworthy meet to be extolled:
Devanāgarī: आ मन्द्रस्य सनिष्यन्तो वरेण्यं वृणीमहे अह्रयं वाजमृग्मियम्
pada pāṭha: ā | mandrasya | saniṣyantaḥ | vareṇyam | vr̥ṇīmahe | ahrayam | vājam | r̥gmiyam || rātim | bhr̥gūṇām | uśijam | kavi-kratum | agnim | rājantam | divyena | śociṣā ||3.2.4||

IAST: rātim bhṛgūṇām uśijaṁ kavikratum agniṁ rājantaṁ divyena śociṣā
Griffith: The Bhrgus' bounty, willing, strong with sages' lore, even Agni shining forth with light that comes from heaven.
Devanāgarī: रातिं भृगूणामुशिजं कविक्रतुमग्निं राजन्तं दिव्येन शोचिषा
pada pāṭha: ā | mandrasya | saniṣyantaḥ | vareṇyam | vr̥ṇīmahe | ahrayam | vājam | r̥gmiyam || rātim | bhr̥gūṇām | uśijam | kavi-kratum | agnim | rājantam | divyena | śociṣā ||3.2.4||

IAST: agniṁ sumnāya dadhire puro janā vājaśravasam iha vṛktabarhiṣaḥ
Griffith: For happiness, men, having trimmed the sacred grass, set Agni glorious for his strength before them here;
Devanāgarī: अग्निं सुम्नाय दधिरे पुरो जना वाजश्रवसमिह वृक्तबर्हिषः
pada pāṭha: agnim | sumnāya | dadhire | puraḥ | janāḥ | vāja-śravasam | iha | vr̥kta-barhiṣaḥ || yata-srucaḥ | su-rucam | viśva-devyam | rudram | yajñānām | sādhat-iṣṭim | apasām ||3.2.5||

IAST: yatasrucaḥ surucaṁ viśvadevyaṁ rudraṁ yajñānāṁ sādhadiṣṭim apasām
Griffith: Yea, with raised ladles, him bright, dear to all the Gods, perfecting aims of works, Rudra of solemn rites.
Devanāgarī: यतस्रुचः सुरुचं विश्वदेव्यं रुद्रं यज्ञानां साधदिष्टिमपसाम्
pada pāṭha: agnim | sumnāya | dadhire | puraḥ | janāḥ | vāja-śravasam | iha | vr̥kta-barhiṣaḥ || yata-srucaḥ | su-rucam | viśva-devyam | rudram | yajñānām | sādhat-iṣṭim | apasām ||3.2.5||

IAST: pāvakaśoce tava hi kṣayam pari hotar yajñeṣu vṛktabarhiṣo naraḥ
Griffith: Around thy dwelling-place, O brightly-shining Priest, are men at sacrifice, whose sacred grass is trimmed.
Devanāgarī: पावकशोचे तव हि क्षयं परि होतर्यज्ञेषु वृक्तबर्हिषो नरः
pada pāṭha: pāvaka-śoce | tava | hi | kṣayam | pari | hotaḥ | yajñeṣu | vr̥kta-barhiṣaḥ | naraḥ || agne | duvaḥ | icchamānāsaḥ | āpyam | upa | āsate | draviṇam | dhehi | tebhyaḥ ||3.2.6||

IAST: agne duva icchamānāsa āpyam upāsate draviṇaṁ dhehi tebhyaḥ
Griffith: Wishing to do thee service, Agni, they are there, desirous of thy friendship grant them store of wealth.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने दुव इच्छमानास आप्यमुपासते द्रविणं धेहि तेभ्यः
pada pāṭha: pāvaka-śoce | tava | hi | kṣayam | pari | hotaḥ | yajñeṣu | vr̥kta-barhiṣaḥ | naraḥ || agne | duvaḥ | icchamānāsaḥ | āpyam | upa | āsate | draviṇam | dhehi | tebhyaḥ ||3.2.6||

IAST: ā rodasī apṛṇad ā svar mahaj jātaṁ yad enam apaso adhārayan
Griffith: He hath filled heaven and earth and the great realm of light, when at his birth the skilful held him in their hold.
Devanāgarī: आ रोदसी अपृणदा स्वर्महज्जातं यदेनमपसो अधारयन्
pada pāṭha: ā | rodasī iti | apr̥ṇat | ā | svaḥ | mahat | jātam | yat | enam | apasaḥ | adhārayan || saḥ | adhvarāya | pari | nīyate | kaviḥ | atyaḥ | na | vāja-sātaye | canaḥ-hitaḥ ||3.2.7||

IAST: so adhvarāya pari ṇīyate kavir atyo na vājasātaye canohitaḥ
Griffith: He like a horse is led forth to the sacrifice Sage, graciously inclined, that he may win us strength.
Devanāgarī: सो अध्वराय परि णीयते कविरत्यो न वाजसातये चनोहितः
pada pāṭha: ā | rodasī iti | apr̥ṇat | ā | svaḥ | mahat | jātam | yat | enam | apasaḥ | adhārayan || saḥ | adhvarāya | pari | nīyate | kaviḥ | atyaḥ | na | vāja-sātaye | canaḥ-hitaḥ ||3.2.7||

IAST: namasyata havyadātiṁ svadhvaraṁ duvasyata damyaṁ jātavedasam
Griffith: Honour the oblation-bearer, him who knows fair rites, serve ye the Household Friend who knows all things that be.
Devanāgarī: नमस्यत हव्यदातिं स्वध्वरं दुवस्यत दम्यं जातवेदसम्
pada pāṭha: namasyata | havya-dātim | su-adhvaram | duvasyata | damyam | jāta-vedasam || rathīḥ | r̥tasya | br̥hataḥ | vi-carṣaṇiḥ | agniḥ | devānām | abhavat | puraḥ-hitaḥ ||3.2.8||

IAST: rathīr ṛtasya bṛhato vicarṣaṇir agnir devānām abhavat purohitaḥ
Griffith: He drives the chariot of the lofty ordinance: Agni most active, is the great High Priest of Gods.
Devanāgarī: रथीरृतस्य बृहतो विचर्षणिरग्निर्देवानामभवत्पुरोहितः
pada pāṭha: namasyata | havya-dātim | su-adhvaram | duvasyata | damyam | jāta-vedasam || rathīḥ | r̥tasya | br̥hataḥ | vi-carṣaṇiḥ | agniḥ | devānām | abhavat | puraḥ-hitaḥ ||3.2.8||

IAST: tisro yahvasya samidhaḥ parijmano 'gner apunann uśijo amṛtyavaḥ
Griffith: They who are free from death, fain for him, purified three splendours of the mighty Agni, circling all.
Devanāgarī: तिस्रो यह्वस्य समिधः परिज्मनोऽग्नेरपुनन्नुशिजो अमृत्यवः
pada pāṭha: tisraḥ | yahvasya | sam-idhaḥ | pari-jmanaḥ | agneḥ | apunan | uśijaḥ | amr̥tyavaḥ || tāsām | ekām | adadhuḥ | martye | bhujam | ūm̐ iti | lokam | ūm̐ iti | dve iti | upa | jāmim | īyatuḥ ||3.2.9||

IAST: tāsām ekām adadhur martye bhujam u lokam u dve upa jāmim īyatuḥ
Griffith: To man, for his enjoyment, one of these they gave: the other two have passed into the sister sphere.
Devanāgarī: तासामेकामदधुर्मर्त्ये भुजमु लोकमु द्वे उप जामिमीयतुः
pada pāṭha: tisraḥ | yahvasya | sam-idhaḥ | pari-jmanaḥ | agneḥ | apunan | uśijaḥ | amr̥tyavaḥ || tāsām | ekām | adadhuḥ | martye | bhujam | ūm̐ iti | lokam | ūm̐ iti | dve iti | upa | jāmim | īyatuḥ ||3.2.9||

IAST: viśāṁ kaviṁ viśpatim mānuṣīr iṣaḥ saṁ sīm akṛṇvan svadhitiṁ na tejase
Griffith: Man's sacrificial food hath sharpened like an axe, for brightness, him the Sage of men, the people's Lord,
Devanāgarī: विशां कविं विश्पतिं मानुषीरिषः सं सीमकृण्वन्स्वधितिं न तेजसे
pada pāṭha: viśām | kavim | viśpatim | mānuṣīḥ | iṣaḥ | sam | sīm | akr̥ṇvan | sva-dhitim | na | tejase || saḥ | ut-vataḥ | ni-vataḥ | yāti | veviṣat | saḥ | garbham | eṣu | bhuvaneṣu | dīdharat ||3.2.10||

IAST: sa udvato nivato yāti veviṣat sa garbham eṣu bhuvaneṣu dīdharat
Griffith: Busied with sacred rites he mounts and he descends. He hath laid down his vital germ within these worlds.
Devanāgarī: स उद्वतो निवतो याति वेविषत्स गर्भमेषु भुवनेषु दीधरत्
pada pāṭha: viśām | kavim | viśpatim | mānuṣīḥ | iṣaḥ | sam | sīm | akr̥ṇvan | sva-dhitim | na | tejase || saḥ | ut-vataḥ | ni-vataḥ | yāti | veviṣat | saḥ | garbham | eṣu | bhuvaneṣu | dīdharat ||3.2.10||

IAST: sa jinvate jaṭhareṣu prajajñivān vṛṣā citreṣu nānadan na siṁhaḥ
Griffith: He stirs with life in wombs dissimilar in kind, born as a Lion or a loudly-bellowing Bull:
Devanāgarī: स जिन्वते जठरेषु प्रजज्ञिवान्वृषा चित्रेषु नानदन्न सिंहः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | jinvate | jaṭhareṣu | prajajñi-vān | vr̥ṣā | citreṣu | nānadat | na | siṁhaḥ || vaiśvānaraḥ | pr̥thu-pājāḥ | amartyaḥ | vasu | ratnā | dayamānaḥ | vi | dāśuṣe ||3.2.11||

IAST: vaiśvānaraḥ pṛthupājā amartyo vasu ratnā dayamāno vi dāśuṣe
Griffith: Vaisvanara immortal with wide-reaching might, bestowing goods and wealth on him who offiers gifts.
Devanāgarī: वैश्वानरः पृथुपाजा अमर्त्यो वसु रत्ना दयमानो वि दाशुषे
pada pāṭha: saḥ | jinvate | jaṭhareṣu | prajajñi-vān | vr̥ṣā | citreṣu | nānadat | na | siṁhaḥ || vaiśvānaraḥ | pr̥thu-pājāḥ | amartyaḥ | vasu | ratnā | dayamānaḥ | vi | dāśuṣe ||3.2.11||

IAST: vaiśvānaraḥ pratnathā nākam āruhad divas pṛṣṭham bhandamānaḥ sumanmabhiḥ
Griffith: Vaisvanara, as of old, mounted the cope of heaven, heaven's ridge, well greeted, by those skilled in noble songs.
Devanāgarī: वैश्वानरः प्रत्नथा नाकमारुहद्दिवस्पृष्ठं भन्दमानः सुमन्मभिः
pada pāṭha: vaiśvānaraḥ | pratna-thā | nākam | ā | aruhat | divaḥ | pr̥ṣṭham | bhandamānaḥ | sumanma-bhiḥ || saḥ | pūrva-vat | janayan | jantave | dhanam | samānam | ajmam | pari | eti | jāgr̥viḥ ||3.2.12||

IAST: sa pūrvavaj janayañ jantave dhanaṁ samānam ajmam pary eti jāgṛviḥ
Griffith: He, as of old, producing riches for the folk, still watchful, traversesthe common way again.
Devanāgarī: स पूर्ववज्जनयञ्जन्तवे धनं समानमज्मं पर्येति जागृविः
pada pāṭha: vaiśvānaraḥ | pratna-thā | nākam | ā | aruhat | divaḥ | pr̥ṣṭham | bhandamānaḥ | sumanma-bhiḥ || saḥ | pūrva-vat | janayan | jantave | dhanam | samānam | ajmam | pari | eti | jāgr̥viḥ ||3.2.12||

IAST: ṛtāvānaṁ yajñiyaṁ vipram ukthyam ā yaṁ dadhe mātariśvā divi kṣayam
Griffith: For new prosperity we seek to Agni, him whose course is splendid, gold-haired, excellently bright,
Devanāgarī: ऋतावानं यज्ञियं विप्रमुक्थ्यमा यं दधे मातरिश्वा दिवि क्षयम्
pada pāṭha: r̥ta-vānam | yajñiyam | vipram | ukthyam | ā | yam | dadhe | mātariśvā | divi | kṣayam || tam | citra-yāmam | hari-keśam | īmahe | su-dītim | agnim | suvitāya | navyase ||3.2.13||

IAST: taṁ citrayāmaṁ harikeśam īmahe sudītim agniṁ suvitāya navyase
Griffith: Whom Matarisvan stablished, dweller in the heaven, meet for high praise and holy, sage and true to Law.
Devanāgarī: तं चित्रयामं हरिकेशमीमहे सुदीतिमग्निं सुविताय नव्यसे
pada pāṭha: r̥ta-vānam | yajñiyam | vipram | ukthyam | ā | yam | dadhe | mātariśvā | divi | kṣayam || tam | citra-yāmam | hari-keśam | īmahe | su-dītim | agnim | suvitāya | navyase ||3.2.13||

IAST: śuciṁ na yāmann iṣiraṁ svardṛśaṁ ketuṁ divo rocanasthām uṣarbudham
Griffith: As pure and swift of course, beholder of the light, who stands in heaven's bright sphere a sign, who wakes at dawn,
Devanāgarī: शुचिं न यामन्निषिरं स्वर्दृशं केतुं दिवो रोचनस्थामुषर्बुधम्
pada pāṭha: śucim | na | yāman | iṣiram | svaḥ-dr̥śam | ketum | divaḥ | rocana-sthām | uṣaḥ-budham || agnim | mūrdhānam | divaḥ | aprati-skutam | tam | īmahe | namasā | vājinam | br̥hat ||3.2.14||

IAST: agnim mūrdhānaṁ divo apratiṣkutaṁ tam īmahe namasā vājinam bṛhat
Griffith: Agni, the head of heaven, whom none may turn aside-to him the Powerful with mighty prayer we seek.
Devanāgarī: अग्निं मूर्धानं दिवो अप्रतिष्कुतं तमीमहे नमसा वाजिनं बृहत्
pada pāṭha: śucim | na | yāman | iṣiram | svaḥ-dr̥śam | ketum | divaḥ | rocana-sthām | uṣaḥ-budham || agnim | mūrdhānam | divaḥ | aprati-skutam | tam | īmahe | namasā | vājinam | br̥hat ||3.2.14||

IAST: mandraṁ hotāraṁ śucim advayāvinaṁ damūnasam ukthyaṁ viśvacarṣaṇim
Griffith: The cheerful Priest, the pure, in whom no guile is found, Friend of the House, praise-worthy, dear to all mankind,
Devanāgarī: मन्द्रं होतारं शुचिमद्वयाविनं दमूनसमुक्थ्यं विश्वचर्षणिम्
pada pāṭha: mandram | hotāram | śucim | advayāvinam | damūnasam | ukthyam | viśva-carṣaṇim || ratham | na | citram | vapuṣāya | darśatam | manuḥ-hitam | sadam | it | rāyaḥ | īmahe ||3.2.15||

IAST: rathaṁ na citraṁ vapuṣāya darśatam manurhitaṁ sadam id rāya īmahe
Griffith: Fair to behold for beauty like a splendid car,- Agni the Friend of men we ever seek for wealth.
Devanāgarī: रथं न चित्रं वपुषाय दर्शतं मनुर्हितं सदमिद्राय ईमहे
pada pāṭha: mandram | hotāram | śucim | advayāvinam | damūnasam | ukthyam | viśva-carṣaṇim || ratham | na | citram | vapuṣāya | darśatam | manuḥ-hitam | sadam | it | rāyaḥ | īmahe ||3.2.15||

IAST: vaiśvānarāya pṛthupājase vipo ratnā vidhanta dharuṇeṣu gātave
Griffith: To him who shines afar, Vaisvanara, shall bards give precious things that he may go on certain paths:
Devanāgarī: वैश्वानराय पृथुपाजसे विपो रत्ना विधन्त धरुणेषु गातवे
pada pāṭha: vaiśvānarāya | pr̥thu-pājase | vipaḥ | ratnā | vidhanta | dharuṇeṣu | gātave || agniḥ | hi | devān | amr̥taḥ | duvasyati | atha | dharmāṇi | sanatā | na | dūduṣat ||3.3.1||

IAST: agnir hi devām̐ amṛto duvasyaty athā dharmāṇi sanatā na dūduṣat
Griffith: For Agni the Immortal serves the Deities, and therefore never breaks their everlasting laws.
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्हि देवाँ अमृतो दुवस्यत्यथा धर्माणि सनता न दूदुषत्
pada pāṭha: vaiśvānarāya | pr̥thu-pājase | vipaḥ | ratnā | vidhanta | dharuṇeṣu | gātave || agniḥ | hi | devān | amr̥taḥ | duvasyati | atha | dharmāṇi | sanatā | na | dūduṣat ||3.3.1||

IAST: antar dūto rodasī dasma īyate hotā niṣatto manuṣaḥ purohitaḥ
Griffith: He, wondrous envoy, goes between the earth and heaven, firm seated as the Herald, great High Priest of men.
Devanāgarī: अन्तर्दूतो रोदसी दस्म ईयते होता निषत्तो मनुषः पुरोहितः
pada pāṭha: antaḥ | dūtaḥ | rodasī iti | dasmaḥ | īyate | hotā | ni-sattaḥ | manuṣaḥ | puraḥ-hitaḥ || kṣayam | br̥hantam | pari | bhūṣati | dyu-bhiḥ | devebhiḥ | agniḥ | iṣitaḥ | dhiyā-vasuḥ ||3.3.2||

IAST: kṣayam bṛhantam pari bhūṣati dyubhir devebhir agnir iṣito dhiyāvasuḥ
Griffith: He compassethwith rays the lofty dwelling-place, Agni, sent forward by the Gods, enriched with piayer.
Devanāgarī: क्षयं बृहन्तं परि भूषति द्युभिर्देवेभिरग्निरिषितो धियावसुः
pada pāṭha: antaḥ | dūtaḥ | rodasī iti | dasmaḥ | īyate | hotā | ni-sattaḥ | manuṣaḥ | puraḥ-hitaḥ || kṣayam | br̥hantam | pari | bhūṣati | dyu-bhiḥ | devebhiḥ | agniḥ | iṣitaḥ | dhiyā-vasuḥ ||3.3.2||

IAST: ketuṁ yajñānāṁ vidathasya sādhanaṁ viprāso agnim mahayanta cittibhiḥ
Griffith: Sages shall glorify Agni with earnest thoughts, ensign of sacrifice, who fills the synod full:
Devanāgarī: केतुं यज्ञानां विदथस्य साधनं विप्रासो अग्निं महयन्त चित्तिभिः
pada pāṭha: ketum | yajñānām | vidathasya | sādhanam | viprāsaḥ | agnim | mahayanta | citti-bhiḥ || apāṁsi | yasmin | adhi | sam-dadhuḥ | giraḥ | tasmin | sumnāni | yajamānaḥ | ā | cake ||3.3.3||

IAST: apāṁsi yasminn adhi saṁdadhur giras tasmin sumnāni yajamāna ā cake
Griffith: In whom the singers have stored up their holy acts to him the worshipper looks for joy and happiness.
Devanāgarī: अपांसि यस्मिन्नधि संदधुर्गिरस्तस्मिन्सुम्नानि यजमान आ चके
pada pāṭha: ketum | yajñānām | vidathasya | sādhanam | viprāsaḥ | agnim | mahayanta | citti-bhiḥ || apāṁsi | yasmin | adhi | sam-dadhuḥ | giraḥ | tasmin | sumnāni | yajamānaḥ | ā | cake ||3.3.3||

IAST: pitā yajñānām asuro vipaścitāṁ vimānam agnir vayunaṁ ca vāghatām
Griffith: The Sire of sacrifice, great God of holy bards, Agni, the measure and the symbol of the priests,
Devanāgarī: पिता यज्ञानामसुरो विपश्चितां विमानमग्निर्वयुनं च वाघताम्
pada pāṭha: pitā | yajñānām | asuraḥ | vipaḥ-citām | vi-mānam | agniḥ | vayunam | ca | vāghatām || ā | viveśa | rodasī iti | bhūri-varpasā | puru-priyaḥ | bhandate | dhāma-bhiḥ | kaviḥ ||3.3.4||

IAST: ā viveśa rodasī bhūrivarpasā purupriyo bhandate dhāmabhiḥ kaviḥ
Griffith: Hath entered heaven and earth that show in varied form: the Sage whom many love rejoiceth in his might.
Devanāgarī: आ विवेश रोदसी भूरिवर्पसा पुरुप्रियो भन्दते धामभिः कविः
pada pāṭha: pitā | yajñānām | asuraḥ | vipaḥ-citām | vi-mānam | agniḥ | vayunam | ca | vāghatām || ā | viveśa | rodasī iti | bhūri-varpasā | puru-priyaḥ | bhandate | dhāma-bhiḥ | kaviḥ ||3.3.4||

IAST: candram agniṁ candrarathaṁ harivrataṁ vaiśvānaram apsuṣadaṁ svarvidam
Griffith: Bright Agni with the bright car, Lord of green domains, Vaisvanara dweller in the floods, who finds the light,
Devanāgarī: चन्द्रमग्निं चन्द्ररथं हरिव्रतं वैश्वानरमप्सुषदं स्वर्विदम्
pada pāṭha: candram | agnim | candra-ratham | hari-vratam | vaiśvānaram | apsu-sadam | svaḥ-vidam || vi-gāham | tūrṇim | taviṣībhiḥ | ā-vr̥tam | bhūrṇim | devāsaḥ | iha | su-śriyam | dadhuḥ ||3.3.5||

IAST: vigāhaṁ tūrṇiṁ taviṣībhir āvṛtam bhūrṇiṁ devāsa iha suśriyaṁ dadhuḥ
Griffith: Pervading, swift and wild, encompassed round with powers, him very glorious have the Gods established here.
Devanāgarī: विगाहं तूर्णिं तविषीभिरावृतं भूर्णिं देवास इह सुश्रियं दधुः
pada pāṭha: candram | agnim | candra-ratham | hari-vratam | vaiśvānaram | apsu-sadam | svaḥ-vidam || vi-gāham | tūrṇim | taviṣībhiḥ | ā-vr̥tam | bhūrṇim | devāsaḥ | iha | su-śriyam | dadhuḥ ||3.3.5||

IAST: agnir devebhir manuṣaś ca jantubhis tanvāno yajñam purupeśasaṁ dhiyā
Griffith: Agni, together with the Gods and Manu's folk by thought extending sacrifice in varied form,
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्देवेभिर्मनुषश्च जन्तुभिस्तन्वानो यज्ञं पुरुपेशसं धिया
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | devebhiḥ | manuṣaḥ | ca | jantu-bhiḥ | tanvānaḥ | yajñam | puru-peśasam | dhiyā || rathīḥ | antaḥ | īyate | sādhadiṣṭi-bhiḥ | jīraḥ | damūnāḥ | abhiśasti-cātanaḥ ||3.3.6||

IAST: rathīr antar īyate sādhadiṣṭibhir jīro damūnā abhiśasticātanaḥ
Griffith: Goes, car-borne, to and fro with those who crown each rite, the fleet, the Household Friend, who turns the curse aside.
Devanāgarī: रथीरन्तरीयते साधदिष्टिभिर्जीरो दमूना अभिशस्तिचातनः
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | devebhiḥ | manuṣaḥ | ca | jantu-bhiḥ | tanvānaḥ | yajñam | puru-peśasam | dhiyā || rathīḥ | antaḥ | īyate | sādhadiṣṭi-bhiḥ | jīraḥ | damūnāḥ | abhiśasti-cātanaḥ ||3.3.6||

IAST: agne jarasva svapatya āyuny ūrjā pinvasva sam iṣo didīhi naḥ
Griffith: Sing, Agni, for long life to us and noble sons: teem thou with plenty, shine upon us store of food.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने जरस्व स्वपत्य आयुन्यूर्जा पिन्वस्व समिषो दिदीहि नः
pada pāṭha: agne | jarasva | su-apatye | āyuni | ūrjā | pinvasva | sam | iṣaḥ | didīhi | naḥ || vayāṁsi | jinva | br̥hataḥ | ca | jāgr̥ve | uśik | devānām | asi | su-kratuḥ | vipām ||3.3.7||

IAST: vayāṁsi jinva bṛhataś ca jāgṛva uśig devānām asi sukratur vipām
Griffith: Increase the great man's strength, thou ever-vigilant: thou, longing for the Gods, knowest their hymns full well.
Devanāgarī: वयांसि जिन्व बृहतश्च जागृव उशिग्देवानामसि सुक्रतुर्विपाम्
pada pāṭha: agne | jarasva | su-apatye | āyuni | ūrjā | pinvasva | sam | iṣaḥ | didīhi | naḥ || vayāṁsi | jinva | br̥hataḥ | ca | jāgr̥ve | uśik | devānām | asi | su-kratuḥ | vipām ||3.3.7||

IAST: viśpatiṁ yahvam atithiṁ naraḥ sadā yantāraṁ dhīnām uśijaṁ ca vāghatām
Griffith: The Mighty One, Lord of the people and their guest, the leader of their thoughts, devoted Friend of priests,
Devanāgarī: विश्पतिं यह्वमतिथिं नरः सदा यन्तारं धीनामुशिजं च वाघताम्
pada pāṭha: viśpatim | yahvam | atithim | naraḥ | sadā | yantāram | dhīnām | uśijam | ca | vāghatām || adhvarāṇām | cetanam | jāta-vedasam | pra | śaṁsanti | namasā | jūti-bhiḥ | vr̥dhe ||3.3.8||

IAST: adhvarāṇāṁ cetanaṁ jātavedasam pra śaṁsanti namasā jūtibhir vṛdhe
Griffith: Our solemn rites' announcer, Jatavedas, men with worship ever praise, with urgings for their weal.
Devanāgarī: अध्वराणां चेतनं जातवेदसं प्र शंसन्ति नमसा जूतिभिर्वृधे
pada pāṭha: viśpatim | yahvam | atithim | naraḥ | sadā | yantāram | dhīnām | uśijam | ca | vāghatām || adhvarāṇām | cetanam | jāta-vedasam | pra | śaṁsanti | namasā | jūti-bhiḥ | vr̥dhe ||3.3.8||

IAST: vibhāvā devaḥ suraṇaḥ pari kṣitīr agnir babhūva śavasā sumadrathaḥ
Griffith: Agni the God resplendent, giver of great joy, hath on his lovely car compassed the lands with, might.
Devanāgarī: विभावा देवः सुरणः परि क्षितीरग्निर्बभूव शवसा सुमद्रथः
pada pāṭha: vibhā-vā | devaḥ | su-raṇaḥ | pari | kṣitīḥ | agniḥ | babhūva | śavasā | sumat-rathaḥ || tasya | vratāni | bhūri-poṣiṇaḥ | vayam | upa | bhūṣema | dame | ā | suvr̥kti-bhiḥ ||3.3.9||

IAST: tasya vratāni bhūripoṣiṇo vayam upa bhūṣema dama ā suvṛktibhiḥ
Griffith: Let us with pure laudations in his house approach the high laws of the nourisher of multitudes.
Devanāgarī: तस्य व्रतानि भूरिपोषिणो वयमुप भूषेम दम आ सुवृक्तिभिः
pada pāṭha: vibhā-vā | devaḥ | su-raṇaḥ | pari | kṣitīḥ | agniḥ | babhūva | śavasā | sumat-rathaḥ || tasya | vratāni | bhūri-poṣiṇaḥ | vayam | upa | bhūṣema | dame | ā | suvr̥kti-bhiḥ ||3.3.9||

IAST: vaiśvānara tava dhāmāny ā cake yebhiḥ svarvid abhavo vicakṣaṇa
Griffith: I celebrate thy glories, O Vaisvanara, wherewith thou, O farsighted God, has found the light.
Devanāgarī: वैश्वानर तव धामान्या चके येभिः स्वर्विदभवो विचक्षण
pada pāṭha: vaiśvānara | tava | dhāmāni | ā | cakre | yebhiḥ | svaḥ-vit | abhavaḥ | vi-cakṣaṇa || jātaḥ | ā | apr̥ṇaḥ | bhuvanāni | rodasī iti | agne | tā | viśvā | pari-bhūḥ | asi | tmanā ||3.3.10||

IAST: jāta āpṛṇo bhuvanāni rodasī agne tā viśvā paribhūr asi tmanā
Griffith: Thou filledst at thy birth both worlds, the earth and heaven: all this, O Agni, hast thou compassed of thyself.
Devanāgarī: जात आपृणो भुवनानि रोदसी अग्ने ता विश्वा परिभूरसि त्मना
pada pāṭha: vaiśvānara | tava | dhāmāni | ā | cakre | yebhiḥ | svaḥ-vit | abhavaḥ | vi-cakṣaṇa || jātaḥ | ā | apr̥ṇaḥ | bhuvanāni | rodasī iti | agne | tā | viśvā | pari-bhūḥ | asi | tmanā ||3.3.10||

IAST: vaiśvānarasya daṁsanābhyo bṛhad ariṇād ekaḥ svapasyayā kaviḥ
Griffith: By his great skill the Sage alone hath brought to pass a great deed, mightier than Vaisvanara's wondrous acts.
Devanāgarī: वैश्वानरस्य दंसनाभ्यो बृहदरिणादेकः स्वपस्यया कविः
pada pāṭha: vaiśvānarasya | daṁsanābhyaḥ | br̥hat | ariṇāt | ekaḥ | su-apasyayā | kaviḥ || ubhā | pitarā | mahayan | ajāyata | agniḥ | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | bhūri-retasā ||3.3.11||

IAST: ubhā pitarā mahayann ajāyatāgnir dyāvāpṛthivī bhūriretasā
Griffith: Agni sprang into being, magnifying both his Parents, Heaven and Earth, rich in prolific seed.
Devanāgarī: उभा पितरा महयन्नजायताग्निर्द्यावापृथिवी भूरिरेतसा
pada pāṭha: vaiśvānarasya | daṁsanābhyaḥ | br̥hat | ariṇāt | ekaḥ | su-apasyayā | kaviḥ || ubhā | pitarā | mahayan | ajāyata | agniḥ | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | bhūri-retasā ||3.3.11||

IAST: samit-samit sumanā bodhy asme śucā-śucā sumatiṁ rāsi vasvaḥ
Griffith: BE friendly with each kindled log of fuel, with every flash bestow the boon of riches.
Devanāgarī: समित्समित्सुमना बोध्यस्मे शुचाशुचा सुमतिं रासि वस्वः
pada pāṭha: samit-samit | su-manāḥ | bodhi | asme iti | śucā-śucā | su-matim | rāsi | vasvaḥ || ā | deva | devān | yajathāya | vakṣi | sakhā | sakhīn | su-manāḥ | yakṣi | agne ||3.4.1||

IAST: ā deva devān yajathāya vakṣi sakhā sakhīn sumanā yakṣy agne
Griffith: Bring thou the Gods, O God, unto our worship: serve, well-inclined, as Friend thy friends, O Agni.
Devanāgarī: आ देव देवान्यजथाय वक्षि सखा सखीन्सुमना यक्ष्यग्ने
pada pāṭha: samit-samit | su-manāḥ | bodhi | asme iti | śucā-śucā | su-matim | rāsi | vasvaḥ || ā | deva | devān | yajathāya | vakṣi | sakhā | sakhīn | su-manāḥ | yakṣi | agne ||3.4.1||

IAST: yaṁ devāsas trir ahann āyajante dive-dive varuṇo mitro agniḥ
Griffith: Agni whom daily Varuna and Mitra the Gods bring thrice a day to this our worship,
Devanāgarī: यं देवासस्त्रिरहन्नायजन्ते दिवेदिवे वरुणो मित्रो अग्निः
pada pāṭha: yam | devāsaḥ | triḥ | ahan | ā-yajante | dive-dive | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | agniḥ || saḥ | imam | yajñam | madhu-mantam | kr̥dhi | naḥ | tanū-napāt | ghr̥ta-yonim | vidhantam ||3.4.2||

IAST: semaṁ yajñam madhumantaṁ kṛdhī nas tanūnapād ghṛtayoniṁ vidhantam
Griffith: Tanunapat, enrich with meath our service that dwells with holy oil, that offers honour.
Devanāgarī: सेमं यज्ञं मधुमन्तं कृधी नस्तनूनपाद्घृतयोनिं विधन्तम्
pada pāṭha: yam | devāsaḥ | triḥ | ahan | ā-yajante | dive-dive | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | agniḥ || saḥ | imam | yajñam | madhu-mantam | kr̥dhi | naḥ | tanū-napāt | ghr̥ta-yonim | vidhantam ||3.4.2||

IAST: pra dīdhitir viśvavārā jigāti hotāram iḻaḥ prathamaṁ yajadhyai
Griffith: The thought that bringeth every boon proceedeth to worship first the Priest of the libation,
Devanāgarī: प्र दीधितिर्विश्ववारा जिगाति होतारमिळः प्रथमं यजध्यै
pada pāṭha: pra | dīdhitiḥ | viśva-vārā | jigāti | hotāram | iḷaḥ | prathamam | yajadhyai || accha | namaḥ-bhiḥ | vr̥ṣabham | vandadhyai | saḥ | devān | yakṣat | iṣitaḥ | yajīyān ||3.4.3||

IAST: acchā namobhir vṛṣabhaṁ vandadhyai sa devān yakṣad iṣito yajīyān
Griffith: That we may greet the Strong One with our homage. Urged, may he bring the Gods, best Sacrificer.
Devanāgarī: अच्छा नमोभिर्वृषभं वन्दध्यै स देवान्यक्षदिषितो यजीयान्
pada pāṭha: pra | dīdhitiḥ | viśva-vārā | jigāti | hotāram | iḷaḥ | prathamam | yajadhyai || accha | namaḥ-bhiḥ | vr̥ṣabham | vandadhyai | saḥ | devān | yakṣat | iṣitaḥ | yajīyān ||3.4.3||

IAST: ūrdhvo vāṁ gātur adhvare akāry ūrdhvā śocīṁṣi prasthitā rajāṁsi
Griffith: On high your way to sacrifice was made ready; the radiant flames went upward to the regions.
Devanāgarī: ऊर्ध्वो वां गातुरध्वरे अकार्यूर्ध्वा शोचींषि प्रस्थिता रजांसि
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvaḥ | vām | gātuḥ | adhvare | akāri | ūrdhvā | śocīṁṣi | pra-sthitā | rajāṁsi || divaḥ | vā | nābhā | ni | asādi | hotā | str̥ṇīmahi | deva-vyacāḥ | vi | barhiḥ ||3.4.4||

IAST: divo vā nābhā ny asādi hotā stṛṇīmahi devavyacā vi barhiḥ
Griffith: Full in the midst of heaven the Priest is seated: sirew we the sacred grass where Gods may rest them.
Devanāgarī: दिवो वा नाभा न्यसादि होता स्तृणीमहि देवव्यचा वि बर्हिः
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvaḥ | vām | gātuḥ | adhvare | akāri | ūrdhvā | śocīṁṣi | pra-sthitā | rajāṁsi || divaḥ | vā | nābhā | ni | asādi | hotā | str̥ṇīmahi | deva-vyacāḥ | vi | barhiḥ ||3.4.4||

IAST: sapta hotrāṇi manasā vṛṇānā invanto viśvam prati yann ṛtena
Griffith: Claiming in mind the seven priests' burntoblations, inciting all, they came in settled order.
Devanāgarī: सप्त होत्राणि मनसा वृणाना इन्वन्तो विश्वं प्रति यन्नृतेन
pada pāṭha: sapta | hotrāṇi | manasā | vr̥ṇānāḥ | invantaḥ | viśvam | prati | yan | r̥tena || nr̥-peśasaḥ | vidatheṣu | pra | jātāḥ | abhi | imam | yajñam | vi | caranta | pūrvīḥ ||3.4.5||

IAST: nṛpeśaso vidatheṣu pra jātā abhīmaṁ yajñaṁ vi caranta pūrvīḥ
Griffith: To this our sacrifice approach the many who show in hero beauty at assemblies.
Devanāgarī: नृपेशसो विदथेषु प्र जाता अभीमं यज्ञं वि चरन्त पूर्वीः
pada pāṭha: sapta | hotrāṇi | manasā | vr̥ṇānāḥ | invantaḥ | viśvam | prati | yan | r̥tena || nr̥-peśasaḥ | vidatheṣu | pra | jātāḥ | abhi | imam | yajñam | vi | caranta | pūrvīḥ ||3.4.5||

IAST: ā bhandamāne uṣasā upāke uta smayete tanvā virūpe
Griffith: Night and Dawn, lauded, hither come together, both smiling, different are their forms in colour,
Devanāgarī: आ भन्दमाने उषसा उपाके उत स्मयेते तन्वा विरूपे
pada pāṭha: ā | bhandamāne iti | uṣasau | upāke iti | uta | smayete iti | tanvā | virūpe iti vi-rūpe || yathā | naḥ | mitraḥ | varuṇaḥ | jujoṣat | indraḥ | marutvān | uta | vā | mahaḥ-bhiḥ ||3.4.6||

IAST: yathā no mitro varuṇo jujoṣad indro marutvām̐ uta vā mahobhiḥ
Griffith: That Varuna and Mitra may accept us, and Indra, girt by Maruts, with his glories.
Devanāgarī: यथा नो मित्रो वरुणो जुजोषदिन्द्रो मरुत्वाँ उत वा महोभिः
pada pāṭha: ā | bhandamāne iti | uṣasau | upāke iti | uta | smayete iti | tanvā | virūpe iti vi-rūpe || yathā | naḥ | mitraḥ | varuṇaḥ | jujoṣat | indraḥ | marutvān | uta | vā | mahaḥ-bhiḥ ||3.4.6||

IAST: daivyā hotārā prathamā ny ṛñje sapta pṛkṣāsaḥ svadhayā madanti
Griffith: I crave the grace of heaven's two chief Invokers: the seven swift steeds joy in their wonted manner.
Devanāgarī: दैव्या होतारा प्रथमा न्यृञ्जे सप्त पृक्षासः स्वधया मदन्ति
pada pāṭha: daivyā | hotārā | prathamā | ni | r̥ñje | sapta | pr̥kṣāsaḥ | svadhayā | madanti || r̥tam | śaṁsantaḥ | r̥tam | it | te | āhuḥ | anu | vratam | vrata-pāḥ | dīdhyānāḥ ||3.4.7||

IAST: ṛtaṁ śaṁsanta ṛtam it ta āhur anu vrataṁ vratapā dīdhyānāḥ
Griffith: These speak of truth, praising the truth eternal, thinking on Order as the guards of Order.
Devanāgarī: ऋतं शंसन्त ऋतमित्त आहुरनु व्रतं व्रतपा दीध्यानाः
pada pāṭha: daivyā | hotārā | prathamā | ni | r̥ñje | sapta | pr̥kṣāsaḥ | svadhayā | madanti || r̥tam | śaṁsantaḥ | r̥tam | it | te | āhuḥ | anu | vratam | vrata-pāḥ | dīdhyānāḥ ||3.4.7||

IAST: ā bhāratī bhāratībhiḥ sajoṣā iḻā devair manuṣyebhir agniḥ
Griffith: May Bharati with all her Sisters, Ila accordant with the Gods, with mortalls Agni,
Devanāgarī: आ भारती भारतीभिः सजोषा इळा देवैर्मनुष्येभिरग्निः
pada pāṭha: ā | bhāratī | bhāratībhiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | iḷāḥ | devaiḥ | manuṣyebhiḥ | agniḥ || sarasvatī | sārasvatebhiḥ | arvāk | tisraḥ | devīḥ | barhiḥ | ā | idam | sadantu ||3.4.8||

IAST: sarasvatī sārasvatebhir arvāk tisro devīr barhir edaṁ sadantu
Griffith: Sarasvati with all her kindred Rivers, come to this grass, Three Goddesses, and seat them.
Devanāgarī: सरस्वती सारस्वतेभिरर्वाक्तिस्रो देवीर्बर्हिरेदं सदन्तु
pada pāṭha: ā | bhāratī | bhāratībhiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | iḷāḥ | devaiḥ | manuṣyebhiḥ | agniḥ || sarasvatī | sārasvatebhiḥ | arvāk | tisraḥ | devīḥ | barhiḥ | ā | idam | sadantu ||3.4.8||

IAST: tan nas turīpam adha poṣayitnu deva tvaṣṭar vi rarāṇaḥ syasva
Griffith: Well pleased with us do thou O God, O Tvastar, give ready issue to our procreant vigour,
Devanāgarī: तन्नस्तुरीपमध पोषयित्नु देव त्वष्टर्वि रराणः स्यस्व
pada pāṭha: tat | naḥ | turīpam | adha | poṣayitnu | deva | tvaṣṭaḥ | vi | rarāṇaḥ | syasveti syasva || yataḥ | vīraḥ | karmaṇyaḥ | su-dakṣaḥ | yukta-grāvā | jāyate | deva-kāmaḥ ||3.4.9||

IAST: yato vīraḥ karmaṇyaḥ sudakṣo yuktagrāvā jāyate devakāmaḥ
Griffith: Whence springs the hero, powerful, skilled in action, lover of Gods, adjuster of the press-stones.
Devanāgarī: यतो वीरः कर्मण्यः सुदक्षो युक्तग्रावा जायते देवकामः
pada pāṭha: tat | naḥ | turīpam | adha | poṣayitnu | deva | tvaṣṭaḥ | vi | rarāṇaḥ | syasveti syasva || yataḥ | vīraḥ | karmaṇyaḥ | su-dakṣaḥ | yukta-grāvā | jāyate | deva-kāmaḥ ||3.4.9||

IAST: vanaspate 'va sṛjopa devān agnir haviḥ śamitā sūdayāti
Griffith: Send to the Gods the oblation, Lord of Forests; and let the Immolator, Agni, dress it.
Devanāgarī: वनस्पतेऽव सृजोप देवानग्निर्हविः शमिता सूदयाति
pada pāṭha: vanaspate | ava | sr̥ja | upa | devān | agniḥ | haviḥ | śamitā | sūdayāti || saḥ | it | ūm̐ iti | hotā | satya-taraḥ | yajāti | yathā | devānām | janimāni | veda ||3.4.10||

IAST: sed u hotā satyataro yajāti yathā devānāṁ janimāni veda
Griffith: He as the truer Priest shall offer worship, for the Gods' generations well he knoweth.
Devanāgarī: सेदु होता सत्यतरो यजाति यथा देवानां जनिमानि वेद
pada pāṭha: vanaspate | ava | sr̥ja | upa | devān | agniḥ | haviḥ | śamitā | sūdayāti || saḥ | it | ūm̐ iti | hotā | satya-taraḥ | yajāti | yathā | devānām | janimāni | veda ||3.4.10||

IAST: ā yāhy agne samidhāno arvāṅ indreṇa devaiḥ sarathaṁ turebhiḥ
Griffith: Come thou to us, O Agni, duly kindled, together with the potent Gods and Indra.
Devanāgarī: आ याह्यग्ने समिधानो अर्वाङिन्द्रेण देवैः सरथं तुरेभिः
pada pāṭha: ā | yāhi | agne | sam-idhānaḥ | arvāṅ | indreṇa | devaiḥ | sa-ratham | turebhiḥ || barhiḥ | naḥ | āstām | aditiḥ | su-putrā | svāhā | devāḥ | amr̥tāḥ | mādayantām ||3.4.11||

IAST: barhir na āstām aditiḥ suputrā svāhā devā amṛtā mādayantām
Griffith: On this our grass sit Aditi, happy Mother, and let our Hail delight the Gods Immortal.
Devanāgarī: बर्हिर्न आस्तामदितिः सुपुत्रा स्वाहा देवा अमृता मादयन्ताम्
pada pāṭha: ā | yāhi | agne | sam-idhānaḥ | arvāṅ | indreṇa | devaiḥ | sa-ratham | turebhiḥ || barhiḥ | naḥ | āstām | aditiḥ | su-putrā | svāhā | devāḥ | amr̥tāḥ | mādayantām ||3.4.11||

IAST: praty agnir uṣasaś cekitāno 'bodhi vipraḥ padavīḥ kavīnām
Griffith: AGNI who shines against the Dawns is wakened. The holy Singer who precedes the sages.
Devanāgarī: प्रत्यग्निरुषसश्चेकितानोऽबोधि विप्रः पदवीः कवीनाम्
pada pāṭha: prati | agniḥ | uṣasaḥ | cekitānaḥ | abodhi | vipraḥ | pada-vīḥ | kavīnām || pr̥thu-pājāḥ | devayat-bhiḥ | sam-iddhaḥ | apa | dvārā | tamasaḥ | vahniḥ | āvarityāvaḥ ||3.5.1||

IAST: pṛthupājā devayadbhiḥ samiddho 'pa dvārā tamaso vahnir āvaḥ
Griffith: With far-spread lustre, kindled by the pious, the Priest hath thrown both gates of darkness open.
Devanāgarī: पृथुपाजा देवयद्भिः समिद्धोऽप द्वारा तमसो वह्निरावः
pada pāṭha: prati | agniḥ | uṣasaḥ | cekitānaḥ | abodhi | vipraḥ | pada-vīḥ | kavīnām || pr̥thu-pājāḥ | devayat-bhiḥ | sam-iddhaḥ | apa | dvārā | tamasaḥ | vahniḥ | āvarityāvaḥ ||3.5.1||

IAST: pred v agnir vāvṛdhe stomebhir gīrbhiḥ stotṝṇāṁ namasya ukthaiḥ
Griffith: Agni hath waxen mighty by laudations, to be adored with hymns of those who praise him.
Devanāgarī: प्रेद्वग्निर्वावृधे स्तोमेभिर्गीर्भिः स्तोतॄणां नमस्य उक्थैः
pada pāṭha: pra | it | ūm̐ iti | agniḥ | vavr̥dhe | stomebhiḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | stotr̥̄ṇām | namasyaḥ | ukthaiḥ || pūrvīḥ | r̥tasya | sam-dr̥śaḥ | cakānaḥ | sam | dūtaḥ | adyaut | uṣasaḥ | vi-roke ||3.5.2||

IAST: pūrvīr ṛtasya saṁdṛśaś cakānaḥ saṁ dūto adyaud uṣaso viroke
Griffith: Loving the varied shows of holy Order at the first flush of dawn he shines as envoy.
Devanāgarī: पूर्वीरृतस्य संदृशश्चकानः सं दूतो अद्यौदुषसो विरोके
pada pāṭha: pra | it | ūm̐ iti | agniḥ | vavr̥dhe | stomebhiḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | stotr̥̄ṇām | namasyaḥ | ukthaiḥ || pūrvīḥ | r̥tasya | sam-dr̥śaḥ | cakānaḥ | sam | dūtaḥ | adyaut | uṣasaḥ | vi-roke ||3.5.2||

IAST: adhāyy agnir mānuṣīṣu vikṣv apāṁ garbho mitra ṛtena sādhan
Griffith: Amid men's homes hath Agni been established, fulfilling with the Law, Friend, germ of waters.
Devanāgarī: अधाय्यग्निर्मानुषीषु विक्ष्वपां गर्भो मित्र ऋतेन साधन्
pada pāṭha: adhāyi | agniḥ | mānuṣīṣu | vikṣu | apām | garbhaḥ | mitraḥ | r̥tena | sādhan || ā | hiryataḥ | yajataḥ | sānu | asthāt | abhūt | ūm̐ iti | vipraḥ | havyaḥ | matīnām ||3.5.3||

IAST: ā haryato yajataḥ sānv asthād abhūd u vipro havyo matīnām
Griffith: Loved and adored, the height he hath ascended, the Singer, object of our invocations.
Devanāgarī: आ हर्यतो यजतः सान्वस्थादभूदु विप्रो हव्यो मतीनाम्
pada pāṭha: adhāyi | agniḥ | mānuṣīṣu | vikṣu | apām | garbhaḥ | mitraḥ | r̥tena | sādhan || ā | hiryataḥ | yajataḥ | sānu | asthāt | abhūt | ūm̐ iti | vipraḥ | havyaḥ | matīnām ||3.5.3||

IAST: mitro agnir bhavati yat samiddho mitro hotā varuṇo jātavedāḥ
Griffith: Agni is Mitra when enkindled duly, Mitra as Priest, Varuna, Jatavedas;
Devanāgarī: मित्रो अग्निर्भवति यत्समिद्धो मित्रो होता वरुणो जातवेदाः
pada pāṭha: mitraḥ | agniḥ | bhavati | yat | sam-iddhaḥ | mitraḥ | hotā | varuṇaḥ | jāta-vedāḥ || mitraḥ | adhvaryuḥ | iṣiraḥ | damūnāḥ | mitraḥ | sindhūnām | uta | parvatānām ||3.5.4||

IAST: mitro adhvaryur iṣiro damūnā mitraḥ sindhūnām uta parvatānām
Griffith: Mitra as active minister, and House-Friend, Mitra of flowing rivers and of mountains.
Devanāgarī: मित्रो अध्वर्युरिषिरो दमूना मित्रः सिन्धूनामुत पर्वतानाम्
pada pāṭha: mitraḥ | agniḥ | bhavati | yat | sam-iddhaḥ | mitraḥ | hotā | varuṇaḥ | jāta-vedāḥ || mitraḥ | adhvaryuḥ | iṣiraḥ | damūnāḥ | mitraḥ | sindhūnām | uta | parvatānām ||3.5.4||

IAST: pāti priyaṁ ripo agram padaṁ veḥ pāti yahvaś caraṇaṁ sūryasya
Griffith: The Earth's, the Bird's dear lofty place he guardeth, he guardeth in his might the course of Surya,
Devanāgarī: पाति प्रियं रिपो अग्रं पदं वेः पाति यह्वश्चरणं सूर्यस्य
pada pāṭha: pāti | priyam | ripaḥ | agram | padam | veḥ | pāti | yahvaḥ | caraṇam | sūryasya || pāti | nābhā | sapta-śīrṣāṇām | agniḥ | pāti | devānām | upa-mādam | r̥ṣvaḥ ||3.5.5||

IAST: pāti nābhā saptaśīrṣāṇam agniḥ pāti devānām upamādam ṛṣvaḥ
Griffith: Guardeth the Seven-headed in the centre, guardeth sublime the Deities enjoyment.
Devanāgarī: पाति नाभा सप्तशीर्षाणमग्निः पाति देवानामुपमादमृष्वः
pada pāṭha: pāti | priyam | ripaḥ | agram | padam | veḥ | pāti | yahvaḥ | caraṇam | sūryasya || pāti | nābhā | sapta-śīrṣāṇām | agniḥ | pāti | devānām | upa-mādam | r̥ṣvaḥ ||3.5.5||

IAST: ṛbhuś cakra īḍyaṁ cāru nāma viśvāni devo vayunāni vidvān
Griffith: The skilful God who knows all forms of knowledge made for himself a fair form, meet for worship.
Devanāgarī: ऋभुश्चक्र ईड्यं चारु नाम विश्वानि देवो वयुनानि विद्वान्
pada pāṭha: r̥bhuḥ | cakre | īḍyam | cāru | nāma | viśvāni | devaḥ | vayunāni | vidvān || sasasya | carma | ghr̥ta-vat | padam | veḥ | tat | it | agniḥ | rakṣati | apra-yucchan ||3.5.6||

IAST: sasasya carma ghṛtavat padaṁ ves tad id agnī rakṣaty aprayucchan
Griffith: This Agni guards with care that never ceases the Sonia's skin, the Bird's place rich in fatness.
Devanāgarī: ससस्य चर्म घृतवत्पदं वेस्तदिदग्नी रक्षत्यप्रयुच्छन्
pada pāṭha: r̥bhuḥ | cakre | īḍyam | cāru | nāma | viśvāni | devaḥ | vayunāni | vidvān || sasasya | carma | ghr̥ta-vat | padam | veḥ | tat | it | agniḥ | rakṣati | apra-yucchan ||3.5.6||

IAST: ā yonim agnir ghṛtavantam asthāt pṛthupragāṇam uśantam uśānaḥ
Griffith: Agni hath entered longingly the longing shrine rich with fatness, giving easy access.
Devanāgarī: आ योनिमग्निर्घृतवन्तमस्थात्पृथुप्रगाणमुशन्तमुशानः
pada pāṭha: ā | yonim | agniḥ | ghr̥ta-vantam | asthāt | pr̥thu-pragānam | uśantam | uśānaḥ || dīdyānaḥ | śuciḥ | r̥ṣvaḥ | pāvakaḥ | punaḥ-punaḥ | mātarā | navyasī iti | kariti kaḥ ||3.5.7||

IAST: dīdyānaḥ śucir ṛṣvaḥ pāvakaḥ punaḥ-punar mātarā navyasī kaḥ
Griffith: Resplendent, pure, sublime and purifying, again, again he renovates his Mothers.
Devanāgarī: दीद्यानः शुचिरृष्वः पावकः पुनःपुनर्मातरा नव्यसी कः
pada pāṭha: ā | yonim | agniḥ | ghr̥ta-vantam | asthāt | pr̥thu-pragānam | uśantam | uśānaḥ || dīdyānaḥ | śuciḥ | r̥ṣvaḥ | pāvakaḥ | punaḥ-punaḥ | mātarā | navyasī iti | kariti kaḥ ||3.5.7||

IAST: sadyo jāta oṣadhībhir vavakṣe yadī vardhanti prasvo ghṛtena
Griffith: Born suddenly, by plants he grew to greatness, when tender shoots with holy oil increased him,
Devanāgarī: सद्यो जात ओषधीभिर्ववक्षे यदी वर्धन्ति प्रस्वो घृतेन
pada pāṭha: sadyaḥ | jātaḥ | oṣadhībhiḥ | vavakṣe | yadi | vardhanti | pra-svaḥ | ghr̥tena || āpaḥ-iva | pra-vatā | śumbhamānāḥ | uruṣyat | agniḥ | pitroḥ | upa-sthe ||3.5.8||

IAST: āpa iva pravatā śumbhamānā uruṣyad agniḥ pitror upasthe
Griffith: Like waters lovely when they hasten downward may Agni in his Parents' lap protect us.
Devanāgarī: आप इव प्रवता शुम्भमाना उरुष्यदग्निः पित्रोरुपस्थे
pada pāṭha: sadyaḥ | jātaḥ | oṣadhībhiḥ | vavakṣe | yadi | vardhanti | pra-svaḥ | ghr̥tena || āpaḥ-iva | pra-vatā | śumbhamānāḥ | uruṣyat | agniḥ | pitroḥ | upa-sthe ||3.5.8||

IAST: ud u ṣṭutaḥ samidhā yahvo adyaud varṣman divo adhi nābhā pṛthivyāḥ
Griffith: Extolled, the Strong shone forth with kindled fuel to the earth's centre, to the height of heaven.
Devanāgarī: उदु ष्टुतः समिधा यह्वो अद्यौद्वर्ष्मन्दिवो अधि नाभा पृथिव्याः
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti| stutaḥ | sam-idhā | yahvaḥ | adyaut | varṣman | divaḥ | adhi | nābhā | pr̥thivyāḥ || mitraḥ | agniḥ | īḍyaḥ | mātariśvā | ā | dūtaḥ | vakṣat | yajathāya | devān ||3.5.9||

IAST: mitro agnir īḍyo mātariśvā dūto vakṣad yajathāya devān
Griffith: May Agni, Friend, adorable Matarisvan, as envoy bring the Gods unto our worship.
Devanāgarī: मित्रो अग्निरीड्यो मातरिश्वा दूतो वक्षद्यजथाय देवान्
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti| stutaḥ | sam-idhā | yahvaḥ | adyaut | varṣman | divaḥ | adhi | nābhā | pr̥thivyāḥ || mitraḥ | agniḥ | īḍyaḥ | mātariśvā | ā | dūtaḥ | vakṣat | yajathāya | devān ||3.5.9||

IAST: ud astambhīt samidhā nākam ṛṣvo 'gnir bhavann uttamo rocanānām
Griffith: Best of all luminaries lofty Agni supported with his flame the height of heaven,
Devanāgarī: उदस्तम्भीत्समिधा नाकमृष्वोऽग्निर्भवन्नुत्तमो रोचनानाम्
pada pāṭha: ut | astambhīt | sam-idhā | nākam | r̥ṣvaḥ | agniḥ | bhavan | ut-tamaḥ | rocanānām || yadi | bhr̥gu-bhyaḥ | pari | mātariśvā | guhā | santam | havya-vāham | sam-īdhe ||3.5.10||

IAST: yadī bhṛgubhyaḥ pari mātariśvā guhā santaṁ havyavāhaṁ samīdhe
Griffith: When, far from Bhrgus, Matarisvan kindled the oblation-bearer where he lay in secret.
Devanāgarī: यदी भृगुभ्यः परि मातरिश्वा गुहा सन्तं हव्यवाहं समीधे
pada pāṭha: ut | astambhīt | sam-idhā | nākam | r̥ṣvaḥ | agniḥ | bhavan | ut-tamaḥ | rocanānām || yadi | bhr̥gu-bhyaḥ | pari | mātariśvā | guhā | santam | havya-vāham | sam-īdhe ||3.5.10||

IAST: iḻām agne purudaṁsaṁ saniṁ goḥ śaśvattamaṁ havamānāya sādha
Griffith: As holy food, Agni to thine invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels.
Devanāgarī: इळामग्ने पुरुदंसं सनिं गोः शश्वत्तमं हवमानाय साध
pada pāṭha: iḷām | agne | puru-daṁsam | sanim | goḥ | śaśvat-tamam | havamānāya | sādha || syāt | naḥ | sūnuḥ | tanayaḥ | vijā-vā | agne | sā | te | su-matiḥ | bhūtu | asme iti ||3.5.11||

IAST: syān naḥ sūnus tanayo vijāvāgne sā te sumatir bhūtv asme
Griffith: To us be born a son and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-word.
Devanāgarī: स्यान्नः सूनुस्तनयो विजावाग्ने सा ते सुमतिर्भूत्वस्मे
pada pāṭha: iḷām | agne | puru-daṁsam | sanim | goḥ | śaśvat-tamam | havamānāya | sādha || syāt | naḥ | sūnuḥ | tanayaḥ | vijā-vā | agne | sā | te | su-matiḥ | bhūtu | asme iti ||3.5.11||

IAST: pra kāravo mananā vacyamānā devadrīcīṁ nayata devayantaḥ
Griffith: URGED on by deep devotion, O ye singers, bring, pious ones, the God-approaching ladle.
Devanāgarī: प्र कारवो मनना वच्यमाना देवद्रीचीं नयत देवयन्तः
pada pāṭha: pra | kāravaḥ | mananā | vacyamānāḥ | devadrīcīm | nayata | deva-yantaḥ || dakṣiṇā-vāṭ | vājinī | prācī | eti | haviḥ | bharantī | agnaye | ghr̥tācī ||3.6.1||

IAST: dakṣiṇāvāḍ vājinī prācy eti havir bharanty agnaye ghṛtācī
Griffith: Borne onward to the right it travels eastward, and, filled with oil, to Agni bears oblation.
Devanāgarī: दक्षिणावाड्वाजिनी प्राच्येति हविर्भरन्त्यग्नये घृताची
pada pāṭha: pra | kāravaḥ | mananā | vacyamānāḥ | devadrīcīm | nayata | deva-yantaḥ || dakṣiṇā-vāṭ | vājinī | prācī | eti | haviḥ | bharantī | agnaye | ghr̥tācī ||3.6.1||

IAST: ā rodasī apṛṇā jāyamāna uta pra rikthā adha nu prayajyo
Griffith: Thou at thy birth didst fill both earth and heaven, yea, Most Adorable, thou didst exceed them.
Devanāgarī: आ रोदसी अपृणा जायमान उत प्र रिक्था अध नु प्रयज्यो
pada pāṭha: ā | rodasī iti | apr̥ṇāḥ | jāyamānaḥ | uta | pra | rikthāḥ | adha | nu | prayajyo iti pra-yajyo || divaḥ | cit | agne | mahinā | pr̥thivyāḥ | vacyantām | te | vahnayaḥ | sapta-jihvāḥ ||3.6.2||

IAST: divaś cid agne mahinā pṛthivyā vacyantāṁ te vahnayaḥ saptajihvāḥ
Griffith: Even through the heaven's and through the earth's expanses let thy swift seventongued flames roll on, O Agni.
Devanāgarī: दिवश्चिदग्ने महिना पृथिव्या वच्यन्तां ते वह्नयः सप्तजिह्वाः
pada pāṭha: ā | rodasī iti | apr̥ṇāḥ | jāyamānaḥ | uta | pra | rikthāḥ | adha | nu | prayajyo iti pra-yajyo || divaḥ | cit | agne | mahinā | pr̥thivyāḥ | vacyantām | te | vahnayaḥ | sapta-jihvāḥ ||3.6.2||

IAST: dyauś ca tvā pṛthivī yajñiyāso ni hotāraṁ sādayante damāya
Griffith: Both Heaven and Earth and Gods who should be worshipped establish thee as Priest for every dwelling,
Devanāgarī: द्यौश्च त्वा पृथिवी यज्ञियासो नि होतारं सादयन्ते दमाय
pada pāṭha: dyauḥ | ca | tvā | pr̥thivī | yajñiyāsaḥ | ni | hotāram | sādayante | damāya || yadi | viśaḥ | mānuṣīḥ | deva-yantīḥ | prayasvatīḥ | īḷate | śukram | arciḥ ||3.6.3||

IAST: yadī viśo mānuṣīr devayantīḥ prayasvatīr īḻate śukram arciḥ
Griffith: Whenever human families, God-devoted, bringing oblations; laud thy splendid lustre.
Devanāgarī: यदी विशो मानुषीर्देवयन्तीः प्रयस्वतीरीळते शुक्रमर्चिः
pada pāṭha: dyauḥ | ca | tvā | pr̥thivī | yajñiyāsaḥ | ni | hotāram | sādayante | damāya || yadi | viśaḥ | mānuṣīḥ | deva-yantīḥ | prayasvatīḥ | īḷate | śukram | arciḥ ||3.6.3||

IAST: mahān sadhasthe dhruva ā niṣatto 'ntar dyāvā māhine haryamāṇaḥ
Griffith: Firm in the Gods' home is the Mighty seated, between vast Heaven and Earth the well-beloved-
Devanāgarī: महान्सधस्थे ध्रुव आ निषत्तोऽन्तर्द्यावा माहिने हर्यमाणः
pada pāṭha: mahān | sadha-sthe | dhruvaḥ | ā | ni-sattaḥ | antaḥ | dyāvā | māhine iti | haryamāṇaḥ || āskre iti | sapatnī iti sa-patnī | ajare iti | amr̥kte iti | sabardughe iti sabaḥ-dughe | uru-gāyasya | dhenū iti ||3.6.4||

IAST: āskre sapatnī ajare amṛkte sabardughe urugāyasya dhenū
Griffith: Those Cows who yield, unharmed, their nectar, Spouses of the Far-Strider, everyoung, united.
Devanāgarī: आस्क्रे सपत्नी अजरे अमृक्ते सबर्दुघे उरुगायस्य धेनू
pada pāṭha: mahān | sadha-sthe | dhruvaḥ | ā | ni-sattaḥ | antaḥ | dyāvā | māhine iti | haryamāṇaḥ || āskre iti | sapatnī iti sa-patnī | ajare iti | amr̥kte iti | sabardughe iti sabaḥ-dughe | uru-gāyasya | dhenū iti ||3.6.4||

IAST: vratā te agne mahato mahāni tava kratvā rodasī ā tatantha
Griffith: Great are the deeds of thee, the Great, O Agni: thou by thy power hast spread out earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: व्रता ते अग्ने महतो महानि तव क्रत्वा रोदसी आ ततन्थ
pada pāṭha: vratā | te | agne | mahataḥ | mahāni | tava | kratvā | rodasī iti | ā | tatantha || tvam | dūtaḥ | abhavaḥ | jāyamānaḥ | tvam | netā | vr̥ṣabha | carṣaṇīnām ||3.6.5||

IAST: tvaṁ dūto abhavo jāyamānas tvaṁ netā vṛṣabha carṣaṇīnām
Griffith: As soon as thou wast born thou wast an envoy, thou, Mighty One, was Leader of the people.
Devanāgarī: त्वं दूतो अभवो जायमानस्त्वं नेता वृषभ चर्षणीनाम्
pada pāṭha: vratā | te | agne | mahataḥ | mahāni | tava | kratvā | rodasī iti | ā | tatantha || tvam | dūtaḥ | abhavaḥ | jāyamānaḥ | tvam | netā | vr̥ṣabha | carṣaṇīnām ||3.6.5||

IAST: ṛtasya vā keśinā yogyābhir ghṛtasnuvā rohitā dhuri dhiṣva
Griffith: Bind to the pole with cords of holy Order the long-maned ruddy steeds who sprinkle fatness.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य वा केशिना योग्याभिर्घृतस्नुवा रोहिता धुरि धिष्व
pada pāṭha: r̥tasya | vā | keśinā | yogyābhiḥ | ghr̥ta-snuvā | rohitā | dhuri | dhiṣva || atha | ā | vaha | devān | deva | viśvān | su-adhvarā | kr̥ṇuhi | jāta-vedaḥ ||3.6.6||

IAST: athā vaha devān deva viśvān svadhvarā kṛṇuhi jātavedaḥ
Griffith: Bring hithier, O thou God, all Gods together: provide them noble worship, Jatavedas.
Devanāgarī: अथा वह देवान्देव विश्वान्स्वध्वरा कृणुहि जातवेदः
pada pāṭha: r̥tasya | vā | keśinā | yogyābhiḥ | ghr̥ta-snuvā | rohitā | dhuri | dhiṣva || atha | ā | vaha | devān | deva | viśvān | su-adhvarā | kr̥ṇuhi | jāta-vedaḥ ||3.6.6||

IAST: divaś cid ā te rucayanta rokā uṣo vibhātīr anu bhāsi pūrvīḥ
Griffith: Even from the sky thy brilliant lights shone hither: still hast thou beamed through many a radiant morning,
Devanāgarī: दिवश्चिदा ते रुचयन्त रोका उषो विभातीरनु भासि पूर्वीः
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | cit | ā | te | rucayanta | rokāḥ | uṣaḥ | vi-bhātīḥ | anu | bhāsi | pūrvīḥ || apaḥ | yat | agne | uśadhak | vaneṣu | hotuḥ | mandrasya | panayanta | devāḥ ||3.6.7||

IAST: apo yad agna uśadhag vaneṣu hotur mandrasya panayanta devāḥ
Griffith: That the Gods praised their joyous Herald's labour eagerly burning, Agni, in the forests.
Devanāgarī: अपो यदग्न उशधग्वनेषु होतुर्मन्द्रस्य पनयन्त देवाः
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | cit | ā | te | rucayanta | rokāḥ | uṣaḥ | vi-bhātīḥ | anu | bhāsi | pūrvīḥ || apaḥ | yat | agne | uśadhak | vaneṣu | hotuḥ | mandrasya | panayanta | devāḥ ||3.6.7||

IAST: urau vā ye antarikṣe madanti divo vā ye rocane santi devāḥ
Griffith: The Gods who take delight in air's wide region, or those the dwellers in heaven's realm of brightness,
Devanāgarī: उरौ वा ये अन्तरिक्षे मदन्ति दिवो वा ये रोचने सन्ति देवाः
pada pāṭha: urau | vā | ye | antarikṣe | madanti | divaḥ | vā | ye | rocane | santi | devāḥ || ūmāḥ | vā | ye | su-havāsaḥ | yajatrāḥ | ā-yemire | rathyaḥ | agne | aśvāḥ ||3.6.8||

IAST: ūmā vā ye suhavāso yajatrā āyemire rathyo agne aśvāḥ
Griffith: Or those, the Holy, prompt to hear, our helpers, who, carborne, turn their horses hither, Agni---
Devanāgarī: ऊमा वा ये सुहवासो यजत्रा आयेमिरे रथ्यो अग्ने अश्वाः
pada pāṭha: urau | vā | ye | antarikṣe | madanti | divaḥ | vā | ye | rocane | santi | devāḥ || ūmāḥ | vā | ye | su-havāsaḥ | yajatrāḥ | ā-yemire | rathyaḥ | agne | aśvāḥ ||3.6.8||

IAST: aibhir agne sarathaṁ yāhy arvāṅ nānārathaṁ vā vibhavo hy aśvāḥ
Griffith: With these, borne on one ear, Agni, approach us, or borne on many, for thy steeds are able.
Devanāgarī: ऐभिरग्ने सरथं याह्यर्वाङ्नानारथं वा विभवो ह्यश्वाः
pada pāṭha: ā | ebhiḥ | agne | sa-ratham | yāhi | arvāṅ | nānā-ratham | vā | vi-bhavaḥ | hi | aśvāḥ || patnī-vataḥ | triṁśatam | trīn | ca | devān | anu-svadham | ā | vaha | mādayasva ||3.6.9||

IAST: patnīvatas triṁśataṁ trīm̐ś ca devān anuṣvadham ā vaha mādayasva
Griffith: Bring, witb their Dames, the Gods, the Three and-Thirty, after thy Godlike nature, and be joyful.
Devanāgarī: पत्नीवतस्त्रिंशतं त्रीँश्च देवाननुष्वधमा वह मादयस्व
pada pāṭha: ā | ebhiḥ | agne | sa-ratham | yāhi | arvāṅ | nānā-ratham | vā | vi-bhavaḥ | hi | aśvāḥ || patnī-vataḥ | triṁśatam | trīn | ca | devān | anu-svadham | ā | vaha | mādayasva ||3.6.9||

IAST: sa hotā yasya rodasī cid urvī yajñaṁ-yajñam abhi vṛdhe gṛṇītaḥ
Griffith: He is the Priest at whose repeated worship even wide Heaven and Earth sing out for increase.
Devanāgarī: स होता यस्य रोदसी चिदुर्वी यज्ञंयज्ञमभि वृधे गृणीतः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hotā | yasya | rodasī iti | cit | urvī iti | yajñam-yajñam | abhi | vr̥dhe | gr̥ṇītaḥ || prācī iti | adhvarā-iva | tasthatuḥ | sumeke iti su-meke | r̥tavarī ityr̥ta-varī | r̥ta-jātasya | satye iti ||3.6.10||

IAST: prācī adhvareva tasthatuḥ sumeke ṛtāvarī ṛtajātasya satye
Griffith: They fair and true and holy coming forward stand at his sacrifice who springs from Order.
Devanāgarī: प्राची अध्वरेव तस्थतुः सुमेके ऋतावरी ऋतजातस्य सत्ये
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hotā | yasya | rodasī iti | cit | urvī iti | yajñam-yajñam | abhi | vr̥dhe | gr̥ṇītaḥ || prācī iti | adhvarā-iva | tasthatuḥ | sumeke iti su-meke | r̥tavarī ityr̥ta-varī | r̥ta-jātasya | satye iti ||3.6.10||

IAST: iḻām agne purudaṁsaṁ saniṁ goḥ śaśvattamaṁ havamānāya sādha
Griffith: As holy food, Agni, to thine invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels.
Devanāgarī: इळामग्ने पुरुदंसं सनिं गोः शश्वत्तमं हवमानाय साध
pada pāṭha: iḷām | agne | puru-daṁsam | sanim | goḥ | śaśvat-tamam | havamānāya | sādha || syāt | naḥ | sūnuḥ | tanayaḥ | vijā-vā | agne | sā | te | su-matiḥ | bhūtu | asme iti ||3.6.11||

IAST: syān naḥ sūnus tanayo vijāvāgne sā te sumatir bhūtv asme
Griffith: To us be born a son and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to usward.
Devanāgarī: स्यान्नः सूनुस्तनयो विजावाग्ने सा ते सुमतिर्भूत्वस्मे
pada pāṭha: iḷām | agne | puru-daṁsam | sanim | goḥ | śaśvat-tamam | havamānāya | sādha || syāt | naḥ | sūnuḥ | tanayaḥ | vijā-vā | agne | sā | te | su-matiḥ | bhūtu | asme iti ||3.6.11||

IAST: pra ya āruḥ śitipṛṣṭhasya dhāser ā mātarā viviśuḥ sapta vāṇīḥ
Griffith: THE seven tones risen from the whitebacked viand have made their way between the pair of Mothers.
Devanāgarī: प्र य आरुः शितिपृष्ठस्य धासेरा मातरा विविशुः सप्त वाणीः
pada pāṭha: pra | ye | āruḥ | śiti-pr̥ṣṭhasya | dhāseḥ | ā | mātarā | viviśuḥ | sapta | vāṇīḥ || pari-kṣitā | pitarā | sam | carete iti | pra | sarsrāte iti | dīrgham | āyuḥ | pra-yakṣe ||3.7.1||

IAST: parikṣitā pitarā saṁ carete pra sarsrāte dīrgham āyuḥ prayakṣe
Griffith: Both circumjacent Parents come together to yield us length of days they hasten forward.
Devanāgarī: परिक्षिता पितरा सं चरेते प्र सर्स्राते दीर्घमायुः प्रयक्षे
pada pāṭha: pra | ye | āruḥ | śiti-pr̥ṣṭhasya | dhāseḥ | ā | mātarā | viviśuḥ | sapta | vāṇīḥ || pari-kṣitā | pitarā | sam | carete iti | pra | sarsrāte iti | dīrgham | āyuḥ | pra-yakṣe ||3.7.1||

IAST: divakṣaso dhenavo vṛṣṇo aśvā devīr ā tasthau madhumad vahantīḥ
Griffith: The Male who dwells in heaven hath Mares and Milchkine: he came to Goddesses who bring sweet treasure.
Devanāgarī: दिवक्षसो धेनवो वृष्णो अश्वा देवीरा तस्थौ मधुमद्वहन्तीः
pada pāṭha: divakṣasaḥ | dhenavaḥ | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | aśvāḥ | devīḥ | ā | tasthau | madhu-mat | vahantīḥ || r̥tasya | tvā | sadasi | kṣema-yantam | pari | ekā | carati | vartanim | gauḥ ||3.7.2||

IAST: ṛtasya tvā sadasi kṣemayantam pary ekā carati vartaniṁ gauḥ
Griffith: To thee safe resting in the seat of Order the Cow alone upon her way proceedeth.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य त्वा सदसि क्षेमयन्तं पर्येका चरति वर्तनिं गौः
pada pāṭha: divakṣasaḥ | dhenavaḥ | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | aśvāḥ | devīḥ | ā | tasthau | madhu-mat | vahantīḥ || r̥tasya | tvā | sadasi | kṣema-yantam | pari | ekā | carati | vartanim | gauḥ ||3.7.2||

IAST: ā sīm arohat suyamā bhavantīḥ patiś cikitvān rayivid rayīṇām
Griffith: Wise Master, wealthy finder-out of riches, he mounted those who may with case be guided.
Devanāgarī: आ सीमरोहत्सुयमा भवन्तीः पतिश्चिकित्वान्रयिविद्रयीणाम्
pada pāṭha: ā | sīm | arohat | su-yamāḥ | bhavantīḥ | patiḥ | cikitvān | rayi-vit | rayīṇām || pra | nīla-pr̥ṣṭhaḥ | atasasya | dhāseḥ | tāḥ | avāsayat | purudha-pratīkaḥ ||3.7.3||

IAST: pra nīlapṛṣṭho atasasya dhāses tā avāsayat purudhapratīkaḥ
Griffith: He, dark-backed, manifold with varied aspect, hath made them burst forth from their food the brush-wood.
Devanāgarī: प्र नीलपृष्ठो अतसस्य धासेस्ता अवासयत्पुरुधप्रतीकः
pada pāṭha: ā | sīm | arohat | su-yamāḥ | bhavantīḥ | patiḥ | cikitvān | rayi-vit | rayīṇām || pra | nīla-pr̥ṣṭhaḥ | atasasya | dhāseḥ | tāḥ | avāsayat | purudha-pratīkaḥ ||3.7.3||

IAST: mahi tvāṣṭram ūrjayantīr ajuryaṁ stabhūyamānaṁ vahato vahanti
Griffith: Strength-giving streams bear hither him eternal, fain to support the mighty work. of Tvastar.
Devanāgarī: महि त्वाष्ट्रमूर्जयन्तीरजुर्यं स्तभूयमानं वहतो वहन्ति
pada pāṭha: mahi | tvāṣṭram | ūrjayantīḥ | ajuryam | stabhu-yamānam | vahataḥ | vahanti || vi | aṅgebhiḥ | didyutānaḥ | sadha-sthe | ekām-iva | rodasī iti | ā | viveśa ||3.7.4||

IAST: vy aṅgebhir didyutānaḥ sadhastha ekām iva rodasī ā viveśa
Griffith: He, flashing in his home with all his members, hath entered both the worlds as they were single.
Devanāgarī: व्यङ्गेभिर्दिद्युतानः सधस्थ एकामिव रोदसी आ विवेश
pada pāṭha: mahi | tvāṣṭram | ūrjayantīḥ | ajuryam | stabhu-yamānam | vahataḥ | vahanti || vi | aṅgebhiḥ | didyutānaḥ | sadha-sthe | ekām-iva | rodasī iti | ā | viveśa ||3.7.4||

IAST: jānanti vṛṣṇo aruṣasya śevam uta bradhnasya śāsane raṇanti
Griffith: They know the red Bull's blessing, and are joyful under the flaming-coloured Lord's dominion:
Devanāgarī: जानन्ति वृष्णो अरुषस्य शेवमुत ब्रध्नस्य शासने रणन्ति
pada pāṭha: jānanti | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | aruṣasya | śevam | uta | bradhnasya | śāsane | raṇanti || divaḥ-rucaḥ | su-rucaḥ | rocamānāḥ | iḷā | yeṣām | gaṇyā | māhinā | gīḥ ||3.7.5||

IAST: divorucaḥ suruco rocamānā iḻā yeṣāṁ gaṇyā māhinā gīḥ
Griffith: They who give shine from heavenwith fair effulgence, whose lofty song like Ila must be honoured.
Devanāgarī: दिवोरुचः सुरुचो रोचमाना इळा येषां गण्या माहिना गीः
pada pāṭha: jānanti | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | aruṣasya | śevam | uta | bradhnasya | śāsane | raṇanti || divaḥ-rucaḥ | su-rucaḥ | rocamānāḥ | iḷā | yeṣām | gaṇyā | māhinā | gīḥ ||3.7.5||

IAST: uto pitṛbhyām pravidānu ghoṣam maho mahadbhyām anayanta śūṣam
Griffith: Yea, by tradition from the ancient sages they brought great strength from the two mighty Parents,
Devanāgarī: उतो पितृभ्यां प्रविदानु घोषं महो महद्भ्यामनयन्त शूषम्
pada pāṭha: uto iti | pitr̥-bhyām | pra-vidā | anu | ghoṣam | mahaḥ | mahat-bhyām | anayanta | śūṣam || ukṣā | ha | yatra | pari | dhānam | aktoḥ | anu | svam | dhāma | jarituḥ | vavakṣa ||3.7.6||

IAST: ukṣā ha yatra pari dhānam aktor anu svaṁ dhāma jaritur vavakṣa
Griffith: To where the singer's Bull, the night's dispeller, after his proper law hath waxen stronger.
Devanāgarī: उक्षा ह यत्र परि धानमक्तोरनु स्वं धाम जरितुर्ववक्ष
pada pāṭha: uto iti | pitr̥-bhyām | pra-vidā | anu | ghoṣam | mahaḥ | mahat-bhyām | anayanta | śūṣam || ukṣā | ha | yatra | pari | dhānam | aktoḥ | anu | svam | dhāma | jarituḥ | vavakṣa ||3.7.6||

IAST: adhvaryubhiḥ pañcabhiḥ sapta viprāḥ priyaṁ rakṣante nihitam padaṁ veḥ
Griffith: Seven holy singers guard with five Adhvaryus the Bird's beloved firmly-settled station.
Devanāgarī: अध्वर्युभिः पञ्चभिः सप्त विप्राः प्रियं रक्षन्ते निहितं पदं वेः
pada pāṭha: adhvaryu-bhiḥ | pañca-bhiḥ | sapta | viprāḥ | priyam | rakṣante | ni-hitam | padam | veriti veḥ || prāñcaḥ | madanti | ukṣaṇaḥ | ajuryāḥ | devāḥ | devānām | anu | hi | vratā | guriti guḥ ||3.7.7||

IAST: prāñco madanty ukṣaṇo ajuryā devā devānām anu hi vratā guḥ
Griffith: The willing Bulls, untouched by old, rejoice them: as Gods themselves the ways of Gods they follow.
Devanāgarī: प्राञ्चो मदन्त्युक्षणो अजुर्या देवा देवानामनु हि व्रता गुः
pada pāṭha: adhvaryu-bhiḥ | pañca-bhiḥ | sapta | viprāḥ | priyam | rakṣante | ni-hitam | padam | veriti veḥ || prāñcaḥ | madanti | ukṣaṇaḥ | ajuryāḥ | devāḥ | devānām | anu | hi | vratā | guriti guḥ ||3.7.7||

IAST: daivyā hotārā prathamā ny ṛñje sapta pṛkṣāsaḥ svadhayā madanti
Griffith: I crave the grace of heaven's two chief Invokers: the seven swift steeds joy in their wonted manner.
Devanāgarī: दैव्या होतारा प्रथमा न्यृञ्जे सप्त पृक्षासः स्वधया मदन्ति
pada pāṭha: daivyā | hotārā | prathamā | ni | r̥ñje | sapta | pr̥kṣāsaḥ | svadhayā | madanti || r̥tam | śaṁsantaḥ | r̥tam | it | te | āhuḥ | anu | vratam | vrata-pāḥ | dīdhyānāḥ ||3.7.8||

IAST: ṛtaṁ śaṁsanta ṛtam it ta āhur anu vrataṁ vratapā dīdhyānāḥ
Griffith: These speak of truth, praising the Truth Eternal, thinking on Order as the guards of Order.
Devanāgarī: ऋतं शंसन्त ऋतमित्त आहुरनु व्रतं व्रतपा दीध्यानाः
pada pāṭha: daivyā | hotārā | prathamā | ni | r̥ñje | sapta | pr̥kṣāsaḥ | svadhayā | madanti || r̥tam | śaṁsantaḥ | r̥tam | it | te | āhuḥ | anu | vratam | vrata-pāḥ | dīdhyānāḥ ||3.7.8||

IAST: vṛṣāyante mahe atyāya pūrvīr vṛṣṇe citrāya raśmayaḥ suyāmāḥ
Griffith: The many seek the great Steed as a stallion: the reins obey the Lord of varied colour.
Devanāgarī: वृषायन्ते महे अत्याय पूर्वीर्वृष्णे चित्राय रश्मयः सुयामाः
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣa-yante | mahe | atyāya | pūrvīḥ | vr̥ṣṇe | citrāya | raśmayaḥ | su-yāmāḥ || deva | hotaḥ | mandra-taraḥ | cikitvān | mahaḥ | devān | rodasī iti | ā | iha | vakṣi ||3.7.9||

IAST: deva hotar mandrataraś cikitvān maho devān rodasī eha vakṣi
Griffith: O heavenly Priest, most pleasant, full of wisdom, bring the great Gods to us, and Earth and Heaven.
Devanāgarī: देव होतर्मन्द्रतरश्चिकित्वान्महो देवान्रोदसी एह वक्षि
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣa-yante | mahe | atyāya | pūrvīḥ | vr̥ṣṇe | citrāya | raśmayaḥ | su-yāmāḥ || deva | hotaḥ | mandra-taraḥ | cikitvān | mahaḥ | devān | rodasī iti | ā | iha | vakṣi ||3.7.9||

IAST: pṛkṣaprayajo draviṇaḥ suvācaḥ suketava uṣaso revad ūṣuḥ
Griffith: Rich Lord, the Mornings have gleamed forth in splendour, fair-rayed, fair-speaking, worshipped with all viands,
Devanāgarī: पृक्षप्रयजो द्रविणः सुवाचः सुकेतव उषसो रेवदूषुः
pada pāṭha: pr̥kṣa-prayajaḥ | draviṇaḥ | su-vācaḥ | su-ketavaḥ | uṣasaḥ | revat | ūṣuḥ || uto iti | cit | agne | mahinā | pr̥thivyāḥ | kr̥tam | cit | enaḥ | sam | mahe | daśasya ||3.7.10||

IAST: uto cid agne mahinā pṛthivyāḥ kṛtaṁ cid enaḥ sam mahe daśasya
Griffith: Yea, with the glory of the earth, O Agni. Forgive us, for our weal, e'en sin cornmitted.
Devanāgarī: उतो चिदग्ने महिना पृथिव्याः कृतं चिदेनः सं महे दशस्य
pada pāṭha: pr̥kṣa-prayajaḥ | draviṇaḥ | su-vācaḥ | su-ketavaḥ | uṣasaḥ | revat | ūṣuḥ || uto iti | cit | agne | mahinā | pr̥thivyāḥ | kr̥tam | cit | enaḥ | sam | mahe | daśasya ||3.7.10||

IAST: iḻām agne purudaṁsaṁ saniṁ goḥ śaśvattamaṁ havamānāya sādha
Griffith: As holy food, Agni, to thine invoker, give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels.
Devanāgarī: इळामग्ने पुरुदंसं सनिं गोः शश्वत्तमं हवमानाय साध
pada pāṭha: iḷām | agne | puru-daṁsam | sanim | goḥ | śaśvat-tamam | havamānāya | sādha || syāt | naḥ | sūnuḥ | tanayaḥ | vijā-vā | agne | sā | te | su-matiḥ | bhūtu | asme iti ||3.7.11||

IAST: syān naḥ sūnus tanayo vijāvāgne sā te sumatir bhūtv asme
Griffith: To us be born a son, and spreading offspring Agni, be this thy gracious will to usward.
Devanāgarī: स्यान्नः सूनुस्तनयो विजावाग्ने सा ते सुमतिर्भूत्वस्मे
pada pāṭha: iḷām | agne | puru-daṁsam | sanim | goḥ | śaśvat-tamam | havamānāya | sādha || syāt | naḥ | sūnuḥ | tanayaḥ | vijā-vā | agne | sā | te | su-matiḥ | bhūtu | asme iti ||3.7.11||

IAST: añjanti tvām adhvare devayanto vanaspate madhunā daivyena
Griffith: GOD-SERVING men, O Sovran of the Forest, with heavenly meath at sacrifice anoint thee.
