Devanāgarī: अञ्जन्ति त्वामध्वरे देवयन्तो वनस्पते मधुना दैव्येन
pada pāṭha: añjanti | tvām | adhvare | deva-yantaḥ | vanaspate | madhunā | daivyena || yat | ūrdhvaḥ | tiṣṭhāḥ | draviṇā | iha | dhattāt | yat | vā | kṣayaḥ | mātuḥ | asyāḥ | upa-sthe ||3.8.1||

IAST: yad ūrdhvas tiṣṭhā draviṇeha dhattād yad vā kṣayo mātur asyā upasthe
Griffith: Grant wealth to us when thou art standing upright as when reposing on this Mother's bosom.
Devanāgarī: यदूर्ध्वस्तिष्ठा द्रविणेह धत्ताद्यद्वा क्षयो मातुरस्या उपस्थे
pada pāṭha: añjanti | tvām | adhvare | deva-yantaḥ | vanaspate | madhunā | daivyena || yat | ūrdhvaḥ | tiṣṭhāḥ | draviṇā | iha | dhattāt | yat | vā | kṣayaḥ | mātuḥ | asyāḥ | upa-sthe ||3.8.1||

IAST: samiddhasya śrayamāṇaḥ purastād brahma vanvāno ajaraṁ suvīram
Griffith: Set up to eastward of the fire enkindled, accepting prayer that wastes not, rich in hero.
Devanāgarī: समिद्धस्य श्रयमाणः पुरस्ताद्ब्रह्म वन्वानो अजरं सुवीरम्
pada pāṭha: sam-iddhasya | śrayamāṇaḥ | purastāt | brahma | vanvānaḥ | ajaram | su-vīram || āre | asmat | amatim | bādhamānaḥ | ut | śrayasva | mahate | saubhagāya ||3.8.2||

IAST: āre asmad amatim bādhamāna uc chrayasva mahate saubhagāya
Griffith: Driving far from us poverty and famine, lift thyself up to bring us great good fortune.
Devanāgarī: आरे अस्मदमतिं बाधमान उच्छ्रयस्व महते सौभगाय
pada pāṭha: sam-iddhasya | śrayamāṇaḥ | purastāt | brahma | vanvānaḥ | ajaram | su-vīram || āre | asmat | amatim | bādhamānaḥ | ut | śrayasva | mahate | saubhagāya ||3.8.2||

IAST: uc chrayasva vanaspate varṣman pṛthivyā adhi
Griffith: Lord of the Forest, raise. thyself up on the loftiest spot of earth.
Devanāgarī: उच्छ्रयस्व वनस्पते वर्ष्मन्पृथिव्या अधि
pada pāṭha: ut | śrayasva | vanaspate | varṣman | pr̥thivyāḥ | adhi || su-mitī | mīyamānaḥ | varcaḥ | dhāḥ | yajña-vāhase ||3.8.3||

IAST: sumitī mīyamāno varco dhā yajñavāhase
Griffith: Give splendour, fixt and measured well, to him who brings the sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: सुमिती मीयमानो वर्चो धा यज्ञवाहसे
pada pāṭha: ut | śrayasva | vanaspate | varṣman | pr̥thivyāḥ | adhi || su-mitī | mīyamānaḥ | varcaḥ | dhāḥ | yajña-vāhase ||3.8.3||

IAST: yuvā suvāsāḥ parivīta āgāt sa u śreyān bhavati jāyamānaḥ
Griffith: Well-robed, enveloped he is come, the youthful: springing to life his glory waxeth greater.
Devanāgarī: युवा सुवासाः परिवीत आगात्स उ श्रेयान्भवति जायमानः
pada pāṭha: yuvā | su-vāsāḥ | pari-vītaḥ | ā | agāt | saḥ | ūm̐ iti | śreyān | bhavati | jāyamānaḥ || tam | dhīrāsaḥ | kavayaḥ | ut | nayanti | su-ādhyaḥ | manasā | deva-yantaḥ ||3.8.4||

IAST: taṁ dhīrāsaḥ kavaya un nayanti svādhyo manasā devayantaḥ
Griffith: Contemplative in mind and God-adoring, sages of high intelligence upraise him.
Devanāgarī: तं धीरासः कवय उन्नयन्ति स्वाध्यो मनसा देवयन्तः
pada pāṭha: yuvā | su-vāsāḥ | pari-vītaḥ | ā | agāt | saḥ | ūm̐ iti | śreyān | bhavati | jāyamānaḥ || tam | dhīrāsaḥ | kavayaḥ | ut | nayanti | su-ādhyaḥ | manasā | deva-yantaḥ ||3.8.4||

IAST: jāto jāyate sudinatve ahnāṁ samarya ā vidathe vardhamānaḥ
Griffith: Sprung up he rises in the days' fair weather, increasing in the men-frequented synod.
Devanāgarī: जातो जायते सुदिनत्वे अह्नां समर्य आ विदथे वर्धमानः
pada pāṭha: jātaḥ | jāyate | sudina-tve | ahnām | sa-marye | ā | vidathe | vardhamānaḥ || punanti | dhīrāḥ | apasaḥ | manīṣā | deva-yāḥ | vipraḥ | ut | iyarti | vācam ||3.8.5||

IAST: punanti dhīrā apaso manīṣā devayā vipra ud iyarti vācam
Griffith: With song the wise and skilful consecrate him: his voice the God-adoring singer utters.
Devanāgarī: पुनन्ति धीरा अपसो मनीषा देवया विप्र उदियर्ति वाचम्
pada pāṭha: jātaḥ | jāyate | sudina-tve | ahnām | sa-marye | ā | vidathe | vardhamānaḥ || punanti | dhīrāḥ | apasaḥ | manīṣā | deva-yāḥ | vipraḥ | ut | iyarti | vācam ||3.8.5||

IAST: yān vo naro devayanto nimimyur vanaspate svadhitir vā tatakṣa
Griffith: Ye whom religious men have firmly planted; thou Forest Sovran whom the axe hath fashioned,-
Devanāgarī: यान्वो नरो देवयन्तो निमिम्युर्वनस्पते स्वधितिर्वा ततक्ष
pada pāṭha: yān | vaḥ | naraḥ | deva-yantaḥ | ni-mimyuḥ | vanaspate | sva-dhitiḥ | vā | tatakṣa || te | devāsaḥ | svaravaḥ | tasthi-vāṁsaḥ | prajā-vat | asme iti | didhiṣantu | ratnam ||3.8.6||

IAST: te devāsaḥ svaravas tasthivāṁsaḥ prajāvad asme didhiṣantu ratnam
Griffith: Let those the Stakes divine which here are standing be fain to grant us wealth with store of children.
Devanāgarī: ते देवासः स्वरवस्तस्थिवांसः प्रजावदस्मे दिधिषन्तु रत्नम्
pada pāṭha: yān | vaḥ | naraḥ | deva-yantaḥ | ni-mimyuḥ | vanaspate | sva-dhitiḥ | vā | tatakṣa || te | devāsaḥ | svaravaḥ | tasthi-vāṁsaḥ | prajā-vat | asme iti | didhiṣantu | ratnam ||3.8.6||

IAST: ye vṛkṇāso adhi kṣami nimitāso yatasrucaḥ
Griffith: O men who lift the ladles up, these hewn and planted in the ground,
Devanāgarī: ये वृक्णासो अधि क्षमि निमितासो यतस्रुचः
pada pāṭha: ye | vr̥kṇāsaḥ | adhi | kṣami | ni-mitāsaḥ | yata-srucaḥ || te | naḥ | vyantu | vāryam | deva-trā | kṣetra-sādhasaḥ ||3.8.7||

IAST: te no vyantu vāryaṁ devatrā kṣetrasādhasaḥ
Griffith: Bringing a blessing to the field, shall bear our precious gift to Gods.
Devanāgarī: ते नो व्यन्तु वार्यं देवत्रा क्षेत्रसाधसः
pada pāṭha: ye | vr̥kṇāsaḥ | adhi | kṣami | ni-mitāsaḥ | yata-srucaḥ || te | naḥ | vyantu | vāryam | deva-trā | kṣetra-sādhasaḥ ||3.8.7||

IAST: ādityā rudrā vasavaḥ sunīthā dyāvākṣāmā pṛthivī antarikṣam
Griffith: Adityas, Rudras, Vasus, careful leaders, Earth, Heaven, and Prthivi and Air's mid-region,
Devanāgarī: आदित्या रुद्रा वसवः सुनीथा द्यावाक्षामा पृथिवी अन्तरिक्षम्
pada pāṭha: ādityāḥ | rudrāḥ | vasavaḥ | su-nīthāḥ | dyāvākṣāmā | pr̥thivī | antarikṣam || sa-joṣasaḥ | yajñam | avantu | devāḥ | ūrdhvam | kr̥ṇvantu | adhvarasya | ketum ||3.8.8||

IAST: sajoṣaso yajñam avantu devā ūrdhvaṁ kṛṇvantv adhvarasya ketum
Griffith: Accordant Deities shall bless our worship and make our sacrifice's ensign lofty.
Devanāgarī: सजोषसो यज्ञमवन्तु देवा ऊर्ध्वं कृण्वन्त्वध्वरस्य केतुम्
pada pāṭha: ādityāḥ | rudrāḥ | vasavaḥ | su-nīthāḥ | dyāvākṣāmā | pr̥thivī | antarikṣam || sa-joṣasaḥ | yajñam | avantu | devāḥ | ūrdhvam | kr̥ṇvantu | adhvarasya | ketum ||3.8.8||

IAST: haṁsā iva śreṇiśo yatānāḥ śukrā vasānāḥ svaravo na āguḥ
Griffith: Like swan's that flee in lengthened line, the Pillars have come to us arrayed in brilliant coIour.
Devanāgarī: हंसा इव श्रेणिशो यतानाः शुक्रा वसानाः स्वरवो न आगुः
pada pāṭha: haṁsāḥ-iva | śreṇi-śaḥ | yatānāḥ | śukrā | vasānāḥ | svaravaḥ | naḥ | ā | aguḥ || ut-nīyamānāḥ | kavi-bhiḥ | purastāt | devāḥ | devānām | api | yanti | pāthaḥ ||3.8.9||

IAST: unnīyamānāḥ kavibhiḥ purastād devā devānām api yanti pāthaḥ
Griffith: They, lifted up on high, by sages, eastward, go forth as Gods to the God's dwelling-places.
Devanāgarī: उन्नीयमानाः कविभिः पुरस्ताद्देवा देवानामपि यन्ति पाथः
pada pāṭha: haṁsāḥ-iva | śreṇi-śaḥ | yatānāḥ | śukrā | vasānāḥ | svaravaḥ | naḥ | ā | aguḥ || ut-nīyamānāḥ | kavi-bhiḥ | purastāt | devāḥ | devānām | api | yanti | pāthaḥ ||3.8.9||

IAST: śṛṅgāṇīvec chṛṅgiṇāṁ saṁ dadṛśre caṣālavantaḥ svaravaḥ pṛthivyām
Griffith: Those Stakes upon the earth with rings that deck them seem to the eye like horns of horned creatures;
Devanāgarī: शृङ्गाणीवेच्छृङ्गिणां सं ददृश्रे चषालवन्तः स्वरवः पृथिव्याम्
pada pāṭha: śr̥ṅgāṇi-iva | it | śr̥ṅgiṇām | sam | dadr̥śre | caṣāla-vantaḥ | svaravaḥ | pr̥thivyām || vāghat-bhiḥ | vā | vi-have | śroṣamāṇāḥ | asmān | avantu | pr̥tanājyeṣu ||3.8.10||

IAST: vāghadbhir vā vihave śroṣamāṇā asmām̐ avantu pṛtanājyeṣu
Griffith: Or, as upraised by priests in invocation, let them assist us in the rush to battle.
Devanāgarī: वाघद्भिर्वा विहवे श्रोषमाणा अस्माँ अवन्तु पृतनाज्येषु
pada pāṭha: śr̥ṅgāṇi-iva | it | śr̥ṅgiṇām | sam | dadr̥śre | caṣāla-vantaḥ | svaravaḥ | pr̥thivyām || vāghat-bhiḥ | vā | vi-have | śroṣamāṇāḥ | asmān | avantu | pr̥tanājyeṣu ||3.8.10||

IAST: vanaspate śatavalśo vi roha sahasravalśā vi vayaṁ ruhema
Griffith: Lord of the Wood, rise with a hundred branches. with thousand branches may we rise to greatness,
Devanāgarī: वनस्पते शतवल्शो वि रोह सहस्रवल्शा वि वयं रुहेम
pada pāṭha: vanaspate | śata-valśaḥ | vi | roha | sahasra-valśāḥ | vi | vayam | ruhema || yam | tvām | ayam | sva-dhitiḥ | tejamānaḥ | pra-nināya | mahate | saubhagāya ||3.8.11||

IAST: yaṁ tvām ayaṁ svadhitis tejamānaḥ praṇināya mahate saubhagāya
Griffith: Tlou whom this hatchct, with an edge well whetted for great felicity, hath brought before us.
Devanāgarī: यं त्वामयं स्वधितिस्तेजमानः प्रणिनाय महते सौभगाय
pada pāṭha: vanaspate | śata-valśaḥ | vi | roha | sahasra-valśāḥ | vi | vayam | ruhema || yam | tvām | ayam | sva-dhitiḥ | tejamānaḥ | pra-nināya | mahate | saubhagāya ||3.8.11||

IAST: sakhāyas tvā vavṛmahe devam martāsa ūtaye
Griffith: WE as thy friends have chosen thee, mortals a God, to be our help,
Devanāgarī: सखायस्त्वा ववृमहे देवं मर्तास ऊतये
pada pāṭha: sakhāyaḥ | tvā | vavr̥mahe | devam | martāsaḥ | ūtaye || apām | napātam | su-bhagam | su-dīditim | su-pratūrtim | anehasam ||3.9.1||

IAST: apāṁ napātaṁ subhagaṁ sudīditiṁ supratūrtim anehasam
Griffith: The Waters' Child, the blessed, the resplendent One, victorious and beyond compare.
Devanāgarī: अपां नपातं सुभगं सुदीदितिं सुप्रतूर्तिमनेहसम्
pada pāṭha: sakhāyaḥ | tvā | vavr̥mahe | devam | martāsaḥ | ūtaye || apām | napātam | su-bhagam | su-dīditim | su-pratūrtim | anehasam ||3.9.1||

IAST: kāyamāno vanā tvaṁ yan mātṝr ajagann apaḥ
Griffith: Since thou delighting in the woods hast gone unto thy mother streams,
Devanāgarī: कायमानो वना त्वं यन्मातॄरजगन्नपः
pada pāṭha: kāyamānaḥ | vanā | tvam | yat | mātr̥̄ḥ | ajagan | apaḥ || na | tat | te | agne | pra-mr̥ṣe | ni-vartanam | yat | dūre | san | iha | abhavaḥ ||3.9.2||

IAST: na tat te agne pramṛṣe nivartanaṁ yad dūre sann ihābhavaḥ
Griffith: Not to be scorned, Agni, is that return of thine when from afar thou now art here.
Devanāgarī: न तत्ते अग्ने प्रमृषे निवर्तनं यद्दूरे सन्निहाभवः
pada pāṭha: kāyamānaḥ | vanā | tvam | yat | mātr̥̄ḥ | ajagan | apaḥ || na | tat | te | agne | pra-mr̥ṣe | ni-vartanam | yat | dūre | san | iha | abhavaḥ ||3.9.2||

IAST: ati tṛṣṭaṁ vavakṣithāthaiva sumanā asi
Griffith: O'er pungent smoke host thou prevailed, and thus art thou benevolent.
Devanāgarī: अति तृष्टं ववक्षिथाथैव सुमना असि
pada pāṭha: ati | tr̥ṣṭam | vavakṣitha | atha | eva | su-manāḥ | asi || pra-pra | anye | yanti | pari | anye | āsate | yeṣām | sakhye | asi | śritaḥ ||3.9.3||

IAST: pra-prānye yanti pary anya āsate yeṣāṁ sakhye asi śritaḥ
Griffith: Some go before, and others round about thee sit, they in whose friendship thou hast place.
Devanāgarī: प्रप्रान्ये यन्ति पर्यन्य आसते येषां सख्ये असि श्रितः
pada pāṭha: ati | tr̥ṣṭam | vavakṣitha | atha | eva | su-manāḥ | asi || pra-pra | anye | yanti | pari | anye | āsate | yeṣām | sakhye | asi | śritaḥ ||3.9.3||

IAST: īyivāṁsam ati sridhaḥ śaśvatīr ati saścataḥ
Griffith: Him who had passed beyond his foes, beyond continual pursuits,
Devanāgarī: ईयिवांसमति स्रिधः शश्वतीरति सश्चतः
pada pāṭha: īyi-vāṁsam | ati | sridhaḥ | śaśvatīḥ | ati | saścataḥ || anu | īm | avindan | ni-cirāsaḥ | adruhaḥ | ap-su | siṁham-iva | śritam ||3.9.4||

IAST: anv īm avindan nicirāso adruho 'psu siṁham iva śritam
Griffith: Him the unerring Ones, observant, found in floods, couched like a lion in his lair.
Devanāgarī: अन्वीमविन्दन्निचिरासो अद्रुहोऽप्सु सिंहमिव श्रितम्
pada pāṭha: īyi-vāṁsam | ati | sridhaḥ | śaśvatīḥ | ati | saścataḥ || anu | īm | avindan | ni-cirāsaḥ | adruhaḥ | ap-su | siṁham-iva | śritam ||3.9.4||

IAST: sasṛvāṁsam iva tmanāgnim itthā tirohitam
Griffith: Him wandering at his own free will, Agni here hidden from our view,
Devanāgarī: ससृवांसमिव त्मनाग्निमित्था तिरोहितम्
pada pāṭha: sasr̥vāṁsam-iva | tmanā | agnim | itthā | tiraḥ-hitam || ā | enam | nayat | mātariśvā | parā-vataḥ | devebhyaḥ | mathitam | pari ||3.9.5||

IAST: ainaṁ nayan mātariśvā parāvato devebhyo mathitam pari
Griffith: Him Matarisvan brought to us from far away produced by friction, from the Gods.
Devanāgarī: ऐनं नयन्मातरिश्वा परावतो देवेभ्यो मथितं परि
pada pāṭha: sasr̥vāṁsam-iva | tmanā | agnim | itthā | tiraḥ-hitam || ā | enam | nayat | mātariśvā | parā-vataḥ | devebhyaḥ | mathitam | pari ||3.9.5||

IAST: taṁ tvā martā agṛbhṇata devebhyo havyavāhana
Griffith: O Bearer of Oblations, thus mortals received thee from the Gods,
Devanāgarī: तं त्वा मर्ता अगृभ्णत देवेभ्यो हव्यवाहन
pada pāṭha: tam | tvā | martāḥ | agr̥bhṇata | devebhyaḥ | havya-vāhana || viśvān | yat | yajñān | abhi-pāsi | mānuṣa | tava | kratvā | yaviṣṭhya ||3.9.6||

IAST: viśvān yad yajñām̐ abhipāsi mānuṣa tava kratvā yaviṣṭhya
Griffith: Whilst thou, the Friend of man, guardest each sacrifice with thine own power, Most Youthful One.
Devanāgarī: विश्वान्यद्यज्ञाँ अभिपासि मानुष तव क्रत्वा यविष्ठ्य
pada pāṭha: tam | tvā | martāḥ | agr̥bhṇata | devebhyaḥ | havya-vāhana || viśvān | yat | yajñān | abhi-pāsi | mānuṣa | tava | kratvā | yaviṣṭhya ||3.9.6||

IAST: tad bhadraṁ tava daṁsanā pākāya cic chadayati
Griffith: Amid thy wonders this is good, yea, to the simple is it clear,
Devanāgarī: तद्भद्रं तव दंसना पाकाय चिच्छदयति
pada pāṭha: tat | bhadram | tava | daṁsanā | pākāya | cit | chadayati || tvām | yat | agne | paśavaḥ | sam-āsate | sam-iddham | api-śarvare ||3.9.7||

IAST: tvāṁ yad agne paśavaḥ samāsate samiddham apiśarvare
Griffith: When gathered round about thee, Agni, lie the herds where thou art kindled in the morn.
Devanāgarī: त्वां यदग्ने पशवः समासते समिद्धमपिशर्वरे
pada pāṭha: tat | bhadram | tava | daṁsanā | pākāya | cit | chadayati || tvām | yat | agne | paśavaḥ | sam-āsate | sam-iddham | api-śarvare ||3.9.7||

IAST: ā juhotā svadhvaraṁ śīram pāvakaśociṣam
Griffith: Offer to him who knows fair rites, who burns with purifying glow,
Devanāgarī: आ जुहोता स्वध्वरं शीरं पावकशोचिषम्
pada pāṭha: ā | juhota | su-adhvaram | śīram | pāvaka-śociṣam || āśum | dūtam | ajiram | pratnam | īḍyam | śruṣṭī | devam | saparyata ||3.9.8||

IAST: āśuṁ dūtam ajiram pratnam īḍyaṁ śruṣṭī devaṁ saparyata
Griffith: Swift envoy, active, ancient, and adorable: serve ye the God attentively.
Devanāgarī: आशुं दूतमजिरं प्रत्नमीड्यं श्रुष्टी देवं सपर्यत
pada pāṭha: ā | juhota | su-adhvaram | śīram | pāvaka-śociṣam || āśum | dūtam | ajiram | pratnam | īḍyam | śruṣṭī | devam | saparyata ||3.9.8||

IAST: trīṇi śatā trī sahasrāṇy agniṁ triṁśac ca devā nava cāsaparyan
Griffith: Three times a hundred Gods and thrice a thousand, and three times ten and nine have worshipped Agni,
Devanāgarī: त्रीणि शता त्री सहस्राण्यग्निं त्रिंशच्च देवा नव चासपर्यन्
pada pāṭha: trīṇi | śatā | trī | sahasrāṇi | agnim | triṁśat | ca | devāḥ | nava | ca | asaparyan || aukṣan | ghr̥taiḥ | astr̥ṇan | barhiḥ | asmai | āt | it | hotāram | ni | asādayanta ||3.9.9||

IAST: aukṣan ghṛtair astṛṇan barhir asmā ād id dhotāraṁ ny asādayanta
Griffith: For him spread sacred grass, with oil bedewed him, and stablished him as Priest and Sacrificer.
Devanāgarī: औक्षन्घृतैरस्तृणन्बर्हिरस्मा आदिद्धोतारं न्यसादयन्त
pada pāṭha: trīṇi | śatā | trī | sahasrāṇi | agnim | triṁśat | ca | devāḥ | nava | ca | asaparyan || aukṣan | ghr̥taiḥ | astr̥ṇan | barhiḥ | asmai | āt | it | hotāram | ni | asādayanta ||3.9.9||

IAST: tvām agne manīṣiṇaḥ samrājaṁ carṣaṇīnām
Griffith: THEE Agni, God, Imperial Lord of all mankind, do mortal men
Devanāgarī: त्वामग्ने मनीषिणः सम्राजं चर्षणीनाम्
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | manīṣiṇaḥ | sam-rājam | carṣaṇīnām || devam | martāsaḥ | indhate | sam | adhvare ||3.10.1||

IAST: devam martāsa indhate sam adhvare
Griffith: With understanding kindle at thesacrifice.
Devanāgarī: देवं मर्तास इन्धते समध्वरे
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | manīṣiṇaḥ | sam-rājam | carṣaṇīnām || devam | martāsaḥ | indhate | sam | adhvare ||3.10.1||

IAST: tvāṁ yajñeṣv ṛtvijam agne hotāram īḻate
Griffith: They laud thee in their solemn rites, Agni, as Minister and Priest,
Devanāgarī: त्वां यज्ञेष्वृत्विजमग्ने होतारमीळते
pada pāṭha: tvām | yajñeṣu | r̥tvijam | agne | hotāram | īḷate || gopāḥ | r̥tasya | dīdihi | sve | dame ||3.10.2||

IAST: gopā ṛtasya dīdihi sve dame
Griffith: Shine forth in thine own home as guardian of the Law.
Devanāgarī: गोपा ऋतस्य दीदिहि स्वे दमे
pada pāṭha: tvām | yajñeṣu | r̥tvijam | agne | hotāram | īḷate || gopāḥ | r̥tasya | dīdihi | sve | dame ||3.10.2||

IAST: sa ghā yas te dadāśati samidhā jātavedase
Griffith: He, verily, who honours thee with fuel, Knower of all life,
Devanāgarī: स घा यस्ते ददाशति समिधा जातवेदसे
pada pāṭha: saḥ | gha | yaḥ | te | dadāśati | sam-idhā | jāta-vedase || saḥ | agne | dhatte | su-vīryam | saḥ | puṣyati ||3.10.3||

IAST: so agne dhatte suvīryaṁ sa puṣyati
Griffith: He, Agni! wins heroic might, he prospers well.
Devanāgarī: सो अग्ने धत्ते सुवीर्यं स पुष्यति
pada pāṭha: saḥ | gha | yaḥ | te | dadāśati | sam-idhā | jāta-vedase || saḥ | agne | dhatte | su-vīryam | saḥ | puṣyati ||3.10.3||

IAST: sa ketur adhvarāṇām agnir devebhir ā gamat
Griffith: Ensign of sacrifices, he, Agni, with Gods is come to us,
Devanāgarī: स केतुरध्वराणामग्निर्देवेभिरा गमत्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | ketuḥ | adhvarāṇām | agniḥ | devebhiḥ | ā | gamat || añjānaḥ | sapta | hotr̥-bhiḥ | haviṣmate ||3.10.4||

IAST: añjānaḥ sapta hotṛbhir haviṣmate
Griffith: Decked by the seven priests, to him who bringeth gifts.
Devanāgarī: अञ्जानः सप्त होतृभिर्हविष्मते
pada pāṭha: saḥ | ketuḥ | adhvarāṇām | agniḥ | devebhiḥ | ā | gamat || añjānaḥ | sapta | hotr̥-bhiḥ | haviṣmate ||3.10.4||

IAST: pra hotre pūrvyaṁ vaco 'gnaye bharatā bṛhat
Griffith: ToAgni, the Invoking Priest, offer your best, your lofty speech,
Devanāgarī: प्र होत्रे पूर्व्यं वचोऽग्नये भरता बृहत्
pada pāṭha: pra | hotre | pūrvyam | vacaḥ | agnaye | bharata | br̥hat || vipām | jyotīṁṣi | bibhrate | na | vedhase ||3.10.5||

IAST: vipāṁ jyotīṁṣi bibhrate na vedhase
Griffith: To him Ordainer-like who brings the light of songs.
Devanāgarī: विपां ज्योतींषि बिभ्रते न वेधसे
pada pāṭha: pra | hotre | pūrvyam | vacaḥ | agnaye | bharata | br̥hat || vipām | jyotīṁṣi | bibhrate | na | vedhase ||3.10.5||

IAST: agniṁ vardhantu no giro yato jāyata ukthyaḥ
Griffith: Let these our hymns make Agni grow, whence, meet for laud, he springs to life,
Devanāgarī: अग्निं वर्धन्तु नो गिरो यतो जायत उक्थ्यः
pada pāṭha: agnim | vardhantu | naḥ | giraḥ | yataḥ | jāyate | ukthyaḥ || mahe | vājāya | draviṇāya | darśataḥ ||3.10.6||

IAST: mahe vājāya draviṇāya darśataḥ
Griffith: To mighty strength and great possession, fair to see.
Devanāgarī: महे वाजाय द्रविणाय दर्शतः
pada pāṭha: agnim | vardhantu | naḥ | giraḥ | yataḥ | jāyate | ukthyaḥ || mahe | vājāya | draviṇāya | darśataḥ ||3.10.6||

IAST: agne yajiṣṭho adhvare devān devayate yaja
Griffith: Best Sacrificer, bring the Gods, O Agni, to the pious man:
Devanāgarī: अग्ने यजिष्ठो अध्वरे देवान्देवयते यज
pada pāṭha: agne | yajiṣṭhaḥ | adhvare | devān | deva-yate | yaja || hotā | mandraḥ | vi | rājasi | ati | sridhaḥ ||3.10.7||

IAST: hotā mandro vi rājasy ati sridhaḥ
Griffith: A joyful Priest, thy splendour drive our foes afar
Devanāgarī: होता मन्द्रो वि राजस्यति स्रिधः
pada pāṭha: agne | yajiṣṭhaḥ | adhvare | devān | deva-yate | yaja || hotā | mandraḥ | vi | rājasi | ati | sridhaḥ ||3.10.7||

IAST: sa naḥ pāvaka dīdihi dyumad asme suvīryam
Griffith: As such, O Purifier, shine on us heroic glorious might:
Devanāgarī: स नः पावक दीदिहि द्युमदस्मे सुवीर्यम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | pāvaka | dīdihi | dyu-mat | asme iti | su-vīryam || bhava | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | antamaḥ | svastaye ||3.10.8||

IAST: bhavā stotṛbhyo antamaḥ svastaye
Griffith: Be nearest Friend to those who laud thee, for their weal.
Devanāgarī: भवा स्तोतृभ्यो अन्तमः स्वस्तये
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | pāvaka | dīdihi | dyu-mat | asme iti | su-vīryam || bhava | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | antamaḥ | svastaye ||3.10.8||

IAST: taṁ tvā viprā vipanyavo jāgṛvāṁsaḥ sam indhate
Griffith: So, wakeful, versed in sacred hymns, the holy singers kindly thee.
Devanāgarī: तं त्वा विप्रा विपन्यवो जागृवांसः समिन्धते
pada pāṭha: tam | tvā | viprāḥ | vipanyavaḥ | jāgr̥-vāṁsaḥ | sam | indhate || havya-vāham | amartyam | sahaḥ-vr̥dham ||3.10.9||

IAST: havyavāham amartyaṁ sahovṛdham
Griffith: Oblation-bearer, deathless, cherisher of strength.
Devanāgarī: हव्यवाहममर्त्यं सहोवृधम्
pada pāṭha: tam | tvā | viprāḥ | vipanyavaḥ | jāgr̥-vāṁsaḥ | sam | indhate || havya-vāham | amartyam | sahaḥ-vr̥dham ||3.10.9||

IAST: agnir hotā purohito 'dhvarasya vicarṣaṇiḥ
Griffith: AGNI is Priest, the great High Priest of sacrifice, most swift in act:
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्होता पुरोहितोऽध्वरस्य विचर्षणिः
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | hotā | puraḥ-hitaḥ | adhvarasya | vi-carṣaṇiḥ || saḥ | veda | yajñam | ānuṣak ||3.11.1||

IAST: sa veda yajñam ānuṣak
Griffith: He knows the rite in constant course.
Devanāgarī: स वेद यज्ञमानुषक्
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | hotā | puraḥ-hitaḥ | adhvarasya | vi-carṣaṇiḥ || saḥ | veda | yajñam | ānuṣak ||3.11.1||

IAST: sa havyavāḻ amartya uśig dūtaś canohitaḥ
Griffith: Oblation-bearer, deathless, well inclined, an eager messenger,
Devanāgarī: स हव्यवाळमर्त्य उशिग्दूतश्चनोहितः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | havya-vāṭ | amartyaḥ | uśik | dūtaḥ | canaḥ-hitaḥ || agniḥ | dhiyā | sam | r̥ṇvati ||3.11.2||

IAST: agnir dhiyā sam ṛṇvati
Griffith: Agni comes nigh us with the thought.
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्धिया समृण्वति
pada pāṭha: saḥ | havya-vāṭ | amartyaḥ | uśik | dūtaḥ | canaḥ-hitaḥ || agniḥ | dhiyā | sam | r̥ṇvati ||3.11.2||

IAST: agnir dhiyā sa cetati ketur yajñasya pūrvyaḥ
Griffith: Ensign of sacrifice from of old, Agni well knoweth with his thought
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्धिया स चेतति केतुर्यज्ञस्य पूर्व्यः
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | dhiyā | saḥ | cetati | ketuḥ | yajñasya | pūrvyaḥ || artham | hi | asya | taraṇi ||3.11.3||

IAST: arthaṁ hy asya taraṇi
Griffith: To prosper this man's aim and hope.
Devanāgarī: अर्थं ह्यस्य तरणि
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | dhiyā | saḥ | cetati | ketuḥ | yajñasya | pūrvyaḥ || artham | hi | asya | taraṇi ||3.11.3||

IAST: agniṁ sūnuṁ sanaśrutaṁ sahaso jātavedasam
Griffith: Agni, illustrious from old time, the Son of Strength who knows all life,
Devanāgarī: अग्निं सूनुं सनश्रुतं सहसो जातवेदसम्
pada pāṭha: agnim | sūnum | sana-śrutam | sahasaḥ | jāta-vedasam || vahnim | devāḥ | akr̥ṇvata ||3.11.4||

IAST: vahniṁ devā akṛṇvata
Griffith: The Gods have made to their Priest.
Devanāgarī: वह्निं देवा अकृण्वत
pada pāṭha: agnim | sūnum | sana-śrutam | sahasaḥ | jāta-vedasam || vahnim | devāḥ | akr̥ṇvata ||3.11.4||

IAST: adābhyaḥ puraetā viśām agnir mānuṣīṇām
Griffith: Infallible is Agni, he who goes before the tribes of men,
Devanāgarī: अदाभ्यः पुरएता विशामग्निर्मानुषीणाम्
pada pāṭha: adābhyaḥ | puraḥ-etā | viśām | agniḥ | mānuṣīṇām || tūrṇiḥ | rathaḥ | sadā | navaḥ ||3.11.5||

IAST: tūrṇī rathaḥ sadā navaḥ
Griffith: A chariot swift and ever new.
Devanāgarī: तूर्णी रथः सदा नवः
pada pāṭha: adābhyaḥ | puraḥ-etā | viśām | agniḥ | mānuṣīṇām || tūrṇiḥ | rathaḥ | sadā | navaḥ ||3.11.5||

IAST: sāhvān viśvā abhiyujaḥ kratur devānām amṛktaḥ
Griffith: Strength of the Gods which none may harm, subduing all his enemies,
Devanāgarī: साह्वान्विश्वा अभियुजः क्रतुर्देवानाममृक्तः
pada pāṭha: sahvān | viśvāḥ | abhi-yujaḥ | kratuḥ | devānām | amr̥ktaḥ || agniḥ | tuviśravaḥ-tamaḥ ||3.11.6||

IAST: agnis tuviśravastamaḥ
Griffith: Agni is mightiest in fame.
Devanāgarī: अग्निस्तुविश्रवस्तमः
pada pāṭha: sahvān | viśvāḥ | abhi-yujaḥ | kratuḥ | devānām | amr̥ktaḥ || agniḥ | tuviśravaḥ-tamaḥ ||3.11.6||

IAST: abhi prayāṁsi vāhasā dāśvām̐ aśnoti martyaḥ
Griffith: By offering sacred food to him the mortal worshipper obtains.
Devanāgarī: अभि प्रयांसि वाहसा दाश्वाँ अश्नोति मर्त्यः
pada pāṭha: abhi | prayāṁsi | vāhasā | dāśvān | aśnoti | martyaḥ || kṣayam | pāvaka-śociṣaḥ ||3.11.7||

IAST: kṣayam pāvakaśociṣaḥ
Griffith: A home from him whose light makes pure.
Devanāgarī: क्षयं पावकशोचिषः
pada pāṭha: abhi | prayāṁsi | vāhasā | dāśvān | aśnoti | martyaḥ || kṣayam | pāvaka-śociṣaḥ ||3.11.7||

IAST: pari viśvāni sudhitāgner aśyāma manmabhiḥ
Griffith: From Agni, by our hymns, may we gain all things that bring happiness,
Devanāgarī: परि विश्वानि सुधिताग्नेरश्याम मन्मभिः
pada pāṭha: pari | viśvāni | su-dhitā | agneḥ | aśyāma | manma-bhiḥ || viprāsaḥ | jāta-vedasaḥ ||3.11.8||

IAST: viprāso jātavedasaḥ
Griffith: Singers of him who knows all life.
Devanāgarī: विप्रासो जातवेदसः
pada pāṭha: pari | viśvāni | su-dhitā | agneḥ | aśyāma | manma-bhiḥ || viprāsaḥ | jāta-vedasaḥ ||3.11.8||

IAST: agne viśvāni vāryā vājeṣu saniṣāmahe
Griffith: O Agni, in our deeds of might may we obtain all precious things:
Devanāgarī: अग्ने विश्वानि वार्या वाजेषु सनिषामहे
pada pāṭha: agne | viśvāni | vāryā | vājeṣu | saniṣāmahe || tve iti | devāsaḥ | ā | īrire ||3.11.9||

IAST: tve devāsa erire
Griffith: Tle Gods are centred all in thee.
Devanāgarī: त्वे देवास एरिरे
pada pāṭha: agne | viśvāni | vāryā | vājeṣu | saniṣāmahe || tve iti | devāsaḥ | ā | īrire ||3.11.9||

IAST: indrāgnī ā gataṁ sutaṁ gīrbhir nabho vareṇyam
Griffith: MOVED, Indra-Agni, by our hymn, come to the juice, the precious dew:
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्नी आ गतं सुतं गीर्भिर्नभो वरेण्यम्
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | ā | gatam | sutam | gīḥ-bhiḥ | nabhaḥ | vareṇyam || asya | pātam | dhiyā | iṣitā ||3.12.1||

IAST: asya pātaṁ dhiyeṣitā
Griffith: Drink ye thereof, impelled by song.
Devanāgarī: अस्य पातं धियेषिता
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | ā | gatam | sutam | gīḥ-bhiḥ | nabhaḥ | vareṇyam || asya | pātam | dhiyā | iṣitā ||3.12.1||

IAST: indrāgnī jarituḥ sacā yajño jigāti cetanaḥ
Griffith: O Indra-Agni, with the man who lauds you comes the wakening rite:
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्नी जरितुः सचा यज्ञो जिगाति चेतनः
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | jarituḥ | sacā | yajñaḥ | jigāti | cetanaḥ || ayā | pātam | imam | sutam ||3.12.2||

IAST: ayā pātam imaṁ sutam
Griffith: So drink ye both this juice assured.
Devanāgarī: अया पातमिमं सुतम्
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | jarituḥ | sacā | yajñaḥ | jigāti | cetanaḥ || ayā | pātam | imam | sutam ||3.12.2||

IAST: indram agniṁ kavicchadā yajñasya jūtyā vṛṇe
Griffith: Through force of sacrifice I choose Indra-Agni who love the wise:
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रमग्निं कविच्छदा यज्ञस्य जूत्या वृणे
pada pāṭha: indram | agnim | kavi-chadā | yajñasya | jūtyā | vr̥ṇe || tā | somasya | iha | tr̥mpatām ||3.12.3||

IAST: tā somasyeha tṛmpatām
Griffith: With Sorna let these sate them here.
Devanāgarī: ता सोमस्येह तृम्पताम्
pada pāṭha: indram | agnim | kavi-chadā | yajñasya | jūtyā | vr̥ṇe || tā | somasya | iha | tr̥mpatām ||3.12.3||

IAST: tośā vṛtrahaṇā huve sajitvānāparājitā
Griffith: Indra and Agni I invoke, joint-victors, bounteous, unsubdued,
Devanāgarī: तोशा वृत्रहणा हुवे सजित्वानापराजिता
pada pāṭha: tośā | vr̥tra-hanā | huve | sa-jitvānā | aparā-jitā || indrāgnī iti | vāja-sātamā ||3.12.4||

IAST: indrāgnī vājasātamā
Griffith: Foe-slayers, best to win the spoil.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्नी वाजसातमा
pada pāṭha: tośā | vr̥tra-hanā | huve | sa-jitvānā | aparā-jitā || indrāgnī iti | vāja-sātamā ||3.12.4||

IAST: pra vām arcanty ukthino nīthāvido jaritāraḥ
Griffith: Indra and Agni, singers skilled in melody hymn you, bringing lauds:
Devanāgarī: प्र वामर्चन्त्युक्थिनो नीथाविदो जरितारः
pada pāṭha: pra | vām | arcanti | ukthinaḥ | nītha-vidaḥ | jaritāraḥ || indrāgnī iti | iṣaḥ | ā | vr̥ṇe ||3.12.5||

IAST: indrāgnī iṣa ā vṛṇe
Griffith: I choose you for the sacred food.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्नी इष आ वृणे
pada pāṭha: pra | vām | arcanti | ukthinaḥ | nītha-vidaḥ | jaritāraḥ || indrāgnī iti | iṣaḥ | ā | vr̥ṇe ||3.12.5||

IAST: indrāgnī navatim puro dāsapatnīr adhūnutam
Griffith: Indra and Agni, ye cast down the ninety forts which DAsas held,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्नी नवतिं पुरो दासपत्नीरधूनुतम्
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | navatim | puraḥ | dāsa-patnīḥ | adhūnutam || sākam | ekena | karmaṇā ||3.12.6||

IAST: sākam ekena karmaṇā
Griffith: Together, with one mighty deed.
Devanāgarī: साकमेकेन कर्मणा
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | navatim | puraḥ | dāsa-patnīḥ | adhūnutam || sākam | ekena | karmaṇā ||3.12.6||

IAST: indrāgnī apasas pary upa pra yanti dhītayaḥ
Griffith: To Indra-Agni eeverent thoughts go forward from the holy task
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्नी अपसस्पर्युप प्र यन्ति धीतयः
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | apasaḥ | pari | upa | pra | yanti | dhītayaḥ || r̥tasya | pathyāḥ | anu ||3.12.7||

IAST: ṛtasya pathyā anu
Griffith: Along the path of sacred Law.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य पथ्या अनु
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | apasaḥ | pari | upa | pra | yanti | dhītayaḥ || r̥tasya | pathyāḥ | anu ||3.12.7||

IAST: indrāgnī taviṣāṇi vāṁ sadhasthāni prayāṁsi ca
Griffith: O Indra-Agni, powers are yours, and dwellings and delightful food
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्नी तविषाणि वां सधस्थानि प्रयांसि च
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | taviṣāṇi | vām | sadha-sthāni | prayāṁsi | ca || yuvoḥ | ap-tūryam | hitam ||3.12.8||

IAST: yuvor aptūryaṁ hitam
Griffith: Good is your readiness to act.
Devanāgarī: युवोरप्तूर्यं हितम्
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | taviṣāṇi | vām | sadha-sthāni | prayāṁsi | ca || yuvoḥ | ap-tūryam | hitam ||3.12.8||

IAST: indrāgnī rocanā divaḥ pari vājeṣu bhūṣathaḥ
Griffith: Indra and Agni, in your deeds of might ye deck heaven's lucid realms:
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्नी रोचना दिवः परि वाजेषु भूषथः
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | rocanā | divaḥ | pari | vājeṣu | bhūṣathaḥ || tat | vām | ceti | pra | vīryam ||3.12.9||

IAST: tad vāṁ ceti pra vīryam
Griffith: Famed is that hero strength of yours.
Devanāgarī: तद्वां चेति प्र वीर्यम्
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | rocanā | divaḥ | pari | vājeṣu | bhūṣathaḥ || tat | vām | ceti | pra | vīryam ||3.12.9||

IAST: pra vo devāyāgnaye barhiṣṭham arcāsmai
Griffith: To Agni, to this God of yours I sing aloud with utmost power.
Devanāgarī: प्र वो देवायाग्नये बर्हिष्ठमर्चास्मै
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | devāya | agnaye | barhiṣṭham | arca | asmai || gamat | devebhiḥ | ā | saḥ | naḥ | yajiṣṭhaḥ | barhiḥ | ā | sadat ||3.13.1||

IAST: gamad devebhir ā sa no yajiṣṭho barhir ā sadat
Griffith: May he come to us with the Gods, and sit, best Offerer, on the grass.
Devanāgarī: गमद्देवेभिरा स नो यजिष्ठो बर्हिरा सदत्
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | devāya | agnaye | barhiṣṭham | arca | asmai || gamat | devebhiḥ | ā | saḥ | naḥ | yajiṣṭhaḥ | barhiḥ | ā | sadat ||3.13.1||

IAST: ṛtāvā yasya rodasī dakṣaṁ sacanta ūtayaḥ
Griffith: The Holy, whose are earth and heaven, and succour waits upon his strength;
Devanāgarī: ऋतावा यस्य रोदसी दक्षं सचन्त ऊतयः
pada pāṭha: r̥ta-vā | yasya | rodasī iti | dakṣam | sacante | ūtayaḥ || haviṣmantaḥ | tam | īḷate | tam | saniṣyantaḥ | avase ||3.13.2||

IAST: haviṣmantas tam īḻate taṁ saniṣyanto 'vase
Griffith: Him men who bring oblations laud, and they who wish to gain, for grace.
Devanāgarī: हविष्मन्तस्तमीळते तं सनिष्यन्तोऽवसे
pada pāṭha: r̥ta-vā | yasya | rodasī iti | dakṣam | sacante | ūtayaḥ || haviṣmantaḥ | tam | īḷate | tam | saniṣyantaḥ | avase ||3.13.2||

IAST: sa yantā vipra eṣāṁ sa yajñānām athā hi ṣaḥ
Griffith: He is the Sage who guides these men, Leader of sacred rites is he.
Devanāgarī: स यन्ता विप्र एषां स यज्ञानामथा हि षः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | yantā | vipraḥ | eṣām | saḥ | yajñānām | atha | hi | saḥ || agnim | tam | vaḥ | duvasyata | dātā | yaḥ | vanitā | magham ||3.13.3||

IAST: agniṁ taṁ vo duvasyata dātā yo vanitā magham
Griffith: Him your own Agni, serve ye well, who winneth and bestoweth wealth.
Devanāgarī: अग्निं तं वो दुवस्यत दाता यो वनिता मघम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | yantā | vipraḥ | eṣām | saḥ | yajñānām | atha | hi | saḥ || agnim | tam | vaḥ | duvasyata | dātā | yaḥ | vanitā | magham ||3.13.3||

IAST: sa naḥ śarmāṇi vītaye 'gnir yacchatu śaṁtamā
Griffith: So may the gracious Agni grant most goodly shelter for our use;
Devanāgarī: स नः शर्माणि वीतयेऽग्निर्यच्छतु शंतमा
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | śarmāṇi | vītaye | agniḥ | yacchatu | śam-tamā || yataḥ | naḥ | pruṣṇavat | vasu | divi | kṣiti-bhyaḥ | ap-su | ā ||3.13.4||

IAST: yato naḥ pruṣṇavad vasu divi kṣitibhyo apsv ā
Griffith: Whence in the heavens or in the floods he shall pour wealth upon our lands.
Devanāgarī: यतो नः प्रुष्णवद्वसु दिवि क्षितिभ्यो अप्स्वा
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | śarmāṇi | vītaye | agniḥ | yacchatu | śam-tamā || yataḥ | naḥ | pruṣṇavat | vasu | divi | kṣiti-bhyaḥ | ap-su | ā ||3.13.4||

IAST: dīdivāṁsam apūrvyaṁ vasvībhir asya dhītibhiḥ
Griffith: The singers kindle him, the Priest, Agni the Lord of tribes of men,
Devanāgarī: दीदिवांसमपूर्व्यं वस्वीभिरस्य धीतिभिः
pada pāṭha: dīdi-vāṁsam | apūrvyam | vasvībhiḥ | asya | dhīti-bhiḥ || r̥kvāṇaḥ | agnim | indhate | hotāram | viśpatim | viśām ||3.13.5||

IAST: ṛkvāṇo agnim indhate hotāraṁ viśpatiṁ viśām
Griffith: Resplendent and without a peer through his own excellent designs.
Devanāgarī: ऋक्वाणो अग्निमिन्धते होतारं विश्पतिं विशाम्
pada pāṭha: dīdi-vāṁsam | apūrvyam | vasvībhiḥ | asya | dhīti-bhiḥ || r̥kvāṇaḥ | agnim | indhate | hotāram | viśpatim | viśām ||3.13.5||

IAST: uta no brahmann aviṣa uktheṣu devahūtamaḥ
Griffith: Help us, thou Brahman, best of all invokers of the Gods in song.
Devanāgarī: उत नो ब्रह्मन्नविष उक्थेषु देवहूतमः
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | brahman | aviṣaḥ | uktheṣu | deva-hūtamaḥ || śam | naḥ | śoca | marut-vr̥dhaḥ | agne | sahasra-sātamaḥ ||3.13.6||

IAST: śaṁ naḥ śocā marudvṛdho 'gne sahasrasātamaḥ
Griffith: Beam, Friend of Maruts, bliss on us, O Agni, a most liberal God.
Devanāgarī: शं नः शोचा मरुद्वृधोऽग्ने सहस्रसातमः
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | brahman | aviṣaḥ | uktheṣu | deva-hūtamaḥ || śam | naḥ | śoca | marut-vr̥dhaḥ | agne | sahasra-sātamaḥ ||3.13.6||

IAST: nū no rāsva sahasravat tokavat puṣṭimad vasu
Griffith: Yea, grant us treasure thousandfold with children and with nourishment,
Devanāgarī: नू नो रास्व सहस्रवत्तोकवत्पुष्टिमद्वसु
pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | rāsva | sahasra-vat | toka-vat | puṣṭi-mat | vasu || dyu-mat | agne | su-vīryam | varṣiṣṭham | anupa-kṣitam ||3.13.7||

IAST: dyumad agne suvīryaṁ varṣiṣṭham anupakṣitam
Griffith: And, Agni, splendid hero strength, exalted, wasting not away.
Devanāgarī: द्युमदग्ने सुवीर्यं वर्षिष्ठमनुपक्षितम्
pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | rāsva | sahasra-vat | toka-vat | puṣṭi-mat | vasu || dyu-mat | agne | su-vīryam | varṣiṣṭham | anupa-kṣitam ||3.13.7||

IAST: ā hotā mandro vidathāny asthāt satyo yajvā kavitamaḥ sa vedhāḥ
Griffith: THE pleasant Priest is come into the synod, true, skilled in sacrifice, most wise, Ordainer.
Devanāgarī: आ होता मन्द्रो विदथान्यस्थात्सत्यो यज्वा कवितमः स वेधाः
pada pāṭha: ā | hotā | mandraḥ | vadathāni | asthāt | satyaḥ | yajvā | kavi-tamaḥ | saḥ | vedhāḥ || vidyut-rathaḥ | sahasaḥ | putraḥ | agniḥ | śociḥ-keśaḥ | pr̥thivyām | pājaḥ | aśret ||3.14.1||

IAST: vidyudrathaḥ sahasas putro agniḥ śociṣkeśaḥ pṛthivyām pājo aśret
Griffith: Agni, the Son of Strength, whose car is lightning, whose hair is flame, hath shown on earth his lustre.
Devanāgarī: विद्युद्रथः सहसस्पुत्रो अग्निः शोचिष्केशः पृथिव्यां पाजो अश्रेत्
pada pāṭha: ā | hotā | mandraḥ | vadathāni | asthāt | satyaḥ | yajvā | kavi-tamaḥ | saḥ | vedhāḥ || vidyut-rathaḥ | sahasaḥ | putraḥ | agniḥ | śociḥ-keśaḥ | pr̥thivyām | pājaḥ | aśret ||3.14.1||

IAST: ayāmi te namaüktiṁ juṣasva ṛtāvas tubhyaṁ cetate sahasvaḥ
Griffith: To thee I offer reverent speech: accept it: to thee who markest it, victorious, faithful!
Devanāgarī: अयामि ते नम‍उक्तिं जुषस्व ऋतावस्तुभ्यं चेतते सहस्वः
pada pāṭha: ayāmi | te | namaḥ-uktim | juṣasva | r̥ta-vaḥ | tubhyam | cetate | sahasvaḥ || vidvān | ā | vakṣi | viduṣaḥ | ni | satsi | madhye | ā | barhiḥ | ūtaye | yajatra ||3.14.2||

IAST: vidvām̐ ā vakṣi viduṣo ni ṣatsi madhya ā barhir ūtaye yajatra
Griffith: Bring, thou who knowest, those who know, and seat thee amid the sacred grass, for help, O Holy.
Devanāgarī: विद्वाँ आ वक्षि विदुषो नि षत्सि मध्य आ बर्हिरूतये यजत्र
pada pāṭha: ayāmi | te | namaḥ-uktim | juṣasva | r̥ta-vaḥ | tubhyam | cetate | sahasvaḥ || vidvān | ā | vakṣi | viduṣaḥ | ni | satsi | madhye | ā | barhiḥ | ūtaye | yajatra ||3.14.2||

IAST: dravatāṁ ta uṣasā vājayantī agne vātasya pathyābhir accha
Griffith: The Two who show their vigour, Night and Morning, by the wind's paths shall haste to thee O Agni.
Devanāgarī: द्रवतां त उषसा वाजयन्ती अग्ने वातस्य पथ्याभिरच्छ
pada pāṭha: dravatām | te | uṣasā | vājayantī iti | agne | vātasya | pathyābhiḥ | accha || yat | sīm | añjanti | pūrvyam | haviḥ-bhiḥ | ā | vandhurā-iva | tasthatuḥ | duroṇe ||3.14.3||

IAST: yat sīm añjanti pūrvyaṁ havirbhir ā vandhureva tasthatur duroṇe
Griffith: When men adorn the Ancient with oblations, these seek, as on two chariot-seats, the dwelling.
Devanāgarī: यत्सीमञ्जन्ति पूर्व्यं हविर्भिरा वन्धुरेव तस्थतुर्दुरोणे
pada pāṭha: dravatām | te | uṣasā | vājayantī iti | agne | vātasya | pathyābhiḥ | accha || yat | sīm | añjanti | pūrvyam | haviḥ-bhiḥ | ā | vandhurā-iva | tasthatuḥ | duroṇe ||3.14.3||

IAST: mitraś ca tubhyaṁ varuṇaḥ sahasvo 'gne viśve marutaḥ sumnam arcan
Griffith: To thee, strong Agni! Varuna and Mitra and all the Maruts sang a song of triumph,
Devanāgarī: मित्रश्च तुभ्यं वरुणः सहस्वोऽग्ने विश्वे मरुतः सुम्नमर्चन्
pada pāṭha: mitraḥ | ca | tubhyam | varuṇaḥ | sahasvaḥ | agne | viśve | marutaḥ | sumnam | arcan || yat | śociṣā | sahasaḥ | putra | tiṣṭhāḥ | abhi | kṣitīḥ | prathayan | sūryaḥ | nr̥̄n ||3.14.4||

IAST: yac chociṣā sahasas putra tiṣṭhā abhi kṣitīḥ prathayan sūryo nṝn
Griffith: What time unto the people's lands thou camest, spreading them as the Sun of men, with lustre.
Devanāgarī: यच्छोचिषा सहसस्पुत्र तिष्ठा अभि क्षितीः प्रथयन्सूर्यो नॄन्
pada pāṭha: mitraḥ | ca | tubhyam | varuṇaḥ | sahasvaḥ | agne | viśve | marutaḥ | sumnam | arcan || yat | śociṣā | sahasaḥ | putra | tiṣṭhāḥ | abhi | kṣitīḥ | prathayan | sūryaḥ | nr̥̄n ||3.14.4||

IAST: vayaṁ te adya rarimā hi kāmam uttānahastā namasopasadya
Griffith: Approaching with raised hands and adoration, we have this day fulfilled for thee thy longing.
Devanāgarī: वयं ते अद्य ररिमा हि काममुत्तानहस्ता नमसोपसद्य
pada pāṭha: vayam | te | adya | rarima | hi | kāmam | uttāna-hastāḥ | namasā | upa-sadya || yajiṣṭhena | manasā | yakṣi | devān | asredhatā | manmanā | vipraḥ | agne ||3.14.5||

IAST: yajiṣṭhena manasā yakṣi devān asredhatā manmanā vipro agne
Griffith: Worship the Gods with most devoted spirit, a Priest with no unfriendly thought, O Agni.
Devanāgarī: यजिष्ठेन मनसा यक्षि देवानस्रेधता मन्मना विप्रो अग्ने
pada pāṭha: vayam | te | adya | rarima | hi | kāmam | uttāna-hastāḥ | namasā | upa-sadya || yajiṣṭhena | manasā | yakṣi | devān | asredhatā | manmanā | vipraḥ | agne ||3.14.5||

IAST: tvad dhi putra sahaso vi pūrvīr devasya yanty ūtayo vi vājāḥ
Griffith: For, Son of Strength, from thee come many succours, and powers abundant that a God possesses.
Devanāgarī: त्वद्धि पुत्र सहसो वि पूर्वीर्देवस्य यन्त्यूतयो वि वाजाः
pada pāṭha: tvat | hi | putra | sahasaḥ | vi | pūrvīḥ | devasya | yanti | ūtayaḥ | vi | vājāḥ || tvam | dehi | sahasriṇam | rayim | naḥ | adrogheṇa | vacasā | satyam | agne ||3.14.6||

IAST: tvaṁ dehi sahasriṇaṁ rayiṁ no 'drogheṇa vacasā satyam agne
Griffith: Agni, to us with speech that hath no falsehood grant riches, real, to be told in thousands.
Devanāgarī: त्वं देहि सहस्रिणं रयिं नोऽद्रोघेण वचसा सत्यमग्ने
pada pāṭha: tvat | hi | putra | sahasaḥ | vi | pūrvīḥ | devasya | yanti | ūtayaḥ | vi | vājāḥ || tvam | dehi | sahasriṇam | rayim | naḥ | adrogheṇa | vacasā | satyam | agne ||3.14.6||

IAST: tubhyaṁ dakṣa kavikrato yānīmā deva martāso adhvare akarma
Griffith: Whatever, God, in sacrifice we mortals have wrought is all for thee, strong, wise of purpose!
Devanāgarī: तुभ्यं दक्ष कविक्रतो यानीमा देव मर्तासो अध्वरे अकर्म
pada pāṭha: tubhyam | dakṣa | kavikrato iti kavi-krato | yāni | imā | deva | martāsaḥ | adhvare | akarma || tvam | viśvasya | su-rathasya | bodhi | sarvam | tat | agne | amr̥ta | svada | iha ||3.14.7||

IAST: tvaṁ viśvasya surathasya bodhi sarvaṁ tad agne amṛta svadeha
Griffith: Be thou the Friend of each good chariot's master. All this enjoy thou here, immortal Agni.
Devanāgarī: त्वं विश्वस्य सुरथस्य बोधि सर्वं तदग्ने अमृत स्वदेह
pada pāṭha: tubhyam | dakṣa | kavikrato iti kavi-krato | yāni | imā | deva | martāsaḥ | adhvare | akarma || tvam | viśvasya | su-rathasya | bodhi | sarvam | tat | agne | amr̥ta | svada | iha ||3.14.7||

IAST: vi pājasā pṛthunā śośucāno bādhasva dviṣo rakṣaso amīvāḥ
Griffith: RESPLENDENT with thy wide-extending lustre, dispel the terrors of the fiends who hate us
Devanāgarī: वि पाजसा पृथुना शोशुचानो बाधस्व द्विषो रक्षसो अमीवाः
pada pāṭha: vi | pājasā | pr̥thunā | śośucānaḥ | bādhasva | dviṣaḥ | rakṣasaḥ | amīvāḥ || su-śarmaṇaḥ | br̥hataḥ | śarmaṇi | syām | agneḥ | aham | su-havasya | pra-nītau ||3.15.1||

IAST: suśarmaṇo bṛhataḥ śarmaṇi syām agner ahaṁ suhavasya praṇītau
Griffith: May lofty Agni be my guide and shelter, the easily-invoked, the good Protector.
Devanāgarī: सुशर्मणो बृहतः शर्मणि स्यामग्नेरहं सुहवस्य प्रणीतौ
pada pāṭha: vi | pājasā | pr̥thunā | śośucānaḥ | bādhasva | dviṣaḥ | rakṣasaḥ | amīvāḥ || su-śarmaṇaḥ | br̥hataḥ | śarmaṇi | syām | agneḥ | aham | su-havasya | pra-nītau ||3.15.1||

IAST: tvaṁ no asyā uṣaso vyuṣṭau tvaṁ sūra udite bodhi gopāḥ
Griffith: Be thou To us, while now the morn is breaking, be thou a guardian when the Sun hath mounted..
Devanāgarī: त्वं नो अस्या उषसो व्युष्टौ त्वं सूर उदिते बोधि गोपाः
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | asyāḥ | uṣasaḥ | vi-uṣṭau | tvam | sūre | ut-ite | bodhi | gopāḥ || janma-iva | nityam | tanayam | juṣasva | stomam | me | agne | tanvā | su-jāta ||3.15.2||

IAST: janmeva nityaṁ tanayaṁ juṣasva stomam me agne tanvā sujāta
Griffith: Accept, as men accept a true-born infant, my laud, O Agni nobly born in body.
Devanāgarī: जन्मेव नित्यं तनयं जुषस्व स्तोमं मे अग्ने तन्वा सुजात
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | asyāḥ | uṣasaḥ | vi-uṣṭau | tvam | sūre | ut-ite | bodhi | gopāḥ || janma-iva | nityam | tanayam | juṣasva | stomam | me | agne | tanvā | su-jāta ||3.15.2||

IAST: tvaṁ nṛcakṣā vṛṣabhānu pūrvīḥ kṛṣṇāsv agne aruṣo vi bhāhi
Griffith: Bull, who beholdest men, through many mornings, among the dark ones shine forth red, O Agni.
Devanāgarī: त्वं नृचक्षा वृषभानु पूर्वीः कृष्णास्वग्ने अरुषो वि भाहि
pada pāṭha: tvam | nr̥-cakṣāḥ | vr̥ṣabha | anu | pūrvīḥ | kr̥ṣṇāsu | agne | aruṣaḥ | vi | bhāhi || vaso iti | neṣi | ca | parṣi | ca | ati | aṁhaḥ | kr̥dhi | naḥ | rāye | uśijaḥ | yaviṣṭha ||3.15.3||

IAST: vaso neṣi ca parṣi cāty aṁhaḥ kṛdhī no rāya uśijo yaviṣṭha
Griffith: Lead us, good Lord, and bear us over trouble: Help us who long, Most Youthful God, to riches.
Devanāgarī: वसो नेषि च पर्षि चात्यंहः कृधी नो राय उशिजो यविष्ठ
pada pāṭha: tvam | nr̥-cakṣāḥ | vr̥ṣabha | anu | pūrvīḥ | kr̥ṣṇāsu | agne | aruṣaḥ | vi | bhāhi || vaso iti | neṣi | ca | parṣi | ca | ati | aṁhaḥ | kr̥dhi | naḥ | rāye | uśijaḥ | yaviṣṭha ||3.15.3||

IAST: aṣāḻho agne vṛṣabho didīhi puro viśvāḥ saubhagā saṁjigīvān
Griffith: Shine forth, a Bull invincible, O Agni, winning by conquest all the forts and treasures,
Devanāgarī: अषाळ्हो अग्ने वृषभो दिदीहि पुरो विश्वाः सौभगा संजिगीवान्
pada pāṭha: aṣāḷhaḥ | agne | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | didīhi | puraḥ | viśvāḥ | saubhagā | sam-jigīvān || yajñasya | netā | prathamasya | pāyoḥ | jāta-vedaḥ | br̥hataḥ | su-pranīte ||3.15.4||

IAST: yajñasya netā prathamasya pāyor jātavedo bṛhataḥ supraṇīte
Griffith: Thou Jatavedas who art skilled in guiding, the chief high saving sacrifice's Leader.
Devanāgarī: यज्ञस्य नेता प्रथमस्य पायोर्जातवेदो बृहतः सुप्रणीते
pada pāṭha: aṣāḷhaḥ | agne | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | didīhi | puraḥ | viśvāḥ | saubhagā | sam-jigīvān || yajñasya | netā | prathamasya | pāyoḥ | jāta-vedaḥ | br̥hataḥ | su-pranīte ||3.15.4||

IAST: acchidrā śarma jaritaḥ purūṇi devām̐ acchā dīdyānaḥ sumedhāḥ
Griffith: Lighting Gods hither, Agni, wisest Singer, bring thou to us many and flawless shelters.
Devanāgarī: अच्छिद्रा शर्म जरितः पुरूणि देवाँ अच्छा दीद्यानः सुमेधाः
pada pāṭha: acchidrā | śarma | jaritariti | purūṇi | devān | accha | dīdyānaḥ | su-medhāḥ || rathaḥ | na | sasniḥ | abhi | vakṣi | vājam | agne | tvam | rodasī iti | naḥ | sumeke iti su-meke ||3.15.5||

IAST: ratho na sasnir abhi vakṣi vājam agne tvaṁ rodasī naḥ sumeke
Griffith: Bring vigour, like a car that gathers booty: bring us, O Agni, beauteous.Rarth and Heaven.
Devanāgarī: रथो न सस्निरभि वक्षि वाजमग्ने त्वं रोदसी नः सुमेके
pada pāṭha: acchidrā | śarma | jaritariti | purūṇi | devān | accha | dīdyānaḥ | su-medhāḥ || rathaḥ | na | sasniḥ | abhi | vakṣi | vājam | agne | tvam | rodasī iti | naḥ | sumeke iti su-meke ||3.15.5||

IAST: pra pīpaya vṛṣabha jinva vājān agne tvaṁ rodasī naḥ sudoghe
Griffith: Swell, O thou Bull and give those powers an impulse, e'en Earth and Heaven who yield their milk in plenty,
Devanāgarī: प्र पीपय वृषभ जिन्व वाजानग्ने त्वं रोदसी नः सुदोघे
pada pāṭha: pra | pīpaya | vr̥ṣabha | jinva | vājān | agne | tvam | rodasī iti | naḥ | sudoghe iti su-doghe || devebhiḥ | deva | su-rucā | rucānaḥ | mā | naḥ | martasya | duḥ-matiḥ | pari | sthāt ||3.15.6||

IAST: devebhir deva surucā rucāno mā no martasya durmatiḥ pari ṣṭhāt
Griffith: Shining, O God, with Gods in clear effulgence. Let not a mortal's evil will obstruct us.
Devanāgarī: देवेभिर्देव सुरुचा रुचानो मा नो मर्तस्य दुर्मतिः परि ष्ठात्
pada pāṭha: pra | pīpaya | vr̥ṣabha | jinva | vājān | agne | tvam | rodasī iti | naḥ | sudoghe iti su-doghe || devebhiḥ | deva | su-rucā | rucānaḥ | mā | naḥ | martasya | duḥ-matiḥ | pari | sthāt ||3.15.6||

IAST: iḻām agne purudaṁsaṁ saniṁ goḥ śaśvattamaṁ havamānāya sādha
Griffith: Agni, as holy food to thine invoker, give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels.
Devanāgarī: इळामग्ने पुरुदंसं सनिं गोः शश्वत्तमं हवमानाय साध
pada pāṭha: iḷām | agne | puru-daṁsam | sanim | goḥ | śaśvat-tamam | havamānāya | sādha || syāt | naḥ | sūnuḥ | tanayaḥ | vijā-vā | agne | sā | te | su-matiḥ | bhūtu | asme iti ||3.15.7||

IAST: syān naḥ sūnus tanayo vijāvāgne sā te sumatir bhūtv asme
Griffith: To us be born a son and spreading ofrspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward.
Devanāgarī: स्यान्नः सूनुस्तनयो विजावाग्ने सा ते सुमतिर्भूत्वस्मे
pada pāṭha: iḷām | agne | puru-daṁsam | sanim | goḥ | śaśvat-tamam | havamānāya | sādha || syāt | naḥ | sūnuḥ | tanayaḥ | vijā-vā | agne | sā | te | su-matiḥ | bhūtu | asme iti ||3.15.7||

IAST: ayam agniḥ suvīryasyeśe mahaḥ saubhagasya
Griffith: THIS Agni is the Lord of great felicity and hero Strength;
Devanāgarī: अयमग्निः सुवीर्यस्येशे महः सौभगस्य
pada pāṭha: ayam | agniḥ | su-vīryasya | īśe | mahaḥ | saubhagasya || rāyaḥ | īśe | su-apatyasya | go-mataḥ | īśe | vr̥tra-hathānām ||3.16.1||

IAST: rāya īśe svapatyasya gomata īśe vṛtrahathānām
Griffith: Lord of wealth in herds of kine; Lord of the battles with the foe.
Devanāgarī: राय ईशे स्वपत्यस्य गोमत ईशे वृत्रहथानाम्
pada pāṭha: ayam | agniḥ | su-vīryasya | īśe | mahaḥ | saubhagasya || rāyaḥ | īśe | su-apatyasya | go-mataḥ | īśe | vr̥tra-hathānām ||3.16.1||

IAST: imaṁ naro marutaḥ saścatā vṛdhaṁ yasmin rāyaḥ śevṛdhāsaḥ
Griffith: Wait, Maruts, Heroes, upon him the Prosperer in whom is bliss-increasing wealth;
Devanāgarī: इमं नरो मरुतः सश्चता वृधं यस्मिन्रायः शेवृधासः
pada pāṭha: imam | naraḥ | marutaḥ | saścata | vr̥dham | yasmin | rāyaḥ | śe-vr̥dhāsaḥ || abhi | ye | santi | pr̥tanāsu | duḥ-dhyaḥ | viśvāhā | śatrum | ā-dabhuḥ ||3.16.2||

IAST: abhi ye santi pṛtanāsu dūḍhyo viśvāhā śatrum ādabhuḥ
Griffith: Who in fights ever conquer evil-hearted men, who overcome the enemy.
Devanāgarī: अभि ये सन्ति पृतनासु दूढ्यो विश्वाहा शत्रुमादभुः
pada pāṭha: imam | naraḥ | marutaḥ | saścata | vr̥dham | yasmin | rāyaḥ | śe-vr̥dhāsaḥ || abhi | ye | santi | pr̥tanāsu | duḥ-dhyaḥ | viśvāhā | śatrum | ā-dabhuḥ ||3.16.2||

IAST: sa tvaṁ no rāyaḥ śiśīhi mīḍhvo agne suvīryasya
Griffith: As such, O Agni, deal us wealth and hero might, O Bounteous One!
Devanāgarī: स त्वं नो रायः शिशीहि मीढ्वो अग्ने सुवीर्यस्य
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | naḥ | rāyaḥ | śiśīhi | mīḍhvaḥ | agne | su-vīryasya || tuvi-dyumna | varṣiṣṭhasya | prajā-vataḥ | anamīvasya | śuṣmiṇaḥ ||3.16.3||

IAST: tuvidyumna varṣiṣṭhasya prajāvato 'namīvasya śuṣmiṇaḥ
Griffith: Most lofty, very glorious, rich in progeny, free from disease and full of power.
Devanāgarī: तुविद्युम्न वर्षिष्ठस्य प्रजावतोऽनमीवस्य शुष्मिणः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | naḥ | rāyaḥ | śiśīhi | mīḍhvaḥ | agne | su-vīryasya || tuvi-dyumna | varṣiṣṭhasya | prajā-vataḥ | anamīvasya | śuṣmiṇaḥ ||3.16.3||

IAST: cakrir yo viśvā bhuvanābhi sāsahiś cakrir deveṣv ā duvaḥ
Griffith: He who made all that lives, who passes all in might, who orders service to the Gods,
Devanāgarī: चक्रिर्यो विश्वा भुवनाभि सासहिश्चक्रिर्देवेष्वा दुवः
pada pāṭha: cakriḥ | yaḥ | viśvā | bhuvanā | abhi | sasahiḥ | cakriḥ | deveṣu | ā | duvaḥ || ā | deveṣu | yatate | ā | su-vīrye | ā | śaṁse | uta | nr̥ṇām ||3.16.4||

IAST: ā deveṣu yatata ā suvīrya ā śaṁsa uta nṛṇām
Griffith: He works among the Gods, he works in hero strength, yea, also in the praise of men.
Devanāgarī: आ देवेषु यतत आ सुवीर्य आ शंस उत नृणाम्
pada pāṭha: cakriḥ | yaḥ | viśvā | bhuvanā | abhi | sasahiḥ | cakriḥ | deveṣu | ā | duvaḥ || ā | deveṣu | yatate | ā | su-vīrye | ā | śaṁse | uta | nr̥ṇām ||3.16.4||

IAST: mā no agne 'mataye māvīratāyai rīradhaḥ
Griffith: Give us not up to indigence, Agni, nor want of hero sons,
Devanāgarī: मा नो अग्नेऽमतये मावीरतायै रीरधः
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | agne | amataye | mā | avīratāyai | rīradhaḥ || mā | agotāyai | sahasaḥ | putra | mā | nide | apa | dveṣāṁsi | ā | kr̥dhi ||3.16.5||

IAST: māgotāyai sahasas putra mā nide 'pa dveṣāṁsy ā kṛdhi
Griffith: Nor, Son of Strength, to lack of cattle, nor to blame. Drive. thou our enemies away.
Devanāgarī: मागोतायै सहसस्पुत्र मा निदेऽप द्वेषांस्या कृधि
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | agne | amataye | mā | avīratāyai | rīradhaḥ || mā | agotāyai | sahasaḥ | putra | mā | nide | apa | dveṣāṁsi | ā | kr̥dhi ||3.16.5||

IAST: śagdhi vājasya subhaga prajāvato 'gne bṛhato adhvare
Griffith: Help us to strength, blest Agni! rich in progeny, abundant, in our sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: शग्धि वाजस्य सुभग प्रजावतोऽग्ने बृहतो अध्वरे
pada pāṭha: śagdhi | vājasya | su-bhaga | prajā-vataḥ | agne | br̥hataḥ | adhvare || sam | rāyā | bhūyasā | sr̥ja | mayaḥ-bhunā | tuvi-dyumna | yaśasvatā ||3.16.6||

IAST: saṁ rāyā bhūyasā sṛja mayobhunā tuvidyumna yaśasvatā
Griffith: Flood us with riches yet more plenteous, bringing weal, with high renown, most Glorious One!
Devanāgarī: सं राया भूयसा सृज मयोभुना तुविद्युम्न यशस्वता
pada pāṭha: śagdhi | vājasya | su-bhaga | prajā-vataḥ | agne | br̥hataḥ | adhvare || sam | rāyā | bhūyasā | sr̥ja | mayaḥ-bhunā | tuvi-dyumna | yaśasvatā ||3.16.6||

IAST: samidhyamānaḥ prathamānu dharmā sam aktubhir ajyate viśvavāraḥ
Griffith: DULY enkindled after ancient customs, bringing all treasures, he is balmed with unguents,-
Devanāgarī: समिध्यमानः प्रथमानु धर्मा समक्तुभिरज्यते विश्ववारः
pada pāṭha: sam-idhyamānaḥ | prathamā | anu | dharma | sam | aktu-bhiḥ | ajyate | viśva-vāraḥ || śociḥ-keśaḥ | ghr̥ta-nirnik | pāvakaḥ | su-yajñaḥ | agniḥ | yajathāya | devān ||3.17.1||

IAST: śociṣkeśo ghṛtanirṇik pāvakaḥ suyajño agnir yajathāya devān
Griffith: Flame-haired, oil-clad, the purifying Agni, skilled in fair rites, to bring the Gods for worship.
Devanāgarī: शोचिष्केशो घृतनिर्णिक्पावकः सुयज्ञो अग्निर्यजथाय देवान्
pada pāṭha: sam-idhyamānaḥ | prathamā | anu | dharma | sam | aktu-bhiḥ | ajyate | viśva-vāraḥ || śociḥ-keśaḥ | ghr̥ta-nirnik | pāvakaḥ | su-yajñaḥ | agniḥ | yajathāya | devān ||3.17.1||

IAST: yathāyajo hotram agne pṛthivyā yathā divo jātavedaś cikitvān
Griffith: As thou, O Agni, skilful Jatavedas, hast sacrificed as Priest of Earth, of Heaven,
Devanāgarī: यथायजो होत्रमग्ने पृथिव्या यथा दिवो जातवेदश्चिकित्वान्
pada pāṭha: yathā | ayajaḥ | hotram | agne | pr̥thivyāḥ | yathā | divaḥ | jāta-vedaḥ | cikitvān || eva | anena | haviṣā | yakṣi | devān | manuṣvat | yajñam | pra | tira | imam | adya ||3.17.2||

IAST: evānena haviṣā yakṣi devān manuṣvad yajñam pra tiremam adya
Griffith: So with this offering bring the Gods, and prosper this sacrifice today as erst for Manu.
Devanāgarī: एवानेन हविषा यक्षि देवान्मनुष्वद्यज्ञं प्र तिरेममद्य
pada pāṭha: yathā | ayajaḥ | hotram | agne | pr̥thivyāḥ | yathā | divaḥ | jāta-vedaḥ | cikitvān || eva | anena | haviṣā | yakṣi | devān | manuṣvat | yajñam | pra | tira | imam | adya ||3.17.2||

IAST: trīṇy āyūṁṣi tava jātavedas tisra ājānīr uṣasas te agne
Griffith: Three are thy times of life, O Jatavedas, and the three mornings are thy births, O Agni.
Devanāgarī: त्रीण्यायूंषि तव जातवेदस्तिस्र आजानीरुषसस्ते अग्ने
pada pāṭha: trīṇi | āyūṁṣi | tava | jāta-vedaḥ | tisraḥ | ā-jānīḥ | uṣasaḥ | te | agne || tābhiḥ | devānām | avaḥ | yakṣi | vidvān | atha | bhava | yajamānāya | śam | yoḥ ||3.17.3||

IAST: tābhir devānām avo yakṣi vidvān athā bhava yajamānāya śaṁ yoḥ
Griffith: With these, well-knowing, grant the Gods' kind favour, and help in stir aiid stress the man who worships.
Devanāgarī: ताभिर्देवानामवो यक्षि विद्वानथा भव यजमानाय शं योः
pada pāṭha: trīṇi | āyūṁṣi | tava | jāta-vedaḥ | tisraḥ | ā-jānīḥ | uṣasaḥ | te | agne || tābhiḥ | devānām | avaḥ | yakṣi | vidvān | atha | bhava | yajamānāya | śam | yoḥ ||3.17.3||

IAST: agniṁ sudītiṁ sudṛśaṁ gṛṇanto namasyāmas tveḍyaṁ jātavedaḥ
Griffith: Agni most bright and fair with song we honour, yea, the adorable, O Jatavedas.
Devanāgarī: अग्निं सुदीतिं सुदृशं गृणन्तो नमस्यामस्त्वेड्यं जातवेदः
pada pāṭha: agnim | su-dītim | su-dr̥śam | gr̥ṇantaḥ | namasyāmaḥ | tvā | īḍyam | jāta-vedaḥ || tvām | dūtam | aratim | havya-vāham | devāḥ | akr̥ṇvan | amr̥tasya | nābhim ||3.17.4||

IAST: tvāṁ dūtam aratiṁ havyavāhaṁ devā akṛṇvann amṛtasya nābhim
Griffith: Thee, envoy, messenger, oblation-bearer, the Gods have made centre of life eternal.
Devanāgarī: त्वां दूतमरतिं हव्यवाहं देवा अकृण्वन्नमृतस्य नाभिम्
pada pāṭha: agnim | su-dītim | su-dr̥śam | gr̥ṇantaḥ | namasyāmaḥ | tvā | īḍyam | jāta-vedaḥ || tvām | dūtam | aratim | havya-vāham | devāḥ | akr̥ṇvan | amr̥tasya | nābhim ||3.17.4||

IAST: yas tvad dhotā pūrvo agne yajīyān dvitā ca sattā svadhayā ca śambhuḥ
Griffith: That Priest before thee, yet more skilled in worship, stablished of old, healthgiver by his nature,-
Devanāgarī: यस्त्वद्धोता पूर्वो अग्ने यजीयान्द्विता च सत्ता स्वधया च शम्भुः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | tvat | hotā | pūrvaḥ | agne | yajīyān | dvitā | ca | sattā | svadhayā | ca | śam-bhuḥ || tasya | anu | dharma | pra | yaja | cikitvaḥ | atha | naḥ | dhāḥ | adhvaram | deva-vītau ||3.17.5||

IAST: tasyānu dharma pra yajā cikitvo 'thā no dhā adhvaraṁ devavītau
Griffith: After his custom offer, thou who knowest, and lay our sacrifice where Gods may taste it.
Devanāgarī: तस्यानु धर्म प्र यजा चिकित्वोऽथ नो धा अध्वरं देववीतौ
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | tvat | hotā | pūrvaḥ | agne | yajīyān | dvitā | ca | sattā | svadhayā | ca | śam-bhuḥ || tasya | anu | dharma | pra | yaja | cikitvaḥ | atha | naḥ | dhāḥ | adhvaram | deva-vītau ||3.17.5||

IAST: bhavā no agne sumanā upetau sakheva sakhye pitareva sādhuḥ
Griffith: AGNI, be kind to us when we approach thee good as a friend to friend, as sire and mother.
Devanāgarī: भवा नो अग्ने सुमना उपेतौ सखेव सख्ये पितरेव साधुः
pada pāṭha: bhava | naḥ | agne | su-manāḥ | upa-itau | sakhā-iva | sakhye | pitarā-iva | sādhuḥ || puru-druhaḥ | hi | kṣitayaḥ | janānām | prati | pratīcīḥ | dahatāt | arātīḥ ||3.18.1||

IAST: purudruho hi kṣitayo janānām prati pratīcīr dahatād arātīḥ
Griffith: The races of mankind are great oppressors burn up malignity that strives against us.
Devanāgarī: पुरुद्रुहो हि क्षितयो जनानां प्रति प्रतीचीर्दहतादरातीः
pada pāṭha: bhava | naḥ | agne | su-manāḥ | upa-itau | sakhā-iva | sakhye | pitarā-iva | sādhuḥ || puru-druhaḥ | hi | kṣitayaḥ | janānām | prati | pratīcīḥ | dahatāt | arātīḥ ||3.18.1||

IAST: tapo ṣv agne antarām̐ amitrān tapā śaṁsam araruṣaḥ parasya
Griffith: Agni, burn up the unfriendly who are near us, burn thou the foeman's curse who pays no worship.
Devanāgarī: तपो ष्वग्ने अन्तराँ अमित्रान्तपा शंसमररुषः परस्य
pada pāṭha: tapo iti | su | agne | antarān | amitrān | tapa | śaṁsam | araruṣaḥ | parasya || tapo iti | vaso iti | cikitānaḥ | acittān | vi | te | tiṣṭhantām | ajarāḥ | ayāsaḥ ||3.18.2||

IAST: tapo vaso cikitāno acittān vi te tiṣṭhantām ajarā ayāsaḥ
Griffith: Burn, Vasu, thou who markest well, the foolish: let thine eternal nimble beams surround thee.
Devanāgarī: तपो वसो चिकितानो अचित्तान्वि ते तिष्ठन्तामजरा अयासः
pada pāṭha: tapo iti | su | agne | antarān | amitrān | tapa | śaṁsam | araruṣaḥ | parasya || tapo iti | vaso iti | cikitānaḥ | acittān | vi | te | tiṣṭhantām | ajarāḥ | ayāsaḥ ||3.18.2||

IAST: idhmenāgna icchamāno ghṛtena juhomi havyaṁ tarase balāya
Griffith: With fuel, Agni, and with oil, desirous, mine offering I present for strength and conquest,
Devanāgarī: इध्मेनाग्न इच्छमानो घृतेन जुहोमि हव्यं तरसे बलाय
pada pāṭha: idhmena | agne | icchamānaḥ | ghr̥tena | juhomi | havyam | tarase | balāya || yāvat | īśe | brahmaṇā | vandamānaḥ | imām | dhiyam | śata-seyāya | devīm ||3.18.3||

IAST: yāvad īśe brahmaṇā vandamāna imāṁ dhiyaṁ śataseyāya devīm
Griffith: With prayer, so far as I have power, adoring-this hymn divine to gain a hundred treasures.
Devanāgarī: यावदीशे ब्रह्मणा वन्दमान इमां धियं शतसेयाय देवीम्
pada pāṭha: idhmena | agne | icchamānaḥ | ghr̥tena | juhomi | havyam | tarase | balāya || yāvat | īśe | brahmaṇā | vandamānaḥ | imām | dhiyam | śata-seyāya | devīm ||3.18.3||

IAST: uc chociṣā sahasas putra stuto bṛhad vayaḥ śaśamāneṣu dhehi
Griffith: Give with thy glow, thou Son of Strength, when lauded, great vital power to those who toil to serve thee.
Devanāgarī: उच्छोचिषा सहसस्पुत्र स्तुतो बृहद्वयः शशमानेषु धेहि
pada pāṭha: ut | śociṣā | sahasaḥ | putra | stutaḥ | br̥hat | vayaḥ | śaśamāneṣu | dhehi || revat | agne | viśvāmitreṣu | śam | yoḥ | marmr̥jma | te | tanvam | bhūri | kr̥tvaḥ ||3.18.4||

IAST: revad agne viśvāmitreṣu śaṁ yor marmṛjmā te tanvam bhūri kṛtvaḥ
Griffith: Give richly, Agni, to the Visvamitras in rest and stir. Oft have we decked thy body.
Devanāgarī: रेवदग्ने विश्वामित्रेषु शं योर्मर्मृज्मा ते तन्वं भूरि कृत्वः
pada pāṭha: ut | śociṣā | sahasaḥ | putra | stutaḥ | br̥hat | vayaḥ | śaśamāneṣu | dhehi || revat | agne | viśvāmitreṣu | śam | yoḥ | marmr̥jma | te | tanvam | bhūri | kr̥tvaḥ ||3.18.4||

IAST: kṛdhi ratnaṁ susanitar dhanānāṁ sa ghed agne bhavasi yat samiddhaḥ
Griffith: Give us, O liberal Lord, great gtore of riches, for, Agni, such art thou when duly kindled.
Devanāgarī: कृधि रत्नं सुसनितर्धनानां स घेदग्ने भवसि यत्समिद्धः
pada pāṭha: kr̥dhi | ratnam | su-sanitaḥ | dhanānām | saḥ | gha | it | agne | bhavasi | yat | sam-iddhaḥ || stotuḥ | duroṇe | su-bhagasya | revat | sr̥prā | karasnā | dadhiṣe | vapūṁṣi ||3.18.5||

IAST: stotur duroṇe subhagasya revat sṛprā karasnā dadhiṣe vapūṁṣi
Griffith: Thou in the happy singer's home bestowest, amply with arms extended, things of beauty.
Devanāgarī: स्तोतुर्दुरोणे सुभगस्य रेवत्सृप्रा करस्ना दधिषे वपूंषि
pada pāṭha: kr̥dhi | ratnam | su-sanitaḥ | dhanānām | saḥ | gha | it | agne | bhavasi | yat | sam-iddhaḥ || stotuḥ | duroṇe | su-bhagasya | revat | sr̥prā | karasnā | dadhiṣe | vapūṁṣi ||3.18.5||

IAST: agniṁ hotāram pra vṛṇe miyedhe gṛtsaṁ kaviṁ viśvavidam amūram
Griffith: Aow, quick, sage, infallible, all-knowing, I choose to be our Priest at this oblation.
Devanāgarī: अग्निं होतारं प्र वृणे मियेधे गृत्सं कविं विश्वविदममूरम्
pada pāṭha: agnim | hotāram | pra | vr̥ṇe | miyedhe | gr̥tsam | kavim | viśva-vidam | amūram || saḥ | naḥ | yakṣat | deva-tātā | yajīyān | rāye | vājāya | vanate | maghāni ||3.19.1||

IAST: sa no yakṣad devatātā yajīyān rāye vājāya vanate maghāni
Griffith: In our Gods' service he, best skilled, shall worship: may he obtain us boons for strength and riches.
Devanāgarī: स नो यक्षद्देवताता यजीयान्राये वाजाय वनते मघानि
pada pāṭha: agnim | hotāram | pra | vr̥ṇe | miyedhe | gr̥tsam | kavim | viśva-vidam | amūram || saḥ | naḥ | yakṣat | deva-tātā | yajīyān | rāye | vājāya | vanate | maghāni ||3.19.1||

IAST: pra te agne haviṣmatīm iyarmy acchā sudyumnāṁ rātinīṁ ghṛtācīm
Griffith: Agni, to thee I lift the oil-fed ladle, bright, with an offering, bearing our oblation.
Devanāgarī: प्र ते अग्ने हविष्मतीमियर्म्यच्छा सुद्युम्नां रातिनीं घृताचीम्
pada pāṭha: pra | te | agne | haviṣmatīm | iyarmi | accha | su-dyumnām | rātinīm | ghr̥tācīm || pra-dakṣiṇit | deva-tātim | urāṇaḥ | sam | rāti-bhiḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | yajñam | aśret ||3.19.2||

IAST: pradakṣiṇid devatātim urāṇaḥ saṁ rātibhir vasubhir yajñam aśret
Griffith: From the right hand, choosing the Gods' attendance, he with rich presents hath arranged the worship.
Devanāgarī: प्रदक्षिणिद्देवतातिमुराणः सं रातिभिर्वसुभिर्यज्ञमश्रेत्
pada pāṭha: pra | te | agne | haviṣmatīm | iyarmi | accha | su-dyumnām | rātinīm | ghr̥tācīm || pra-dakṣiṇit | deva-tātim | urāṇaḥ | sam | rāti-bhiḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | yajñam | aśret ||3.19.2||

IAST: sa tejīyasā manasā tvota uta śikṣa svapatyasya śikṣoḥ
Griffith: Of keenest spirit is the man thou aidest give us good offspring, thou who givest freely.
Devanāgarī: स तेजीयसा मनसा त्वोत उत शिक्ष स्वपत्यस्य शिक्षोः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tejīyasā | manasā | tvā-ūtaḥ | uta | śikṣa | su-apatyasya | śikṣoḥ || agne | rāyaḥ | nr̥-tamasya | pra-bhūtau | bhūyāma | te | su-stutayaḥ | ca | vasvaḥ ||3.19.3||

IAST: agne rāyo nṛtamasya prabhūtau bhūyāma te suṣṭutayaś ca vasvaḥ
Griffith: In power of wealth most rich in men. O Agni, of thee, the Good, may we sing forth fair praises.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने रायो नृतमस्य प्रभूतौ भूयाम ते सुष्टुतयश्च वस्वः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tejīyasā | manasā | tvā-ūtaḥ | uta | śikṣa | su-apatyasya | śikṣoḥ || agne | rāyaḥ | nr̥-tamasya | pra-bhūtau | bhūyāma | te | su-stutayaḥ | ca | vasvaḥ ||3.19.3||

IAST: bhūrīṇi hi tve dadhire anīkāgne devasya yajyavo janāsaḥ
Griffith: Men as they worship thee the God, O Agni, have set on thee full many a brilliant, aspect.
Devanāgarī: भूरीणि हि त्वे दधिरे अनीकाग्ने देवस्य यज्यवो जनासः
pada pāṭha: bhūrīṇi | hi | tve iti | dadhire | anīkā | agne | devasya | yajyavaḥ | janāsaḥ || saḥ | ā | vaha | deva-tātim | yaviṣṭha | śardhaḥ | yat | adya | divyam | yajāsi ||3.19.4||

IAST: sa ā vaha devatātiṁ yaviṣṭha śardho yad adya divyaṁ yajāsi
Griffith: So bring Most Youthful One, the Gods' asserrigly, the Heavenly Host which thou to-day shalt honour.
Devanāgarī: स आ वह देवतातिं यविष्ठ शर्धो यदद्य दिव्यं यजासि
pada pāṭha: bhūrīṇi | hi | tve iti | dadhire | anīkā | agne | devasya | yajyavaḥ | janāsaḥ || saḥ | ā | vaha | deva-tātim | yaviṣṭha | śardhaḥ | yat | adya | divyam | yajāsi ||3.19.4||

IAST: yat tvā hotāram anajan miyedhe niṣādayanto yajathāya devāḥ
Griffith: When Gods anoint thee Priest at their oblation, and seat thee for thy task as Sacrificer,
Devanāgarī: यत्त्वा होतारमनजन्मियेधे निषादयन्तो यजथाय देवाः
pada pāṭha: yat | tvā | hotāram | anajan | miyedhe | ni-sādayantaḥ | yajathāya | devāḥ || saḥ | tvam | naḥ | agne | avitā | iha | bodhi | adhi | śravāṁsi | dhehi | naḥ | tanūṣu ||3.19.5||

IAST: sa tvaṁ no agne 'viteha bodhy adhi śravāṁsi dhehi nas tanūṣu
Griffith: O Agni, be thou here our kind defender, and to ourselves vouchsafe the gift of glory.
Devanāgarī: स त्वं नो अग्नेऽवितेह बोध्यधि श्रवांसि धेहि नस्तनूषु
pada pāṭha: yat | tvā | hotāram | anajan | miyedhe | ni-sādayantaḥ | yajathāya | devāḥ || saḥ | tvam | naḥ | agne | avitā | iha | bodhi | adhi | śravāṁsi | dhehi | naḥ | tanūṣu ||3.19.5||

IAST: agnim uṣasam aśvinā dadhikrāṁ vyuṣṭiṣu havate vahnir ukthaiḥ
Griffith: WITH lauds at break of morn the priest invoketh Agni, Dawn, Dadhikras, and both the Asvins.
Devanāgarī: अग्निमुषसमश्विना दधिक्रां व्युष्टिषु हवते वह्निरुक्थैः
pada pāṭha: agnim | uṣasam | aśvinā | dadhi-krām | vi-uṣṭiṣu | havate | vahniḥ | ukthaiḥ || su-jyotiṣaḥ | naḥ | śr̥ṇvantu | devāḥ | sa-joṣasaḥ | adhvaram | vāvaśānāḥ ||3.20.1||

IAST: sujyotiṣo naḥ śṛṇvantu devāḥ sajoṣaso adhvaraṁ vāvaśānāḥ
Griffith: With one consent the Gods whose light is splendid, longing to taste our sacrifice, shall hear us.
Devanāgarī: सुज्योतिषो नः शृण्वन्तु देवाः सजोषसो अध्वरं वावशानाः
pada pāṭha: agnim | uṣasam | aśvinā | dadhi-krām | vi-uṣṭiṣu | havate | vahniḥ | ukthaiḥ || su-jyotiṣaḥ | naḥ | śr̥ṇvantu | devāḥ | sa-joṣasaḥ | adhvaram | vāvaśānāḥ ||3.20.1||

IAST: agne trī te vājinā trī ṣadhasthā tisras te jihvā ṛtajāta pūrvīḥ
Griffith: Three are thy powers, O Agni, three thy stations, three are thy tongues, yea, many, Child of Order!
Devanāgarī: अग्ने त्री ते वाजिना त्री षधस्था तिस्रस्ते जिह्वा ऋतजात पूर्वीः
pada pāṭha: agne | trī | te | vājinā | trī | sadha-sthā | tisraḥ | te | jihvāḥ | r̥ta-jāta | pūrvīḥ || tisraḥ | ūm̐ iti | te | tanvaḥ | deva-vātāḥ | tābhiḥ | naḥ | pāhi | giraḥ | apra-yucchan ||3.20.2||

IAST: tisra u te tanvo devavātās tābhir naḥ pāhi giro aprayucchan
Griffith: Three bodies hast thou which the Gods delight in: with these protect our hymns with care unceasing.
Devanāgarī: तिस्र उ ते तन्वो देववातास्ताभिर्नः पाहि गिरो अप्रयुच्छन्
pada pāṭha: agne | trī | te | vājinā | trī | sadha-sthā | tisraḥ | te | jihvāḥ | r̥ta-jāta | pūrvīḥ || tisraḥ | ūm̐ iti | te | tanvaḥ | deva-vātāḥ | tābhiḥ | naḥ | pāhi | giraḥ | apra-yucchan ||3.20.2||

IAST: agne bhūrīṇi tava jātavedo deva svadhāvo 'mṛtasya nāma
Griffith: O Agni, many are the names thou bearest, immortal, God, Divine, and Jatavedas.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने भूरीणि तव जातवेदो देव स्वधावोऽमृतस्य नाम
pada pāṭha: agne | bhūrīṇi | tava | jāta-vedaḥ | deva | svadhā-vaḥ | amr̥tasya | nāma || yāḥ | ca | māyāḥ | māyinām | viśvam-inva | tve iti | pūrvīḥ | sam-dadhuḥ | pr̥ṣṭabandho iti pr̥ṣṭa-bandho ||3.20.3||

IAST: yāś ca māyā māyināṁ viśvaminva tve pūrvīḥ saṁdadhuḥ pṛṣṭabandho
Griffith: And many charms of charmers, All-Inspirer! have they laid in thee, Lord of true attendants!
Devanāgarī: याश्च माया मायिनां विश्वमिन्व त्वे पूर्वीः संदधुः पृष्टबन्धो
pada pāṭha: agne | bhūrīṇi | tava | jāta-vedaḥ | deva | svadhā-vaḥ | amr̥tasya | nāma || yāḥ | ca | māyāḥ | māyinām | viśvam-inva | tve iti | pūrvīḥ | sam-dadhuḥ | pr̥ṣṭabandho iti pr̥ṣṭa-bandho ||3.20.3||

IAST: agnir netā bhaga iva kṣitīnāṁ daivīnāṁ deva ṛtupā ṛtāvā
Griffith: Agni, like Bhaga, leads the godly people, he who is true to Law and guards the seasons.
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्नेता भग इव क्षितीनां दैवीनां देव ऋतुपा ऋतावा
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | netā | bhagaḥ-iva | kṣitīnām | daivīnām | devaḥ | r̥tu-pāḥ | r̥ta-vā || saḥ | vr̥tra-hā | sanayaḥ | viśva-vedāḥ | parṣat | viśvā | ati | duḥ-itā | gr̥ṇantam ||3.20.4||

IAST: sa vṛtrahā sanayo viśvavedāḥ parṣad viśvāti duritā gṛṇantam
Griffith: Ancient, all-knowing, he the Vrtra-slayer shall bear the singer safe through every trouble.
Devanāgarī: स वृत्रहा सनयो विश्ववेदाः पर्षद्विश्वाति दुरिता गृणन्तम्
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | netā | bhagaḥ-iva | kṣitīnām | daivīnām | devaḥ | r̥tu-pāḥ | r̥ta-vā || saḥ | vr̥tra-hā | sanayaḥ | viśva-vedāḥ | parṣat | viśvā | ati | duḥ-itā | gr̥ṇantam ||3.20.4||

IAST: dadhikrām agnim uṣasaṁ ca devīm bṛhaspatiṁ savitāraṁ ca devam
Griffith: I call on Savitar the God, on Morning, Brhaspati, and Dadhikras, and Agni,
Devanāgarī: दधिक्रामग्निमुषसं च देवीं बृहस्पतिं सवितारं च देवम्
pada pāṭha: dadhi-krām | agnim | uṣasam | ca | devīm | br̥haspatim | savitāram | ca | devam || aśvinā | mitrāvaruṇā | bhagam | ca | vasūn | rudrān | ādityān | iha | huve ||3.20.5||

IAST: aśvinā mitrāvaruṇā bhagaṁ ca vasūn rudrām̐ ādityām̐ iha huve
Griffith: On Varuna and Mitra, on the Asvins, Bhaga, the Vasus, Rudras and Adityas.
Devanāgarī: अश्विना मित्रावरुणा भगं च वसून्रुद्राँ आदित्याँ इह हुवे
pada pāṭha: dadhi-krām | agnim | uṣasam | ca | devīm | br̥haspatim | savitāram | ca | devam || aśvinā | mitrāvaruṇā | bhagam | ca | vasūn | rudrān | ādityān | iha | huve ||3.20.5||

IAST: imaṁ no yajñam amṛteṣu dhehīmā havyā jātavedo juṣasva
Griffith: SET this our sacrifice among the Immortals: be pleased with these our presents, Jatavedas.
Devanāgarī: इमं नो यज्ञममृतेषु धेहीमा हव्या जातवेदो जुषस्व
pada pāṭha: imam | naḥ | yajñam | amr̥teṣu | dhehi | īmā | havyā | jāta-vedaḥ | juṣasva || stokānām | agne | medasaḥ | ghr̥tasya | hotariti | pra | aśāna | prathamaḥ | ni-sadya ||3.21.1||

IAST: stokānām agne medaso ghṛtasya hotaḥ prāśāna prathamo niṣadya
Griffith: O Priest, O Agni, sit thee down before us, and first enjoy the drops of oil and fatness.
Devanāgarī: स्तोकानामग्ने मेदसो घृतस्य होतः प्राशान प्रथमो निषद्य
pada pāṭha: imam | naḥ | yajñam | amr̥teṣu | dhehi | īmā | havyā | jāta-vedaḥ | juṣasva || stokānām | agne | medasaḥ | ghr̥tasya | hotariti | pra | aśāna | prathamaḥ | ni-sadya ||3.21.1||

IAST: ghṛtavantaḥ pāvaka te stokāḥ ścotanti medasaḥ
Griffith: For thee, O Purifier, flow the drops of fatness rich in oil.
Devanāgarī: घृतवन्तः पावक ते स्तोकाः श्चोतन्ति मेदसः
pada pāṭha: ghr̥ta-vantaḥ | pāvaka | te | stokāḥ | ścotanti | medasaḥ || sva-dharman | deva-vītaye | śreṣṭham | naḥ | dhehi | vāryam ||3.21.2||

IAST: svadharman devavītaye śreṣṭhaṁ no dhehi vāryam
Griffith: After thy wont vouchsafe to us the choicest boon that Gods may feast.
Devanāgarī: स्वधर्मन्देववीतये श्रेष्ठं नो धेहि वार्यम्
pada pāṭha: ghr̥ta-vantaḥ | pāvaka | te | stokāḥ | ścotanti | medasaḥ || sva-dharman | deva-vītaye | śreṣṭham | naḥ | dhehi | vāryam ||3.21.2||

IAST: tubhyaṁ stokā ghṛtaścuto 'gne viprāya santya
Griffith: Agni, Most Excellent! for thee the Sage are drops that drip with oil.
Devanāgarī: तुभ्यं स्तोका घृतश्चुतोऽग्ने विप्राय सन्त्य
pada pāṭha: tubhyam | stokāḥ | ghr̥ta-ścutaḥ | agne | viprāya | santya || r̥ṣiḥ | śreṣṭhaḥ | sam | idhyase | yajñasya | pra-avitā | bhava ||3.21.3||

IAST: ṛṣiḥ śreṣṭhaḥ sam idhyase yajñasya prāvitā bhava
Griffith: Thou art enkindled as the best of Seers. Help thou the sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: ऋषिः श्रेष्ठः समिध्यसे यज्ञस्य प्राविता भव
pada pāṭha: tubhyam | stokāḥ | ghr̥ta-ścutaḥ | agne | viprāya | santya || r̥ṣiḥ | śreṣṭhaḥ | sam | idhyase | yajñasya | pra-avitā | bhava ||3.21.3||

IAST: tubhyaṁ ścotanty adhrigo śacīvaḥ stokāso agne medaso ghṛtasya
Griffith: To thee, O Agni, mighty and resistless, to thee stream forth the drops of oil and fatness.
Devanāgarī: तुभ्यं श्चोतन्त्यध्रिगो शचीवः स्तोकासो अग्ने मेदसो घृतस्य
pada pāṭha: tubhyam | ścotanti | adhrigo ityadhri-go | śacī-vaḥ | stokāsaḥ | agne | medasaḥ | ghr̥tasya || kavi-śastaḥ | br̥hatā | bhānunā | ā | agāḥ | havyā | juṣasva | medhira ||3.21.4||

IAST: kaviśasto bṛhatā bhānunāgā havyā juṣasva medhira
Griffith: With great light art thou come, O praised by poets! Accept our offering, O thou Sage.
Devanāgarī: कविशस्तो बृहता भानुनागा हव्या जुषस्व मेधिर
pada pāṭha: tubhyam | ścotanti | adhrigo ityadhri-go | śacī-vaḥ | stokāsaḥ | agne | medasaḥ | ghr̥tasya || kavi-śastaḥ | br̥hatā | bhānunā | ā | agāḥ | havyā | juṣasva | medhira ||3.21.4||

IAST: ojiṣṭhaṁ te madhyato meda udbhṛtam pra te vayaṁ dadāmahe
Griffith: Fatness exceeding rich, extracted from the midst,-this as our gift we offer thee.
Devanāgarī: ओजिष्ठं ते मध्यतो मेद उद्भृतं प्र ते वयं ददामहे
pada pāṭha: ojiṣṭham | te | madhyataḥ | medaḥ | ut-bhr̥tam | pra | te | vayam | dadāmahe || ścotanti | te | vaso iti | stokāḥ | adhi | tvaci | prati | tān | deva-śaḥ | vihi ||3.21.5||

IAST: ścotanti te vaso stokā adhi tvaci prati tān devaśo vihi
Griffith: Excellent God, the drops run down upon thy skin. Deal them to each among the Gods.
Devanāgarī: श्चोतन्ति ते वसो स्तोका अधि त्वचि प्रति तान्देवशो विहि
pada pāṭha: ojiṣṭham | te | madhyataḥ | medaḥ | ut-bhr̥tam | pra | te | vayam | dadāmahe || ścotanti | te | vaso iti | stokāḥ | adhi | tvaci | prati | tān | deva-śaḥ | vihi ||3.21.5||

IAST: ayaṁ so agnir yasmin somam indraḥ sutaṁ dadhe jaṭhare vāvaśānaḥ
Griffith: THIS is that Agni whence the longing Indra took the pressed Soma deep within his body.
Devanāgarī: अयं सो अग्निर्यस्मिन्सोममिन्द्रः सुतं दधे जठरे वावशानः
pada pāṭha: ayam | saḥ | agniḥ | yasmin | somam | indraḥ | sutam | dadhe | jaṭhare | vāvaśānaḥ || sahasriṇam | vājam | atyam | na | saptim | sasa-vān | san | stūyase | jāta-vedaḥ ||3.22.1||

IAST: sahasriṇaṁ vājam atyaṁ na saptiṁ sasavān san stūyase jātavedaḥ
Griffith: Winner of spoils in thousands, like a courser, with praise art thou exalted, Jatavedas.
Devanāgarī: सहस्रिणं वाजमत्यं न सप्तिं ससवान्सन्स्तूयसे जातवेदः
pada pāṭha: ayam | saḥ | agniḥ | yasmin | somam | indraḥ | sutam | dadhe | jaṭhare | vāvaśānaḥ || sahasriṇam | vājam | atyam | na | saptim | sasa-vān | san | stūyase | jāta-vedaḥ ||3.22.1||

IAST: agne yat te divi varcaḥ pṛthivyāṁ yad oṣadhīṣv apsv ā yajatra
Griffith: That light of thine in heaven and earth, O Agni, in plants, O Holy One, and in the waters,
Devanāgarī: अग्ने यत्ते दिवि वर्चः पृथिव्यां यदोषधीष्वप्स्वा यजत्र
pada pāṭha: agne | yat | te | divi | varcaḥ | pr̥thivyām | yat | oṣadhīṣu | ap-su | ā | yajatra || yena | antarikṣam | uru | ā-tatantha | tveṣaḥ | saḥ | bhānuḥ | arṇavaḥ | nr̥-cakṣāḥ ||3.22.2||

IAST: yenāntarikṣam urv ātatantha tveṣaḥ sa bhānur arṇavo nṛcakṣāḥ
Griffith: Wherewith thou hast spread wide the air's mid-region-bright is that splendour, wavy, man-beholding.
Devanāgarī: येनान्तरिक्षमुर्वाततन्थ त्वेषः स भानुरर्णवो नृचक्षाः
pada pāṭha: agne | yat | te | divi | varcaḥ | pr̥thivyām | yat | oṣadhīṣu | ap-su | ā | yajatra || yena | antarikṣam | uru | ā-tatantha | tveṣaḥ | saḥ | bhānuḥ | arṇavaḥ | nr̥-cakṣāḥ ||3.22.2||

IAST: agne divo arṇam acchā jigāsy acchā devām̐ ūciṣe dhiṣṇyā ye
Griffith: O Agni, to the sea of heaven thou goest: thou hast called hither Gods beheld in spirit.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने दिवो अर्णमच्छा जिगास्यच्छा देवाँ ऊचिषे धिष्ण्या ये
pada pāṭha: agne | divaḥ | arṇam | accha | jigāsi | accha | devān | ūciṣe | dhiṣṇyāḥ | ye || yāḥ | rocane | parastāt | sūryasya | yāḥ | ca | avastāt | upa-tiṣṭhante | āpaḥ ||3.22.3||

IAST: yā rocane parastāt sūryasya yāś cāvastād upatiṣṭhanta āpaḥ
Griffith: The waters, too, come hither, those up yonder in the Sun's realm of light, and those beneath it.
Devanāgarī: या रोचने परस्तात्सूर्यस्य याश्चावस्तादुपतिष्ठन्त आपः
pada pāṭha: agne | divaḥ | arṇam | accha | jigāsi | accha | devān | ūciṣe | dhiṣṇyāḥ | ye || yāḥ | rocane | parastāt | sūryasya | yāḥ | ca | avastāt | upa-tiṣṭhante | āpaḥ ||3.22.3||

IAST: purīṣyāso agnayaḥ prāvaṇebhiḥ sajoṣasaḥ
Griffith: Let fires that dwell in mist, combined with those that have their home in floods,
Devanāgarī: पुरीष्यासो अग्नयः प्रावणेभिः सजोषसः
pada pāṭha: purīṣyāsaḥ | agnayaḥ | pravaṇebhiḥ | sa-joṣasaḥ || juṣantām | yajñam | adruhaḥ | anamīvāḥ | iṣaḥ | mahīḥ ||3.22.4||

IAST: juṣantāṁ yajñam adruho 'namīvā iṣo mahīḥ
Griffith: Guileless accept our sacrifice, great viands free from all disease.
Devanāgarī: जुषन्तां यज्ञमद्रुहोऽनमीवा इषो महीः
pada pāṭha: purīṣyāsaḥ | agnayaḥ | pravaṇebhiḥ | sa-joṣasaḥ || juṣantām | yajñam | adruhaḥ | anamīvāḥ | iṣaḥ | mahīḥ ||3.22.4||

IAST: iḻām agne purudaṁsaṁ saniṁ goḥ śaśvattamaṁ havamānāya sādha
Griffith: Agni, as holy food to thine invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels.
Devanāgarī: इळामग्ने पुरुदंसं सनिं गोः शश्वत्तमं हवमानाय साध
pada pāṭha: iḷām | agne | puru-daṁsam | sanim | goḥ | śaśvat-tamam | havamānāya | sādha || syāt | naḥ | sūnuḥ | tanayaḥ | vijā-vā | agne | sā | te | su-matiḥ | bhūtu | asme iti ||3.22.5||

IAST: syān naḥ sūnus tanayo vijāvāgne sā te sumatir bhūtv asme
Griffith: To us be born a son and spreading offspring. Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward.
Devanāgarī: स्यान्नः सूनुस्तनयो विजावाग्ने सा ते सुमतिर्भूत्वस्मे
pada pāṭha: iḷām | agne | puru-daṁsam | sanim | goḥ | śaśvat-tamam | havamānāya | sādha || syāt | naḥ | sūnuḥ | tanayaḥ | vijā-vā | agne | sā | te | su-matiḥ | bhūtu | asme iti ||3.22.5||

IAST: nirmathitaḥ sudhita ā sadhasthe yuvā kavir adhvarasya praṇetā
Griffith: RUBBED into life, well stablished in the dwelling, Leader of sacrifice, the Sage, the youthful,
Devanāgarī: निर्मथितः सुधित आ सधस्थे युवा कविरध्वरस्य प्रणेता
pada pāṭha: niḥ-mathitaḥ | su-dhitaḥ | ā | sadha-sthe | yuvā | kaviḥ | adhvarasya | pra-netā || jūryat-su | agniḥ | ajaraḥ | vaneṣu | atra | dadhe | amr̥tam | jāta-vedāḥ ||3.23.1||

IAST: jūryatsv agnir ajaro vaneṣv atrā dadhe amṛtaṁ jātavedāḥ
Griffith: Here in the wasting fuel Jatavedas, eternal, hath assumed immortal being.
Devanāgarī: जूर्यत्स्वग्निरजरो वनेष्वत्रा दधे अमृतं जातवेदाः
pada pāṭha: niḥ-mathitaḥ | su-dhitaḥ | ā | sadha-sthe | yuvā | kaviḥ | adhvarasya | pra-netā || jūryat-su | agniḥ | ajaraḥ | vaneṣu | atra | dadhe | amr̥tam | jāta-vedāḥ ||3.23.1||

IAST: amanthiṣṭām bhāratā revad agniṁ devaśravā devavātaḥ sudakṣam
Griffith: Both Bharatas, Devasravas, Devavata, have strongly rubbed to life effectual Agni.
Devanāgarī: अमन्थिष्टां भारता रेवदग्निं देवश्रवा देववातः सुदक्षम्
pada pāṭha: amanthiṣṭām | bhāratā | revat | agnim | deva-śravāḥ | deva-vātaḥ | su-dakṣam || agne | vi | paśya | br̥hatā | abhi | rāyā | iṣām | naḥ | netā | bhavatāt | anu | dyūn ||3.23.2||

IAST: agne vi paśya bṛhatābhi rāyeṣāṁ no netā bhavatād anu dyūn
Griffith: O Agni, look thou forth with ample riches: be, every day, bearer of food to feed us.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने वि पश्य बृहताभि रायेषां नो नेता भवतादनु द्यून्
pada pāṭha: amanthiṣṭām | bhāratā | revat | agnim | deva-śravāḥ | deva-vātaḥ | su-dakṣam || agne | vi | paśya | br̥hatā | abhi | rāyā | iṣām | naḥ | netā | bhavatāt | anu | dyūn ||3.23.2||

IAST: daśa kṣipaḥ pūrvyaṁ sīm ajījanan sujātam mātṛṣu priyam
Griffith: Him nobly born of old the fingers ten produced, him whom his Mothers counted dear.
Devanāgarī: दश क्षिपः पूर्व्यं सीमजीजनन्सुजातं मातृषु प्रियम्
pada pāṭha: daśa | kṣipaḥ | pūrvyam | sīm | ajījanan | su-jātam | mātr̥ṣu | priyam || agnim | stuhi | daiva-vātam | deva-śravaḥ | yaḥ | janānām | asat | vaśī ||3.23.3||

IAST: agniṁ stuhi daivavātaṁ devaśravo yo janānām asad vaśī
Griffith: Praise Devavata's Agni, thou Devasravas, him who shall be the people's Lord.
Devanāgarī: अग्निं स्तुहि दैववातं देवश्रवो यो जनानामसद्वशी
pada pāṭha: daśa | kṣipaḥ | pūrvyam | sīm | ajījanan | su-jātam | mātr̥ṣu | priyam || agnim | stuhi | daiva-vātam | deva-śravaḥ | yaḥ | janānām | asat | vaśī ||3.23.3||

IAST: ni tvā dadhe vara ā pṛthivyā iḻāyās pade sudinatve ahnām
Griffith: He set thee in the earth's most lovely station, in Ila's place, in days of fair bright weather.
Devanāgarī: नि त्वा दधे वर आ पृथिव्या इळायास्पदे सुदिनत्वे अह्नाम्
pada pāṭha: ni | tvā | dadhe | vare | ā | pr̥thivyāḥ | iḷāyāḥ | pade | sudina-tve | ahnām || dr̥ṣat-vatyām | mānuṣe | āpayāyām | sarasvatyām | revat | agne | didīhi ||3.23.4||

IAST: dṛṣadvatyām mānuṣa āpayāyāṁ sarasvatyāṁ revad agne didīhi
Griffith: On man, on Apaya, Agni! on the rivers Drsadvati, Sarasvati, shine richly.
Devanāgarī: दृषद्वत्यां मानुष आपयायां सरस्वत्यां रेवदग्ने दिदीहि
pada pāṭha: ni | tvā | dadhe | vare | ā | pr̥thivyāḥ | iḷāyāḥ | pade | sudina-tve | ahnām || dr̥ṣat-vatyām | mānuṣe | āpayāyām | sarasvatyām | revat | agne | didīhi ||3.23.4||

IAST: iḻām agne purudaṁsaṁ saniṁ goḥ śaśvattamaṁ havamānāya sādha
Griffith: Agni, as holy food to thine invoker give wealth in cattle, lasting, rich in marvels.
Devanāgarī: इळामग्ने पुरुदंसं सनिं गोः शश्वत्तमं हवमानाय साध
pada pāṭha: iḷām | agne | puru-daṁsam | sanim | goḥ | śaśvat-tamam | havamānāya | sādha || syāt | naḥ | sūnuḥ | tanayaḥ | vijā-vā | agne | sā | te | su-matiḥ | bhūtu | asme iti ||3.23.5||

IAST: syān naḥ sūnus tanayo vijāvāgne sā te sumatir bhūtv asme
Griffith: To us be born a son and spreading offspring Agni, be this thy gracious will to us-ward
Devanāgarī: स्यान्नः सूनुस्तनयो विजावाग्ने सा ते सुमतिर्भूत्वस्मे
pada pāṭha: iḷām | agne | puru-daṁsam | sanim | goḥ | śaśvat-tamam | havamānāya | sādha || syāt | naḥ | sūnuḥ | tanayaḥ | vijā-vā | agne | sā | te | su-matiḥ | bhūtu | asme iti ||3.23.5||

IAST: agne sahasva pṛtanā abhimātīr apāsya
Griffith: AGNI, subdue opposing bands, and drive our enemies away.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने सहस्व पृतना अभिमातीरपास्य
pada pāṭha: agne | sahasva | pr̥tanāḥ | abhi-mātīḥ | apa | asya || dustaraḥ | taran | arātīḥ | varcaḥ | dhāḥ | yajña-vāhase ||3.24.1||

IAST: duṣṭaras tarann arātīr varco dhā yajñavāhase
Griffith: Invincible, slay godless foes: give splendour to the worshipper.
Devanāgarī: दुष्टरस्तरन्नरातीर्वर्चो धा यज्ञवाहसे
pada pāṭha: agne | sahasva | pr̥tanāḥ | abhi-mātīḥ | apa | asya || dustaraḥ | taran | arātīḥ | varcaḥ | dhāḥ | yajña-vāhase ||3.24.1||

IAST: agna iḻā sam idhyase vītihotro amartyaḥ
Griffith: Lit with libation, Agni, thou, deathless, who callest Gods to feast,
Devanāgarī: अग्न इळा समिध्यसे वीतिहोत्रो अमर्त्यः
pada pāṭha: agne | iḷā | sam | idhyase | vīti-hotraḥ | amartyaḥ || juṣasva | su | naḥ | adhvaram ||3.24.2||

IAST: juṣasva sū no adhvaram
Griffith: Accept our sacrifice with joy.
Devanāgarī: जुषस्व सू नो अध्वरम्
pada pāṭha: agne | iḷā | sam | idhyase | vīti-hotraḥ | amartyaḥ || juṣasva | su | naḥ | adhvaram ||3.24.2||

IAST: agne dyumnena jāgṛve sahasaḥ sūnav āhuta
Griffith: With splendour, Agni, Son of Strength, thou who art worshipped, wakeful One.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने द्युम्नेन जागृवे सहसः सूनवाहुत
pada pāṭha: agne | dyumnena | jāgr̥ve | sahasaḥ | sūno iti | ā-huta || ā | idam | barhiḥ | sadaḥ | mama ||3.24.3||

IAST: edam barhiḥ sado mama
