Griffith: Seat thee on this my sacred grass.
Devanāgarī: एदं बर्हिः सदो मम
pada pāṭha: agne | dyumnena | jāgr̥ve | sahasaḥ | sūno iti | ā-huta || ā | idam | barhiḥ | sadaḥ | mama ||3.24.3||

IAST: agne viśvebhir agnibhir devebhir mahayā giraḥ
Griffith: With all thy fires, with all the Gods, Agni, exalt the songs we sing.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने विश्वेभिरग्निभिर्देवेभिर्महया गिरः
pada pāṭha: agne | viśvebhiḥ | agni-bhiḥ | devebhiḥ | mahaya | giraḥ || yajñeṣu | ye | ūm̐ iti | cāyavaḥ ||3.24.4||

IAST: yajñeṣu ya u cāyavaḥ
Griffith: And living men in holy rites.
Devanāgarī: यज्ञेषु य उ चायवः
pada pāṭha: agne | viśvebhiḥ | agni-bhiḥ | devebhiḥ | mahaya | giraḥ || yajñeṣu | ye | ūm̐ iti | cāyavaḥ ||3.24.4||

IAST: agne dā dāśuṣe rayiṁ vīravantam parīṇasam
Griffith: Grant, Agni, to the worshipper wealth rich in heroes, plenteous store,
Devanāgarī: अग्ने दा दाशुषे रयिं वीरवन्तं परीणसम्
pada pāṭha: agne | dāḥ | dāśuṣe | rayim | vīra-vantam | parīṇasam || śiśīhi | naḥ | sūnu-mataḥ ||3.24.5||

IAST: śiśīhi naḥ sūnumataḥ
Griffith: Make thou us rich with many sons.
Devanāgarī: शिशीहि नः सूनुमतः
pada pāṭha: agne | dāḥ | dāśuṣe | rayim | vīra-vantam | parīṇasam || śiśīhi | naḥ | sūnu-mataḥ ||3.24.5||

IAST: agne divaḥ sūnur asi pracetās tanā pṛthivyā uta viśvavedāḥ
Griffith: THOU art the sapient Son of Dyaus, O Agni, yes and the Child of Earth, who knowest all things.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने दिवः सूनुरसि प्रचेतास्तना पृथिव्या उत विश्ववेदाः
pada pāṭha: agne | divaḥ | sūnuḥ | asi | pra-cetāḥ | tanā | pr̥thivyāḥ | uta | viśva-vedāḥ || r̥dhak | devān | iha | yaja | cikitvaḥ ||3.25.1||

IAST: ṛdhag devām̐ iha yajā cikitvaḥ
Griffith: Bring the Gods specially, thou Sage, for worship.
Devanāgarī: ऋधग्देवाँ इह यजा चिकित्वः
pada pāṭha: agne | divaḥ | sūnuḥ | asi | pra-cetāḥ | tanā | pr̥thivyāḥ | uta | viśva-vedāḥ || r̥dhak | devān | iha | yaja | cikitvaḥ ||3.25.1||

IAST: agniḥ sanoti vīryāṇi vidvān sanoti vājam amṛtāya bhūṣan
Griffith: Agni the wise bestows the might of heroes grants strengthening food, preparing it for nectar.
Devanāgarī: अग्निः सनोति वीर्याणि विद्वान्सनोति वाजममृताय भूषन्
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | sanoti | vīryāṇi | vidvān | sanoti | vājam | amr̥tāya | bhūṣan || saḥ | naḥ | devān | ā | iha | vaha | purukṣo iti puru-kṣo ||3.25.2||

IAST: sa no devām̐ eha vahā purukṣo
Griffith: Thou who art rich in food bring the Gods hither.
Devanāgarī: स नो देवाँ एह वहा पुरुक्षो
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | sanoti | vīryāṇi | vidvān | sanoti | vājam | amr̥tāya | bhūṣan || saḥ | naḥ | devān | ā | iha | vaha | purukṣo iti puru-kṣo ||3.25.2||

IAST: agnir dyāvāpṛthivī viśvajanye ā bhāti devī amṛte amūraḥ
Griffith: Agni, infallible, lights Earth and Heaven, immortal Goddesses gracious to all men,-
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्द्यावापृथिवी विश्वजन्ये आ भाति देवी अमृते अमूरः
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | viśvajanye iti viśva-janye | ā | bhāti | devī iti | amr̥te iti | amūraḥ || kṣayan | vājaiḥ | puru-candraḥ | namaḥ-bhiḥ ||3.25.3||

IAST: kṣayan vājaiḥ puruścandro namobhiḥ
Griffith: Lord through his strength, splendid through adorations.
Devanāgarī: क्षयन्वाजैः पुरुश्चन्द्रो नमोभिः
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | viśvajanye iti viśva-janye | ā | bhāti | devī iti | amr̥te iti | amūraḥ || kṣayan | vājaiḥ | puru-candraḥ | namaḥ-bhiḥ ||3.25.3||

IAST: agna indraś ca dāśuṣo duroṇe sutāvato yajñam ihopa yātam
Griffith: Come to the sacrifice, Agni and Indra come to the offerer's house who hath the Soma.
Devanāgarī: अग्न इन्द्रश्च दाशुषो दुरोणे सुतावतो यज्ञमिहोप यातम्
pada pāṭha: agne | indraḥ | ca | dāśuṣaḥ | duroṇe | suta-vataḥ | yajñam | iha | upa | yātam || amardhantā | soma-peyāya | devā ||3.25.4||

IAST: amardhantā somapeyāya devā
Griffith: Come, friendly-minded, Gods, to drink the Soma.
Devanāgarī: अमर्धन्ता सोमपेयाय देवा
pada pāṭha: agne | indraḥ | ca | dāśuṣaḥ | duroṇe | suta-vataḥ | yajñam | iha | upa | yātam || amardhantā | soma-peyāya | devā ||3.25.4||

IAST: agne apāṁ sam idhyase duroṇe nityaḥ sūno sahaso jātavedaḥ
Griffith: In the floods' home art thou enkindled, Agni, O Jatavedas, Son of Strength, eternal,
Devanāgarī: अग्ने अपां समिध्यसे दुरोणे नित्यः सूनो सहसो जातवेदः
pada pāṭha: agne | apām | sam | idhyase | duroṇe | nityaḥ | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | jāta-vedaḥ || sadha-sthāni | mahayamānaḥ | ūtī ||3.25.5||

IAST: sadhasthāni mahayamāna ūtī
Griffith: Exalting with thine help the gatheringplaces.
Devanāgarī: सधस्थानि महयमान ऊती
pada pāṭha: agne | apām | sam | idhyase | duroṇe | nityaḥ | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | jāta-vedaḥ || sadha-sthāni | mahayamānaḥ | ūtī ||3.25.5||

IAST: vaiśvānaram manasāgniṁ nicāyyā haviṣmanto anuṣatyaṁ svarvidam
Griffith: REVERING in our heart Agni Vaisvanara, the finder of the light, whose promises are true,
Devanāgarī: वैश्वानरं मनसाग्निं निचाय्या हविष्मन्तो अनुषत्यं स्वर्विदम्
pada pāṭha: vaiśvānaram | manasā | agnim | ni-cāyya | haviṣmantaḥ | anu-satyam | svaḥ-vidam || su-dānum | devam | rathiram | vasu-yavaḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | raṇvam | kuśikāsaḥ | havāmahe ||3.26.1||

IAST: sudānuṁ devaṁ rathiraṁ vasūyavo gīrbhī raṇvaṁ kuśikāso havāmahe
Griffith: The liberal, gladsome, car-borne God we Kusikas invoke him with oblation, seeking wealth with songs.
Devanāgarī: सुदानुं देवं रथिरं वसूयवो गीर्भी रण्वं कुशिकासो हवामहे
pada pāṭha: vaiśvānaram | manasā | agnim | ni-cāyya | haviṣmantaḥ | anu-satyam | svaḥ-vidam || su-dānum | devam | rathiram | vasu-yavaḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | raṇvam | kuśikāsaḥ | havāmahe ||3.26.1||

IAST: taṁ śubhram agnim avase havāmahe vaiśvānaram mātariśvānam ukthyam
Griffith: That Agni, bright, Vaisvanara, we invoke for help, and Matarisvan worthy of the song of praise;
Devanāgarī: तं शुभ्रमग्निमवसे हवामहे वैश्वानरं मातरिश्वानमुक्थ्यम्
pada pāṭha: tam | śubhram | agnim | avase | havāmahe | vaiśvānaram | mātariśvānam | ukthyam || br̥haspatim | manuṣaḥ | deva-tātaye | vipram | śrotāram | atithim | raghu-syadam ||3.26.2||

IAST: bṛhaspatim manuṣo devatātaye vipraṁ śrotāram atithiṁ raghuṣyadam
Griffith: Brhaspati for man's observance of the Gods, the Singer prompt to hear, the swiftly-moving guest.
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पतिं मनुषो देवतातये विप्रं श्रोतारमतिथिं रघुष्यदम्
pada pāṭha: tam | śubhram | agnim | avase | havāmahe | vaiśvānaram | mātariśvānam | ukthyam || br̥haspatim | manuṣaḥ | deva-tātaye | vipram | śrotāram | atithim | raghu-syadam ||3.26.2||

IAST: aśvo na krandañ janibhiḥ sam idhyate vaiśvānaraḥ kuśikebhir yuge-yuge
Griffith: Age after age Vaisvanara, neighing like a horse, is kindled with the women by the Kusikas.
Devanāgarī: अश्वो न क्रन्दञ्जनिभिः समिध्यते वैश्वानरः कुशिकेभिर्युगेयुगे
pada pāṭha: aśvaḥ | na | krandan | jani-bhiḥ | sam | idhyate | vaiśvānaraḥ | kuśikebhiḥ | yuge-yuge || saḥ | naḥ | agniḥ | su-vīryam | su-aśvyam | dadhātu | ratnam | amr̥teṣu | jāgr̥viḥ ||3.26.3||

IAST: sa no agniḥ suvīryaṁ svaśvyaṁ dadhātu ratnam amṛteṣu jāgṛviḥ
Griffith: May Agni, he who wakes among Immortal Gods, grant us heroic strength and wealth in noble steeds.
Devanāgarī: स नो अग्निः सुवीर्यं स्वश्व्यं दधातु रत्नममृतेषु जागृविः
pada pāṭha: aśvaḥ | na | krandan | jani-bhiḥ | sam | idhyate | vaiśvānaraḥ | kuśikebhiḥ | yuge-yuge || saḥ | naḥ | agniḥ | su-vīryam | su-aśvyam | dadhātu | ratnam | amr̥teṣu | jāgr̥viḥ ||3.26.3||

IAST: pra yantu vājās taviṣībhir agnayaḥ śubhe sammiślāḥ pṛṣatīr ayukṣata
Griffith: Let them go forth, the strong, as flames of fire with might. Gathered for victory they have yoked their spotted deer.
Devanāgarī: प्र यन्तु वाजास्तविषीभिरग्नयः शुभे सम्मिश्लाः पृषतीरयुक्षत
pada pāṭha: pra | yantu | vājāḥ | taviṣībhiḥ | agnayaḥ | śubhe | sam-miślāḥ | pr̥ṣatīḥ | ayukṣata || br̥hat-ukṣaḥ | marutaḥ | viśva-vedasaḥ | pra | vepayanti | parvatān | adābhyāḥ ||3.26.4||

IAST: bṛhadukṣo maruto viśvavedasaḥ pra vepayanti parvatām̐ adābhyāḥ
Griffith: Pourers of floods, the Maruts, Masters of all wealth, they who can ne'er be conquered, make the mountains shake.
Devanāgarī: बृहदुक्षो मरुतो विश्ववेदसः प्र वेपयन्ति पर्वताँ अदाभ्याः
pada pāṭha: pra | yantu | vājāḥ | taviṣībhiḥ | agnayaḥ | śubhe | sam-miślāḥ | pr̥ṣatīḥ | ayukṣata || br̥hat-ukṣaḥ | marutaḥ | viśva-vedasaḥ | pra | vepayanti | parvatān | adābhyāḥ ||3.26.4||

IAST: agniśriyo maruto viśvakṛṣṭaya ā tveṣam ugram ava īmahe vayam
Griffith: The Maruts, Friends of men, are glorious as the fire: their mighty and resplendent succour we implore.
Devanāgarī: अग्निश्रियो मरुतो विश्वकृष्टय आ त्वेषमुग्रमव ईमहे वयम्
pada pāṭha: agni-śriyaḥ | marutaḥ | viśva-kr̥ṣṭayaḥ | ā | tveṣam | ugram | avaḥ | īmahe | vayam || te | svāninaḥ | rudriyāḥ | varṣa-nirnijaḥ | siṁhāḥ | na | heṣa-kratavaḥ | su-dānavaḥ ||3.26.5||

IAST: te svānino rudriyā varṣanirṇijaḥ siṁhā na heṣakratavaḥ sudānavaḥ
Griffith: Those storming Sons of Rudra clothed in robes of rain, boon-givers of good gifts, roar as the lions roar.
Devanāgarī: ते स्वानिनो रुद्रिया वर्षनिर्णिजः सिंहा न हेषक्रतवः सुदानवः
pada pāṭha: agni-śriyaḥ | marutaḥ | viśva-kr̥ṣṭayaḥ | ā | tveṣam | ugram | avaḥ | īmahe | vayam || te | svāninaḥ | rudriyāḥ | varṣa-nirnijaḥ | siṁhāḥ | na | heṣa-kratavaḥ | su-dānavaḥ ||3.26.5||

IAST: vrātaṁ-vrātaṁ gaṇaṁ-gaṇaṁ suśastibhir agner bhāmam marutām oja īmahe
Griffith: We, band on band and troop following troop, entreat with fair lauds Agni's splendour and the Maruts' might,
Devanāgarī: व्रातंव्रातं गणंगणं सुशस्तिभिरग्नेर्भामं मरुतामोज ईमहे
pada pāṭha: vrātam-vrātam | gaṇam-gaṇam | suśasti-bhiḥ | agneḥ | bhāmam | marutām | ojaḥ | īmahe || pr̥ṣat-aśvāsaḥ | anavabhra-rādhasaḥ | gantāraḥ | yajñam | vidatheṣu | dhīrāḥ ||3.26.6||

IAST: pṛṣadaśvāso anavabhrarādhaso gantāro yajñaṁ vidatheṣu dhīrāḥ
Griffith: With spotted deer for steeds, with wealth that never fails, they, wise Ones, come to sacrifice at our gatherings.
Devanāgarī: पृषदश्वासो अनवभ्रराधसो गन्तारो यज्ञं विदथेषु धीराः
pada pāṭha: vrātam-vrātam | gaṇam-gaṇam | suśasti-bhiḥ | agneḥ | bhāmam | marutām | ojaḥ | īmahe || pr̥ṣat-aśvāsaḥ | anavabhra-rādhasaḥ | gantāraḥ | yajñam | vidatheṣu | dhīrāḥ ||3.26.6||

IAST: agnir asmi janmanā jātavedā ghṛtam me cakṣur amṛtam ma āsan
Griffith: Agni am I who know, by birth, all creatures. Mine eye is butter, in my mouth is nectar.
Devanāgarī: अग्निरस्मि जन्मना जातवेदा घृतं मे चक्षुरमृतं म आसन्
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | asmi | janmanā | jāta-vedāḥ | ghr̥tam | me | cakṣuḥ | amr̥tam | me | āsan || arkaḥ | tri-dhātuḥ | rajasaḥ | vi-mānaḥ | ajasraḥ | gharmaḥ | haviḥ | asmi | nāma ||3.26.7||

IAST: arkas tridhātū rajaso vimāno 'jasro gharmo havir asmi nāma
Griffith: I am light threefold, measurer of the region exhaustless heat am I, named burnt-oblation.
Devanāgarī: अर्कस्त्रिधातू रजसो विमानोऽजस्रो घर्मो हविरस्मि नाम
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | asmi | janmanā | jāta-vedāḥ | ghr̥tam | me | cakṣuḥ | amr̥tam | me | āsan || arkaḥ | tri-dhātuḥ | rajasaḥ | vi-mānaḥ | ajasraḥ | gharmaḥ | haviḥ | asmi | nāma ||3.26.7||

IAST: tribhiḥ pavitrair apupod dhy arkaṁ hṛdā matiṁ jyotir anu prajānan
Griffith: Bearing in mind a thought with light accordant, he purified the Sun with three refinings;
Devanāgarī: त्रिभिः पवित्रैरपुपोद्ध्यर्कं हृदा मतिं ज्योतिरनु प्रजानन्
pada pāṭha: tri-bhiḥ | pavitraiḥ | apupot | hi | arkam | hr̥dā | matim | jyotiḥ | anu | pra-jānan || varṣiṣṭham | ratnam | akr̥ta | svadhābhiḥ | āt | it | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | pari | apaśyat ||3.26.8||

IAST: varṣiṣṭhaṁ ratnam akṛta svadhābhir ād id dyāvāpṛthivī pary apaśyat
Griffith: By his own nature gained the highest treasure, and looked abroad over the earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: वर्षिष्ठं रत्नमकृत स्वधाभिरादिद्द्यावापृथिवी पर्यपश्यत्
pada pāṭha: tri-bhiḥ | pavitraiḥ | apupot | hi | arkam | hr̥dā | matim | jyotiḥ | anu | pra-jānan || varṣiṣṭham | ratnam | akr̥ta | svadhābhiḥ | āt | it | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | pari | apaśyat ||3.26.8||

IAST: śatadhāram utsam akṣīyamāṇaṁ vipaścitam pitaraṁ vaktvānām
Griffith: The Spring that fails not with a hundred streamlets, Father inspired of' prayers that men should utter,
Devanāgarī: शतधारमुत्समक्षीयमाणं विपश्चितं पितरं वक्त्वानाम्
pada pāṭha: śata-dhāram | utsam | akṣīyamāṇam | vipaḥ-citam | pitaram | vaktvānām || meḷim | madantam | pitroḥ | upa-sthe | tam | rodasī iti | pipr̥tam | satya-vācam ||3.26.9||

IAST: meḻim madantam pitror upasthe taṁ rodasī pipṛtaṁ satyavācam
Griffith: The Sparkler, joyous in his Parents' bosorn, -him, the Truth-speaker, sate ye, Earth and Heaven.
Devanāgarī: मेळिं मदन्तं पित्रोरुपस्थे तं रोदसी पिपृतं सत्यवाचम्
pada pāṭha: śata-dhāram | utsam | akṣīyamāṇam | vipaḥ-citam | pitaram | vaktvānām || meḷim | madantam | pitroḥ | upa-sthe | tam | rodasī iti | pipr̥tam | satya-vācam ||3.26.9||

IAST: pra vo vājā abhidyavo haviṣmanto ghṛtācyā
Griffith: IN ladle dropping oil your food goes in oblation up to heaven,
Devanāgarī: प्र वो वाजा अभिद्यवो हविष्मन्तो घृताच्या
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | vājāḥ | abhi-dyavaḥ | haviṣmantaḥ | ghr̥tācyā || devān | jigāti | sumnayuḥ ||3.27.1||

IAST: devāñ jigāti sumnayuḥ
Griffith: Goes to the Gods in search of bliss.
Devanāgarī: देवाञ्जिगाति सुम्नयुः
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | vājāḥ | abhi-dyavaḥ | haviṣmantaḥ | ghr̥tācyā || devān | jigāti | sumnayuḥ ||3.27.1||

IAST: īḻe agniṁ vipaścitaṁ girā yajñasya sādhanam
Griffith: Agni I laud, the Sage inspired, crowner of sacrifice through song,
Devanāgarī: ईळे अग्निं विपश्चितं गिरा यज्ञस्य साधनम्
pada pāṭha: īḷe | agnim | vipaḥ-citam | girā | yajñasya | sādhanam || śruṣṭī-vānam | dhita-vānam ||3.27.2||

IAST: śruṣṭīvānaṁ dhitāvānam
Griffith: Who listens and gives bounteous gifts.
Devanāgarī: श्रुष्टीवानं धितावानम्
pada pāṭha: īḷe | agnim | vipaḥ-citam | girā | yajñasya | sādhanam || śruṣṭī-vānam | dhita-vānam ||3.27.2||

IAST: agne śakema te vayaṁ yamaṁ devasya vājinaḥ
Griffith: O Agni, if we might obtain control of thee the potent God,
Devanāgarī: अग्ने शकेम ते वयं यमं देवस्य वाजिनः
pada pāṭha: agne | śakema | te | vayam | yamam | devasya | vājinaḥ || ati | dveṣāṁsi | tarema ||3.27.3||

IAST: ati dveṣāṁsi tarema
Griffith: Then should we overcome our foes.
Devanāgarī: अति द्वेषांसि तरेम
pada pāṭha: agne | śakema | te | vayam | yamam | devasya | vājinaḥ || ati | dveṣāṁsi | tarema ||3.27.3||

IAST: samidhyamāno adhvare 'gniḥ pāvaka īḍyaḥ
Griffith: Kindled at sacrifices he is Agni, hallower, meet for praise,
Devanāgarī: समिध्यमानो अध्वरेऽग्निः पावक ईड्यः
pada pāṭha: sam-idhyamānaḥ | adhvare | agniḥ | pāvakaḥ | īḍyaḥ || śociḥ-keśaḥ | tam | īmahe ||3.27.4||

IAST: śociṣkeśas tam īmahe
Griffith: With flame for hair: to him we seek.
Devanāgarī: शोचिष्केशस्तमीमहे
pada pāṭha: sam-idhyamānaḥ | adhvare | agniḥ | pāvakaḥ | īḍyaḥ || śociḥ-keśaḥ | tam | īmahe ||3.27.4||

IAST: pṛthupājā amartyo ghṛtanirṇik svāhutaḥ
Griffith: Immortal Agni, shining far, enrobed with oil, well worshipped, bears
Devanāgarī: पृथुपाजा अमर्त्यो घृतनिर्णिक्स्वाहुतः
pada pāṭha: pr̥thu-pājāḥ | amartyaḥ | ghr̥ta-nirnik | su-āhutaḥ || agniḥ | yajñasya | havya-vāṭ ||3.27.5||

IAST: agnir yajñasya havyavāṭ
Griffith: The gifts of sacrifice away.
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्यज्ञस्य हव्यवाट्
pada pāṭha: pr̥thu-pājāḥ | amartyaḥ | ghr̥ta-nirnik | su-āhutaḥ || agniḥ | yajñasya | havya-vāṭ ||3.27.5||

IAST: taṁ sabādho yatasruca itthā dhiyā yajñavantaḥ
Griffith: The priests with ladles lifted up, worshipping here with holy thought,
Devanāgarī: तं सबाधो यतस्रुच इत्था धिया यज्ञवन्तः
pada pāṭha: tam | sa-bādhaḥ | yata-srucaḥ | itthā | dhiyā | yajña-vantaḥ || ā | cakruḥ | agnim | ūtaye ||3.27.6||

IAST: ā cakrur agnim ūtaye
Griffith: Have brought this Agni for our aid.
Devanāgarī: आ चक्रुरग्निमूतये
pada pāṭha: tam | sa-bādhaḥ | yata-srucaḥ | itthā | dhiyā | yajña-vantaḥ || ā | cakruḥ | agnim | ūtaye ||3.27.6||

IAST: hotā devo amartyaḥ purastād eti māyayā
Griffith: Immortal, Sacrificer, God, with wondrous power he leads the way,
Devanāgarī: होता देवो अमर्त्यः पुरस्तादेति मायया
pada pāṭha: hotā | devaḥ | amartyaḥ | purastāt | eti | māyayā || vidathāni | pra-codayan ||3.27.7||

IAST: vidathāni pracodayan
Griffith: Urging the great assembly on.
Devanāgarī: विदथानि प्रचोदयन्
pada pāṭha: hotā | devaḥ | amartyaḥ | purastāt | eti | māyayā || vidathāni | pra-codayan ||3.27.7||

IAST: vājī vājeṣu dhīyate 'dhvareṣu pra ṇīyate
Griffith: Strong, he is set on deeds ofstrength. In sacrifices led in front,
Devanāgarī: वाजी वाजेषु धीयतेऽध्वरेषु प्र णीयते
pada pāṭha: vājī | vājeṣu | dhīyate | adhvareṣu | pra | nīyate || vipraḥ | yajñasya | sādhanaḥ ||3.27.8||

IAST: vipro yajñasya sādhanaḥ
Griffith: As Singer he completes the rite.
Devanāgarī: विप्रो यज्ञस्य साधनः
pada pāṭha: vājī | vājeṣu | dhīyate | adhvareṣu | pra | nīyate || vipraḥ | yajñasya | sādhanaḥ ||3.27.8||

IAST: dhiyā cakre vareṇyo bhūtānāṁ garbham ā dadhe
Griffith: Excellent, he was made by thought. The Germ of beings have I gained,
Devanāgarī: धिया चक्रे वरेण्यो भूतानां गर्भमा दधे
pada pāṭha: dhiyā | cakre | vareṇyaḥ | bhūtānām | garbham | ā | dadhe || dakṣasya | pitaram | tanā ||3.27.9||

IAST: dakṣasya pitaraṁ tanā
Griffith: Yea, and die Sire of active strength.
Devanāgarī: दक्षस्य पितरं तना
pada pāṭha: dhiyā | cakre | vareṇyaḥ | bhūtānām | garbham | ā | dadhe || dakṣasya | pitaram | tanā ||3.27.9||

IAST: ni tvā dadhe vareṇyaṁ dakṣasyeḻā sahaskṛta
Griffith: Thee have I stablished, Excellent, O strengthened by the sage's prayer,
Devanāgarī: नि त्वा दधे वरेण्यं दक्षस्येळा सहस्कृत
pada pāṭha: ni | tvā | dadhe | vareṇyam | dakṣasya | iḷā | sahaḥ-kr̥ta || agne | su-dītim | uśijam ||3.27.10||

IAST: agne sudītim uśijam
Griffith: Thee, Agni, longing, nobly bright.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने सुदीतिमुशिजम्
pada pāṭha: ni | tvā | dadhe | vareṇyam | dakṣasya | iḷā | sahaḥ-kr̥ta || agne | su-dītim | uśijam ||3.27.10||

IAST: agniṁ yanturam apturam ṛtasya yoge vanuṣaḥ
Griffith: Agni, the swift and active One, singers, at time of sacrifice,
Devanāgarī: अग्निं यन्तुरमप्तुरमृतस्य योगे वनुषः
pada pāṭha: agnim | yanturam | ap-turam | r̥tasya | yoge | vanuṣaḥ || viprāḥ | vājaiḥ | sam | indhate ||3.27.11||

IAST: viprā vājaiḥ sam indhate
Griffith: Eagerly kindle with their food.
Devanāgarī: विप्रा वाजैः समिन्धते
pada pāṭha: agnim | yanturam | ap-turam | r̥tasya | yoge | vanuṣaḥ || viprāḥ | vājaiḥ | sam | indhate ||3.27.11||

IAST: ūrjo napātam adhvare dīdivāṁsam upa dyavi
Griffith: Agni the Son of Strength who shines up to the heaven in solemn rites,
Devanāgarī: ऊर्जो नपातमध्वरे दीदिवांसमुप द्यवि
pada pāṭha: ūrjaḥ | napātam | adhvare | dīdi-vāṁsam | upa | dyavi || agnim | īḷe | kavi-kratum ||3.27.12||

IAST: agnim īḻe kavikratum
Griffith: The wise of heart, I glorify.
Devanāgarī: अग्निमीळे कविक्रतुम्
pada pāṭha: ūrjaḥ | napātam | adhvare | dīdi-vāṁsam | upa | dyavi || agnim | īḷe | kavi-kratum ||3.27.12||

IAST: īḻenyo namasyas tiras tamāṁsi darśataḥ
Griffith: Meet to be lauded and adored, showing in beauty through the dark,
Devanāgarī: ईळेन्यो नमस्यस्तिरस्तमांसि दर्शतः
pada pāṭha: īḷenyaḥ | namasyaḥ | tiraḥ | tamāṁsi | darśataḥ || sam | agniḥ | idhyate | vr̥ṣā ||3.27.13||

IAST: sam agnir idhyate vṛṣā
Griffith: Agni, the Strong, is kindled well.
Devanāgarī: समग्निरिध्यते वृषा
pada pāṭha: īḷenyaḥ | namasyaḥ | tiraḥ | tamāṁsi | darśataḥ || sam | agniḥ | idhyate | vr̥ṣā ||3.27.13||

IAST: vṛṣo agniḥ sam idhyate 'śvo na devavāhanaḥ
Griffith: Agni is kindled as a bull, like a horsebearer of the Gods:
Devanāgarī: वृषो अग्निः समिध्यतेऽश्वो न देववाहनः
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣo iti | agniḥ | sam | idhyate | aśvaḥ | na | deva-vāhanaḥ || tam | haviṣmantaḥ | īḷate ||3.27.14||

IAST: taṁ haviṣmanta īḻate
Griffith: Men with oblations worship him.
Devanāgarī: तं हविष्मन्त ईळते
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣo iti | agniḥ | sam | idhyate | aśvaḥ | na | deva-vāhanaḥ || tam | haviṣmantaḥ | īḷate ||3.27.14||

IAST: vṛṣaṇaṁ tvā vayaṁ vṛṣan vṛṣaṇaḥ sam idhīmahi
Griffith: Thee will we kindle as a bull, we who are Bulls ourselves, O Bull.
Devanāgarī: वृषणं त्वा वयं वृषन्वृषणः समिधीमहि
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣaṇam | tvā | vayam | vr̥ṣan | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | sam | idhīmahi || agne | dīdyatam | br̥hat ||3.27.15||

IAST: agne dīdyatam bṛhat
Griffith: Thee, Agni, shining mightily.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने दीद्यतं बृहत्
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣaṇam | tvā | vayam | vr̥ṣan | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | sam | idhīmahi || agne | dīdyatam | br̥hat ||3.27.15||

IAST: agne juṣasva no haviḥ puroḻāśaṁ jātavedaḥ
Griffith: AGNI who knowest all, accept our offering and the cake of meal,
Devanāgarī: अग्ने जुषस्व नो हविः पुरोळाशं जातवेदः
pada pāṭha: agne | juṣasva | naḥ | haviḥ | puroḷāśam | jāta-vedaḥ || prātaḥ-sāve | dhiyāvaso iti dhiyā-vaso ||3.28.1||

IAST: prātaḥsāve dhiyāvaso
Griffith: At dawn's libation, rich in prayer!
Devanāgarī: प्रातःसावे धियावसो
pada pāṭha: agne | juṣasva | naḥ | haviḥ | puroḷāśam | jāta-vedaḥ || prātaḥ-sāve | dhiyāvaso iti dhiyā-vaso ||3.28.1||

IAST: puroḻā agne pacatas tubhyaṁ vā ghā pariṣkṛtaḥ
Griffith: Agni, the sacrificial cake hath been prepared and dressed for thee:
Devanāgarī: पुरोळा अग्ने पचतस्तुभ्यं वा घा परिष्कृतः
pada pāṭha: puroḷāḥ | agne | pacataḥ | tubhyam | vā | gha | pari-kr̥taḥ || tam | juṣasva | yaviṣṭhya ||3.28.2||

IAST: taṁ juṣasva yaviṣṭhya
Griffith: Accept it, O Most Youthful God.
Devanāgarī: तं जुषस्व यविष्ठ्य
pada pāṭha: puroḷāḥ | agne | pacataḥ | tubhyam | vā | gha | pari-kr̥taḥ || tam | juṣasva | yaviṣṭhya ||3.28.2||

IAST: agne vīhi puroḻāśam āhutaṁ tiroahnyam
Griffith: Agni, enjoy the cake of meal and our oblation three days old:
Devanāgarī: अग्ने वीहि पुरोळाशमाहुतं तिरोअह्न्यम्
pada pāṭha: agne | vīhi | puroḷāśam | ā-hutam | tiraḥ-ahnyam || sahasaḥ | sūnuḥ | asi | adhvare | hitaḥ ||3.28.3||

IAST: sahasaḥ sūnur asy adhvare hitaḥ
Griffith: Thou, Son of Strength, art stablished at our sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: सहसः सूनुरस्यध्वरे हितः
pada pāṭha: agne | vīhi | puroḷāśam | ā-hutam | tiraḥ-ahnyam || sahasaḥ | sūnuḥ | asi | adhvare | hitaḥ ||3.28.3||

IAST: mādhyaṁdine savane jātavedaḥ puroḻāśam iha kave juṣasva
Griffith: Here at the midday sacrifice enjoy thou the sacrificial cake, wise, Jatavedas!
Devanāgarī: माध्यंदिने सवने जातवेदः पुरोळाशमिह कवे जुषस्व
pada pāṭha: mādhyaṁdine | savane | jāta-vedaḥ | puroḷāśam | iha | kave | juṣasva || agne | yahvasya | tava | bhāga-dheyam | na | pra | minanti | vidatheṣu | dhīrāḥ ||3.28.4||

IAST: agne yahvasya tava bhāgadheyaṁ na pra minanti vidatheṣu dhīrāḥ
Griffith: Agni, the sages in assemblies never minish the portion due to thee the Mighty.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने यह्वस्य तव भागधेयं न प्र मिनन्ति विदथेषु धीराः
pada pāṭha: mādhyaṁdine | savane | jāta-vedaḥ | puroḷāśam | iha | kave | juṣasva || agne | yahvasya | tava | bhāga-dheyam | na | pra | minanti | vidatheṣu | dhīrāḥ ||3.28.4||

IAST: agne tṛtīye savane hi kāniṣaḥ puroḻāśaṁ sahasaḥ sūnav āhutam
Griffith: O Agni, at the third libation takewith joy the offered cake of sacrifice, thou, Son of Strength.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने तृतीये सवने हि कानिषः पुरोळाशं सहसः सूनवाहुतम्
pada pāṭha: agne | tr̥tīye | savane | hi | kāniṣaḥ | puroḷāśam | sahasaḥ | sūno iti | ā-hutam || atha | deveṣu | adhvaram | vipanyayā | dhāḥ | ratna-vantam | amr̥teṣu | jāgr̥vim ||3.28.5||

IAST: athā deveṣv adhvaraṁ vipanyayā dhā ratnavantam amṛteṣu jāgṛvim
Griffith: Through skill in song bear to the Gods our sacrifice, watchful and fraught with riches, to Immortal God.
Devanāgarī: अथा देवेष्वध्वरं विपन्यया धा रत्नवन्तममृतेषु जागृविम्
pada pāṭha: agne | tr̥tīye | savane | hi | kāniṣaḥ | puroḷāśam | sahasaḥ | sūno iti | ā-hutam || atha | deveṣu | adhvaram | vipanyayā | dhāḥ | ratna-vantam | amr̥teṣu | jāgr̥vim ||3.28.5||

IAST: agne vṛdhāna āhutim puroḻāśaṁ jātavedaḥ
Griffith: O waxing Agni, knower, thou, of all, accept our gifts, the cake,
Devanāgarī: अग्ने वृधान आहुतिं पुरोळाशं जातवेदः
pada pāṭha: agne | vr̥dhānaḥ | ā-hutim | puroḷāśam | jāta-vedaḥ || juṣasva | tiraḥ-ahnyam ||3.28.6||

IAST: juṣasva tiroahnyam
Griffith: And that prepared ere yesterday.
Devanāgarī: जुषस्व तिरोअह्न्यम्
pada pāṭha: agne | vr̥dhānaḥ | ā-hutim | puroḷāśam | jāta-vedaḥ || juṣasva | tiraḥ-ahnyam ||3.28.6||

IAST: astīdam adhimanthanam asti prajananaṁ kṛtam
Griffith: HERE is the gear for friction, here tinder made ready for the spark.
Devanāgarī: अस्तीदमधिमन्थनमस्ति प्रजननं कृतम्
pada pāṭha: asti | idam | adhi-manthanam | asti | pra-jananam | kr̥tam || etām | viśpatnīm | ā | bhara | agnim | manthāma | pūrva-thā ||3.29.1||

IAST: etāṁ viśpatnīm ā bharāgnim manthāma pūrvathā
Griffith: Bring thou the Matron: we will rub Agni in ancient fashion forth.
Devanāgarī: एतां विश्पत्नीमा भराग्निं मन्थाम पूर्वथा
pada pāṭha: asti | idam | adhi-manthanam | asti | pra-jananam | kr̥tam || etām | viśpatnīm | ā | bhara | agnim | manthāma | pūrva-thā ||3.29.1||

IAST: araṇyor nihito jātavedā garbha iva sudhito garbhiṇīṣu
Griffith: n the two fire-sticks Jatavedas lieth, even as the well-set germ in pregnant women,
Devanāgarī: अरण्योर्निहितो जातवेदा गर्भ इव सुधितो गर्भिणीषु
pada pāṭha: araṇyoḥ | ni-hitaḥ | jāta-vedāḥ | garbhaḥ-iva | su-dhitaḥ | garbhiṇīṣu || dive-dive | īḍyaḥ | jāgr̥vat-bhiḥ | haviṣmat-bhiḥ | manuṣyebhiḥ | agniḥ ||3.29.2||

IAST: dive-diva īḍyo jāgṛvadbhir haviṣmadbhir manuṣyebhir agniḥ
Griffith: Agni who day by day must be exalted by men who watch and worship with oblations.
Devanāgarī: दिवेदिव ईड्यो जागृवद्भिर्हविष्मद्भिर्मनुष्येभिरग्निः
pada pāṭha: araṇyoḥ | ni-hitaḥ | jāta-vedāḥ | garbhaḥ-iva | su-dhitaḥ | garbhiṇīṣu || dive-dive | īḍyaḥ | jāgr̥vat-bhiḥ | haviṣmat-bhiḥ | manuṣyebhiḥ | agniḥ ||3.29.2||

IAST: uttānāyām ava bharā cikitvān sadyaḥ pravītā vṛṣaṇaṁ jajāna
Griffith: Lay this with care on that which lies extended: straight hath she borne the Steerwhen made prolific.
Devanāgarī: उत्तानायामव भरा चिकित्वान्सद्यः प्रवीता वृषणं जजान
pada pāṭha: uttānāyām | ava | bhara | cikitvān | sadyaḥ | pra-vītā | vr̥ṣaṇam | jajāna || aruṣa-stūpaḥ | ruśat | asya | pājaḥ | iḷāyāḥ | putraḥ | vayune | ajaniṣṭa ||3.29.3||

IAST: aruṣastūpo ruśad asya pāja iḻāyās putro vayune 'janiṣṭa
Griffith: With his red pillar-radiant is his splendour -in our skilled task is born the Son of Ila.
Devanāgarī: अरुषस्तूपो रुशदस्य पाज इळायास्पुत्रो वयुनेऽजनिष्ट
pada pāṭha: uttānāyām | ava | bhara | cikitvān | sadyaḥ | pra-vītā | vr̥ṣaṇam | jajāna || aruṣa-stūpaḥ | ruśat | asya | pājaḥ | iḷāyāḥ | putraḥ | vayune | ajaniṣṭa ||3.29.3||

IAST: iḻāyās tvā pade vayaṁ nābhā pṛthivyā adhi
Griffith: In Ila's place we set thee down, upon the central point of earth,
Devanāgarī: इळायास्त्वा पदे वयं नाभा पृथिव्या अधि
pada pāṭha: iḷāyāḥ | tvā | pade | vayam | nābhā | pr̥thivyāḥ | adhi || jāta-vedaḥ | ni | dhīmahi | agne | havyāya | voḷhave ||3.29.4||

IAST: jātavedo ni dhīmahy agne havyāya voḻhave
Griffith: That, Agni Jatavedas, thou mayst bear our offerings to the Gods.
Devanāgarī: जातवेदो नि धीमह्यग्ने हव्याय वोळ्हवे
pada pāṭha: iḷāyāḥ | tvā | pade | vayam | nābhā | pr̥thivyāḥ | adhi || jāta-vedaḥ | ni | dhīmahi | agne | havyāya | voḷhave ||3.29.4||

IAST: manthatā naraḥ kavim advayantam pracetasam amṛtaṁ supratīkam
Griffith: Rub into life, ye men, the Sage, the guileless, Immortal, very wise and fair to look on.
Devanāgarī: मन्थता नरः कविमद्वयन्तं प्रचेतसममृतं सुप्रतीकम्
pada pāṭha: manthata | naraḥ | kavim | advayantam | pra-cetasam | amr̥tam | su-pratīkam || yajñasya | ketum | prathamam | purastāt | agnim | naraḥ | janayata | su-śevam ||3.29.5||

IAST: yajñasya ketum prathamam purastād agniṁ naro janayatā suśevam
Griffith: O men, bring forth the most propitious Agni, first ensign of the sacrifice to eastward.
Devanāgarī: यज्ञस्य केतुं प्रथमं पुरस्तादग्निं नरो जनयता सुशेवम्
pada pāṭha: manthata | naraḥ | kavim | advayantam | pra-cetasam | amr̥tam | su-pratīkam || yajñasya | ketum | prathamam | purastāt | agnim | naraḥ | janayata | su-śevam ||3.29.5||

IAST: yadī manthanti bāhubhir vi rocate 'śvo na vājy aruṣo vaneṣv ā
Griffith: When with their arms they rub him straight he shineth forth like a strong courser, red in colour, in the wood.
Devanāgarī: यदी मन्थन्ति बाहुभिर्वि रोचतेऽश्वो न वाज्यरुषो वनेष्वा
pada pāṭha: yadi | manthanti | bāhu-bhiḥ | vi | rocate | aśvaḥ | na | vājī | aruṣaḥ | vaneṣu | ā || citraḥ | na | yāman | aśvinoḥ | ani-vr̥taḥ | pari | vr̥ṇakti | aśmanaḥ | tr̥ṇā | dahan ||3.29.6||

IAST: citro na yāmann aśvinor anivṛtaḥ pari vṛṇakty aśmanas tṛṇā dahan
Griffith: Bright, checkless, as it were upon the Atvins' path, lie passeth by the stones and burneth up the grass.
Devanāgarī: चित्रो न यामन्नश्विनोरनिवृतः परि वृणक्त्यश्मनस्तृणा दहन्
pada pāṭha: yadi | manthanti | bāhu-bhiḥ | vi | rocate | aśvaḥ | na | vājī | aruṣaḥ | vaneṣu | ā || citraḥ | na | yāman | aśvinoḥ | ani-vr̥taḥ | pari | vr̥ṇakti | aśmanaḥ | tr̥ṇā | dahan ||3.29.6||

IAST: jāto agnī rocate cekitāno vājī vipraḥ kaviśastaḥ sudānuḥ
Griffith: Agni shines forth when born, observant, mighty, the bountiful, the Singar praised by sages;
Devanāgarī: जातो अग्नी रोचते चेकितानो वाजी विप्रः कविशस्तः सुदानुः
pada pāṭha: jātaḥ | agniḥ | rocate | cekitānaḥ | vājī | vipraḥ | kavi-śastaḥ | su-dānuḥ || yam | devāsaḥ | īḍyam | viśva-vidam | havya-vāham | adadhuḥ | adhvareṣu ||3.29.7||

IAST: yaṁ devāsa īḍyaṁ viśvavidaṁ havyavāham adadhur adhvareṣu
Griffith: Whom, as adorable and knowing all things, Gods set at solemn rites as offeringbearer.
Devanāgarī: यं देवास ईड्यं विश्वविदं हव्यवाहमदधुरध्वरेषु
pada pāṭha: jātaḥ | agniḥ | rocate | cekitānaḥ | vājī | vipraḥ | kavi-śastaḥ | su-dānuḥ || yam | devāsaḥ | īḍyam | viśva-vidam | havya-vāham | adadhuḥ | adhvareṣu ||3.29.7||

IAST: sīda hotaḥ sva u loke cikitvān sādayā yajñaṁ sukṛtasya yonau
Griffith: Set thee, O Priest, in, thine own place, observant: lay down the sacrifice in the home of worship.
Devanāgarī: सीद होतः स्व उ लोके चिकित्वान्सादया यज्ञं सुकृतस्य योनौ
pada pāṭha: sīda | hotariti | sve | ūm̐ iti | loke | cikitvān | sādaya | yajñam | su-kr̥tasya | yonau || deva-avīḥ | devān | haviṣā | yajāsi | agne | br̥hat | yajamāne | vayaḥ | dhāḥ ||3.29.8||

IAST: devāvīr devān haviṣā yajāsy agne bṛhad yajamāne vayo dhāḥ
Griffith: Thou, dear to Gods, shalt serve them with oblation: Agni, give long life to the sacrificer.
Devanāgarī: देवावीर्देवान्हविषा यजास्यग्ने बृहद्यजमाने वयो धाः
pada pāṭha: sīda | hotariti | sve | ūm̐ iti | loke | cikitvān | sādaya | yajñam | su-kr̥tasya | yonau || deva-avīḥ | devān | haviṣā | yajāsi | agne | br̥hat | yajamāne | vayaḥ | dhāḥ ||3.29.8||

IAST: kṛṇota dhūmaṁ vṛṣaṇaṁ sakhāyo 'sredhanta itana vājam accha
Griffith: Raise ye a mighty smoke, my fellow-workers! Ye shall attain to wealth without obstruction.
Devanāgarī: कृणोत धूमं वृषणं सखायोऽस्रेधन्त इतन वाजमच्छ
pada pāṭha: kr̥ṇota | dhūmam | vr̥ṣaṇam | sakhāyaḥ | asredhantaḥ | itana | vājam | accha || ayam | agniḥ | pr̥tanāṣāṭ | su-vīraḥ | yena | devāsaḥ | asahanta | dasyūn ||3.29.9||

IAST: ayam agniḥ pṛtanāṣāṭ suvīro yena devāso asahanta dasyūn
Griffith: This Agni is the battle-winning Hero by whom the Gods have overcome the Dasyus.
Devanāgarī: अयमग्निः पृतनाषाट् सुवीरो येन देवासो असहन्त दस्यून्
pada pāṭha: kr̥ṇota | dhūmam | vr̥ṣaṇam | sakhāyaḥ | asredhantaḥ | itana | vājam | accha || ayam | agniḥ | pr̥tanāṣāṭ | su-vīraḥ | yena | devāsaḥ | asahanta | dasyūn ||3.29.9||

IAST: ayaṁ te yonir ṛtviyo yato jāto arocathāḥ
Griffith: This is thine ordered place of birth whence sprung to life thou shonest forth.
Devanāgarī: अयं ते योनिरृत्वियो यतो जातो अरोचथाः
pada pāṭha: ayam | te | yoniḥ | r̥tviyaḥ | yataḥ | jātaḥ | arocathāḥ || tam | jānan | agne | ā | sīda | atha | naḥ | vardhaya | giraḥ ||3.29.10||

IAST: taṁ jānann agna ā sīdāthā no vardhayā giraḥ
Griffith: Knowing this, Agni, sit thee down, and prosper thou the songs we sing.
Devanāgarī: तं जानन्नग्न आ सीदाथा नो वर्धया गिरः
pada pāṭha: ayam | te | yoniḥ | r̥tviyaḥ | yataḥ | jātaḥ | arocathāḥ || tam | jānan | agne | ā | sīda | atha | naḥ | vardhaya | giraḥ ||3.29.10||

IAST: tanūnapād ucyate garbha āsuro narāśaṁso bhavati yad vijāyate
Griffith: As Germ Celestial he is called Tanunapat, and Narasamsa born diffused in varied shape.
Devanāgarī: तनूनपादुच्यते गर्भ आसुरो नराशंसो भवति यद्विजायते
pada pāṭha: tanū-napāt | ucyate | garbhaḥ | āsuraḥ | narāśaṁsaḥ | bhavati | yat | vi-jāyate || mātariśvā | yat | amimīta | mātari | vātasya | sargaḥ | abhavat | sarīmaṇi ||3.29.11||

IAST: mātariśvā yad amimīta mātari vātasya sargo abhavat sarīmaṇi
Griffith: Formed in his Mother he is Matarisvan; he hath, in his course, become the rapid flight of wind.
Devanāgarī: मातरिश्वा यदमिमीत मातरि वातस्य सर्गो अभवत्सरीमणि
pada pāṭha: tanū-napāt | ucyate | garbhaḥ | āsuraḥ | narāśaṁsaḥ | bhavati | yat | vi-jāyate || mātariśvā | yat | amimīta | mātari | vātasya | sargaḥ | abhavat | sarīmaṇi ||3.29.11||

IAST: sunirmathā nirmathitaḥ sunidhā nihitaḥ kaviḥ
Griffith: With strong attrition rubbed to life, laid down with careful hand, a Sage,
Devanāgarī: सुनिर्मथा निर्मथितः सुनिधा निहितः कविः
pada pāṭha: suniḥ-mathā | niḥ-mathitaḥ | su-nidhā | ni-hitaḥ | kaviḥ || agne | su-adhvarā | kr̥ṇu | devān | deva-yate | yaja ||3.29.12||

IAST: agne svadhvarā kṛṇu devān devayate yaja
Griffith: Agni, make sacrifices good, and for the pious bring the Gods.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने स्वध्वरा कृणु देवान्देवयते यज
pada pāṭha: suniḥ-mathā | niḥ-mathitaḥ | su-nidhā | ni-hitaḥ | kaviḥ || agne | su-adhvarā | kr̥ṇu | devān | deva-yate | yaja ||3.29.12||

IAST: ajījanann amṛtam martyāso 'sremāṇaṁ taraṇiṁ vīḻujambham
Griffith: Mortals have brought to life the God Immortal, the Conqueror with mighty jaws, unfailing.
Devanāgarī: अजीजनन्नमृतं मर्त्यासोऽस्रेमाणं तरणिं वीळुजम्भम्
pada pāṭha: ajījanan | amr̥tam | martyāsaḥ | asremāṇam | taraṇim | vīḷu-jambham || daśa | svasāraḥ | agruvaḥ | sam-īcīḥ | pumāṁsam | jātam | abhi | sam | rabhante ||3.29.13||

IAST: daśa svasāro agruvaḥ samīcīḥ pumāṁsaṁ jātam abhi saṁ rabhante
Griffith: The sisters ten, unwedded and united, together grasp the Babe, the new-born Infant.
Devanāgarī: दश स्वसारो अग्रुवः समीचीः पुमांसं जातमभि सं रभन्ते
pada pāṭha: ajījanan | amr̥tam | martyāsaḥ | asremāṇam | taraṇim | vīḷu-jambham || daśa | svasāraḥ | agruvaḥ | sam-īcīḥ | pumāṁsam | jātam | abhi | sam | rabhante ||3.29.13||

IAST: pra saptahotā sanakād arocata mātur upasthe yad aśocad ūdhani
Griffith: Served by the seven priests, he shone forth from ancient time, when in his Mother's bosom, in her lap, he glowed.
Devanāgarī: प्र सप्तहोता सनकादरोचत मातुरुपस्थे यदशोचदूधनि
pada pāṭha: pra | sapta-hotā | sanakāt | arocata | mātuḥ | upa-sthe | yat | aśocat | ūdhani || na | ni | miṣati | su-raṇaḥ | dive-dive | yat | asurasya | jaṭharāt | ajāyata ||3.29.14||

IAST: na ni miṣati suraṇo dive-dive yad asurasya jaṭharād ajāyata
Griffith: Giving delight each day he closeth not his eye, since from the Asura's body hewas brought to life.
Devanāgarī: न नि मिषति सुरणो दिवेदिवे यदसुरस्य जठरादजायत
pada pāṭha: pra | sapta-hotā | sanakāt | arocata | mātuḥ | upa-sthe | yat | aśocat | ūdhani || na | ni | miṣati | su-raṇaḥ | dive-dive | yat | asurasya | jaṭharāt | ajāyata ||3.29.14||

IAST: amitrāyudho marutām iva prayāḥ prathamajā brahmaṇo viśvam id viduḥ
Griffith: Even as the Maruts, onslaughts who attack the foe, those born the first of all knew the full power of prayer.
Devanāgarī: अमित्रायुधो मरुतामिव प्रयाः प्रथमजा ब्रह्मणो विश्वमिद्विदुः
pada pāṭha: amitra-yudhaḥ | marutām-iva | pra-yāḥ | prathama-jāḥ | brahmaṇaḥ | viśvam | it | viduḥ || dyumna-vat | brahma | kuśikāsaḥ | ā | īrire | ekaḥ-ekaḥ | dame | agnim | sam | īdhire ||3.29.15||

IAST: dyumnavad brahma kuśikāsa erira eka-eko dame agniṁ sam īdhire
Griffith: The Kusikas have made the glorious hymn ascend, and, each one singly in his home, have kindled fire.
Devanāgarī: द्युम्नवद्ब्रह्म कुशिकास एरिर एकएको दमे अग्निं समीधिरे
pada pāṭha: amitra-yudhaḥ | marutām-iva | pra-yāḥ | prathama-jāḥ | brahmaṇaḥ | viśvam | it | viduḥ || dyumna-vat | brahma | kuśikāsaḥ | ā | īrire | ekaḥ-ekaḥ | dame | agnim | sam | īdhire ||3.29.15||

IAST: yad adya tvā prayati yajñe asmin hotaś cikitvo 'vṛṇīmahīha
Griffith: As we, O Priest observant, have elected thee this day, what time the solemn sacrifice began,
Devanāgarī: यदद्य त्वा प्रयति यज्ञे अस्मिन्होतश्चिकित्वोऽवृणीमहीह
pada pāṭha: yat | adya | tvā | pra-yati | yajñe | asmin | hotariti | cikitvaḥ | avr̥ṇīmahi | iha || dhruvam | ayāḥ | dhruvam | uta | aśamiṣṭhāḥ | pra-jānan | vidvān | upa | yāhi | somam ||3.29.16||

IAST: dhruvam ayā dhruvam utāśamiṣṭhāḥ prajānan vidvām̐ upa yāhi somam
Griffith: So surely hast thou worshipped, surely hast thou toiled: come thou unto the Soma, wise and knowing all.
Devanāgarī: ध्रुवमया ध्रुवमुताशमिष्ठाः प्रजानन्विद्वाँ उप याहि सोमम्
pada pāṭha: yat | adya | tvā | pra-yati | yajñe | asmin | hotariti | cikitvaḥ | avr̥ṇīmahi | iha || dhruvam | ayāḥ | dhruvam | uta | aśamiṣṭhāḥ | pra-jānan | vidvān | upa | yāhi | somam ||3.29.16||

IAST: icchanti tvā somyāsaḥ sakhāyaḥ sunvanti somaṁ dadhati prayāṁsi
Griffith: THE friends who offer Soma long to find thee: they pour forth Soma and present their viands.
Devanāgarī: इच्छन्ति त्वा सोम्यासः सखायः सुन्वन्ति सोमं दधति प्रयांसि
pada pāṭha: icchanti | tvā | somyāsaḥ | sakhāyaḥ | sunvanti | somam | dadhati | prayāṁsi || tatikṣante | abhi-śastim | janānām | indra | tvat | ā | kaḥ | cana | hi | pra-ketaḥ ||3.30.1||

IAST: titikṣante abhiśastiṁ janānām indra tvad ā kaś cana hi praketaḥ
Griffith: They bear unmoved the cursing of the people, for all our wisdom comes from thee, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: तितिक्षन्ते अभिशस्तिं जनानामिन्द्र त्वदा कश्चन हि प्रकेतः
pada pāṭha: icchanti | tvā | somyāsaḥ | sakhāyaḥ | sunvanti | somam | dadhati | prayāṁsi || tatikṣante | abhi-śastim | janānām | indra | tvat | ā | kaḥ | cana | hi | pra-ketaḥ ||3.30.1||

IAST: na te dūre paramā cid rajāṁsy ā tu pra yāhi harivo haribhyām
Griffith: Not far for thee are mid-air's loftiest regions: start hither, Lord of Bays, with thy Bay Horses.
Devanāgarī: न ते दूरे परमा चिद्रजांस्या तु प्र याहि हरिवो हरिभ्याम्
pada pāṭha: na | te | dūre | paramā | cit | rajāṁsi | ā | tu | pra | yāhi | hari-vaḥ | hari-bhyām || sthirāya | vr̥ṣṇe | savanā | kr̥tā | imā | yuktāḥ | grāvāṇaḥ | sam-idhāne | agnau ||3.30.2||

IAST: sthirāya vṛṣṇe savanā kṛtemā yuktā grāvāṇaḥ samidhāne agnau
Griffith: Made for the Firm and Strong are these libations. The pressing-stones are set and fire is kindled.
Devanāgarī: स्थिराय वृष्णे सवना कृतेमा युक्ता ग्रावाणः समिधाने अग्नौ
pada pāṭha: na | te | dūre | paramā | cit | rajāṁsi | ā | tu | pra | yāhi | hari-vaḥ | hari-bhyām || sthirāya | vr̥ṣṇe | savanā | kr̥tā | imā | yuktāḥ | grāvāṇaḥ | sam-idhāne | agnau ||3.30.2||

IAST: indraḥ suśipro maghavā tarutro mahāvrātas tuvikūrmir ṛghāvān
Griffith: Fair cheeks hath Indra, Maghavan, the Victor, Lord of a great host, Stormer, strong in action.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रः सुशिप्रो मघवा तरुत्रो महाव्रातस्तुविकूर्मिरृघावान्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | su-śipraḥ | magha-vā | tarutraḥ | mahā-vrātaḥ | tuvi-kūrmiḥ | r̥ghāvān || yat | ugraḥ | dhāḥ | bādhitaḥ | martyeṣu | kva | tyā | te | vr̥ṣabha | vīryāṇi ||3.30.3||

IAST: yad ugro dhā bādhito martyeṣu kva tyā te vṛṣabha vīryāṇi
Griffith: What once thou didst in might when mortals vexed thee,-where now, O Bull, are those thy hero exploits?
Devanāgarī: यदुग्रो धा बाधितो मर्त्येषु क्व त्या ते वृषभ वीर्याणि
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | su-śipraḥ | magha-vā | tarutraḥ | mahā-vrātaḥ | tuvi-kūrmiḥ | r̥ghāvān || yat | ugraḥ | dhāḥ | bādhitaḥ | martyeṣu | kva | tyā | te | vr̥ṣabha | vīryāṇi ||3.30.3||

IAST: tvaṁ hi ṣmā cyāvayann acyutāny eko vṛtrā carasi jighnamānaḥ
Griffith: For, overthrowing what hath ne'er been shaken, thou goest forth alone destroying Vrtras.
Devanāgarī: त्वं हि ष्मा च्यावयन्नच्युतान्येको वृत्रा चरसि जिघ्नमानः
pada pāṭha: tvam | hi | sma | cyavayan | acyutāni | ekaḥ | vr̥trā | carasi | jighnamānaḥ || tava | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | parvatāsaḥ | anu | vratāya | nimitā-iva | tasthuḥ ||3.30.4||

IAST: tava dyāvāpṛthivī parvatāso 'nu vratāya nimiteva tasthuḥ
Griffith: For him who followeth thy Law the mountains and heaven and earth stand as if firmly stablished.
Devanāgarī: तव द्यावापृथिवी पर्वतासोऽनु व्रताय निमितेव तस्थुः
pada pāṭha: tvam | hi | sma | cyavayan | acyutāni | ekaḥ | vr̥trā | carasi | jighnamānaḥ || tava | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | parvatāsaḥ | anu | vratāya | nimitā-iva | tasthuḥ ||3.30.4||

IAST: utābhaye puruhūta śravobhir eko dṛḻham avado vṛtrahā san
Griffith: Yea, Much-invoked! in safety through thy glories alone thou speakest truth as Vrtra's slayer.
Devanāgarī: उताभये पुरुहूत श्रवोभिरेको दृळ्हमवदो वृत्रहा सन्
pada pāṭha: uta | abhaye | puru-hūta | śravaḥ-bhiḥ | ekaḥ | dr̥ḷham | avadaḥ | vr̥tra-hā | san || ime iti | cit | indra | rodasī iti | apāre iti | yat | sam-gr̥bhṇāḥ | magha-van | kāśiḥ | it | te ||3.30.5||

IAST: ime cid indra rodasī apāre yat saṁgṛbhṇā maghavan kāśir it te
Griffith: E'en these two boundless worlds to thee, O Indra, what time thou graspest them, are but a handful.
Devanāgarī: इमे चिदिन्द्र रोदसी अपारे यत्संगृभ्णा मघवन्काशिरित्ते
pada pāṭha: uta | abhaye | puru-hūta | śravaḥ-bhiḥ | ekaḥ | dr̥ḷham | avadaḥ | vr̥tra-hā | san || ime iti | cit | indra | rodasī iti | apāre iti | yat | sam-gr̥bhṇāḥ | magha-van | kāśiḥ | it | te ||3.30.5||

IAST: pra sū ta indra pravatā haribhyām pra te vajraḥ pramṛṇann etu śatrūn
Griffith: Forthwith thy Bay steeds down the steep, O Indra, forth, crushing foemen, go thy bolt of thunder!
Devanāgarī: प्र सू त इन्द्र प्रवता हरिभ्यां प्र ते वज्रः प्रमृणन्नेतु शत्रून्
pada pāṭha: pra | su | te | indra | pra-vatā | hari-bhyām | pra | te | vajraḥ | pra-mr̥ṇan | etu | śatrūn || jahi | pratīcaḥ | anūcaḥ | parācaḥ | viśvam | satyam | kr̥ṇuhi | viṣṭam | astu ||3.30.6||

IAST: jahi pratīco anūcaḥ parāco viśvaṁ satyaṁ kṛṇuhi viṣṭam astu
Griffith: Slay those who meet thee, those who flee, who follow: make all thy promise true; be all completed.
Devanāgarī: जहि प्रतीचो अनूचः पराचो विश्वं सत्यं कृणुहि विष्टमस्तु
pada pāṭha: pra | su | te | indra | pra-vatā | hari-bhyām | pra | te | vajraḥ | pra-mr̥ṇan | etu | śatrūn || jahi | pratīcaḥ | anūcaḥ | parācaḥ | viśvam | satyam | kr̥ṇuhi | viṣṭam | astu ||3.30.6||

IAST: yasmai dhāyur adadhā martyāyābhaktaṁ cid bhajate gehyaṁ saḥ
Griffith: The man to whom thou givest as Provider enjoys domestic plenty undivided.
Devanāgarī: यस्मै धायुरदधा मर्त्यायाभक्तं चिद्भजते गेह्यं सः
pada pāṭha: yasmai | dhāyuḥ | adadhāḥ | martyāya | abhaktam | cit | bhajate | gehyam | saḥ || bhadrā | te | indra | su-matiḥ | ghr̥tācī | sahasra-dānā | puru-hūta | rātiḥ ||3.30.7||

IAST: bhadrā ta indra sumatir ghṛtācī sahasradānā puruhūta rātiḥ
Griffith: Blest, Indra, is thy favour dropping fatness: thy worship, Much-invoked! brings gifts in thousands.
Devanāgarī: भद्रा त इन्द्र सुमतिर्घृताची सहस्रदाना पुरुहूत रातिः
pada pāṭha: yasmai | dhāyuḥ | adadhāḥ | martyāya | abhaktam | cit | bhajate | gehyam | saḥ || bhadrā | te | indra | su-matiḥ | ghr̥tācī | sahasra-dānā | puru-hūta | rātiḥ ||3.30.7||

IAST: sahadānum puruhūta kṣiyantam ahastam indra sam piṇak kuṇārum
Griffith: Thou, Indra, Much-invoked! didst crush to pieces Kunaru handless fiend who dwelt with Danu.
Devanāgarī: सहदानुं पुरुहूत क्षियन्तमहस्तमिन्द्र सं पिणक्कुणारुम्
pada pāṭha: saha-dānum | puru-hūta | kṣiyantam | ahastam | indra | sam | piṇak | kuṇārum || abhi | vr̥tram | vardhamānam | piyārum | apādam | indra | tavasā | jaghantha ||3.30.8||

IAST: abhi vṛtraṁ vardhamānam piyārum apādam indra tavasā jaghantha
Griffith: Thou with might, Indra, smotest dead the scorner, the footless Vrtra as he waxed in vigour.
Devanāgarī: अभि वृत्रं वर्धमानं पियारुमपादमिन्द्र तवसा जघन्थ
pada pāṭha: saha-dānum | puru-hūta | kṣiyantam | ahastam | indra | sam | piṇak | kuṇārum || abhi | vr̥tram | vardhamānam | piyārum | apādam | indra | tavasā | jaghantha ||3.30.8||

IAST: ni sāmanām iṣirām indra bhūmim mahīm apārāṁ sadane sasattha
Griffith: Thou hast established in her seat, O Indra, the level earth, vast, vigorous, unbounded.
Devanāgarī: नि सामनामिषिरामिन्द्र भूमिं महीमपारां सदने ससत्थ
pada pāṭha: ni | sāmanām | iṣirām | indra | bhūmim | mahīm | apārām | sadane | sasattha || astabhnāt | dyām | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | antarikṣam | arṣantu | āpaḥ | tvayā | iha | pra-sūtāḥ ||3.30.9||

IAST: astabhnād dyāṁ vṛṣabho antarikṣam arṣantv āpas tvayeha prasūtāḥ
Griffith: The Bull hath propped the heaven and air's mid-region. By thee sent onward let the floods flow hither.
Devanāgarī: अस्तभ्नाद्द्यां वृषभो अन्तरिक्षमर्षन्त्वापस्त्वयेह प्रसूताः
pada pāṭha: ni | sāmanām | iṣirām | indra | bhūmim | mahīm | apārām | sadane | sasattha || astabhnāt | dyām | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | antarikṣam | arṣantu | āpaḥ | tvayā | iha | pra-sūtāḥ ||3.30.9||

IAST: alātṛṇo vala indra vrajo goḥ purā hantor bhayamāno vy āra
Griffith: He who withheld the kine, in silence I yielded in fear before thy blow, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: अलातृणो वल इन्द्र व्रजो गोः पुरा हन्तोर्भयमानो व्यार
pada pāṭha: alātr̥ṇaḥ | valaḥ | indra | vrajaḥ | goḥ | purā | hantoḥ | bhayamānaḥ | vi | āra || su-gān | pathaḥ | akr̥ṇot | niḥ-aje | gāḥ | pra | āvan | vāṇīḥ | puru-hūtam | dhamantīḥ ||3.30.10||

IAST: sugān patho akṛṇon niraje gāḥ prāvan vāṇīḥ puruhūtaṁ dhamantīḥ
Griffith: He made paths easy to drive forth the cattle. Loud-breathing praises helped the Much-invoked One.
Devanāgarī: सुगान्पथो अकृणोन्निरजे गाः प्रावन्वाणीः पुरुहूतं धमन्तीः
pada pāṭha: alātr̥ṇaḥ | valaḥ | indra | vrajaḥ | goḥ | purā | hantoḥ | bhayamānaḥ | vi | āra || su-gān | pathaḥ | akr̥ṇot | niḥ-aje | gāḥ | pra | āvan | vāṇīḥ | puru-hūtam | dhamantīḥ ||3.30.10||

IAST: eko dve vasumatī samīcī indra ā paprau pṛthivīm uta dyām
Griffith: Indra alone filled full the earth and heaven, the Pair who meet together, rich in treasures.
Devanāgarī: एको द्वे वसुमती समीची इन्द्र आ पप्रौ पृथिवीमुत द्याम्
pada pāṭha: ekaḥ | dve iti | vasumatī iti vasu-matī | samīcī iti sam-īcī | indraḥ | ā | paprau | pr̥thivīm | uta | dyām || uta | antarikṣāt | abhi | naḥ | sam-īke | iṣaḥ | rathīḥ | sa-yujaḥ | śūra | vājān ||3.30.11||

IAST: utāntarikṣād abhi naḥ samīka iṣo rathīḥ sayujaḥ śūra vājān
Griffith: Yea, bring thou near us from the air's mid-region strength, on thy car, and wholesome food, O Hero.
Devanāgarī: उतान्तरिक्षादभि नः समीक इषो रथीः सयुजः शूर वाजान्
pada pāṭha: ekaḥ | dve iti | vasumatī iti vasu-matī | samīcī iti sam-īcī | indraḥ | ā | paprau | pr̥thivīm | uta | dyām || uta | antarikṣāt | abhi | naḥ | sam-īke | iṣaḥ | rathīḥ | sa-yujaḥ | śūra | vājān ||3.30.11||

IAST: diśaḥ sūryo na mināti pradiṣṭā dive-dive haryaśvaprasūtāḥ
Griffith: Surya transgresses not the ordered limits set daily by the Lord of Tawny Coursers.
Devanāgarī: दिशः सूर्यो न मिनाति प्रदिष्टा दिवेदिवे हर्यश्वप्रसूताः
pada pāṭha: diśaḥ | sūryaḥ | na | mināti | pra-diṣṭāḥ | dive-dive | haryaśva-prasūtāḥ || sam | yat | ānaṭ | adhvanaḥ | āt | it | aśvaiḥ | vi-mocanam | kr̥ṇute | tat | tu | asya ||3.30.12||

IAST: saṁ yad ānaḻ adhvana ād id aśvair vimocanaṁ kṛṇute tat tv asya
Griffith: When to the goal he comes, his journey ended, his Steeds he looses: this is Indra's doing.
Devanāgarī: सं यदानळध्वन आदिदश्वैर्विमोचनं कृणुते तत्त्वस्य
pada pāṭha: diśaḥ | sūryaḥ | na | mināti | pra-diṣṭāḥ | dive-dive | haryaśva-prasūtāḥ || sam | yat | ānaṭ | adhvanaḥ | āt | it | aśvaiḥ | vi-mocanam | kr̥ṇute | tat | tu | asya ||3.30.12||

IAST: didṛkṣanta uṣaso yāmann aktor vivasvatyā mahi citram anīkam
Griffith: Men gladly in the course of night would look on the broad bright front of the refulgent Morning;
Devanāgarī: दिदृक्षन्त उषसो यामन्नक्तोर्विवस्वत्या महि चित्रमनीकम्
pada pāṭha: didr̥kṣante | uṣasaḥ | yāman | aktoḥ | vivasvatyāḥ | mahi | citram | anīkam || viśve | jānanti | mahinā | yat | ā | agāt | indrasya | karma | su-kr̥tā | purūṇi ||3.30.13||

IAST: viśve jānanti mahinā yad āgād indrasya karma sukṛtā purūṇi
Griffith: And all acknowledge, when she comes in glory, the manifold and goodly works of Indra.
Devanāgarī: विश्वे जानन्ति महिना यदागादिन्द्रस्य कर्म सुकृता पुरूणि
pada pāṭha: didr̥kṣante | uṣasaḥ | yāman | aktoḥ | vivasvatyāḥ | mahi | citram | anīkam || viśve | jānanti | mahinā | yat | ā | agāt | indrasya | karma | su-kr̥tā | purūṇi ||3.30.13||

IAST: mahi jyotir nihitaṁ vakṣaṇāsv āmā pakvaṁ carati bibhratī gauḥ
Griffith: A mighty splendour rests upon her bosom: bearing ripe milk the Cow, unripe, advances.
Devanāgarī: महि ज्योतिर्निहितं वक्षणास्वामा पक्वं चरति बिभ्रती गौः
pada pāṭha: mahi | jyotiḥ | ni-hitam | vakṣaṇāsu | āmā | pakvam | carati | bibhratī | gauḥ || viśvam | svādma | sam-bhr̥tam | usriyāyām | yat | sīm | indraḥ | adadhāt | bhojanāya ||3.30.14||

IAST: viśvaṁ svādma sambhṛtam usriyāyāṁ yat sīm indro adadhād bhojanāya
Griffith: All sweetness is collected in the Heifer, sweetness which Indra made for our enjoyment.
Devanāgarī: विश्वं स्वाद्म सम्भृतमुस्रियायां यत्सीमिन्द्रो अदधाद्भोजनाय
pada pāṭha: mahi | jyotiḥ | ni-hitam | vakṣaṇāsu | āmā | pakvam | carati | bibhratī | gauḥ || viśvam | svādma | sam-bhr̥tam | usriyāyām | yat | sīm | indraḥ | adadhāt | bhojanāya ||3.30.14||

IAST: indra dṛhya yāmakośā abhūvan yajñāya śikṣa gṛṇate sakhibhyaḥ
Griffith: Barring the way they come. Be firm, O Indra; aid friends to sacrifice and him who singeth.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र दृह्य यामकोशा अभूवन्यज्ञाय शिक्ष गृणते सखिभ्यः
pada pāṭha: indra | dr̥hya | yāma-kośāḥ | abhūvan | yajñāya | śikṣa | gr̥ṇate | sakhi-bhyaḥ || duḥ-māyavaḥ | duḥ-evāḥ | martyāsaḥ | niṣaṅgiṇaḥ | ripavaḥ | hantvāsaḥ ||3.30.15||

IAST: durmāyavo durevā martyāso niṣaṅgiṇo ripavo hantvāsaḥ
Griffith: These must be slain by thee, malignant mortals, armed with ill arts, our quiverbearing foemen.
Devanāgarī: दुर्मायवो दुरेवा मर्त्यासो निषङ्गिणो रिपवो हन्त्वासः
pada pāṭha: indra | dr̥hya | yāma-kośāḥ | abhūvan | yajñāya | śikṣa | gr̥ṇate | sakhi-bhyaḥ || duḥ-māyavaḥ | duḥ-evāḥ | martyāsaḥ | niṣaṅgiṇaḥ | ripavaḥ | hantvāsaḥ ||3.30.15||

IAST: saṁ ghoṣaḥ śṛṇve 'vamair amitrair jahī ny eṣv aśaniṁ tapiṣṭhām
Griffith: A cry is beard from enemies most near us: against them send thy fiercest-flaming weapon.
Devanāgarī: सं घोषः शृण्वेऽवमैरमित्रैर्जही न्येष्वशनिं तपिष्ठाम्
pada pāṭha: sam | ghoṣaḥ | śr̥ṇve | avamaiḥ | amitraiḥ | jahi | ni | eṣu | aśanim | tapiṣṭhām || vr̥śca | īm | adhastāt | vi | ruja | sahasva | jahi | rakṣaḥ | magha-van | randhayasva ||3.30.16||

IAST: vṛścem adhastād vi rujā sahasva jahi rakṣo maghavan randhayasva
Griffith: Rend them from under, crush them and subdue them. Slay, Maghavan, and make the fiends our booty.
Devanāgarī: वृश्चेमधस्ताद्वि रुजा सहस्व जहि रक्षो मघवन्रन्धयस्व
pada pāṭha: sam | ghoṣaḥ | śr̥ṇve | avamaiḥ | amitraiḥ | jahi | ni | eṣu | aśanim | tapiṣṭhām || vr̥śca | īm | adhastāt | vi | ruja | sahasva | jahi | rakṣaḥ | magha-van | randhayasva ||3.30.16||

IAST: ud vṛha rakṣaḥ sahamūlam indra vṛścā madhyam praty agraṁ śṛṇīhi
Griffith: Root up the race of Raksasas, O Indra rend it in front and crush it in the middle.
Devanāgarī: उद्वृह रक्षः सहमूलमिन्द्र वृश्चा मध्यं प्रत्यग्रं शृणीहि
pada pāṭha: ut | vr̥ha | rakṣaḥ | saha-mūlam | indra | vr̥śca | madhyam | prati | agram | śr̥ṇīhi || ā | kīvataḥ | salalūkam | cakartha | brahma-dviṣe | tapuṣim | hetim | asya ||3.30.17||

IAST: ā kīvataḥ salalūkaṁ cakartha brahmadviṣe tapuṣiṁ hetim asya
Griffith: How long hast thou bebaved as one who wavers? Cast thy hot dart at him who hates devotion:
Devanāgarī: आ कीवतः सललूकं चकर्थ ब्रह्मद्विषे तपुषिं हेतिमस्य
pada pāṭha: ut | vr̥ha | rakṣaḥ | saha-mūlam | indra | vr̥śca | madhyam | prati | agram | śr̥ṇīhi || ā | kīvataḥ | salalūkam | cakartha | brahma-dviṣe | tapuṣim | hetim | asya ||3.30.17||

IAST: svastaye vājibhiś ca praṇetaḥ saṁ yan mahīr iṣa āsatsi pūrvīḥ
Griffith: When borne by strong Steeds for our weal, O Leader, thou seatest thee at many noble viands.
Devanāgarī: स्वस्तये वाजिभिश्च प्रणेतः सं यन्महीरिष आसत्सि पूर्वीः
pada pāṭha: svastaye | vāji-bhiḥ | ca | pranetariti pra-netaḥ | sam | yat | mahīḥ | iṣaḥ | ā-satsi | pūrvīḥ || rāyaḥ | vantāraḥ | br̥hataḥ | syāma | asme iti | astu | bhagaḥ | indra | prajā-vān ||3.30.18||

IAST: rāyo vantāro bṛhataḥ syāmāsme astu bhaga indra prajāvān
Griffith: May we be winners of abundant riches. May Indra be our wealth with store of children.
Devanāgarī: रायो वन्तारो बृहतः स्यामास्मे अस्तु भग इन्द्र प्रजावान्
pada pāṭha: svastaye | vāji-bhiḥ | ca | pranetariti pra-netaḥ | sam | yat | mahīḥ | iṣaḥ | ā-satsi | pūrvīḥ || rāyaḥ | vantāraḥ | br̥hataḥ | syāma | asme iti | astu | bhagaḥ | indra | prajā-vān ||3.30.18||

IAST: ā no bhara bhagam indra dyumantaṁ ni te deṣṇasya dhīmahi prareke
Griffith: Bestow on us resplendent wealth. O Indra let us enjoy thine overflow of bounty.
Devanāgarī: आ नो भर भगमिन्द्र द्युमन्तं नि ते देष्णस्य धीमहि प्ररेके
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | bhara | bhagam | indra | dyu-mantam | ni | te | deṣṇasya | dhīmahi | pra-reke || ūrvaḥ-iva | paprathe | kāmaḥ | asme iti | tam | ā | pr̥ṇa | vasu-pate | vasūnām ||3.30.19||

IAST: ūrva iva paprathe kāmo asme tam ā pṛṇa vasupate vasūnām
Griffith: Wide as a sea our longing hath expanded, fulfil it, O thou Treasure-Lord of treasures.
Devanāgarī: ऊर्व इव पप्रथे कामो अस्मे तमा पृण वसुपते वसूनाम्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | bhara | bhagam | indra | dyu-mantam | ni | te | deṣṇasya | dhīmahi | pra-reke || ūrvaḥ-iva | paprathe | kāmaḥ | asme iti | tam | ā | pr̥ṇa | vasu-pate | vasūnām ||3.30.19||

IAST: imaṁ kāmam mandayā gobhir aśvaiś candravatā rādhasā paprathaś ca
Griffith: With kine and horses satisfy this longing with very splendid bounty skill extend it.
Devanāgarī: इमं कामं मन्दया गोभिरश्वैश्चन्द्रवता राधसा पप्रथश्च
pada pāṭha: imam | kāmam | mandaya | go-bhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | candra-vatā | rādhasā | paprathaḥ | ca || svaḥ-yavaḥ | mati-bhiḥ | tubhyam | viprāḥ | indrāya | vāhaḥ | kuśikāsaḥ | akran ||3.30.20||

IAST: svaryavo matibhis tubhyaṁ viprā indrāya vāhaḥ kuśikāso akran
Griffith: Seeking the light, with hymns to thee, O Indra, Kusikas have brought their gift, the singers.
Devanāgarī: स्वर्यवो मतिभिस्तुभ्यं विप्रा इन्द्राय वाहः कुशिकासो अक्रन्
pada pāṭha: imam | kāmam | mandaya | go-bhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | candra-vatā | rādhasā | paprathaḥ | ca || svaḥ-yavaḥ | mati-bhiḥ | tubhyam | viprāḥ | indrāya | vāhaḥ | kuśikāsaḥ | akran ||3.30.20||

IAST: ā no gotrā dardṛhi gopate gāḥ sam asmabhyaṁ sanayo yantu vājāḥ
Griffith: Lord of the kine, burst the kine's stable open: cows shall be ours, and strength that wins the booty.
Devanāgarī: आ नो गोत्रा दर्दृहि गोपते गाः समस्मभ्यं सनयो यन्तु वाजाः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | gotrā | dardr̥hi | go-pate | gāḥ | sam | asmabhyam | sanayaḥ | yantu | vājāḥ || divakṣāḥ | asi | vr̥ṣabha | satya-śuṣmaḥ | asmabhyam | su | magha-van | bodhi | go-dāḥ ||3.30.21||

IAST: divakṣā asi vṛṣabha satyaśuṣmo 'smabhyaṁ su maghavan bodhi godāḥ
Griffith: Hero, whose might is true, thy home is heaven: to us, O Maghavan, grant gifts of cattle.
Devanāgarī: दिवक्षा असि वृषभ सत्यशुष्मोऽस्मभ्यं सु मघवन्बोधि गोदाः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | gotrā | dardr̥hi | go-pate | gāḥ | sam | asmabhyam | sanayaḥ | yantu | vājāḥ || divakṣāḥ | asi | vr̥ṣabha | satya-śuṣmaḥ | asmabhyam | su | magha-van | bodhi | go-dāḥ ||3.30.21||

IAST: śunaṁ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṁ vājasātau
Griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in this fight where spoil is gathered,
Devanāgarī: शुनं हुवेम मघवानमिन्द्रमस्मिन्भरे नृतमं वाजसातौ
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.30.22||

IAST: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṁ vṛtrāṇi saṁjitaṁ dhanānām
Griffith: The Strong who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vrtras, wins and gathers riches.
Devanāgarī: शृण्वन्तमुग्रमूतये समत्सु घ्नन्तं वृत्राणि संजितं धनानाम्
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.30.22||

IAST: śāsad vahnir duhitur naptyaṁ gād vidvām̐ ṛtasya dīdhitiṁ saparyan
Griffith: WISE, teaching, following the thought of Order, the sonless gained a grandson from his daughter.
Devanāgarī: शासद्वह्निर्दुहितुर्नप्त्यं गाद्विद्वाँ ऋतस्य दीधितिं सपर्यन्
pada pāṭha: śāsat | vahniḥ | duhituḥ | naptyam | gāt | vidvān | r̥tasya | dīdhitim | saparyan || pitā | yatra | duhituḥ | sekam | r̥ñjan | sam | śagmyena | manasā | dadhanve ||3.31.1||

IAST: pitā yatra duhituḥ sekam ṛñjan saṁ śagmyena manasā dadhanve
Griffith: Fain, as a sire, to see his child prolific, he sped to meet her with an eager spirit.
Devanāgarī: पिता यत्र दुहितुः सेकमृञ्जन्सं शग्म्येन मनसा दधन्वे
pada pāṭha: śāsat | vahniḥ | duhituḥ | naptyam | gāt | vidvān | r̥tasya | dīdhitim | saparyan || pitā | yatra | duhituḥ | sekam | r̥ñjan | sam | śagmyena | manasā | dadhanve ||3.31.1||

IAST: na jāmaye tānvo riktham āraik cakāra garbhaṁ sanitur nidhānam
Griffith: The Son left not his portion to the brother, he made a home to hold him who should gain, it.
Devanāgarī: न जामये तान्वो रिक्थमारैक्चकार गर्भं सनितुर्निधानम्
pada pāṭha: na | jāmaye | tānvaḥ | riktham | araik | cakāra | garbham | sanituḥ | ni-dhānam || yadi | mātaraḥ | janayanta | vahnim | anyaḥ | kartā | su-kr̥toḥ | anyaḥ | r̥ndhan ||3.31.2||

IAST: yadī mātaro janayanta vahnim anyaḥ kartā sukṛtor anya ṛndhan
Griffith: What time his Parents gave the Priest his being, of the good pair one acted, one promoted.
Devanāgarī: यदी मातरो जनयन्त वह्निमन्यः कर्ता सुकृतोरन्य ऋन्धन्
pada pāṭha: na | jāmaye | tānvaḥ | riktham | araik | cakāra | garbham | sanituḥ | ni-dhānam || yadi | mātaraḥ | janayanta | vahnim | anyaḥ | kartā | su-kr̥toḥ | anyaḥ | r̥ndhan ||3.31.2||

IAST: agnir jajñe juhvā rejamāno mahas putrām̐ aruṣasya prayakṣe
Griffith: Agni was born trembling with tongue that flickered, so that the Red's great children should be honoured.
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्जज्ञे जुह्वा रेजमानो महस्पुत्राँ अरुषस्य प्रयक्षे
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | jajñe | juhvā | rejamānaḥ | mahaḥ | putrān | aruṣasya | pra-yakṣe || mahān | garbhaḥ | mahi | ā | jātam | eṣām | mahī | pra-vr̥t | hari-aśvasya | yajñaiḥ ||3.31.3||

IAST: mahān garbho mahy ā jātam eṣām mahī pravṛd dharyaśvasya yajñaiḥ
Griffith: Great is their germ, that born of them is mighty, great the Bays' Lord's approach through sacrifices.
Devanāgarī: महान्गर्भो मह्या जातमेषां मही प्रवृद्धर्यश्वस्य यज्ञैः
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | jajñe | juhvā | rejamānaḥ | mahaḥ | putrān | aruṣasya | pra-yakṣe || mahān | garbhaḥ | mahi | ā | jātam | eṣām | mahī | pra-vr̥t | hari-aśvasya | yajñaiḥ ||3.31.3||

IAST: abhi jaitrīr asacanta spṛdhānam mahi jyotis tamaso nir ajānan
Griffith: Conquering bands upon the Warrior waited: they recognized great light from out the darkness.
Devanāgarī: अभि जैत्रीरसचन्त स्पृधानं महि ज्योतिस्तमसो निरजानन्
pada pāṭha: abhi | jaitrīḥ | asacanta | spr̥dhānam | mahi | jyotiḥ | tamasaḥ | niḥ | ajānan || tam | jānatīḥ | prati | ut | āyan | uṣasaḥ | patiḥ | gavām | abhavat | ekaḥ | indraḥ ||3.31.4||

IAST: taṁ jānatīḥ praty ud āyann uṣāsaḥ patir gavām abhavad eka indraḥ
Griffith: The conscious Dawns went forth to meet his coming, and the sole Master of the kine was Indra.
Devanāgarī: तं जानतीः प्रत्युदायन्नुषासः पतिर्गवामभवदेक इन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: abhi | jaitrīḥ | asacanta | spr̥dhānam | mahi | jyotiḥ | tamasaḥ | niḥ | ajānan || tam | jānatīḥ | prati | ut | āyan | uṣasaḥ | patiḥ | gavām | abhavat | ekaḥ | indraḥ ||3.31.4||

IAST: vīḻau satīr abhi dhīrā atṛndan prācāhinvan manasā sapta viprāḥ
Griffith: The sages freed them from their firmbuilt prison: the seven priests drove them forward with their spirit.
Devanāgarī: वीळौ सतीरभि धीरा अतृन्दन्प्राचाहिन्वन्मनसा सप्त विप्राः
pada pāṭha: vīḷau | satīḥ | abhi | dhīrāḥ | atr̥ndan | prācā | ahinvan | manasā | sapta | viprāḥ || viśvām | avindan | pathyām | r̥tasya | pra-jānan | it | tā | namasā | ā | viveśa ||3.31.5||

IAST: viśvām avindan pathyām ṛtasya prajānann it tā namasā viveśa
Griffith: All holy Order's pathway they discovered he, full of knowledge, shared these deeds through worship.
Devanāgarī: विश्वामविन्दन्पथ्यामृतस्य प्रजानन्नित्ता नमसा विवेश
pada pāṭha: vīḷau | satīḥ | abhi | dhīrāḥ | atr̥ndan | prācā | ahinvan | manasā | sapta | viprāḥ || viśvām | avindan | pathyām | r̥tasya | pra-jānan | it | tā | namasā | ā | viveśa ||3.31.5||

IAST: vidad yadī saramā rugṇam adrer mahi pāthaḥ pūrvyaṁ sadhryak kaḥ
Griffith: When Sarama had found the mountain's fissure, that vast and ancient place she plundered thoroughly.
Devanāgarī: विदद्यदी सरमा रुग्णमद्रेर्महि पाथः पूर्व्यं सध्र्यक्कः
pada pāṭha: vidat | yadi | saramā | rugṇam | adreḥ | mahi | pāthaḥ | pūrvyam | sadhryak | kariti kaḥ || agram | nayat | su-padī | akṣarāṇām | accha | ravam | prathamā | jānatī | gāt ||3.31.6||

IAST: agraṁ nayat supady akṣarāṇām acchā ravam prathamā jānatī gāt
Griffith: In the floods' van she led them forth, light-footed: she who well knew came first unto their lowing.
Devanāgarī: अग्रं नयत्सुपद्यक्षराणामच्छा रवं प्रथमा जानती गात्
pada pāṭha: vidat | yadi | saramā | rugṇam | adreḥ | mahi | pāthaḥ | pūrvyam | sadhryak | kariti kaḥ || agram | nayat | su-padī | akṣarāṇām | accha | ravam | prathamā | jānatī | gāt ||3.31.6||

IAST: agacchad u vipratamaḥ sakhīyann asūdayat sukṛte garbham adriḥ
Griffith: Longing for friendship came the noblest singer: the hill poured forth its treasure for the pious.
Devanāgarī: अगच्छदु विप्रतमः सखीयन्नसूदयत्सुकृते गर्भमद्रिः
pada pāṭha: agacchat | ūm̐ iti | vipra-tamaḥ | sakhi-yan | asūdayat | su-kr̥te | garbham | adriḥ || sasāna | maryaḥ | yuva-bhiḥ | makhasyan | atha | abhavat | aṅgirāḥ | sadyaḥ | arcan ||3.31.7||

IAST: sasāna maryo yuvabhir makhasyann athābhavad aṅgirāḥ sadyo arcan
Griffith: The Hero with young followers fought and conquered, and straightway Angiras was singing praises,
Devanāgarī: ससान मर्यो युवभिर्मखस्यन्नथाभवदङ्गिराः सद्यो अर्चन्
pada pāṭha: agacchat | ūm̐ iti | vipra-tamaḥ | sakhi-yan | asūdayat | su-kr̥te | garbham | adriḥ || sasāna | maryaḥ | yuva-bhiḥ | makhasyan | atha | abhavat | aṅgirāḥ | sadyaḥ | arcan ||3.31.7||

IAST: sataḥ-sataḥ pratimānam purobhūr viśvā veda janimā hanti śuṣṇam
Griffith: Peer of each noble thing, yea, all excelling, all creatures doth he know, he slayeth Susna.
Devanāgarī: सतःसतः प्रतिमानं पुरोभूर्विश्वा वेद जनिमा हन्ति शुष्णम्
pada pāṭha: sataḥ-sataḥ | prati-mānam | puraḥ-bhūḥ | viśvā | veda | janima | hanti | śuṣṇam || pra | naḥ | divaḥ | pada-vīḥ | gavyuḥ | arcan | sakhā | sakhīn | amuñcat | niḥ | avadyāt ||3.31.8||

IAST: pra ṇo divaḥ padavīr gavyur arcan sakhā sakhīm̐r amuñcan nir avadyāt
Griffith: Our leader, fain for war, singing from heaven, as Friend he saved his lovers from dishonour.
Devanāgarī: प्र णो दिवः पदवीर्गव्युरर्चन्सखा सखीँरमुञ्चन्निरवद्यात्
pada pāṭha: sataḥ-sataḥ | prati-mānam | puraḥ-bhūḥ | viśvā | veda | janima | hanti | śuṣṇam || pra | naḥ | divaḥ | pada-vīḥ | gavyuḥ | arcan | sakhā | sakhīn | amuñcat | niḥ | avadyāt ||3.31.8||

IAST: ni gavyatā manasā sedur arkaiḥ kṛṇvānāso amṛtatvāya gātum
Griffith: They sate them down with spirit fain for booty, making with hymns a way to life eternal.
Devanāgarī: नि गव्यता मनसा सेदुरर्कैः कृण्वानासो अमृतत्वाय गातुम्
pada pāṭha: ni | gavyatā | manasā | seduḥ | arkaiḥ | kr̥ṇvānāsaḥ | amr̥ta-tvāya | gātum || idam | cit | nu | sadanam | bhūri | eṣām | yena | māsān | asisāsan | r̥tena ||3.31.9||

IAST: idaṁ cin nu sadanam bhūry eṣāṁ yena māsām̐ asiṣāsann ṛtena
Griffith: And this is still their place of frequent session, whereby they sought to gain the months through Order.
Devanāgarī: इदं चिन्नु सदनं भूर्येषां येन मासाँ असिषासन्नृतेन
pada pāṭha: ni | gavyatā | manasā | seduḥ | arkaiḥ | kr̥ṇvānāsaḥ | amr̥ta-tvāya | gātum || idam | cit | nu | sadanam | bhūri | eṣām | yena | māsān | asisāsan | r̥tena ||3.31.9||

IAST: sampaśyamānā amadann abhi svam payaḥ pratnasya retaso dughānāḥ
Griffith: Drawing the milk of ancient seed prolific, they joyed as they beheld their own possession.
Devanāgarī: सम्पश्यमाना अमदन्नभि स्वं पयः प्रत्नस्य रेतसो दुघानाः
pada pāṭha: sam-paśyamānāḥ | amadan | abhi | svam | payaḥ | pratnasya | retasaḥ | dughānāḥ || vi | rodasī iti | atapat | ghoṣaḥ | eṣām | jāte | niḥ-sthām | adadhuḥ | goṣu | vīrān ||3.31.10||

IAST: vi rodasī atapad ghoṣa eṣāṁ jāte niṣṭhām adadhur goṣu vīrān
Griffith: Their shout of triumph heated earth and heaven. When the kine showed, they bade the heroes rouse them.
Devanāgarī: वि रोदसी अतपद्घोष एषां जाते निष्ठामदधुर्गोषु वीरान्
pada pāṭha: sam-paśyamānāḥ | amadan | abhi | svam | payaḥ | pratnasya | retasaḥ | dughānāḥ || vi | rodasī iti | atapat | ghoṣaḥ | eṣām | jāte | niḥ-sthām | adadhuḥ | goṣu | vīrān ||3.31.10||

IAST: sa jātebhir vṛtrahā sed u havyair ud usriyā asṛjad indro arkaiḥ
Griffith: Indra drove forth the kine, that Vrtra-slayer, while hymns of praise rose up and gifts were offered.
Devanāgarī: स जातेभिर्वृत्रहा सेदु हव्यैरुदुस्रिया असृजदिन्द्रो अर्कैः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | jātebhiḥ | vr̥tra-hā | saḥ | it | ūm̐ iti | havyaiḥ | ut | usriyāḥ | asr̥jat | indraḥ | arkaiḥ || urūcī | asmai | ghr̥ta-vat | bharantī | madhu | svādma | duduhe | jenyā | gauḥ ||3.31.11||

IAST: urūcy asmai ghṛtavad bharantī madhu svādma duduhe jenyā gauḥ
Griffith: For him the Cow, noble and far-extending, poured pleasant juices, bringing oil and sweetness.
Devanāgarī: उरूच्यस्मै घृतवद्भरन्ती मधु स्वाद्म दुदुहे जेन्या गौः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | jātebhiḥ | vr̥tra-hā | saḥ | it | ūm̐ iti | havyaiḥ | ut | usriyāḥ | asr̥jat | indraḥ | arkaiḥ || urūcī | asmai | ghr̥ta-vat | bharantī | madhu | svādma | duduhe | jenyā | gauḥ ||3.31.11||

IAST: pitre cic cakruḥ sadanaṁ sam asmai mahi tviṣīmat sukṛto vi hi khyan
Griffith: They made a mansion for their Father, deftly provided him a great and glorious dwelling;
Devanāgarī: पित्रे चिच्चक्रुः सदनं समस्मै महि त्विषीमत्सुकृतो वि हि ख्यन्
pada pāṭha: pitre | cit | cakruḥ | sadanam | sam | asmai | mahi | tviṣi-mat | su-kr̥taḥ | vi | hi | khyan || vi-skabhnantaḥ | skambhanena | janitrī iti | āsīnāḥ | ūrdhvam | rabhasam | vi | minvan ||3.31.12||

IAST: viṣkabhnantaḥ skambhanenā janitrī āsīnā ūrdhvaṁ rabhasaṁ vi minvan
Griffith: With firm support parted and stayed the Parents, and, sitting, fixed him there erected, mighty.
Devanāgarī: विष्कभ्नन्तः स्कम्भनेना जनित्री आसीना ऊर्ध्वं रभसं वि मिन्वन्
pada pāṭha: pitre | cit | cakruḥ | sadanam | sam | asmai | mahi | tviṣi-mat | su-kr̥taḥ | vi | hi | khyan || vi-skabhnantaḥ | skambhanena | janitrī iti | āsīnāḥ | ūrdhvam | rabhasam | vi | minvan ||3.31.12||

IAST: mahī yadi dhiṣaṇā śiśnathe dhāt sadyovṛdhaṁ vibhvaṁ rodasyoḥ
Griffith: What time the ample chalice had impelled him, swift waxing, vast, to pierce the earth and heaven,-
Devanāgarī: मही यदि धिषणा शिश्नथे धात्सद्योवृधं विभ्वं रोदस्योः
pada pāṭha: mahī | yadi | dhiṣaṇā | śiśnathe | dhāt | sadyaḥ-vr̥dham | vi-bhvam | rodasyoḥ || giraḥ | yasmin | anavadyāḥ | sam-īcīḥ | viśvāḥ | indrāya | taviṣīḥ | anuttāḥ ||3.31.13||

IAST: giro yasminn anavadyāḥ samīcīr viśvā indrāya taviṣīr anuttāḥ
Griffith: Him in whom blameless songs are all united: all powers invincible belong to Indra.
Devanāgarī: गिरो यस्मिन्ननवद्याः समीचीर्विश्वा इन्द्राय तविषीरनुत्ताः
pada pāṭha: mahī | yadi | dhiṣaṇā | śiśnathe | dhāt | sadyaḥ-vr̥dham | vi-bhvam | rodasyoḥ || giraḥ | yasmin | anavadyāḥ | sam-īcīḥ | viśvāḥ | indrāya | taviṣīḥ | anuttāḥ ||3.31.13||

IAST: mahy ā te sakhyaṁ vaśmi śaktīr ā vṛtraghne niyuto yanti pūrvīḥ
Griffith: I crave thy powers, I crave thy mighty friendship: full many a team goes to the Vrtra-slayer.
Devanāgarī: मह्या ते सख्यं वश्मि शक्तीरा वृत्रघ्ने नियुतो यन्ति पूर्वीः
pada pāṭha: mahi | ā | te | sakhyam | vaśmi | śaktīḥ | ā | vr̥tra-ghne | ni-yutaḥ | yanti | pūrvīḥ || mahi | stotram | avaḥ | ā | aganma | sūreḥ | asmākam | su | magha-van | bodhi | gopāḥ ||3.31.14||

IAST: mahi stotram ava āganma sūrer asmākaṁ su maghavan bodhi gopāḥ
Griffith: Great is the laud, we seek the Princes' favour. Be thou, O Maghavan, our guard and keeper.
Devanāgarī: महि स्तोत्रमव आगन्म सूरेरस्माकं सु मघवन्बोधि गोपाः
pada pāṭha: mahi | ā | te | sakhyam | vaśmi | śaktīḥ | ā | vr̥tra-ghne | ni-yutaḥ | yanti | pūrvīḥ || mahi | stotram | avaḥ | ā | aganma | sūreḥ | asmākam | su | magha-van | bodhi | gopāḥ ||3.31.14||

IAST: mahi kṣetram puru ścandraṁ vividvān ād it sakhibhyaś carathaṁ sam airat
Griffith: He, having found great, splendid, rich dominion, sent life and motion to his friends and lovers.
Devanāgarī: महि क्षेत्रं पुरु श्चन्द्रं विविद्वानादित्सखिभ्यश्चरथं समैरत्
pada pāṭha: mahi | kṣetram | puru | candram | vividvān | āt | it | sakhi-bhyaḥ | caratham | sam | airat || indraḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ | ajanat | dīdyānaḥ | sākam | sūryam | uṣasam | gātum | agnim ||3.31.15||

IAST: indro nṛbhir ajanad dīdyānaḥ sākaṁ sūryam uṣasaṁ gātum agnim
Griffith: Indra who shone together with the Heroes begot the song, the fire, and Sun and Morning.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो नृभिरजनद्दीद्यानः साकं सूर्यमुषसं गातुमग्निम्
pada pāṭha: mahi | kṣetram | puru | candram | vividvān | āt | it | sakhi-bhyaḥ | caratham | sam | airat || indraḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ | ajanat | dīdyānaḥ | sākam | sūryam | uṣasam | gātum | agnim ||3.31.15||

IAST: apaś cid eṣa vibhvo damūnāḥ pra sadhrīcīr asṛjad viśvaścandrāḥ
Griffith: Vast, the House-Friend, he set the waters flowing, all-lucid, widely spread, that move together.
Devanāgarī: अपश्चिदेष विभ्वो दमूनाः प्र सध्रीचीरसृजद्विश्वश्चन्द्राः
pada pāṭha: apaḥ | cit | eṣaḥ | vi-bhvaḥ | damūnāḥ | pra | sadhrīcīḥ | asr̥jat | viśva-candrāḥ || madhvaḥ | punānāḥ | kavi-bhiḥ | pavitraiḥ | dyu-bhiḥ | hinvanti | aktu-bhiḥ | dhanutrīḥ ||3.31.16||

IAST: madhvaḥ punānāḥ kavibhiḥ pavitrair dyubhir hinvanty aktubhir dhanutrīḥ
Griffith: By the wise cleansings of the meath made holy, through days, and nights they speed the swift streams onward.
Devanāgarī: मध्वः पुनानाः कविभिः पवित्रैर्द्युभिर्हिन्वन्त्यक्तुभिर्धनुत्रीः
pada pāṭha: apaḥ | cit | eṣaḥ | vi-bhvaḥ | damūnāḥ | pra | sadhrīcīḥ | asr̥jat | viśva-candrāḥ || madhvaḥ | punānāḥ | kavi-bhiḥ | pavitraiḥ | dyu-bhiḥ | hinvanti | aktu-bhiḥ | dhanutrīḥ ||3.31.16||

IAST: anu kṛṣṇe vasudhitī jihāte ubhe sūryasya maṁhanā yajatre
Griffith: To thee proceed the dark, the treasure-holders, both of them sanctified by Surya's bounty.
Devanāgarī: अनु कृष्णे वसुधिती जिहाते उभे सूर्यस्य मंहना यजत्रे
pada pāṭha: anu | kr̥ṣṇe iti | vasudhitī iti vasu-dhitī | jihāte iti | ubhe iti | sūryasya | maṁhanā | yajatre iti || pari | yat | te | mahimānam | vr̥jadhyai | sakhāyaḥ | indra | kāmyāḥ | r̥jipyāḥ ||3.31.17||

IAST: pari yat te mahimānaṁ vṛjadhyai sakhāya indra kāmyā ṛjipyāḥ
Griffith: The while thy ovely storming Friends, O Indra, fail to attain the measure of thy greatness.
Devanāgarī: परि यत्ते महिमानं वृजध्यै सखाय इन्द्र काम्या ऋजिप्याः
pada pāṭha: anu | kr̥ṣṇe iti | vasudhitī iti vasu-dhitī | jihāte iti | ubhe iti | sūryasya | maṁhanā | yajatre iti || pari | yat | te | mahimānam | vr̥jadhyai | sakhāyaḥ | indra | kāmyāḥ | r̥jipyāḥ ||3.31.17||

IAST: patir bhava vṛtrahan sūnṛtānāṁ girāṁ viśvāyur vṛṣabho vayodhāḥ
Griffith: Be Lord of joyous songs, O Vrtra-slayer, Bull dear to all, who gives the power of living.
Devanāgarī: पतिर्भव वृत्रहन्सूनृतानां गिरां विश्वायुर्वृषभो वयोधाः
pada pāṭha: patiḥ | bhava | vr̥tra-han | sūnr̥tānām | girām | viśva-āyuḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | vayaḥ-dhāḥ || ā | naḥ | gahi | sakhyebhiḥ | śivebhiḥ | mahān | mahībhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ | saraṇyan ||3.31.18||

IAST: ā no gahi sakhyebhiḥ śivebhir mahān mahībhir ūtibhiḥ saraṇyan
Griffith: Come unto us with thine auspicious friendship, hastening, Mighty One, with mighty succours.
Devanāgarī: आ नो गहि सख्येभिः शिवेभिर्महान्महीभिरूतिभिः सरण्यन्
pada pāṭha: patiḥ | bhava | vr̥tra-han | sūnr̥tānām | girām | viśva-āyuḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | vayaḥ-dhāḥ || ā | naḥ | gahi | sakhyebhiḥ | śivebhiḥ | mahān | mahībhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ | saraṇyan ||3.31.18||

IAST: tam aṅgirasvan namasā saparyan navyaṁ kṛṇomi sanyase purājām
Griffith: Like Angiras I honour him with worship, and renovate old song for him the Ancient.
Devanāgarī: तमङ्गिरस्वन्नमसा सपर्यन्नव्यं कृणोमि सन्यसे पुराजाम्
pada pāṭha: tam | aṅgirasvat | namasā | saparyan | navyam | kr̥ṇomi | sanyase | purā-jām || druhaḥ | vi | yāhi | bahulāḥ | adevīḥ | svariti svaḥ | ca | naḥ | magha-van | sātaye | dhāḥ ||3.31.19||

IAST: druho vi yāhi bahulā adevīḥ svaś ca no maghavan sātaye dhāḥ
Griffith: Chase thou the many godless evil creatures, and give us, Maghavan, heaven's light to help m.
Devanāgarī: द्रुहो वि याहि बहुला अदेवीः स्वश्च नो मघवन्सातये धाः
pada pāṭha: tam | aṅgirasvat | namasā | saparyan | navyam | kr̥ṇomi | sanyase | purā-jām || druhaḥ | vi | yāhi | bahulāḥ | adevīḥ | svariti svaḥ | ca | naḥ | magha-van | sātaye | dhāḥ ||3.31.19||

IAST: mihaḥ pāvakāḥ pratatā abhūvan svasti naḥ pipṛhi pāram āsām
Griffith: Far forth are spread the purifying waters convey thou us across them unto safety.
Devanāgarī: मिहः पावकाः प्रतता अभूवन्स्वस्ति नः पिपृहि पारमासाम्
pada pāṭha: mihaḥ | pāvakāḥ | pra-tatāḥ | abhūvan | svasti | naḥ | pipr̥hi | pāram | āsām || indra | tvam | rathiraḥ | pāhi | naḥ | riṣaḥ | makṣu-makṣu | kr̥ṇuhi | go-jitaḥ | naḥ ||3.31.20||

IAST: indra tvaṁ rathiraḥ pāhi no riṣo makṣū-makṣū kṛṇuhi gojito naḥ
Griffith: Save us, our Charioteer, from harm, O Indra, soon, very soon, make us win spoil of cattle.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र त्वं रथिरः पाहि नो रिषो मक्षूमक्षू कृणुहि गोजितो नः
pada pāṭha: mihaḥ | pāvakāḥ | pra-tatāḥ | abhūvan | svasti | naḥ | pipr̥hi | pāram | āsām || indra | tvam | rathiraḥ | pāhi | naḥ | riṣaḥ | makṣu-makṣu | kr̥ṇuhi | go-jitaḥ | naḥ ||3.31.20||

IAST: adediṣṭa vṛtrahā gopatir gā antaḥ kṛṣṇām̐ aruṣair dhāmabhir gāt
Griffith: His kine their Lord hath shown, e'en Vrtra's slayer, through the black hosts he passed with red attendants.
Devanāgarī: अदेदिष्ट वृत्रहा गोपतिर्गा अन्तः कृष्णाँ अरुषैर्धामभिर्गात्
pada pāṭha: adediṣṭa | vr̥tra-hā | go-patiḥ | gāḥ | antariti | kr̥ṣṇān | aruṣaiḥ | dhāma-bhiḥ | gāt || pra | sūnr̥tāḥ | diśamānaḥ | r̥tena | duraḥ | ca | viśvāḥ | avr̥ṇot | apa | svāḥ ||3.31.21||

IAST: pra sūnṛtā diśamāna ṛtena duraś ca viśvā avṛṇod apa svāḥ
Griffith: Teaching us pleasant things by holy Order, to, us hath he thrown open all his portals.
Devanāgarī: प्र सूनृता दिशमान ऋतेन दुरश्च विश्वा अवृणोदप स्वाः
pada pāṭha: adediṣṭa | vr̥tra-hā | go-patiḥ | gāḥ | antariti | kr̥ṣṇān | aruṣaiḥ | dhāma-bhiḥ | gāt || pra | sūnr̥tāḥ | diśamānaḥ | r̥tena | duraḥ | ca | viśvāḥ | avr̥ṇot | apa | svāḥ ||3.31.21||

IAST: śunaṁ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṁ vājasātau
Griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in this fight where spoil is gathered.
Devanāgarī: शुनं हुवेम मघवानमिन्द्रमस्मिन्भरे नृतमं वाजसातौ
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.31.22||

IAST: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṁ vṛtrāṇi saṁjitaṁ dhanānām
Griffith: The Strong who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vrtras, wins and gathers riches.
Devanāgarī: शृण्वन्तमुग्रमूतये समत्सु घ्नन्तं वृत्राणि संजितं धनानाम्
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.31.22||

IAST: indra somaṁ somapate pibemam mādhyaṁdinaṁ savanaṁ cāru yat te
Griffith: DRINK thou this Soma, Indra, Lord of Soma; drink thou the draught of noonday which thou Iovest.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र सोमं सोमपते पिबेमं माध्यंदिनं सवनं चारु यत्ते
pada pāṭha: indra | somam | soma-pate | piba | imam | mādhyaṁdinam | savanam | cāru | yat | te || pra-pruthya | śipre iti | magha-van | r̥jīṣin | vi-mucya | harī iti | iha | mādayasva ||3.32.1||

IAST: prapruthyā śipre maghavann ṛjīṣin vimucyā harī iha mādayasva
Griffith: Puffing thy cheeks, impetuous, liberal Giver, here loose thy two Bay Horses and rejoice thee.
Devanāgarī: प्रप्रुथ्या शिप्रे मघवन्नृजीषिन्विमुच्या हरी इह मादयस्व
pada pāṭha: indra | somam | soma-pate | piba | imam | mādhyaṁdinam | savanam | cāru | yat | te || pra-pruthya | śipre iti | magha-van | r̥jīṣin | vi-mucya | harī iti | iha | mādayasva ||3.32.1||

IAST: gavāśiram manthinam indra śukram pibā somaṁ rarimā te madāya
Griffith: Quaff it pure, meal-blent, mixt with milk, O Indra; we have poured forth the Soma for thy rapture.
Devanāgarī: गवाशिरं मन्थिनमिन्द्र शुक्रं पिबा सोमं ररिमा ते मदाय
pada pāṭha: go-āśiram | manthinam | indra | śukram | piba | somam | rarima | te | madāya || brahma-kr̥tā | mārutena | gaṇena | sa-joṣāḥ | rudraiḥ | tr̥pat | ā | vr̥ṣasva ||3.32.2||

IAST: brahmakṛtā mārutenā gaṇena sajoṣā rudrais tṛpad ā vṛṣasva
Griffith: Knit with the prayer-fulfilling band of Maruts, yea, with the Rudras, drink till thou art sated;
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्मकृता मारुतेना गणेन सजोषा रुद्रैस्तृपदा वृषस्व
pada pāṭha: go-āśiram | manthinam | indra | śukram | piba | somam | rarima | te | madāya || brahma-kr̥tā | mārutena | gaṇena | sa-joṣāḥ | rudraiḥ | tr̥pat | ā | vr̥ṣasva ||3.32.2||

IAST: ye te śuṣmaṁ ye taviṣīm avardhann arcanta indra marutas ta ojaḥ
Griffith: Those who gave increase to thy strength and vigour; the Maruts singing forth thy might, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: ये ते शुष्मं ये तविषीमवर्धन्नर्चन्त इन्द्र मरुतस्त ओजः
pada pāṭha: ye | te | śuṣmam | ye | taviṣīm | avardhan | arcantaḥ | indra | marutaḥ | te | ojaḥ || mādhyaṁdine | savane | vajra-hasta | piba | rudrebhiḥ | sa-gaṇaḥ | su-śipra ||3.32.3||

IAST: mādhyaṁdine savane vajrahasta pibā rudrebhiḥ sagaṇaḥ suśipra
Griffith: Drink thou, O fair of cheek, whose hand wields thunder, with Rudras banded, at our noon libation.
Devanāgarī: माध्यंदिने सवने वज्रहस्त पिबा रुद्रेभिः सगणः सुशिप्र
pada pāṭha: ye | te | śuṣmam | ye | taviṣīm | avardhan | arcantaḥ | indra | marutaḥ | te | ojaḥ || mādhyaṁdine | savane | vajra-hasta | piba | rudrebhiḥ | sa-gaṇaḥ | su-śipra ||3.32.3||

IAST: ta in nv asya madhumad vivipra indrasya śardho maruto ya āsan
Griffith: They, even the Maruts who were there, excited with song the meath-created strength of Indra.
Devanāgarī: त इन्न्वस्य मधुमद्विविप्र इन्द्रस्य शर्धो मरुतो य आसन्
pada pāṭha: te | it | nu | asya | madhu-mat | vivipre | indrasya | śardhaḥ | marutaḥ | ye | āsan || yebhiḥ | vr̥trasya | iṣitaḥ | viveda | amarmaṇaḥ | manyamānasya | marma ||3.32.4||

IAST: yebhir vṛtrasyeṣito vivedāmarmaṇo manyamānasya marma
Griffith: By them impelled to act he reached the vitals Of Vrtra, though he deemed that none might wound him.
Devanāgarī: येभिर्वृत्रस्येषितो विवेदामर्मणो मन्यमानस्य मर्म
pada pāṭha: te | it | nu | asya | madhu-mat | vivipre | indrasya | śardhaḥ | marutaḥ | ye | āsan || yebhiḥ | vr̥trasya | iṣitaḥ | viveda | amarmaṇaḥ | manyamānasya | marma ||3.32.4||

IAST: manuṣvad indra savanaṁ juṣāṇaḥ pibā somaṁ śaśvate vīryāya
Griffith: Pleased, like a man, with our libation, Indra, drink, for enduring hero might, the Soma.
Devanāgarī: मनुष्वदिन्द्र सवनं जुषाणः पिबा सोमं शश्वते वीर्याय
pada pāṭha: manuṣvat | indra | savanam | juṣāṇaḥ | piba | somam | śaśvate | vīryāya || saḥ | ā | vavr̥tsva | hari-aśva | yajñaiḥ | saraṇyu-bhiḥ | apaḥ | arṇā | sisarṣi ||3.32.5||

IAST: sa ā vavṛtsva haryaśva yajñaiḥ saraṇyubhir apo arṇā sisarṣi
Griffith: Lord of Bays, moved by sacrifice come hither: thou with the Swift Ones stirrest floods and waters.
Devanāgarī: स आ ववृत्स्व हर्यश्व यज्ञैः सरण्युभिरपो अर्णा सिसर्षि
pada pāṭha: manuṣvat | indra | savanam | juṣāṇaḥ | piba | somam | śaśvate | vīryāya || saḥ | ā | vavr̥tsva | hari-aśva | yajñaiḥ | saraṇyu-bhiḥ | apaḥ | arṇā | sisarṣi ||3.32.5||

IAST: tvam apo yad dha vṛtraṁ jaghanvām̐ atyām̐ iva prāsṛjaḥ sartavājau
Griffith: When thou didst loose the streams to run like racers in the swift contest, having smitten Vrtra
Devanāgarī: त्वमपो यद्ध वृत्रं जघन्वाँ अत्याँ इव प्रासृजः सर्तवाजौ
pada pāṭha: tvam | apaḥ | yat | ha | vr̥tram | jaghanvān | atyān-iva | pra | asr̥jaḥ | sartavai | ājau || śayānam | indra | caratā | vadhena | vavri-vāṁsam | pari | devīḥ | adevam ||3.32.6||

IAST: śayānam indra caratā vadhena vavrivāṁsam pari devīr adevam
Griffith: With flying weapon where he lay, O Indra, and, godless, kept the Goddesses encompassed.
Devanāgarī: शयानमिन्द्र चरता वधेन वव्रिवांसं परि देवीरदेवम्
pada pāṭha: tvam | apaḥ | yat | ha | vr̥tram | jaghanvān | atyān-iva | pra | asr̥jaḥ | sartavai | ājau || śayānam | indra | caratā | vadhena | vavri-vāṁsam | pari | devīḥ | adevam ||3.32.6||

IAST: yajāma in namasā vṛddham indram bṛhantam ṛṣvam ajaraṁ yuvānam
Griffith: With reverence let us worship mighty Indra, great and sublime, eternal, everyouthful,
Devanāgarī: यजाम इन्नमसा वृद्धमिन्द्रं बृहन्तमृष्वमजरं युवानम्
pada pāṭha: yajāmaḥ | it | namasā | vr̥ddham | indram | br̥hantam | r̥ṣvam | ajaram | yuvānam || yasya | priye iti | mamatuḥ | yajñiyasya | na | rodasī iti | mahimānam | mamāte iti ||3.32.7||

IAST: yasya priye mamatur yajñiyasya na rodasī mahimānam mamāte
Griffith: Whose greatness the dear world-halves have not measured, no, nor conceived the might of him the Holy.
Devanāgarī: यस्य प्रिये ममतुर्यज्ञियस्य न रोदसी महिमानं ममाते
