pada pāṭha: yajāmaḥ | it | namasā | vr̥ddham | indram | br̥hantam | r̥ṣvam | ajaram | yuvānam || yasya | priye iti | mamatuḥ | yajñiyasya | na | rodasī iti | mahimānam | mamāte iti ||3.32.7||

IAST: indrasya karma sukṛtā purūṇi vratāni devā na minanti viśve
Griffith: Many are Indra's nobly wrought achievements, and none of all the Gods transgress his statutes.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रस्य कर्म सुकृता पुरूणि व्रतानि देवा न मिनन्ति विश्वे
pada pāṭha: indrasya | karma | su-kr̥tā | purūṇi | vratāni | devāḥ | na | minanti | viśve || dādhāra | yaḥ | pr̥thivīm | dyām | uta | imām | jajāna | sūryam | uṣasam | su-daṁsāḥ ||3.32.8||

IAST: dādhāra yaḥ pṛthivīṁ dyām utemāṁ jajāna sūryam uṣasaṁ sudaṁsāḥ
Griffith: He beareth up this earth and heaven, and, doer of marvels, he begot the Sun and Morning.
Devanāgarī: दाधार यः पृथिवीं द्यामुतेमां जजान सूर्यमुषसं सुदंसाः
pada pāṭha: indrasya | karma | su-kr̥tā | purūṇi | vratāni | devāḥ | na | minanti | viśve || dādhāra | yaḥ | pr̥thivīm | dyām | uta | imām | jajāna | sūryam | uṣasam | su-daṁsāḥ ||3.32.8||

IAST: adrogha satyaṁ tava tan mahitvaṁ sadyo yaj jāto apibo ha somam
Griffith: Herein, O Guileless One, is thy true greatness, that soon as born thou drankest up the Soma.
Devanāgarī: अद्रोघ सत्यं तव तन्महित्वं सद्यो यज्जातो अपिबो ह सोमम्
pada pāṭha: adrogha | satyam | tava | tat | mahi-tvam | sadyaḥ | yat | jātaḥ | apibaḥ | ha | somam || na | dyāvaḥ | indra | tavasaḥ | te | ojaḥ | na | ahā | na | māsāḥ | śaradaḥ | varanta ||3.32.9||

IAST: na dyāva indra tavasas ta ojo nāhā na māsāḥ śarado varanta
Griffith: Days may not check the power of thee the Mighty, nor the nights, Indra, nor the months, nor autumns.
Devanāgarī: न द्याव इन्द्र तवसस्त ओजो नाहा न मासाः शरदो वरन्त
pada pāṭha: adrogha | satyam | tava | tat | mahi-tvam | sadyaḥ | yat | jātaḥ | apibaḥ | ha | somam || na | dyāvaḥ | indra | tavasaḥ | te | ojaḥ | na | ahā | na | māsāḥ | śaradaḥ | varanta ||3.32.9||

IAST: tvaṁ sadyo apibo jāta indra madāya somam parame vyoman
Griffith: As soon as thou wast born in highest heaven thou drankest Soma to delight thee, Indra;
Devanāgarī: त्वं सद्यो अपिबो जात इन्द्र मदाय सोमं परमे व्योमन्
pada pāṭha: tvam | sadyaḥ | apibaḥ | jātaḥ | indra | madāya | somam | parame | vi-oman || yat | ha | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | ā | aviveśīḥ | atha | abhavaḥ | pūrvyaḥ | kāru-dhāyāḥ ||3.32.10||

IAST: yad dha dyāvāpṛthivī āviveśīr athābhavaḥ pūrvyaḥ kārudhāyāḥ
Griffith: And when thou hadst pervaded earth and heaven thou wast the first supporter of the singer.
Devanāgarī: यद्ध द्यावापृथिवी आविवेशीरथाभवः पूर्व्यः कारुधायाः
pada pāṭha: tvam | sadyaḥ | apibaḥ | jātaḥ | indra | madāya | somam | parame | vi-oman || yat | ha | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | ā | aviveśīḥ | atha | abhavaḥ | pūrvyaḥ | kāru-dhāyāḥ ||3.32.10||

IAST: ahann ahim pariśayānam arṇa ojāyamānaṁ tuvijāta tavyān
Griffith: Thou, puissant God, more mighty, slewest. Ahi showing his strength when couched around the waters.
Devanāgarī: अहन्नहिं परिशयानमर्ण ओजायमानं तुविजात तव्यान्
pada pāṭha: ahan | ahim | pari-śayānam | arṇaḥ | ojāyamānam | tuvi-jāta | tavyān || na | te | mahi-tvam | anu | bhūt | adha | dyauḥ | yat | anyayā | sphigyā | kṣām | avasthāḥ ||3.32.11||

IAST: na te mahitvam anu bhūd adha dyaur yad anyayā sphigyā kṣām avasthāḥ
Griffith: The heaven itself attained not to thy greatness when with one hip of thine the earth was shadowed.
Devanāgarī: न ते महित्वमनु भूदध द्यौर्यदन्यया स्फिग्या क्षामवस्थाः
pada pāṭha: ahan | ahim | pari-śayānam | arṇaḥ | ojāyamānam | tuvi-jāta | tavyān || na | te | mahi-tvam | anu | bhūt | adha | dyauḥ | yat | anyayā | sphigyā | kṣām | avasthāḥ ||3.32.11||

IAST: yajño hi ta indra vardhano bhūd uta priyaḥ sutasomo miyedhaḥ
Griffith: Sacrifice, Indra, made thee wax so mighty, the dear oblation with the flowing Soma.
Devanāgarī: यज्ञो हि त इन्द्र वर्धनो भूदुत प्रियः सुतसोमो मियेधः
pada pāṭha: yajñaḥ | hi | te | indra | vardhanaḥ | bhūt | uta | priyaḥ | suta-somaḥ | miyedhaḥ || yajñena | yajñam | ava | yajñiyaḥ | san | yajñaḥ | te | vajram | ahi-hatye | āvat ||3.32.12||

IAST: yajñena yajñam ava yajñiyaḥ san yajñas te vajram ahihatya āvat
Griffith: O Worshipful, with worship help our worship, for worship helped thy bolt when slaying Ahi.
Devanāgarī: यज्ञेन यज्ञमव यज्ञियः सन्यज्ञस्ते वज्रमहिहत्य आवत्
pada pāṭha: yajñaḥ | hi | te | indra | vardhanaḥ | bhūt | uta | priyaḥ | suta-somaḥ | miyedhaḥ || yajñena | yajñam | ava | yajñiyaḥ | san | yajñaḥ | te | vajram | ahi-hatye | āvat ||3.32.12||

IAST: yajñenendram avasā cakre arvāg ainaṁ sumnāya navyase vavṛtyām
Griffith: With sacrifice and wish have I brought Indra; still for new blessings may I turn him hither,
Devanāgarī: यज्ञेनेन्द्रमवसा चक्रे अर्वागैनं सुम्नाय नव्यसे ववृत्याम्
pada pāṭha: yajñena | indram | avasā | ā | cakre | arvāk | ā | enam | sumnāya | navyase | vavr̥tyām || yaḥ | stomebhiḥ | vavr̥dhe | pūrvyebhiḥ | yaḥ | madhyamebhiḥ | uta | nūtanebhiḥ ||3.32.13||

IAST: yaḥ stomebhir vāvṛdhe pūrvyebhir yo madhyamebhir uta nūtanebhiḥ
Griffith: Him magnified by ancient songs and praises, by lauds of later time and days yet recent.
Devanāgarī: यः स्तोमेभिर्वावृधे पूर्व्येभिर्यो मध्यमेभिरुत नूतनेभिः
pada pāṭha: yajñena | indram | avasā | ā | cakre | arvāk | ā | enam | sumnāya | navyase | vavr̥tyām || yaḥ | stomebhiḥ | vavr̥dhe | pūrvyebhiḥ | yaḥ | madhyamebhiḥ | uta | nūtanebhiḥ ||3.32.13||

IAST: viveṣa yan mā dhiṣaṇā jajāna stavai purā pāryād indram ahnaḥ
Griffith: I have brought forth a song when longing seized me: ere the decisive day will I laud Indra;
Devanāgarī: विवेष यन्मा धिषणा जजान स्तवै पुरा पार्यादिन्द्रमह्नः
pada pāṭha: viveṣa | yat | mā | dhiṣaṇā | jajāna | stavai | purā | pāryāt | indram | ahnaḥ || aṁhasaḥ | yatra | pīparat | yathā | naḥ | nāvā-iva | yāntam | ubhaye | havante ||3.32.14||

IAST: aṁhaso yatra pīparad yathā no nāveva yāntam ubhaye havante
Griffith: Then may lie safely bear us over trouble, as in a ship, when both sides invocate him.
Devanāgarī: अंहसो यत्र पीपरद्यथा नो नावेव यान्तमुभये हवन्ते
pada pāṭha: viveṣa | yat | mā | dhiṣaṇā | jajāna | stavai | purā | pāryāt | indram | ahnaḥ || aṁhasaḥ | yatra | pīparat | yathā | naḥ | nāvā-iva | yāntam | ubhaye | havante ||3.32.14||

IAST: āpūrṇo asya kalaśaḥ svāhā sekteva kośaṁ sisice pibadhyai
Griffith: Full is his chalice: Glory! Like a pourer I have filled up the vessel for his drinking.
Devanāgarī: आपूर्णो अस्य कलशः स्वाहा सेक्तेव कोशं सिसिचे पिबध्यै
pada pāṭha: ā-pūrṇaḥ | asya | kalaśaḥ | svāhā | sektā-iva | kośam | sisice | pibadhyai || sam | ūm̐ iti | priyāḥ | ā | avavr̥tran | madāya | pra-dakṣiṇit | abhi | somāsaḥ | indram ||3.32.15||

IAST: sam u priyā āvavṛtran madāya pradakṣiṇid abhi somāsa indram
Griffith: Presented on the right, dear Soma juices have brought us Indra, to rejoice him, hither.
Devanāgarī: समु प्रिया आववृत्रन्मदाय प्रदक्षिणिदभि सोमास इन्द्रम्
pada pāṭha: ā-pūrṇaḥ | asya | kalaśaḥ | svāhā | sektā-iva | kośam | sisice | pibadhyai || sam | ūm̐ iti | priyāḥ | ā | avavr̥tran | madāya | pra-dakṣiṇit | abhi | somāsaḥ | indram ||3.32.15||

IAST: na tvā gabhīraḥ puruhūta sindhur nādrayaḥ pari ṣanto varanta
Griffith: Not the deep-flowing flood, O Much-invoked One! not hills that compass thee about restrain thee,
Devanāgarī: न त्वा गभीरः पुरुहूत सिन्धुर्नाद्रयः परि षन्तो वरन्त
pada pāṭha: na | tvā | gabhīraḥ | puru-hūta | sindhuḥ | na | adrayaḥ | pari | santaḥ | varanta || itthā | sakhi-bhyaḥ | iṣitaḥ | yat | indra | ā | dr̥ḷham | cit | arujaḥ | gavyam | ūrvam ||3.32.16||

IAST: itthā sakhibhya iṣito yad indrā dṛḻhaṁ cid arujo gavyam ūrvam
Griffith: Since here incited, for thy friends, O Indra, thou breakest e'en the firm built stall of cattle.
Devanāgarī: इत्था सखिभ्य इषितो यदिन्द्रा दृळ्हं चिदरुजो गव्यमूर्वम्
pada pāṭha: na | tvā | gabhīraḥ | puru-hūta | sindhuḥ | na | adrayaḥ | pari | santaḥ | varanta || itthā | sakhi-bhyaḥ | iṣitaḥ | yat | indra | ā | dr̥ḷham | cit | arujaḥ | gavyam | ūrvam ||3.32.16||

IAST: śunaṁ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṁ vājasātau
Griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in this fight where spoil is gathered,
Devanāgarī: शुनं हुवेम मघवानमिन्द्रमस्मिन्भरे नृतमं वाजसातौ
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.32.17||

IAST: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṁ vṛtrāṇi saṁjitaṁ dhanānām
Griffith: The Strong who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vrtras, wins and gathers riches.
Devanāgarī: शृण्वन्तमुग्रमूतये समत्सु घ्नन्तं वृत्राणि संजितं धनानाम्
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.32.17||

IAST: pra parvatānām uśatī upasthād aśve iva viṣite hāsamāne
Griffith: FORTH from the bosom of the mountains, eager as two swift mares with loosened rein contending,
Devanāgarī: प्र पर्वतानामुशती उपस्थादश्वे इव विषिते हासमाने
pada pāṭha: pra | parvatānām | uśatī iti | upa-sthāt | aśve ivetyaśve-iva | visite iti vi-site | hāsamāne iti || gāvā-iva | śubhre iti | mātarā | rihāṇe iti | vi-pāṭ | śutudrī | payasā | javete iti ||3.33.1||

IAST: gāveva śubhre mātarā rihāṇe vipāṭ chutudrī payasā javete
Griffith: Like two bright mother cows who lick their youngling, Vipas and Sutudri speed down their waters.
Devanāgarī: गावेव शुभ्रे मातरा रिहाणे विपाट् छुतुद्री पयसा जवेते
pada pāṭha: pra | parvatānām | uśatī iti | upa-sthāt | aśve ivetyaśve-iva | visite iti vi-site | hāsamāne iti || gāvā-iva | śubhre iti | mātarā | rihāṇe iti | vi-pāṭ | śutudrī | payasā | javete iti ||3.33.1||

IAST: indreṣite prasavam bhikṣamāṇe acchā samudraṁ rathyeva yāthaḥ
Griffith: Impelled by Indra whom ye pray to urge you, ye move as 'twere on chariots to the ocean.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रेषिते प्रसवं भिक्षमाणे अच्छा समुद्रं रथ्येव याथः
pada pāṭha: indreṣite itīndra-iṣite | pra-savam | bhikṣamāṇe iti | accha | samudram | rathyā-iva | yāthaḥ || samārāṇe iti sam-ārāṇe | ūrmi-bhiḥ | pinvamāne iti | anyā | vām | anyām | api | eti | śubhre iti ||3.33.2||

IAST: samārāṇe ūrmibhiḥ pinvamāne anyā vām anyām apy eti śubhre
Griffith: Flowing together, swelling with your billows, O lucid Streams, each of you seeks the other.
Devanāgarī: समाराणे ऊर्मिभिः पिन्वमाने अन्या वामन्यामप्येति शुभ्रे
pada pāṭha: indreṣite itīndra-iṣite | pra-savam | bhikṣamāṇe iti | accha | samudram | rathyā-iva | yāthaḥ || samārāṇe iti sam-ārāṇe | ūrmi-bhiḥ | pinvamāne iti | anyā | vām | anyām | api | eti | śubhre iti ||3.33.2||

IAST: acchā sindhum mātṛtamām ayāsaṁ vipāśam urvīṁ subhagām aganma
Griffith: I have attained the most maternal River, we have approached Vipas, the broad, the blessed.
Devanāgarī: अच्छा सिन्धुं मातृतमामयासं विपाशमुर्वीं सुभगामगन्म
pada pāṭha: accha | sindhum | mātr̥-tamām | ayāsam | vi-pāśam | urvīm | su-bhagām | aganma || vatsam-iva | mātarā | saṁrihāṇe iti sam-rihāṇe | samānam | yonim | anu | saṁcarantī iti sam-carantī ||3.33.3||

IAST: vatsam iva mātarā saṁrihāṇe samānaṁ yonim anu saṁcarantī
Griffith: Licking as 'twere their calf the pair of Mothers flow onward to their common home together.
Devanāgarī: वत्समिव मातरा संरिहाणे समानं योनिमनु संचरन्ती
pada pāṭha: accha | sindhum | mātr̥-tamām | ayāsam | vi-pāśam | urvīm | su-bhagām | aganma || vatsam-iva | mātarā | saṁrihāṇe iti sam-rihāṇe | samānam | yonim | anu | saṁcarantī iti sam-carantī ||3.33.3||

IAST: enā vayam payasā pinvamānā anu yoniṁ devakṛtaṁ carantīḥ
Griffith: We two who rise and swell with billowy waters move forward to the home which Gods have made us.
Devanāgarī: एना वयं पयसा पिन्वमाना अनु योनिं देवकृतं चरन्तीः
pada pāṭha: enā | vayam | payasā | pinvamānāḥ | anu | yonim | deva-kr̥tam | carantīḥ || na | vartave | pra-savaḥ | sarga-taktaḥ | kim-yuḥ | vipraḥ | nadyaḥ | johavīti ||3.33.4||

IAST: na vartave prasavaḥ sargataktaḥ kiṁyur vipro nadyo johavīti
Griffith: Our flood may not be stayed when urged to motion. What would the singer, calling to the Rivers?
Devanāgarī: न वर्तवे प्रसवः सर्गतक्तः किंयुर्विप्रो नद्यो जोहवीति
pada pāṭha: enā | vayam | payasā | pinvamānāḥ | anu | yonim | deva-kr̥tam | carantīḥ || na | vartave | pra-savaḥ | sarga-taktaḥ | kim-yuḥ | vipraḥ | nadyaḥ | johavīti ||3.33.4||

IAST: ramadhvam me vacase somyāya ṛtāvarīr upa muhūrtam evaiḥ
Griffith: Linger a little at my friendly bidding rest, Holy Ones, a moment in your journey.
Devanāgarī: रमध्वं मे वचसे सोम्याय ऋतावरीरुप मुहूर्तमेवैः
pada pāṭha: ramadhvam | me | vacase | somyāya | r̥ta-varīḥ | upa | muhūrtam | evaiḥ || pra | sindhum | accha | br̥hatī | manīṣā | avasyuḥ | ahve | kuśikasya | sūnuḥ ||3.33.5||

IAST: pra sindhum acchā bṛhatī manīṣāvasyur ahve kuśikasya sūnuḥ
Griffith: With hymn sublime soliciting your favour Kusika's son hath called unto the River.
Devanāgarī: प्र सिन्धुमच्छा बृहती मनीषावस्युरह्वे कुशिकस्य सूनुः
pada pāṭha: ramadhvam | me | vacase | somyāya | r̥ta-varīḥ | upa | muhūrtam | evaiḥ || pra | sindhum | accha | br̥hatī | manīṣā | avasyuḥ | ahve | kuśikasya | sūnuḥ ||3.33.5||

IAST: indro asmām̐ aradad vajrabāhur apāhan vṛtram paridhiṁ nadīnām
Griffith: Indra who wields the thunder dug our channels: he smote down Vrtra, him who stayed our currents.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो अस्माँ अरदद्वज्रबाहुरपाहन्वृत्रं परिधिं नदीनाम्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | asmān | aradat | vajra-bāhuḥ | apa | ahan | vr̥tram | pari-dhim | nadīnām || devaḥ | anayat | savitā | su-pāṇiḥ | tasya | vayam | pra-save | yāmaḥ | urvīḥ ||3.33.6||

IAST: devo 'nayat savitā supāṇis tasya vayam prasave yāma urvīḥ
Griffith: Savitar, God, the lovely-handed, led us, and at his sending forth we flow expanded.
Devanāgarī: देवोऽनयत्सविता सुपाणिस्तस्य वयं प्रसवे याम उर्वीः
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | asmān | aradat | vajra-bāhuḥ | apa | ahan | vr̥tram | pari-dhim | nadīnām || devaḥ | anayat | savitā | su-pāṇiḥ | tasya | vayam | pra-save | yāmaḥ | urvīḥ ||3.33.6||

IAST: pravācyaṁ śaśvadhā vīryaṁ tad indrasya karma yad ahiṁ vivṛścat
Griffith: That hero deed of Indra must be lauded for ever that he rent Ahi in pieces.
Devanāgarī: प्रवाच्यं शश्वधा वीर्यं तदिन्द्रस्य कर्म यदहिं विवृश्चत्
pada pāṭha: pra-vācyam | śaśvadhā | vīryam | tat | indrasya | karma | yat | ahim | vi-vr̥ścat || vi | vajreṇa | pari-sadaḥ | jaghāna | āyan | āpaḥ | ayanam | icchamānāḥ ||3.33.7||

IAST: vi vajreṇa pariṣado jaghānāyann āpo 'yanam icchamānāḥ
Griffith: He smote away the obstructors with his thunder, and eager for their course forth flowed the waters.
Devanāgarī: वि वज्रेण परिषदो जघानायन्नापोऽयनमिच्छमानाः
pada pāṭha: pra-vācyam | śaśvadhā | vīryam | tat | indrasya | karma | yat | ahim | vi-vr̥ścat || vi | vajreṇa | pari-sadaḥ | jaghāna | āyan | āpaḥ | ayanam | icchamānāḥ ||3.33.7||

IAST: etad vaco jaritar māpi mṛṣṭhā ā yat te ghoṣān uttarā yugāni
Griffith: Never forget this word of thine, O singer, which future generations shall reecho.
Devanāgarī: एतद्वचो जरितर्मापि मृष्ठा आ यत्ते घोषानुत्तरा युगानि
pada pāṭha: etat | vacaḥ | jaritaḥ | mā | api | mr̥ṣṭhāḥ | ā | yat | te | ghoṣān | ut-tarā | yugāni || uktheṣu | kāro iti | prati | naḥ | juṣasva | mā | naḥ | ni | kariti kaḥ | puruṣa-trā | namaḥ | te ||3.33.8||

IAST: uktheṣu kāro prati no juṣasva mā no ni kaḥ puruṣatrā namas te
Griffith: In hymns, O bard, show us thy loving kindness. Humble us not mid men. To thee be honour!
Devanāgarī: उक्थेषु कारो प्रति नो जुषस्व मा नो नि कः पुरुषत्रा नमस्ते
pada pāṭha: etat | vacaḥ | jaritaḥ | mā | api | mr̥ṣṭhāḥ | ā | yat | te | ghoṣān | ut-tarā | yugāni || uktheṣu | kāro iti | prati | naḥ | juṣasva | mā | naḥ | ni | kariti kaḥ | puruṣa-trā | namaḥ | te ||3.33.8||

IAST: o ṣu svasāraḥ kārave śṛṇota yayau vo dūrād anasā rathena
Griffith: List quickly, Sisters, to the bard who cometh to you from far away with car and wagon.
Devanāgarī: ओ षु स्वसारः कारवे शृणोत ययौ वो दूरादनसा रथेन
pada pāṭha: o iti | su | svasāraḥ | kārave | śr̥ṇota | yayau | vaḥ | dūrāt | anasā | rathena || ni | su | namadhvam | bhavata | su-pārāḥ | adhaḥ-akṣāḥ | sindhavaḥ | srotyābhiḥ ||3.33.9||

IAST: ni ṣū namadhvam bhavatā supārā adhoakṣāḥ sindhavaḥ srotyābhiḥ
Griffith: Bow lowly down; be easy to be traversed stay, Rivers, with your floods below our axles.
Devanāgarī: नि षू नमध्वं भवता सुपारा अधोअक्षाः सिन्धवः स्रोत्याभिः
pada pāṭha: o iti | su | svasāraḥ | kārave | śr̥ṇota | yayau | vaḥ | dūrāt | anasā | rathena || ni | su | namadhvam | bhavata | su-pārāḥ | adhaḥ-akṣāḥ | sindhavaḥ | srotyābhiḥ ||3.33.9||

IAST: ā te kāro śṛṇavāmā vacāṁsi yayātha dūrād anasā rathena
Griffith: Yea, we will listen to thy words, O singer. With wain and car from far away thou comest.
Devanāgarī: आ ते कारो शृणवामा वचांसि ययाथ दूरादनसा रथेन
pada pāṭha: ā | te | kāro iti | śr̥ṇavāma | vacāṁsi | yayātha | dūrāt | anasā | rathena || ni | te | naṁsai | pīpyānā-iva | yoṣā | maryāya-iva | kanyā | śaśvacai | ta iti te ||3.33.10||

IAST: ni te naṁsai pīpyāneva yoṣā maryāyeva kanyā śaśvacai te
Griffith: Low, like a nursing mother, will I bend me, and yield me as a maiden to her lover.
Devanāgarī: नि ते नंसै पीप्यानेव योषा मर्यायेव कन्या शश्वचै ते
pada pāṭha: ā | te | kāro iti | śr̥ṇavāma | vacāṁsi | yayātha | dūrāt | anasā | rathena || ni | te | naṁsai | pīpyānā-iva | yoṣā | maryāya-iva | kanyā | śaśvacai | ta iti te ||3.33.10||

IAST: yad aṅga tvā bharatāḥ saṁtareyur gavyan grāma iṣita indrajūtaḥ
Griffith: Soon as the Bharatas have fared across thee, the warrior band, urged on and sped by Indra,
Devanāgarī: यदङ्ग त्वा भरताः संतरेयुर्गव्यन्ग्राम इषित इन्द्रजूतः
pada pāṭha: yat | aṅga | tvā | bharatāḥ | sam-tareyuḥ | gavyan | grāmaḥ | iṣitaḥ | indra-jūtaḥ || arṣāt | aha | pra-savaḥ | sarga-taktaḥ | ā | vaḥ | vr̥ṇe | su-matim | yajñiyānām ||3.33.11||

IAST: arṣād aha prasavaḥ sargatakta ā vo vṛṇe sumatiṁ yajñiyānām
Griffith: Then let your streams flow on in rapid motion. I crave your favour who deserve our worship.
Devanāgarī: अर्षादह प्रसवः सर्गतक्त आ वो वृणे सुमतिं यज्ञियानाम्
pada pāṭha: yat | aṅga | tvā | bharatāḥ | sam-tareyuḥ | gavyan | grāmaḥ | iṣitaḥ | indra-jūtaḥ || arṣāt | aha | pra-savaḥ | sarga-taktaḥ | ā | vaḥ | vr̥ṇe | su-matim | yajñiyānām ||3.33.11||

IAST: atāriṣur bharatā gavyavaḥ sam abhakta vipraḥ sumatiṁ nadīnām
Griffith: The warrior host, the Bharatas, fared over the singer won the favour of the Rivers.
Devanāgarī: अतारिषुर्भरता गव्यवः समभक्त विप्रः सुमतिं नदीनाम्
pada pāṭha: atāriṣuḥ | bharatāḥ | gavyavaḥ | sam | abhakta | vipraḥ | su-matim | nadīnām || pra | pinvadhvam | iṣayantīḥ | su-rādhāḥ | ā | vakṣaṇāḥ | pr̥ṇadhvam | yāta | śībham ||3.33.12||

IAST: pra pinvadhvam iṣayantīḥ surādhā ā vakṣaṇāḥ pṛṇadhvaṁ yāta śībham
Griffith: Swell with your billows, hasting, pouring riches. Fill full your channels, and roll swiftly onward.
Devanāgarī: प्र पिन्वध्वमिषयन्तीः सुराधा आ वक्षणाः पृणध्वं यात शीभम्
pada pāṭha: atāriṣuḥ | bharatāḥ | gavyavaḥ | sam | abhakta | vipraḥ | su-matim | nadīnām || pra | pinvadhvam | iṣayantīḥ | su-rādhāḥ | ā | vakṣaṇāḥ | pr̥ṇadhvam | yāta | śībham ||3.33.12||

IAST: ud va ūrmiḥ śamyā hantv āpo yoktrāṇi muñcata
Griffith: So let your wave bear up the pins, and ye, O Waters, spare the thongs;
Devanāgarī: उद्व ऊर्मिः शम्या हन्त्वापो योक्त्राणि मुञ्चत
pada pāṭha: ut | vaḥ | ūrmiḥ | śamyāḥ | hantu | āpaḥ | yoktrāṇi | muñcata || mā | aduḥ-kr̥tau | vi-enasā | aghnyau | śūnam | ā | aratām ||3.33.13||

IAST: māduṣkṛtau vyenasāghnyau śūnam āratām
Griffith: And never may the pair of Bulls, harmless and sinless, waste away.
Devanāgarī: मादुष्कृतौ व्येनसाघ्न्यौ शूनमारताम्
pada pāṭha: ut | vaḥ | ūrmiḥ | śamyāḥ | hantu | āpaḥ | yoktrāṇi | muñcata || mā | aduḥ-kr̥tau | vi-enasā | aghnyau | śūnam | ā | aratām ||3.33.13||

IAST: indraḥ pūrbhid ātirad dāsam arkair vidadvasur dayamāno vi śatrūn
Griffith: FORT-RENDER, Lord of Wealth, dispelling foemen, Indra with lightnings hath o'ercome the Dasa.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रः पूर्भिदातिरद्दासमर्कैर्विदद्वसुर्दयमानो वि शत्रून्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | pūḥ-bhit | ā | atirat | dāsam | arkaiḥ | vidat-vasuḥ | dayamānaḥ | vi | śatrūn || brahma-jūtaḥ | tanvā | vavr̥dhānaḥ | bhūri-dātraḥ | ā | apr̥ṇat | rodasī iti | ubhe iti ||3.34.1||

IAST: brahmajūtas tanvā vāvṛdhāno bhūridātra āpṛṇad rodasī ubhe
Griffith: Impelled by prayer and waxen great in body, he hath filled earth and heaven, the Bounteous Giver.
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्मजूतस्तन्वा वावृधानो भूरिदात्र आपृणद्रोदसी उभे
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | pūḥ-bhit | ā | atirat | dāsam | arkaiḥ | vidat-vasuḥ | dayamānaḥ | vi | śatrūn || brahma-jūtaḥ | tanvā | vavr̥dhānaḥ | bhūri-dātraḥ | ā | apr̥ṇat | rodasī iti | ubhe iti ||3.34.1||

IAST: makhasya te taviṣasya pra jūtim iyarmi vācam amṛtāya bhūṣan
Griffith: I stimulate thy zeal, the Strong, the Hero decking my song of praise forth; Immortal.
Devanāgarī: मखस्य ते तविषस्य प्र जूतिमियर्मि वाचममृताय भूषन्
pada pāṭha: makhasya | te | taviṣasya | pra | jūtim | iyarmi | vācam | amr̥tāya | bhūṣan || indra | kṣitīnām | asi | mānuṣīṇām | viśām | daivīnām | uta | pūrva-yāvā ||3.34.2||

IAST: indra kṣitīnām asi mānuṣīṇāṁ viśāṁ daivīnām uta pūrvayāvā
Griffith: O Indra, thou art equally the Leader of heavenly hosts and human generations.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र क्षितीनामसि मानुषीणां विशां दैवीनामुत पूर्वयावा
pada pāṭha: makhasya | te | taviṣasya | pra | jūtim | iyarmi | vācam | amr̥tāya | bhūṣan || indra | kṣitīnām | asi | mānuṣīṇām | viśām | daivīnām | uta | pūrva-yāvā ||3.34.2||

IAST: indro vṛtram avṛṇoc chardhanītiḥ pra māyinām aminād varpaṇītiḥ
Griffith: Leading, his band Indra encompassed Vrtra; weak grew the wily leader of enchanters.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो वृत्रमवृणोच्छर्धनीतिः प्र मायिनाममिनाद्वर्पणीतिः
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | vr̥tram | avr̥ṇot | śardha-nītiḥ | pra | māyinām | amināt | varpa-nītiḥ || ahan | vi-aṁsam | uśadhak | vaneṣu | āviḥ | dhenāḥ | akr̥ṇot | rāmyāṇām ||3.34.3||

IAST: ahan vyaṁsam uśadhag vaneṣv āvir dhenā akṛṇod rāmyāṇām
Griffith: He who burns fierce in forests slaughtered Vyamsa, and made the Milch-kine of the nights apparent.
Devanāgarī: अहन्व्यंसमुशधग्वनेष्वाविर्धेना अकृणोद्राम्याणाम्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | vr̥tram | avr̥ṇot | śardha-nītiḥ | pra | māyinām | amināt | varpa-nītiḥ || ahan | vi-aṁsam | uśadhak | vaneṣu | āviḥ | dhenāḥ | akr̥ṇot | rāmyāṇām ||3.34.3||

IAST: indraḥ svarṣā janayann ahāni jigāyośigbhiḥ pṛtanā abhiṣṭiḥ
Griffith: Indra, light-winner, days' Creator, conquered, victorious, hostile bands with those who loved him.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रः स्वर्षा जनयन्नहानि जिगायोशिग्भिः पृतना अभिष्टिः
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | svaḥ-sāḥ | janayan | ahāni | jigāya | uśik-bhiḥ | pr̥tanāḥ | abhiṣṭiḥ || pra | arocayat | manave | ketum | ahnām | avindat | jyotiḥ | br̥hate | raṇāya ||3.34.4||

IAST: prārocayan manave ketum ahnām avindaj jyotir bṛhate raṇāya
Griffith: For man the days' bright ensign he illumined, and found the light for his joy and gladness.
Devanāgarī: प्रारोचयन्मनवे केतुमह्नामविन्दज्ज्योतिर्बृहते रणाय
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | svaḥ-sāḥ | janayan | ahāni | jigāya | uśik-bhiḥ | pr̥tanāḥ | abhiṣṭiḥ || pra | arocayat | manave | ketum | ahnām | avindat | jyotiḥ | br̥hate | raṇāya ||3.34.4||

IAST: indras tujo barhaṇā ā viveśa nṛvad dadhāno naryā purūṇi
Griffith: Forward to fiercely falling blows pressed Indra, herolike doing many hero exploits.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रस्तुजो बर्हणा आ विवेश नृवद्दधानो नर्या पुरूणि
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | tujaḥ | barhaṇāḥ | ā | viveśa | nr̥-vat | dadhānaḥ | naryā | purūṇi || acetayat | dhiyaḥ | imāḥ | jaritre | pra | imam | varṇam | atirat | śukram | āsām ||3.34.5||

IAST: acetayad dhiya imā jaritre premaṁ varṇam atirac chukram āsām
Griffith: These holy songs he taught the bard who gaised him, and widely spread these Dawns' resplendent colour.
Devanāgarī: अचेतयद्धिय इमा जरित्रे प्रेमं वर्णमतिरच्छुक्रमासाम्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | tujaḥ | barhaṇāḥ | ā | viveśa | nr̥-vat | dadhānaḥ | naryā | purūṇi || acetayat | dhiyaḥ | imāḥ | jaritre | pra | imam | varṇam | atirat | śukram | āsām ||3.34.5||

IAST: maho mahāni panayanty asyendrasya karma sukṛtā purūṇi
Griffith: They laud the mighty acts of him the Mighty, the many glorious deeds performed by Indra.
Devanāgarī: महो महानि पनयन्त्यस्येन्द्रस्य कर्म सुकृता पुरूणि
pada pāṭha: mahaḥ | mahāni | panayanti | asya | indrasya | karma | su-kr̥tā | purūṇi || vr̥janena | vr̥jinān | sam | pipeṣa | māyābhiḥ | dasyūn | abhibhūti-ojāḥ ||3.34.6||

IAST: vṛjanena vṛjinān sam pipeṣa māyābhir dasyūm̐r abhibhūtyojāḥ
Griffith: He in his strength, with all-surpassing prowess, through wondrous arts crushed the malignant Dasyus.
Devanāgarī: वृजनेन वृजिनान्सं पिपेष मायाभिर्दस्यूँरभिभूत्योजाः
pada pāṭha: mahaḥ | mahāni | panayanti | asya | indrasya | karma | su-kr̥tā | purūṇi || vr̥janena | vr̥jinān | sam | pipeṣa | māyābhiḥ | dasyūn | abhibhūti-ojāḥ ||3.34.6||

IAST: yudhendro mahnā varivaś cakāra devebhyaḥ satpatiś carṣaṇiprāḥ
Griffith: Lord of the brave, Indra who rules the people gave freedom to the Gods by might and battle.
Devanāgarī: युधेन्द्रो मह्ना वरिवश्चकार देवेभ्यः सत्पतिश्चर्षणिप्राः
pada pāṭha: yudhā | indraḥ | mahnā | varivaḥ | cakāra | devebhyaḥ | sat-patiḥ | carṣaṇi-prāḥ || vivasvataḥ | sadane | asya | tāni | viprāḥ | ukthebhiḥ | kavayaḥ | gr̥ṇanti ||3.34.7||

IAST: vivasvataḥ sadane asya tāni viprā ukthebhiḥ kavayo gṛṇanti
Griffith: Wise singers glorify with chanted praises these his achievements in Vivasvan's dwelling.
Devanāgarī: विवस्वतः सदने अस्य तानि विप्रा उक्थेभिः कवयो गृणन्ति
pada pāṭha: yudhā | indraḥ | mahnā | varivaḥ | cakāra | devebhyaḥ | sat-patiḥ | carṣaṇi-prāḥ || vivasvataḥ | sadane | asya | tāni | viprāḥ | ukthebhiḥ | kavayaḥ | gr̥ṇanti ||3.34.7||

IAST: satrāsāhaṁ vareṇyaṁ sahodāṁ sasavāṁsaṁ svar apaś ca devīḥ
Griffith: Excellent, Conqueror, the victory-giver, the winner of the light and Godlike Waters,
Devanāgarī: सत्रासाहं वरेण्यं सहोदां ससवांसं स्वरपश्च देवीः
pada pāṭha: satrā-saham | vareṇyam | sahaḥ-dām | sasavāṁsam | svaḥ | apaḥ | ca | devīḥ || sasāna | yaḥ | pr̥thivīm | dyām | uta | imām | indram | madanti | anu | dhī-raṇāsaḥ ||3.34.8||

IAST: sasāna yaḥ pṛthivīṁ dyām utemām indram madanty anu dhīraṇāsaḥ
Griffith: He who hath won this broad earth and this heaven, -in Indra they rejoice who love devotions.
Devanāgarī: ससान यः पृथिवीं द्यामुतेमामिन्द्रं मदन्त्यनु धीरणासः
pada pāṭha: satrā-saham | vareṇyam | sahaḥ-dām | sasavāṁsam | svaḥ | apaḥ | ca | devīḥ || sasāna | yaḥ | pr̥thivīm | dyām | uta | imām | indram | madanti | anu | dhī-raṇāsaḥ ||3.34.8||

IAST: sasānātyām̐ uta sūryaṁ sasānendraḥ sasāna purubhojasaṁ gām
Griffith: He gained possession of the Sun and Horses, Indra obtained the Cow who feedeth many.
Devanāgarī: ससानात्याँ उत सूर्यं ससानेन्द्रः ससान पुरुभोजसं गाम्
pada pāṭha: sasāna | atyān | uta | sūryam | sasāna | indraḥ | sasāna | puru-bhojasam | gām || hiraṇyayam | uta | bhogam | sasāna | hatvī | dasyūn | pra | āryam | varṇam | āvat ||3.34.9||

IAST: hiraṇyayam uta bhogaṁ sasāna hatvī dasyūn prāryaṁ varṇam āvat
Griffith: Treasure of gold he won; he smote the Dasyus, and gave protection to the Aryan colour.
Devanāgarī: हिरण्ययमुत भोगं ससान हत्वी दस्यून्प्रार्यं वर्णमावत्
pada pāṭha: sasāna | atyān | uta | sūryam | sasāna | indraḥ | sasāna | puru-bhojasam | gām || hiraṇyayam | uta | bhogam | sasāna | hatvī | dasyūn | pra | āryam | varṇam | āvat ||3.34.9||

IAST: indra oṣadhīr asanod ahāni vanaspatīm̐r asanod antarikṣam
Griffith: He took the plants and days for his possession; he gained the forest trees and air's mid-region.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र ओषधीरसनोदहानि वनस्पतीँरसनोदन्तरिक्षम्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | oṣadhīḥ | asanot | ahāni | vanaspatīn | asanot | antarikṣam || bibheda | valam | nunude | vi-vācaḥ | atha | abhavat | damitā | abhi-kratūnām ||3.34.10||

IAST: bibheda valaṁ nunude vivāco 'thābhavad damitābhikratūnām
Griffith: Vala he cleft, and chased away opponents: thus was he tamer of the overweening.
Devanāgarī: बिभेद वलं नुनुदे विवाचोऽथाभवद्दमिताभिक्रतूनाम्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | oṣadhīḥ | asanot | ahāni | vanaspatīn | asanot | antarikṣam || bibheda | valam | nunude | vi-vācaḥ | atha | abhavat | damitā | abhi-kratūnām ||3.34.10||

IAST: śunaṁ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṁ vājasātau
Griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered,
Devanāgarī: शुनं हुवेम मघवानमिन्द्रमस्मिन्भरे नृतमं वाजसातौ
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.34.11||

IAST: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṁ vṛtrāṇi saṁjitaṁ dhanānām
Griffith: The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vrtras, wins and gathers treasures.
Devanāgarī: शृण्वन्तमुग्रमूतये समत्सु घ्नन्तं वृत्राणि संजितं धनानाम्
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.34.11||

IAST: tiṣṭhā harī ratha ā yujyamānā yāhi vāyur na niyuto no accha
Griffith: MOUNT the Bay Horses to thy chariot harnessed, and come to us like Vayu with his coursers.
Devanāgarī: तिष्ठा हरी रथ आ युज्यमाना याहि वायुर्न नियुतो नो अच्छ
pada pāṭha: tiṣṭha | harī iti | rathe | ā | yujyamānā | yāhi | vāyuḥ | na | ni-yutaḥ | naḥ | accha || pibāsi | andhaḥ | abhi-sr̥ṣṭaḥ | asme iti | indra | svāhā | rarima | te | madāya ||3.35.1||

IAST: pibāsy andho abhisṛṣṭo asme indra svāhā rarimā te madāya
Griffith: Thou, hastening to us, shalt drink the Soma. Hail, Indra. We have poured it for thy rapture.
Devanāgarī: पिबास्यन्धो अभिसृष्टो अस्मे इन्द्र स्वाहा ररिमा ते मदाय
pada pāṭha: tiṣṭha | harī iti | rathe | ā | yujyamānā | yāhi | vāyuḥ | na | ni-yutaḥ | naḥ | accha || pibāsi | andhaḥ | abhi-sr̥ṣṭaḥ | asme iti | indra | svāhā | rarima | te | madāya ||3.35.1||

IAST: upājirā puruhūtāya saptī harī rathasya dhūrṣv ā yunajmi
Griffith: For him, the God who is invoked by many, the two swift Bay Steeds to the pole I harness,
Devanāgarī: उपाजिरा पुरुहूताय सप्ती हरी रथस्य धूर्ष्वा युनज्मि
pada pāṭha: upa | ajirā | puru-hūtāya | saptī iti | harī iti | rathasya | dhūḥ-su | ā | yunajmi || dravat | yathā | sam-bhr̥tam | viśvataḥ | cit | upa | imam | yajñam | ā | vahātaḥ | indram ||3.35.2||

IAST: dravad yathā sambhṛtaṁ viśvataś cid upemaṁ yajñam ā vahāta indram
Griffith: That they in fleet course may bring Indra hither, e'en to this sacrifice arranged completely.
Devanāgarī: द्रवद्यथा सम्भृतं विश्वतश्चिदुपेमं यज्ञमा वहात इन्द्रम्
pada pāṭha: upa | ajirā | puru-hūtāya | saptī iti | harī iti | rathasya | dhūḥ-su | ā | yunajmi || dravat | yathā | sam-bhr̥tam | viśvataḥ | cit | upa | imam | yajñam | ā | vahātaḥ | indram ||3.35.2||

IAST: upo nayasva vṛṣaṇā tapuṣpotem ava tvaṁ vṛṣabha svadhāvaḥ
Griffith: Bring the strong Steeds who drink the warm libation, and, Bull of Godlike nature, be thou gracious.
Devanāgarī: उपो नयस्व वृषणा तपुष्पोतेमव त्वं वृषभ स्वधावः
pada pāṭha: upo iti | nayasva | vr̥ṣaṇā | tapuḥ-pā | uta | īm | ava | tvam | vr̥ṣabha | svadhā-vaḥ || grasetām | aśvā | vi | muca | iha | śoṇā | dive-dive | sa-dr̥śīḥ | addhi | dhānāḥ ||3.35.3||

IAST: grasetām aśvā vi muceha śoṇā dive-dive sadṛśīr addhi dhānāḥ
Griffith: Let thy Steeds eat; set free thy Tawny Horses, and roasted grain like this consume thou daily.
Devanāgarī: ग्रसेतामश्वा वि मुचेह शोणा दिवेदिवे सदृशीरद्धि धानाः
pada pāṭha: upo iti | nayasva | vr̥ṣaṇā | tapuḥ-pā | uta | īm | ava | tvam | vr̥ṣabha | svadhā-vaḥ || grasetām | aśvā | vi | muca | iha | śoṇā | dive-dive | sa-dr̥śīḥ | addhi | dhānāḥ ||3.35.3||

IAST: brahmaṇā te brahmayujā yunajmi harī sakhāyā sadhamāda āśū
Griffith: Those who are yoked by prayer I harness, fleet friendly Bays who take their joy together.
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्मणा ते ब्रह्मयुजा युनज्मि हरी सखाया सधमाद आशू
pada pāṭha: brahmaṇā | te | brahma-yujā | yunajmi | harī iti | sakhāyā | sadha-māde | āśū iti || sthiram | ratham | su-kham | indra | adhi-tiṣṭhan | pra-jānan | vidvān | upa | yāhi | somam ||3.35.4||

IAST: sthiraṁ rathaṁ sukham indrādhitiṣṭhan prajānan vidvām̐ upa yāhi somam
Griffith: Mounting thy firm and easy car, O Indra, wise and all-knowing come thou to the Soma.
Devanāgarī: स्थिरं रथं सुखमिन्द्राधितिष्ठन्प्रजानन्विद्वाँ उप याहि सोमम्
pada pāṭha: brahmaṇā | te | brahma-yujā | yunajmi | harī iti | sakhāyā | sadha-māde | āśū iti || sthiram | ratham | su-kham | indra | adhi-tiṣṭhan | pra-jānan | vidvān | upa | yāhi | somam ||3.35.4||

IAST: mā te harī vṛṣaṇā vītapṛṣṭhā ni rīraman yajamānāso anye
Griffith: No other worshippers must stay beside them thy Bays, thy vigorous and smooth-backed Coursers.
Devanāgarī: मा ते हरी वृषणा वीतपृष्ठा नि रीरमन्यजमानासो अन्ये
pada pāṭha: mā | te | harī iti | vr̥ṣaṇā | vīta-pr̥ṣṭhā | ni | rīraman | yajamānāsaḥ | anye || ati-āyāhi | śaśvataḥ | vayam | te | aram | sutebhiḥ | kr̥ṇavāma | somaiḥ ||3.35.5||

IAST: atyāyāhi śaśvato vayaṁ te 'raṁ sutebhiḥ kṛṇavāma somaiḥ
Griffith: Pass by them all and hasten onward hither: with Soma pressed we will prepare to feast thee.
Devanāgarī: अत्यायाहि शश्वतो वयं तेऽरं सुतेभिः कृणवाम सोमैः
pada pāṭha: mā | te | harī iti | vr̥ṣaṇā | vīta-pr̥ṣṭhā | ni | rīraman | yajamānāsaḥ | anye || ati-āyāhi | śaśvataḥ | vayam | te | aram | sutebhiḥ | kr̥ṇavāma | somaiḥ ||3.35.5||

IAST: tavāyaṁ somas tvam ehy arvāṅ chaśvattamaṁ sumanā asya pāhi
Griffith: Thine is this Sorna: hasten to approach it. Drink thou thereof, benevolent, and cease not.
Devanāgarī: तवायं सोमस्त्वमेह्यर्वाङ्छश्वत्तमं सुमना अस्य पाहि
pada pāṭha: tava | ayam | somaḥ | tvam | ā | ihi | arvāṅ | śaśvat-tamam | su-manāḥ | asya | pāhi || asmin | yajñe | barhiṣi | ā | ni-sadya | dadhiṣva | imam | jaṭhare | indum | indra ||3.35.6||

IAST: asmin yajñe barhiṣy ā niṣadyā dadhiṣvemaṁ jaṭhara indum indra
Griffith: Sit on the sacred grass at this our worship, and take these drops into thy belly, Indra.
Devanāgarī: अस्मिन्यज्ञे बर्हिष्या निषद्या दधिष्वेमं जठर इन्दुमिन्द्र
pada pāṭha: tava | ayam | somaḥ | tvam | ā | ihi | arvāṅ | śaśvat-tamam | su-manāḥ | asya | pāhi || asmin | yajñe | barhiṣi | ā | ni-sadya | dadhiṣva | imam | jaṭhare | indum | indra ||3.35.6||

IAST: stīrṇaṁ te barhiḥ suta indra somaḥ kṛtā dhānā attave te haribhyām
Griffith: The grass is strewn for thee, pressed is the Soma; the grain is ready for thy Bays to feed on.
Devanāgarī: स्तीर्णं ते बर्हिः सुत इन्द्र सोमः कृता धाना अत्तवे ते हरिभ्याम्
pada pāṭha: stīrṇam | te | barhiḥ | sutaḥ | indra | somaḥ | kr̥tāḥ | dhānāḥ | attave | te | hari-bhyām || tat-okase | puru-śākāya | vr̥ṣṇe | marutvate | tubhyam | rātā | havīṁṣi ||3.35.7||

IAST: tadokase puruśākāya vṛṣṇe marutvate tubhyaṁ rātā havīṁṣi
Griffith: To thee who lovest them, the very mighty, strong, girt by Maruts, are these gifts presented.
Devanāgarī: तदोकसे पुरुशाकाय वृष्णे मरुत्वते तुभ्यं राता हवींषि
pada pāṭha: stīrṇam | te | barhiḥ | sutaḥ | indra | somaḥ | kr̥tāḥ | dhānāḥ | attave | te | hari-bhyām || tat-okase | puru-śākāya | vr̥ṣṇe | marutvate | tubhyam | rātā | havīṁṣi ||3.35.7||

IAST: imaṁ naraḥ parvatās tubhyam āpaḥ sam indra gobhir madhumantam akran
Griffith: This the sweet draught, with cows, the men, the mountains, the waters, Indra, have for thee made ready.
Devanāgarī: इमं नरः पर्वतास्तुभ्यमापः समिन्द्र गोभिर्मधुमन्तमक्रन्
pada pāṭha: imam | naraḥ | parvatāḥ | tubhyam | āpaḥ | sam | indra | gobhiḥ | madhu-mantam | akran || tasya | ā-gatya | su-manāḥ | r̥ṣva | pāhi | pra-jānan | vidvān | pathyāḥ | anu | svāḥ ||3.35.8||

IAST: tasyāgatyā sumanā ṛṣva pāhi prajānan vidvān pathyā anu svāḥ
Griffith: Come, drink thereof, Sublime One, friendly-minded, foreseeing, knowing well the ways thou goest.
Devanāgarī: तस्यागत्या सुमना ऋष्व पाहि प्रजानन्विद्वान्पथ्या अनु स्वाः
pada pāṭha: imam | naraḥ | parvatāḥ | tubhyam | āpaḥ | sam | indra | gobhiḥ | madhu-mantam | akran || tasya | ā-gatya | su-manāḥ | r̥ṣva | pāhi | pra-jānan | vidvān | pathyāḥ | anu | svāḥ ||3.35.8||

IAST: yām̐ ābhajo maruta indra some ye tvām avardhann abhavan gaṇas te
Griffith: The Maruts, they with whom thou sharedst Soma, Indra, who made thee strong and were thine army,-
Devanāgarī: याँ आभजो मरुत इन्द्र सोमे ये त्वामवर्धन्नभवन्गणस्ते
pada pāṭha: yān | ā | abhajaḥ | marutaḥ | indra | some | ye | tvām | avardhan | abhavan | gaṇaḥ | te || tebhiḥ | etam | sa-joṣāḥ | vāvaśānaḥ | agneḥ | piba | jihvayā | somam | indra ||3.35.9||

IAST: tebhir etaṁ sajoṣā vāvaśāno 'gneḥ piba jihvayā somam indra
Griffith: With these accordant, eagerly desirous drink thou this Soma with the tongue of Agni.
Devanāgarī: तेभिरेतं सजोषा वावशानोऽग्नेः पिब जिह्वया सोममिन्द्र
pada pāṭha: yān | ā | abhajaḥ | marutaḥ | indra | some | ye | tvām | avardhan | abhavan | gaṇaḥ | te || tebhiḥ | etam | sa-joṣāḥ | vāvaśānaḥ | agneḥ | piba | jihvayā | somam | indra ||3.35.9||

IAST: indra piba svadhayā cit sutasyāgner vā pāhi jihvayā yajatra
Griffith: Drink, Indra, of the juice by thine own nature, or by the tongue of Agni, O thou Holy.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र पिब स्वधया चित्सुतस्याग्नेर्वा पाहि जिह्वया यजत्र
pada pāṭha: indra | piba | svadhayā | cit | sutasya | agneḥ | vā | pāhi | jihvayā | yajatra || adhvaryoḥ | vā | pra-yatam | śakra | hastāt | hotuḥ | vā | yajñam | haviṣaḥ | juṣasva ||3.35.10||

IAST: adhvaryor vā prayataṁ śakra hastād dhotur vā yajñaṁ haviṣo juṣasva
Griffith: Accept the sacrificial gift, O Sakra, from the Adhvaryu's hand or from the Hotar's.
Devanāgarī: अध्वर्योर्वा प्रयतं शक्र हस्ताद्धोतुर्वा यज्ञं हविषो जुषस्व
pada pāṭha: indra | piba | svadhayā | cit | sutasya | agneḥ | vā | pāhi | jihvayā | yajatra || adhvaryoḥ | vā | pra-yatam | śakra | hastāt | hotuḥ | vā | yajñam | haviṣaḥ | juṣasva ||3.35.10||

IAST: śunaṁ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṁ vājasātau
Griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered,
Devanāgarī: शुनं हुवेम मघवानमिन्द्रमस्मिन्भरे नृतमं वाजसातौ
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.35.11||

IAST: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṁ vṛtrāṇi saṁjitaṁ dhanānām
Griffith: The Strong, who listens, who.gives aid in battles, who slays the Vrtras, wins and gathers riches.
Devanāgarī: शृण्वन्तमुग्रमूतये समत्सु घ्नन्तं वृत्राणि संजितं धनानाम्
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.35.11||

IAST: imām ū ṣu prabhṛtiṁ sātaye dhāḥ śaśvac-chaśvad ūtibhir yādamānaḥ
Griffith: WITH constant succours, fain thyself to share it, make this oblation which we bring effective.
Devanāgarī: इमामू षु प्रभृतिं सातये धाः शश्वच्छश्वदूतिभिर्यादमानः
pada pāṭha: imām | ūm̐ iti | su | pra-bhr̥tim | sātaye | dhāḥ | śaśvat-śaśvat | ūti-bhiḥ | yādamānaḥ || sute-sute | vavr̥dhe | vardhanebhiḥ | yaḥ | karma-bhiḥ | mahat-bhiḥ | su-śrutaḥ | bhūt ||3.36.1||

IAST: sute-sute vāvṛdhe vardhanebhir yaḥ karmabhir mahadbhiḥ suśruto bhūt
Griffith: Grown great through strengthening gifts at each libation, he hath become renowned by mighty exploits.
Devanāgarī: सुतेसुते वावृधे वर्धनेभिर्यः कर्मभिर्महद्भिः सुश्रुतो भूत्
pada pāṭha: imām | ūm̐ iti | su | pra-bhr̥tim | sātaye | dhāḥ | śaśvat-śaśvat | ūti-bhiḥ | yādamānaḥ || sute-sute | vavr̥dhe | vardhanebhiḥ | yaḥ | karma-bhiḥ | mahat-bhiḥ | su-śrutaḥ | bhūt ||3.36.1||

IAST: indrāya somāḥ pradivo vidānā ṛbhur yebhir vṛṣaparvā vihāyāḥ
Griffith: For Indra were the Somas erst- discovered, whereby he grew strong-jointed, vast, and skilful.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राय सोमाः प्रदिवो विदाना ऋभुर्येभिर्वृषपर्वा विहायाः
pada pāṭha: indrāya | somāḥ | pra-divaḥ | vidānāḥ | r̥bhuḥ | yebhiḥ | vr̥ṣa-parvā | vi-hāyāḥ || pra-yamyamānān | prati | su | gr̥bhāya | indra | piba | vr̥ṣa-dhūtasya | vr̥ṣṇaḥ ||3.36.2||

IAST: prayamyamānān prati ṣū gṛbhāyendra piba vṛṣadhūtasya vṛṣṇaḥ
Griffith: Indra , take quickly these presented juices: drink of the strong, that which the strong have shaken.
Devanāgarī: प्रयम्यमानान्प्रति षू गृभायेन्द्र पिब वृषधूतस्य वृष्णः
pada pāṭha: indrāya | somāḥ | pra-divaḥ | vidānāḥ | r̥bhuḥ | yebhiḥ | vr̥ṣa-parvā | vi-hāyāḥ || pra-yamyamānān | prati | su | gr̥bhāya | indra | piba | vr̥ṣa-dhūtasya | vr̥ṣṇaḥ ||3.36.2||

IAST: pibā vardhasva tava ghā sutāsa indra somāsaḥ prathamā uteme
Griffith: Drink and wax great. Thine are the juices, Indra, both Somas of old time and these we bring thee.
Devanāgarī: पिबा वर्धस्व तव घा सुतास इन्द्र सोमासः प्रथमा उतेमे
pada pāṭha: piba | vardhasva | tava | gha | sutāsaḥ | indra | somāsaḥ | prathamāḥ | uta | ime || yathā | apibaḥ | pūrvyān | indra | somān | eva | pāhi | panyaḥ | adya | navīyān ||3.36.3||

IAST: yathāpibaḥ pūrvyām̐ indra somām̐ evā pāhi panyo adyā navīyān
Griffith: Even as thou drankest, Indra, earlier Somas, so drink to-day, a new guest, meet for praises.
Devanāgarī: यथापिबः पूर्व्याँ इन्द्र सोमाँ एवा पाहि पन्यो अद्या नवीयान्
pada pāṭha: piba | vardhasva | tava | gha | sutāsaḥ | indra | somāsaḥ | prathamāḥ | uta | ime || yathā | apibaḥ | pūrvyān | indra | somān | eva | pāhi | panyaḥ | adya | navīyān ||3.36.3||

IAST: mahām̐ amatro vṛjane virapśy ugraṁ śavaḥ patyate dhṛṣṇv ojaḥ
Griffith: Great and impetuous, mighty-voiced in battle, surpassing power is his, and strength resistless.
Devanāgarī: महाँ अमत्रो वृजने विरप्श्युग्रं शवः पत्यते धृष्ण्वोजः
pada pāṭha: mahān | amatraḥ | vr̥jane | vi-rapśī | ugram | śavaḥ | patyate | dhr̥ṣṇu | ojaḥ || na | aha | vivyāca | pr̥thivī | cana | enam | yat | somāsaḥ | hari-aśvam | amandan ||3.36.4||

IAST: nāha vivyāca pṛthivī canainaṁ yat somāso haryaśvam amandan
Griffith: Him the broad earth hath never comprehended when Somas cheered the Lord of Tawny Coursers.
Devanāgarī: नाह विव्याच पृथिवी चनैनं यत्सोमासो हर्यश्वममन्दन्
pada pāṭha: mahān | amatraḥ | vr̥jane | vi-rapśī | ugram | śavaḥ | patyate | dhr̥ṣṇu | ojaḥ || na | aha | vivyāca | pr̥thivī | cana | enam | yat | somāsaḥ | hari-aśvam | amandan ||3.36.4||

IAST: mahām̐ ugro vāvṛdhe vīryāya samācakre vṛṣabhaḥ kāvyena
Griffith: Mighty and strong he waxed for hero exploit: the Bull was furnished a Sage's wisdom.
Devanāgarī: महाँ उग्रो वावृधे वीर्याय समाचक्रे वृषभः काव्येन
pada pāṭha: mahān | ugraḥ | vavr̥dhe | vīryāya | sam-ācakre | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | kāvyena || indraḥ | bhagaḥ | vāja-dāḥ | asya | gāvaḥ | pra | jāyante | dakṣiṇāḥ | asya | pūrvīḥ ||3.36.5||

IAST: indro bhago vājadā asya gāvaḥ pra jāyante dakṣiṇā asya pūrvīḥ
Griffith: Indra is our kind Lord; his steers have vigour; his cows are many with abundant offspring.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो भगो वाजदा अस्य गावः प्र जायन्ते दक्षिणा अस्य पूर्वीः
pada pāṭha: mahān | ugraḥ | vavr̥dhe | vīryāya | sam-ācakre | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | kāvyena || indraḥ | bhagaḥ | vāja-dāḥ | asya | gāvaḥ | pra | jāyante | dakṣiṇāḥ | asya | pūrvīḥ ||3.36.5||

IAST: pra yat sindhavaḥ prasavaṁ yathāyann āpaḥ samudraṁ rathyeva jagmuḥ
Griffith: As floods according to their stream flow onward, so to the sea, as borne on cars, the waters.
Devanāgarī: प्र यत्सिन्धवः प्रसवं यथायन्नापः समुद्रं रथ्येव जग्मुः
pada pāṭha: pra | yat | sindhavaḥ | pra-savam | yathā | āyan | āpaḥ | samudram | rathyā-iva | jagmuḥ || ataḥ | cit | indraḥ | sadasaḥ | varīyān | yat | īm | somaḥ | pr̥ṇati | dugdhaḥ | aṁśuḥ ||3.36.6||

IAST: ataś cid indraḥ sadaso varīyān yad īṁ somaḥ pṛṇati dugdho aṁśuḥ
Griffith: Vaster is Indra even than his dwelling, what time the stalk milked out, the Soma, fills him.
Devanāgarī: अतश्चिदिन्द्रः सदसो वरीयान्यदीं सोमः पृणति दुग्धो अंशुः
pada pāṭha: pra | yat | sindhavaḥ | pra-savam | yathā | āyan | āpaḥ | samudram | rathyā-iva | jagmuḥ || ataḥ | cit | indraḥ | sadasaḥ | varīyān | yat | īm | somaḥ | pr̥ṇati | dugdhaḥ | aṁśuḥ ||3.36.6||

IAST: samudreṇa sindhavo yādamānā indrāya somaṁ suṣutam bharantaḥ
Griffith: Eager to mingle with the sea, the rivers carry the well-pressed Soma juice to Indra.
Devanāgarī: समुद्रेण सिन्धवो यादमाना इन्द्राय सोमं सुषुतं भरन्तः
pada pāṭha: samudreṇa | sindhavaḥ | yādamānāḥ | indrāya | somam | su-sutam | bharantaḥ || aṁśum | duhanti | hastinaḥ | bharitraiḥ | madhvaḥ | punanti | dhārayā | pavitraiḥ ||3.36.7||

IAST: aṁśuṁ duhanti hastino bharitrair madhvaḥ punanti dhārayā pavitraiḥ
Griffith: They drain the stalk out with their arms, quick-banded, and cleanse it with a stream of mead and filters.
Devanāgarī: अंशुं दुहन्ति हस्तिनो भरित्रैर्मध्वः पुनन्ति धारया पवित्रैः
pada pāṭha: samudreṇa | sindhavaḥ | yādamānāḥ | indrāya | somam | su-sutam | bharantaḥ || aṁśum | duhanti | hastinaḥ | bharitraiḥ | madhvaḥ | punanti | dhārayā | pavitraiḥ ||3.36.7||

IAST: hradā iva kukṣayaḥ somadhānāḥ sam ī vivyāca savanā purūṇi
Griffith: Like lakes appear his flanks filled full with Soma: yea, he contains libations in abundance.
Devanāgarī: ह्रदा इव कुक्षयः सोमधानाः समी विव्याच सवना पुरूणि
pada pāṭha: hradāḥ-iva | kukṣayaḥ | soma-dhānāḥ | sam | īmiti | vivyāca | savanā | purūṇi || annā | yat | indraḥ | prathamā | vi | āśa | vr̥tram | jaghanvān | avr̥ṇīta | somam ||3.36.8||

IAST: annā yad indraḥ prathamā vy āśa vṛtraṁ jaghanvām̐ avṛṇīta somam
Griffith: When Indra had consumed the first sweet viands, he, after slaying Vrtra, claimed the Soma.
Devanāgarī: अन्ना यदिन्द्रः प्रथमा व्याश वृत्रं जघन्वाँ अवृणीत सोमम्
pada pāṭha: hradāḥ-iva | kukṣayaḥ | soma-dhānāḥ | sam | īmiti | vivyāca | savanā | purūṇi || annā | yat | indraḥ | prathamā | vi | āśa | vr̥tram | jaghanvān | avr̥ṇīta | somam ||3.36.8||

IAST: ā tū bhara mākir etat pari ṣṭhād vidmā hi tvā vasupatiṁ vasūnām
Griffith: Then bring thou hither, and let none prevent it: we know thee well, the Lord of wealth and treasure.
Devanāgarī: आ तू भर माकिरेतत्परि ष्ठाद्विद्मा हि त्वा वसुपतिं वसूनाम्
pada pāṭha: ā | tu | bhara | mākiḥ | etat | pari | sthāt | vidma | hi | tvā | vasu-patim | vasūnām || indra | yat | te | māhinam | datram | asti | asmabhyam | tat | hari-aśva | pra | yandhi ||3.36.9||

IAST: indra yat te māhinaṁ datram asty asmabhyaṁ tad dharyaśva pra yandhi
Griffith: That splendid gift which is thine own, O Indra, vouchsafe to us, Lord of the Tawny Coursers.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र यत्ते माहिनं दत्रमस्त्यस्मभ्यं तद्धर्यश्व प्र यन्धि
pada pāṭha: ā | tu | bhara | mākiḥ | etat | pari | sthāt | vidma | hi | tvā | vasu-patim | vasūnām || indra | yat | te | māhinam | datram | asti | asmabhyam | tat | hari-aśva | pra | yandhi ||3.36.9||

IAST: asme pra yandhi maghavann ṛjīṣinn indra rāyo viśvavārasya bhūreḥ
Griffith: O Indra, Maghavan, impetuous mover, grant us abundant wealth that brings all blessings.
Devanāgarī: अस्मे प्र यन्धि मघवन्नृजीषिन्निन्द्र रायो विश्ववारस्य भूरेः
pada pāṭha: asme iti | pra | yandhi | magha-van | r̥jīṣin | indra | rāyaḥ | viśva-vārasya | bhūreḥ || asme iti | śatam | śaradaḥ | jīvase | dhāḥ | asme iti | vīrān | śaśvataḥ | indra | śiprin ||3.36.10||

IAST: asme śataṁ śarado jīvase dhā asme vīrāñ chaśvata indra śiprin
Griffith: Give us a hundred autumns for our lifetime: give us, O fair-checked Indra, store of heroes.
Devanāgarī: अस्मे शतं शरदो जीवसे धा अस्मे वीराञ्छश्वत इन्द्र शिप्रिन्
pada pāṭha: asme iti | pra | yandhi | magha-van | r̥jīṣin | indra | rāyaḥ | viśva-vārasya | bhūreḥ || asme iti | śatam | śaradaḥ | jīvase | dhāḥ | asme iti | vīrān | śaśvataḥ | indra | śiprin ||3.36.10||

IAST: śunaṁ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṁ vājasātau
Griffith: Call we on Indra, Maghavan, auspicious, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered,
Devanāgarī: शुनं हुवेम मघवानमिन्द्रमस्मिन्भरे नृतमं वाजसातौ
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.36.11||

IAST: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṁ vṛtrāṇi saṁjitaṁ dhanānām
Griffith: The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vrtras, wins and gathers riches.
Devanāgarī: शृण्वन्तमुग्रमूतये समत्सु घ्नन्तं वृत्राणि संजितं धनानाम्
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.36.11||

IAST: vārtrahatyāya śavase pṛtanāṣāhyāya ca
Griffith: O INDRA, for the strength that slays Vrtra and conquers in the fight,
Devanāgarī: वार्त्रहत्याय शवसे पृतनाषाह्याय च
pada pāṭha: vārtra-hatyāya | śavase | pr̥tanā-sahyāya | ca || indra | tvā | ā | vartayāmasi ||3.37.1||

IAST: indra tvā vartayāmasi
Griffith: We turn thee hitherward to us.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र त्वा वर्तयामसि
pada pāṭha: vārtra-hatyāya | śavase | pr̥tanā-sahyāya | ca || indra | tvā | ā | vartayāmasi ||3.37.1||

IAST: arvācīnaṁ su te mana uta cakṣuḥ śatakrato
Griffith: O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers, may those who praise thee hitherward.
Devanāgarī: अर्वाचीनं सु ते मन उत चक्षुः शतक्रतो
pada pāṭha: arvācīnam | su | te | manaḥ | uta | cakṣuḥ | śatakrato iti śata-krato || indra | kr̥ṇvantu | vāghataḥ ||3.37.2||

IAST: indra kṛṇvantu vāghataḥ
Griffith: Direct thy spirit and thine eye.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र कृण्वन्तु वाघतः
pada pāṭha: arvācīnam | su | te | manaḥ | uta | cakṣuḥ | śatakrato iti śata-krato || indra | kr̥ṇvantu | vāghataḥ ||3.37.2||

IAST: nāmāni te śatakrato viśvābhir gīrbhir īmahe
Griffith: O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers, with all our songs we invocate
Devanāgarī: नामानि ते शतक्रतो विश्वाभिर्गीर्भिरीमहे
pada pāṭha: nāmāni | te | śatakrato iti śata-krato | viśvābhiḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | īmahe || indra | abhimāti-sahye ||3.37.3||

IAST: indrābhimātiṣāhye
Griffith: Thy names for triumph over foes.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राभिमातिषाह्ये
pada pāṭha: nāmāni | te | śatakrato iti śata-krato | viśvābhiḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | īmahe || indra | abhimāti-sahye ||3.37.3||

IAST: puruṣṭutasya dhāmabhiḥ śatena mahayāmasi
Griffith: We strive for glory through the powers immense of him whom many praise,
Devanāgarī: पुरुष्टुतस्य धामभिः शतेन महयामसि
pada pāṭha: puru-stutasya | dhāma-bhiḥ | śatena | mahayāmasi || indrasya | carṣaṇi-dhr̥taḥ ||3.37.4||

IAST: indrasya carṣaṇīdhṛtaḥ
Griffith: Of Indra who supports mankind.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रस्य चर्षणीधृतः
pada pāṭha: puru-stutasya | dhāma-bhiḥ | śatena | mahayāmasi || indrasya | carṣaṇi-dhr̥taḥ ||3.37.4||

IAST: indraṁ vṛtrāya hantave puruhūtam upa bruve
Griffith: For Vrtra's slaughter I address Indra whom many invocate,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं वृत्राय हन्तवे पुरुहूतमुप ब्रुवे
pada pāṭha: indram | vr̥trāya | hantave | puru-hūtam | upa | bruve || bhareṣu | vāja-sātaye ||3.37.5||

IAST: bhareṣu vājasātaye
Griffith: To win us booty in the wars.
Devanāgarī: भरेषु वाजसातये
pada pāṭha: indram | vr̥trāya | hantave | puru-hūtam | upa | bruve || bhareṣu | vāja-sātaye ||3.37.5||

IAST: vājeṣu sāsahir bhava tvām īmahe śatakrato
Griffith: In battles be victorious. We seek thee, Lord of Hundred Powers,
Devanāgarī: वाजेषु सासहिर्भव त्वामीमहे शतक्रतो
pada pāṭha: vājeṣu | sasahiḥ | bhava | tvām | īmahe | śatakrato iti śata-krato || indra | vr̥trāya | hantave ||3.37.6||

IAST: indra vṛtrāya hantave
Griffith: Indra, that Vrtra may be slain.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र वृत्राय हन्तवे
pada pāṭha: vājeṣu | sasahiḥ | bhava | tvām | īmahe | śatakrato iti śata-krato || indra | vr̥trāya | hantave ||3.37.6||

IAST: dyumneṣu pṛtanājye pṛtsutūrṣu śravaḥsu ca
Griffith: In splendid combats of the hosts, in glories where the fight is won.
Devanāgarī: द्युम्नेषु पृतनाज्ये पृत्सुतूर्षु श्रवस्सु च
pada pāṭha: dyumneṣu | pr̥tanājye | pr̥tsutūrṣu | śravaḥ-su | ca || indra | sākṣva | abhi-mātiṣu ||3.37.7||

IAST: indra sākṣvābhimātiṣu
Griffith: Indra, be victor over foes.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र साक्ष्वाभिमातिषु
pada pāṭha: dyumneṣu | pr̥tanājye | pr̥tsutūrṣu | śravaḥ-su | ca || indra | sākṣva | abhi-mātiṣu ||3.37.7||

IAST: śuṣmintamaṁ na ūtaye dyumninam pāhi jāgṛvim
Griffith: Drink thou the Soma for our help, bright, vigilant, exceeding strong,
Devanāgarī: शुष्मिन्तमं न ऊतये द्युम्निनं पाहि जागृविम्
pada pāṭha: śuṣmin-tamam | naḥ | ūtaye | dyumninam | pāhi | jāgr̥vim || indra | somam | śatakrato iti śata-krato ||3.37.8||

IAST: indra somaṁ śatakrato
Griffith: O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र सोमं शतक्रतो
pada pāṭha: śuṣmin-tamam | naḥ | ūtaye | dyumninam | pāhi | jāgr̥vim || indra | somam | śatakrato iti śata-krato ||3.37.8||

IAST: indriyāṇi śatakrato yā te janeṣu pañcasu
Griffith: O Satakratu, powers which thou mid the Five Races hast displayed-
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रियाणि शतक्रतो या ते जनेषु पञ्चसु
pada pāṭha: indriyāṇi | śatakrato iti śata-krato | yā | te | janeṣu | pañca-su || indra | tāni | te | ā | vr̥ṇe ||3.37.9||

IAST: indra tāni ta ā vṛṇe
Griffith: These, Indra, do I claim of thee.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र तानि त आ वृणे
pada pāṭha: indriyāṇi | śatakrato iti śata-krato | yā | te | janeṣu | pañca-su || indra | tāni | te | ā | vr̥ṇe ||3.37.9||

IAST: agann indra śravo bṛhad dyumnaṁ dadhiṣva duṣṭaram
Griffith: Indra, great glory hast thou gained. Win splendid fame which none may mar
Devanāgarī: अगन्निन्द्र श्रवो बृहद्द्युम्नं दधिष्व दुष्टरम्
pada pāṭha: agan | indra | śravaḥ | br̥hat | dyumnam | dadhiṣva | dustaram || ut | te | śuṣmam | tirāmasi ||3.37.10||

IAST: ut te śuṣmaṁ tirāmasi
Griffith: We make thy might perpetual.
Devanāgarī: उत्ते शुष्मं तिरामसि
pada pāṭha: agan | indra | śravaḥ | br̥hat | dyumnam | dadhiṣva | dustaram || ut | te | śuṣmam | tirāmasi ||3.37.10||

IAST: arvāvato na ā gahy atho śakra parāvataḥ
Griffith: Come to us either from anear, Or, Sakra, come from far away.
Devanāgarī: अर्वावतो न आ गह्यथो शक्र परावतः
pada pāṭha: arvā-vataḥ | naḥ | ā | gahi | atho iti | śakra | parā-vataḥ || ūm̐ iti | lokaḥ | yaḥ | te | adri-vaḥ | indra | iha | tataḥ | ā | gahi ||3.37.11||

IAST: u loko yas te adriva indreha tata ā gahi
Griffith: Indra, wherever be thy home, come to us thence, O Thunder-armed.
Devanāgarī: उ लोको यस्ते अद्रिव इन्द्रेह तत आ गहि
pada pāṭha: arvā-vataḥ | naḥ | ā | gahi | atho iti | śakra | parā-vataḥ || ūm̐ iti | lokaḥ | yaḥ | te | adri-vaḥ | indra | iha | tataḥ | ā | gahi ||3.37.11||

IAST: abhi taṣṭeva dīdhayā manīṣām atyo na vājī sudhuro jihānaḥ
Griffith: HASTING like some strong courser good at drawing, a thought have I imagined like a workman.
Devanāgarī: अभि तष्टेव दीधया मनीषामत्यो न वाजी सुधुरो जिहानः
pada pāṭha: abhi | taṣṭā-iva | dīdhaya | manīṣām | atyaḥ | na | vājī | su-dhuraḥ | jihānaḥ || abhi | priyāṇi | marmr̥śat | parāṇi | kavīn | icchāmi | sam-dr̥śe | su-medhāḥ ||3.38.1||

IAST: abhi priyāṇi marmṛśat parāṇi kavīm̐r icchāmi saṁdṛśe sumedhāḥ
Griffith: Pondering what is dearest and most noble, I long to see the sages full of wisdom.
Devanāgarī: अभि प्रियाणि मर्मृशत्पराणि कवीँरिच्छामि संदृशे सुमेधाः
pada pāṭha: abhi | taṣṭā-iva | dīdhaya | manīṣām | atyaḥ | na | vājī | su-dhuraḥ | jihānaḥ || abhi | priyāṇi | marmr̥śat | parāṇi | kavīn | icchāmi | sam-dr̥śe | su-medhāḥ ||3.38.1||

IAST: inota pṛccha janimā kavīnām manodhṛtaḥ sukṛtas takṣata dyām
Griffith: Ask of the sages' mighty generations firm-minded and devout they framed the heaven.
Devanāgarī: इनोत पृच्छ जनिमा कवीनां मनोधृतः सुकृतस्तक्षत द्याम्
pada pāṭha: inā | uta | pr̥ccha | janima | kavīnām | manaḥ-dhr̥taḥ | su-kr̥taḥ | takṣata | dyām || imāḥ | ūm̐ iti | te | pra-nyaḥ | vardhamānāḥ | manaḥ-vātāḥ | adha | nu | dharmaṇi | gman ||3.38.2||

IAST: imā u te praṇyo vardhamānā manovātā adha nu dharmaṇi gman
Griffith: These are thy heart-sought strengthening directions, and they have come to be sky's upholders.
Devanāgarī: इमा उ ते प्रण्यो वर्धमाना मनोवाता अध नु धर्मणि ग्मन्
pada pāṭha: inā | uta | pr̥ccha | janima | kavīnām | manaḥ-dhr̥taḥ | su-kr̥taḥ | takṣata | dyām || imāḥ | ūm̐ iti | te | pra-nyaḥ | vardhamānāḥ | manaḥ-vātāḥ | adha | nu | dharmaṇi | gman ||3.38.2||

IAST: ni ṣīm id atra guhyā dadhānā uta kṣatrāya rodasī sam añjan
Griffith: Assuming in this world mysterious natures, they decked the heaven and earth for high dominion,
Devanāgarī: नि षीमिदत्र गुह्या दधाना उत क्षत्राय रोदसी समञ्जन्
pada pāṭha: ni | sīm | it | atra | guhyā | dadhānāḥ | uta | kṣatrāya | rodasī iti | sam | añjan || sam | mātrābhiḥ | mamire | yemuḥ | urvī iti | antaḥ | mahī iti | samr̥te iti sam-r̥te | dhāyase | dhuriti dhuḥ ||3.38.3||

IAST: sam mātrābhir mamire yemur urvī antar mahī samṛte dhāyase dhuḥ
Griffith: Measured with measures, fixed their broad expanses, set the great worlds apart held firm for safety.
Devanāgarī: सं मात्राभिर्ममिरे येमुरुर्वी अन्तर्मही समृते धायसे धुः
pada pāṭha: ni | sīm | it | atra | guhyā | dadhānāḥ | uta | kṣatrāya | rodasī iti | sam | añjan || sam | mātrābhiḥ | mamire | yemuḥ | urvī iti | antaḥ | mahī iti | samr̥te iti sam-r̥te | dhāyase | dhuriti dhuḥ ||3.38.3||

IAST: ātiṣṭhantam pari viśve abhūṣañ chriyo vasānaś carati svarociḥ
Griffith: Even as he mounted up they all adorned him: self-luminous he travels clothed in splendour.
Devanāgarī: आतिष्ठन्तं परि विश्वे अभूषञ्छ्रियो वसानश्चरति स्वरोचिः
pada pāṭha: ā-tiṣṭhantam | pari | viśve | abhūṣan | śriyaḥ | vasānaḥ | carati | sva-rociḥ || mahat | tat | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | asurasya | nāma | ā | viśva-rūpaḥ | amr̥tāni | tasthau ||3.38.4||

IAST: mahat tad vṛṣṇo asurasya nāmā viśvarūpo amṛtāni tasthau
Griffith: That is the Bull's, the Asura's mighty figure: he, omniform, hath reached the eternal waters.
Devanāgarī: महत्तद्वृष्णो असुरस्य नामा विश्वरूपो अमृतानि तस्थौ
pada pāṭha: ā-tiṣṭhantam | pari | viśve | abhūṣan | śriyaḥ | vasānaḥ | carati | sva-rociḥ || mahat | tat | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | asurasya | nāma | ā | viśva-rūpaḥ | amr̥tāni | tasthau ||3.38.4||

IAST: asūta pūrvo vṛṣabho jyāyān imā asya śurudhaḥ santi pūrvīḥ
Griffith: First the more ancient Bull engendered offspring; these are his many draughts that lent him vigour.
Devanāgarī: असूत पूर्वो वृषभो ज्यायानिमा अस्य शुरुधः सन्ति पूर्वीः
pada pāṭha: asūta | pūrvaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | jyāyān | imāḥ | asya | śurudhaḥ | santi | pūrvīḥ || divaḥ | napātā | vidathasya | dhībhiḥ | kṣatram | rājānā | pra-divaḥ | dadhāthe iti ||3.38.5||

IAST: divo napātā vidathasya dhībhiḥ kṣatraṁ rājānā pradivo dadhāthe
Griffith: From days of old ye Kings, two Sons of Heaven, by hymns of sacrifice have won dominion.
Devanāgarī: दिवो नपाता विदथस्य धीभिः क्षत्रं राजाना प्रदिवो दधाथे
pada pāṭha: asūta | pūrvaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | jyāyān | imāḥ | asya | śurudhaḥ | santi | pūrvīḥ || divaḥ | napātā | vidathasya | dhībhiḥ | kṣatram | rājānā | pra-divaḥ | dadhāthe iti ||3.38.5||

IAST: trīṇi rājānā vidathe purūṇi pari viśvāni bhūṣathaḥ sadāṁsi
Griffith: Three seats ye Sovrans, in the Holy synod, many, yea, all, ye honour with your presence.
Devanāgarī: त्रीणि राजाना विदथे पुरूणि परि विश्वानि भूषथः सदांसि
pada pāṭha: trīṇi | rājānā | vidathe | purūṇi | pari | viśvāni | bhūṣathaḥ | sadāṁsi || apaśyam | atra | manasā | jaganvān | vrate | gandharvān | api | vāyu-keśān ||3.38.6||

IAST: apaśyam atra manasā jaganvān vrate gandharvām̐ api vāyukeśān
Griffith: There saw I, going thither in the spirit, Gandharvas in their course with wind-blown tresses.
Devanāgarī: अपश्यमत्र मनसा जगन्वान्व्रते गन्धर्वाँ अपि वायुकेशान्
pada pāṭha: trīṇi | rājānā | vidathe | purūṇi | pari | viśvāni | bhūṣathaḥ | sadāṁsi || apaśyam | atra | manasā | jaganvān | vrate | gandharvān | api | vāyu-keśān ||3.38.6||

IAST: tad in nv asya vṛṣabhasya dhenor ā nāmabhir mamire sakmyaṁ goḥ
Griffith: That same companionship of her, the Milch-cow, here with the strong Bull's divers forms they stablished.
Devanāgarī: तदिन्न्वस्य वृषभस्य धेनोरा नामभिर्ममिरे सक्म्यं गोः
pada pāṭha: tat | it | nu | asya | vr̥ṣabhasya | dhenoḥ | ā | nāma-bhiḥ | mamire | sakmyam | goḥ || anyat-anyat | asuryam | vasānāḥ | ni | māyinaḥ | mamire | rūpam | asmin ||3.38.7||

IAST: anyad-anyad asuryaṁ vasānā ni māyino mamire rūpam asmin
Griffith: Enduing still some new celestial figure, the skilful workers shaped a form around him.
Devanāgarī: अन्यदन्यदसुर्यं वसाना नि मायिनो ममिरे रूपमस्मिन्
pada pāṭha: tat | it | nu | asya | vr̥ṣabhasya | dhenoḥ | ā | nāma-bhiḥ | mamire | sakmyam | goḥ || anyat-anyat | asuryam | vasānāḥ | ni | māyinaḥ | mamire | rūpam | asmin ||3.38.7||

IAST: tad in nv asya savitur nakir me hiraṇyayīm amatiṁ yām aśiśret
Griffith: Let no one here debar me from enjoying the golden light which Savitar diffuses.
Devanāgarī: तदिन्न्वस्य सवितुर्नकिर्मे हिरण्ययीममतिं यामशिश्रेत्
pada pāṭha: tat | it | nu | asya | savituḥ | nakiḥ | me | hiraṇyayīm | amatim | yām | aśiśret || ā | su-stutī | rodasī iti | viśvaminve iti viśvam-inve | api-iva | yoṣā | janimāni | vavre ||3.38.8||

IAST: ā suṣṭutī rodasī viśvaminve apīva yoṣā janimāni vavre
Griffith: He covers both all-fostering worlds with praises even as a woman cherishes her children.
Devanāgarī: आ सुष्टुती रोदसी विश्वमिन्वे अपीव योषा जनिमानि वव्रे
pada pāṭha: tat | it | nu | asya | savituḥ | nakiḥ | me | hiraṇyayīm | amatim | yām | aśiśret || ā | su-stutī | rodasī iti | viśvaminve iti viśvam-inve | api-iva | yoṣā | janimāni | vavre ||3.38.8||

IAST: yuvam pratnasya sādhatho maho yad daivī svastiḥ pari ṇaḥ syātam
Griffith: Fulfil, ye twain, his work, the Great, the Ancient: as heavenly blessing keep your guard around us.
Devanāgarī: युवं प्रत्नस्य साधथो महो यद्दैवी स्वस्तिः परि णः स्यातम्
pada pāṭha: yuvam | pratnasya | sādhathaḥ | mahaḥ | yat | daivī | svastiḥ | pari | naḥ | syātam || gopājihvasya | tasthuṣaḥ | vi-rūpā | viśve | paśyanti | māyinaḥ | kr̥tāni ||3.38.9||

IAST: gopājihvasya tasthuṣo virūpā viśve paśyanti māyinaḥ kṛtāni
Griffith: All the wise Gods behold his varied actions who stands erect, whose voice is like a herdsman's.
Devanāgarī: गोपाजिह्वस्य तस्थुषो विरूपा विश्वे पश्यन्ति मायिनः कृतानि
pada pāṭha: yuvam | pratnasya | sādhathaḥ | mahaḥ | yat | daivī | svastiḥ | pari | naḥ | syātam || gopājihvasya | tasthuṣaḥ | vi-rūpā | viśve | paśyanti | māyinaḥ | kr̥tāni ||3.38.9||

IAST: śunaṁ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṁ vājasātau
Griffith: Call we on Indra, Maghavan, auspicious, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered,
Devanāgarī: शुनं हुवेम मघवानमिन्द्रमस्मिन्भरे नृतमं वाजसातौ
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.38.10||

IAST: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṁ vṛtrāṇi saṁjitaṁ dhanānām
Griffith: The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vrtras, wins and gathers riches.
Devanāgarī: शृण्वन्तमुग्रमूतये समत्सु घ्नन्तं वृत्राणि संजितं धनानाम्
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.38.10||

IAST: indram matir hṛda ā vacyamānācchā patiṁ stomataṣṭā jigāti
Griffith: To Indra from the heart the hymn proceedeth, to him the Lord, recited, built with praises;
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं मतिर्हृद आ वच्यमानाच्छा पतिं स्तोमतष्टा जिगाति
pada pāṭha: indram | matiḥ | hr̥daḥ | ā | vacyamānā | accha | patim | stoma-taṣṭā | jigāti || yā | jāgr̥viḥ | vidathe | śasyamānā | indra | yat | te | jāyate | viddhi | tasya ||3.39.1||

IAST: yā jāgṛvir vidathe śasyamānendra yat te jāyate viddhi tasya
Griffith: The wakening song sung forth in holy synod: that which is born for thee, O Indra, notice.
Devanāgarī: या जागृविर्विदथे शस्यमानेन्द्र यत्ते जायते विद्धि तस्य
pada pāṭha: indram | matiḥ | hr̥daḥ | ā | vacyamānā | accha | patim | stoma-taṣṭā | jigāti || yā | jāgr̥viḥ | vidathe | śasyamānā | indra | yat | te | jāyate | viddhi | tasya ||3.39.1||

IAST: divaś cid ā pūrvyā jāyamānā vi jāgṛvir vidathe śasyamānā
Griffith: Born from the heaven e'en in the days aforetime, wakening, sting aloud in holy synod,
Devanāgarī: दिवश्चिदा पूर्व्या जायमाना वि जागृविर्विदथे शस्यमाना
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | cit | ā | pūrvyā | jāyamānā | vi | jāgr̥viḥ | vidathe | śasyamānā || bhadrā | vastrāṇi | arjunā | vasānā | sā | iyam | asme iti | sana-jā | pitryā | dhīḥ ||3.39.2||

IAST: bhadrā vastrāṇy arjunā vasānā seyam asme sanajā pitryā dhīḥ
Griffith: Auspicious, clad in white and shining raiment, this is the ancient hymn of our forefathers.
Devanāgarī: भद्रा वस्त्राण्यर्जुना वसाना सेयमस्मे सनजा पित्र्या धीः
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | cit | ā | pūrvyā | jāyamānā | vi | jāgr̥viḥ | vidathe | śasyamānā || bhadrā | vastrāṇi | arjunā | vasānā | sā | iyam | asme iti | sana-jā | pitryā | dhīḥ ||3.39.2||

IAST: yamā cid atra yamasūr asūta jihvāyā agram patad ā hy asthāt
Griffith: The Mother of the Twins hath borne Twin Children: my tongue's tip raised itself and rested silent.
Devanāgarī: यमा चिदत्र यमसूरसूत जिह्वाया अग्रं पतदा ह्यस्थात्
pada pāṭha: yamā | cit | atra | yama-sūḥ | asūta | jihvāyāḥ | agram | patat | ā | hi | asthāt || vapūṁṣi | jātā | mithunā | sacete iti | tamaḥ-hanā | tapuṣaḥ | budhne | ā-itā ||3.39.3||

IAST: vapūṁṣi jātā mithunā sacete tamohanā tapuṣo budhna etā
Griffith: Killing the darkness at the light's foundation, the Couple newly born attain their beauty.
Devanāgarī: वपूंषि जाता मिथुना सचेते तमोहना तपुषो बुध्न एता
pada pāṭha: yamā | cit | atra | yama-sūḥ | asūta | jihvāyāḥ | agram | patat | ā | hi | asthāt || vapūṁṣi | jātā | mithunā | sacete iti | tamaḥ-hanā | tapuṣaḥ | budhne | ā-itā ||3.39.3||

IAST: nakir eṣāṁ ninditā martyeṣu ye asmākam pitaro goṣu yodhāḥ
Griffith: Not one is found among them, none of mortals, to blame our sires who fought to win the cattle.
Devanāgarī: नकिरेषां निन्दिता मर्त्येषु ये अस्माकं पितरो गोषु योधाः
pada pāṭha: nakiḥ | eṣām | ninditā | martyeṣu | ye | asmākam | pitaraḥ | goṣu | yodhāḥ || indraḥ | eṣām | dr̥ṁhitā | māhina-vān | ut | gotrāṇi | sasr̥je | daṁsanā-vān ||3.39.4||

IAST: indra eṣāṁ dṛṁhitā māhināvān ud gotrāṇi sasṛje daṁsanāvān
Griffith: Their strengthener was Indra the Majestic he spread their stalls of kine the Wonder-Worker.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र एषां दृंहिता माहिनावानुद्गोत्राणि ससृजे दंसनावान्
pada pāṭha: nakiḥ | eṣām | ninditā | martyeṣu | ye | asmākam | pitaraḥ | goṣu | yodhāḥ || indraḥ | eṣām | dr̥ṁhitā | māhina-vān | ut | gotrāṇi | sasr̥je | daṁsanā-vān ||3.39.4||

IAST: sakhā ha yatra sakhibhir navagvair abhijñv ā satvabhir gā anugman
Griffith: Where as a Friend with friendly men, Navagvas, with heroes, on his knees he sought the cattle.
Devanāgarī: सखा ह यत्र सखिभिर्नवग्वैरभिज्ञ्वा सत्वभिर्गा अनुग्मन्
pada pāṭha: sakhā | ha | yatra | sakhi-bhiḥ | nava-gvaiḥ | abhi-jñu | ā | satva-bhiḥ | gāḥ | anu-gman || satyam | tat | indraḥ | daśa-bhiḥ | daśa-gvaiḥ | sūryam | viveda | tamasi | kṣiyantam ||3.39.5||

IAST: satyaṁ tad indro daśabhir daśagvaiḥ sūryaṁ viveda tamasi kṣiyantam
Griffith: There, verily with ten Dasagvas Indra found the Sun lying hidden in the darkness.
Devanāgarī: सत्यं तदिन्द्रो दशभिर्दशग्वैः सूर्यं विवेद तमसि क्षियन्तम्
pada pāṭha: sakhā | ha | yatra | sakhi-bhiḥ | nava-gvaiḥ | abhi-jñu | ā | satva-bhiḥ | gāḥ | anu-gman || satyam | tat | indraḥ | daśa-bhiḥ | daśa-gvaiḥ | sūryam | viveda | tamasi | kṣiyantam ||3.39.5||

IAST: indro madhu sambhṛtam usriyāyām padvad viveda śaphavan name goḥ
Griffith: Indra found meath collected in the milch-cow, by foot and hoof, in the cow's place of pasture.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो मधु सम्भृतमुस्रियायां पद्वद्विवेद शफवन्नमे गोः
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | madhu | sam-bhr̥tam | usriyāyām | pat-vat | viveda | śapha-vat | name | goḥ || guhā | hitam | guhyam | gūḷham | ap-su | haste | dadhe | dakṣiṇe | dakṣiṇa-vān ||3.39.6||

IAST: guhā hitaṁ guhyaṁ gūḻham apsu haste dadhe dakṣiṇe dakṣiṇāvān
Griffith: That which lay secret, hidden in the waters, he held in his right hand, the rich rewarder.
Devanāgarī: गुहा हितं गुह्यं गूळ्हमप्सु हस्ते दधे दक्षिणे दक्षिणावान्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | madhu | sam-bhr̥tam | usriyāyām | pat-vat | viveda | śapha-vat | name | goḥ || guhā | hitam | guhyam | gūḷham | ap-su | haste | dadhe | dakṣiṇe | dakṣiṇa-vān ||3.39.6||

IAST: jyotir vṛṇīta tamaso vijānann āre syāma duritād abhīke
Griffith: He took the light, discerning it from darkness: may we be far removed from all misfortune.
Devanāgarī: ज्योतिर्वृणीत तमसो विजानन्नारे स्याम दुरितादभीके
pada pāṭha: jyotiḥ | vr̥ṇīta | tamasaḥ | vi-jānan | āre | syāma | duḥ-itāt | abhīke || imāḥ | giraḥ | soma-pāḥ | soma-vr̥ddha | juṣasva | indra | puru-tamasya | kāroḥ ||3.39.7||

IAST: imā giraḥ somapāḥ somavṛddha juṣasvendra purutamasya kāroḥ
Griffith: These songs, O Soma-drinker, cheered by Soma, Indra, accept from thy most zealous poet.
Devanāgarī: इमा गिरः सोमपाः सोमवृद्ध जुषस्वेन्द्र पुरुतमस्य कारोः
pada pāṭha: jyotiḥ | vr̥ṇīta | tamasaḥ | vi-jānan | āre | syāma | duḥ-itāt | abhīke || imāḥ | giraḥ | soma-pāḥ | soma-vr̥ddha | juṣasva | indra | puru-tamasya | kāroḥ ||3.39.7||

IAST: jyotir yajñāya rodasī anu ṣyād āre syāma duritasya bhūreḥ
Griffith: Let there be light through both the worlds for worship: may we be far from most overwhelming evil.
Devanāgarī: ज्योतिर्यज्ञाय रोदसी अनु ष्यादारे स्याम दुरितस्य भूरेः
pada pāṭha: jyotiḥ | yajñāya | rodasī iti | anu | syāt | āre | syāma | duḥ-itasya | bhūreḥ || bhūri | cit | hi | tujataḥ | martyasya | su-pārāsaḥ | vasavaḥ | barhaṇā-vat ||3.39.8||

IAST: bhūri cid dhi tujato martyasya supārāso vasavo barhaṇāvat
Griffith: Great woe comes even from the hostile mortal, piled up; but good at rescue are the Vasus.
Devanāgarī: भूरि चिद्धि तुजतो मर्त्यस्य सुपारासो वसवो बर्हणावत्
pada pāṭha: jyotiḥ | yajñāya | rodasī iti | anu | syāt | āre | syāma | duḥ-itasya | bhūreḥ || bhūri | cit | hi | tujataḥ | martyasya | su-pārāsaḥ | vasavaḥ | barhaṇā-vat ||3.39.8||

IAST: śunaṁ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṁ vājasātau
Griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered,
Devanāgarī: शुनं हुवेम मघवानमिन्द्रमस्मिन्भरे नृतमं वाजसातौ
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.39.9||

IAST: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṁ vṛtrāṇi saṁjitaṁ dhanānām
Griffith: The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vrtras, wins and gathers riches.
Devanāgarī: शृण्वन्तमुग्रमूतये समत्सु घ्नन्तं वृत्राणि संजितं धनानाम्
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.39.9||

IAST: indra tvā vṛṣabhaṁ vayaṁ sute some havāmahe
Griffith: THEE, Indra, we invoke, the Bull, what time the Soma is expressed.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र त्वा वृषभं वयं सुते सोमे हवामहे
pada pāṭha: indra | tvā | vr̥ṣabham | vayam | sute | some | havāmahe || saḥ | pāhi | madhvaḥ | andhasaḥ ||3.40.1||

IAST: sa pāhi madhvo andhasaḥ
Griffith: So drink thou of the savoury juice.
Devanāgarī: स पाहि मध्वो अन्धसः
pada pāṭha: indra | tvā | vr̥ṣabham | vayam | sute | some | havāmahe || saḥ | pāhi | madhvaḥ | andhasaḥ ||3.40.1||

IAST: indra kratuvidaṁ sutaṁ somaṁ harya puruṣṭuta
Griffith: Indra, whom many laud, accept the strength-conferring Soma juice:
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र क्रतुविदं सुतं सोमं हर्य पुरुष्टुत
pada pāṭha: indra | kratu-vidam | sutam | somam | harya | puru-stuta || piba | ā | vr̥ṣasva | tatr̥pim ||3.40.2||

IAST: pibā vṛṣasva tātṛpim
Griffith: Quaff, pour down drink that satisfies.
Devanāgarī: पिबा वृषस्व तातृपिम्
pada pāṭha: indra | kratu-vidam | sutam | somam | harya | puru-stuta || piba | ā | vr̥ṣasva | tatr̥pim ||3.40.2||

IAST: indra pra ṇo dhitāvānaṁ yajñaṁ viśvebhir devebhiḥ
Griffith: Indra, with all the Gods promote our wealth-bestowing sacrifice,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र प्र णो धितावानं यज्ञं विश्वेभिर्देवेभिः
pada pāṭha: indra | pra | naḥ | dhita-vānam | yajñam | viśvebhiḥ | devebhiḥ || tira | stavāna | viśpate ||3.40.3||

IAST: tira stavāna viśpate
Griffith: Thou highly-lauded Lord of men.
Devanāgarī: तिर स्तवान विश्पते
pada pāṭha: indra | pra | naḥ | dhita-vānam | yajñam | viśvebhiḥ | devebhiḥ || tira | stavāna | viśpate ||3.40.3||

IAST: indra somāḥ sutā ime tava pra yanti satpate
Griffith: Lord of the brave, to thee proceed these drops of Soma juice expressed,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र सोमाः सुता इमे तव प्र यन्ति सत्पते
pada pāṭha: indra | somāḥ | sutāḥ | ime | tava | pra | yanti | sat-pate || kṣayam | candrāsaḥ | indavaḥ ||3.40.4||

IAST: kṣayaṁ candrāsa indavaḥ
Griffith: The bright drops to thy dwelling-place.
Devanāgarī: क्षयं चन्द्रास इन्दवः
pada pāṭha: indra | somāḥ | sutāḥ | ime | tava | pra | yanti | sat-pate || kṣayam | candrāsaḥ | indavaḥ ||3.40.4||

IAST: dadhiṣvā jaṭhare sutaṁ somam indra vareṇyam
Griffith: Within thy belly, Indra, take juice, Soma the most excellent:
Devanāgarī: दधिष्वा जठरे सुतं सोममिन्द्र वरेण्यम्
pada pāṭha: dadhiṣva | jaṭhare | sutam | somam | indra | vareṇyam || tava | dyukṣāsaḥ | indavaḥ ||3.40.5||

IAST: tava dyukṣāsa indavaḥ
Griffith: Thine are the drops celestial.
Devanāgarī: तव द्युक्षास इन्दवः
pada pāṭha: dadhiṣva | jaṭhare | sutam | somam | indra | vareṇyam || tava | dyukṣāsaḥ | indavaḥ ||3.40.5||

IAST: girvaṇaḥ pāhi naḥ sutam madhor dhārābhir ajyase
Griffith: Drink our libation, Lord of hymns: with streams of meath thou art bedewed
Devanāgarī: गिर्वणः पाहि नः सुतं मधोर्धाराभिरज्यसे
pada pāṭha: girvaṇaḥ | pāhi | naḥ | sutam | madhoḥ | dhārābhiḥ | ajyase || indra | tvā-dātam | it | yaśaḥ ||3.40.6||

IAST: indra tvādātam id yaśaḥ
Griffith: Our glory, Indra, is thy gift.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र त्वादातमिद्यशः
pada pāṭha: girvaṇaḥ | pāhi | naḥ | sutam | madhoḥ | dhārābhiḥ | ajyase || indra | tvā-dātam | it | yaśaḥ ||3.40.6||

IAST: abhi dyumnāni vanina indraṁ sacante akṣitā
Griffith: To Indra go the treasures of the worshipper, which never fail:
Devanāgarī: अभि द्युम्नानि वनिन इन्द्रं सचन्ते अक्षिता
pada pāṭha: abhi | dyumnāni | vaninaḥ | indram | sacante | akṣitā || pītvī | somasya | vavr̥dhe ||3.40.7||

IAST: pītvī somasya vāvṛdhe
Griffith: He drinks the Soma and is strong
Devanāgarī: पीत्वी सोमस्य वावृधे
pada pāṭha: abhi | dyumnāni | vaninaḥ | indram | sacante | akṣitā || pītvī | somasya | vavr̥dhe ||3.40.7||

IAST: arvāvato na ā gahi parāvataś ca vṛtrahan
Griffith: From far away, from near at hand, O Vrtra-slayer, come to us:
Devanāgarī: अर्वावतो न आ गहि परावतश्च वृत्रहन्
pada pāṭha: arvā-vataḥ | naḥ | ā | gahi | parā-vataḥ | ca | vr̥tra-han || imāḥ | juṣasva | naḥ | giraḥ ||3.40.8||

IAST: imā juṣasva no giraḥ
Griffith: Accept the songs we sing to thee.
Devanāgarī: इमा जुषस्व नो गिरः
pada pāṭha: arvā-vataḥ | naḥ | ā | gahi | parā-vataḥ | ca | vr̥tra-han || imāḥ | juṣasva | naḥ | giraḥ ||3.40.8||

IAST: yad antarā parāvatam arvāvataṁ ca hūyase
Griffith: When from the space between the near and far thou art invoked by us,
Devanāgarī: यदन्तरा परावतमर्वावतं च हूयसे
pada pāṭha: yat | antarā | parā-vatam | arvā-vatam | ca | hūyase || indra | iha | tataḥ | ā | gahi ||3.40.9||

IAST: indreha tata ā gahi
Griffith: Thence, Indra. come thou hitherward.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रेह तत आ गहि
pada pāṭha: yat | antarā | parā-vatam | arvā-vatam | ca | hūyase || indra | iha | tataḥ | ā | gahi ||3.40.9||

IAST: ā tū na indra madryag ghuvānaḥ somapītaye
Griffith: INVOKED to drink the Soma juice, come with thy Bay Steeds, Thunder-armed
Devanāgarī: आ तू न इन्द्र मद्र्यग्घुवानः सोमपीतये
pada pāṭha: ā | tu | naḥ | indra | madryak | huvānaḥ | soma-pītaye || hari-bhyām | yāhi | adri-vaḥ ||3.41.1||

IAST: haribhyāṁ yāhy adrivaḥ
Griffith: Come, Indra, hitherward to me.
Devanāgarī: हरिभ्यां याह्यद्रिवः
pada pāṭha: ā | tu | naḥ | indra | madryak | huvānaḥ | soma-pītaye || hari-bhyām | yāhi | adri-vaḥ ||3.41.1||

IAST: satto hotā na ṛtviyas tistire barhir ānuṣak
Griffith: Our priest is seated, true to time; the grass is regularly strewn;
Devanāgarī: सत्तो होता न ऋत्वियस्तिस्तिरे बर्हिरानुषक्
pada pāṭha: sattaḥ | hotā | naḥ | r̥tviyaḥ | tistire | barhiḥ | ānuṣak || ayujran | prātaḥ | adrayaḥ ||3.41.2||

IAST: ayujran prātar adrayaḥ
Griffith: The pressing-stones were set at morn.
Devanāgarī: अयुज्रन्प्रातरद्रयः
pada pāṭha: sattaḥ | hotā | naḥ | r̥tviyaḥ | tistire | barhiḥ | ānuṣak || ayujran | prātaḥ | adrayaḥ ||3.41.2||

IAST: imā brahma brahmavāhaḥ kriyanta ā barhiḥ sīda
Griffith: These prayers, O thou who hearest prayer are offered: seat thee on the grass.
Devanāgarī: इमा ब्रह्म ब्रह्मवाहः क्रियन्त आ बर्हिः सीद
pada pāṭha: imā | brahma | brahma-vāhaḥ | kriyante | ā | barhiḥ | sīda || vīhi | śūra | puroḷāśam ||3.41.3||

IAST: vīhi śūra puroḻāśam
Griffith: Hero, enjoy the offered cake.
Devanāgarī: वीहि शूर पुरोळाशम्
pada pāṭha: imā | brahma | brahma-vāhaḥ | kriyante | ā | barhiḥ | sīda || vīhi | śūra | puroḷāśam ||3.41.3||

IAST: rārandhi savaneṣu ṇa eṣu stomeṣu vṛtrahan
Griffith: O Vrtra-slayer, be thou pleased with these libations, with these hymns,
Devanāgarī: रारन्धि सवनेषु ण एषु स्तोमेषु वृत्रहन्
pada pāṭha: rarandhi | savaneṣu | naḥ | eṣu | stomeṣu | vr̥tra-han || uktheṣu | indra | girvaṇaḥ ||3.41.4||

IAST: uktheṣv indra girvaṇaḥ
Griffith: Song-loving Indra, with our lauds.
Devanāgarī: उक्थेष्विन्द्र गिर्वणः
pada pāṭha: rarandhi | savaneṣu | naḥ | eṣu | stomeṣu | vr̥tra-han || uktheṣu | indra | girvaṇaḥ ||3.41.4||

IAST: matayaḥ somapām uruṁ rihanti śavasas patim
Griffith: Our hymns caress the Lord of Strength, vast, drinker of the Soma's juice,
Devanāgarī: मतयः सोमपामुरुं रिहन्ति शवसस्पतिम्
pada pāṭha: matayaḥ | soma-pām | urum | rihanti | śavasaḥ | patim || indram | vatsam | na | mātaraḥ ||3.41.5||

IAST: indraṁ vatsaṁ na mātaraḥ
Griffith: Indra, as mother-cows their calf.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं वत्सं न मातरः
pada pāṭha: matayaḥ | soma-pām | urum | rihanti | śavasaḥ | patim || indram | vatsam | na | mātaraḥ ||3.41.5||

IAST: sa mandasvā hy andhaso rādhase tanvā mahe
Griffith: Delight thee with the juice we pour for thine own great munificence:
Devanāgarī: स मन्दस्वा ह्यन्धसो राधसे तन्वा महे
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mandasva | hi | andhasaḥ | rādhase | tanvā | mahe || na | stotāram | nide | karaḥ ||3.41.6||

IAST: na stotāraṁ nide karaḥ
Griffith: Yield not thy singer to reproach.
Devanāgarī: न स्तोतारं निदे करः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mandasva | hi | andhasaḥ | rādhase | tanvā | mahe || na | stotāram | nide | karaḥ ||3.41.6||

IAST: vayam indra tvāyavo haviṣmanto jarāmahe
Griffith: We, Indra, dearly loving thee, bearing oblation, sing thee hymns
Devanāgarī: वयमिन्द्र त्वायवो हविष्मन्तो जरामहे
pada pāṭha: vayam | indra | tvā-yavaḥ | haviṣmantaḥ | jarāmahe || uta | tvam | asma-yuḥ | vaso iti ||3.41.7||

IAST: uta tvam asmayur vaso
Griffith: Thou, Vasu, dearly lovest us.
Devanāgarī: उत त्वमस्मयुर्वसो
pada pāṭha: vayam | indra | tvā-yavaḥ | haviṣmantaḥ | jarāmahe || uta | tvam | asma-yuḥ | vaso iti ||3.41.7||

IAST: māre asmad vi mumuco haripriyārvāṅ yāhi
Griffith: O thou to whom thy Bays are dear, loose not thy Horses far from us:
Devanāgarī: मारे अस्मद्वि मुमुचो हरिप्रियार्वाङ्याहि
pada pāṭha: mā | āre | asmat | vi | mumucaḥ | hari-priya | ārvāṅ | yāhi || indra | svadhā-vaḥ | matsva | iha ||3.41.8||

IAST: indra svadhāvo matsveha
Griffith: Here glad thee, Indra, Lord divine.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र स्वधावो मत्स्वेह
pada pāṭha: mā | āre | asmat | vi | mumucaḥ | hari-priya | ārvāṅ | yāhi || indra | svadhā-vaḥ | matsva | iha ||3.41.8||

IAST: arvāñcaṁ tvā sukhe rathe vahatām indra keśinā
Griffith: May long-maned Coursers, dropping oil, bring thee on swift car hitherward,
Devanāgarī: अर्वाञ्चं त्वा सुखे रथे वहतामिन्द्र केशिना
pada pāṭha: arvāñcam | tvā | su-khe | rathe | vahatām | indra | keśinā || ghr̥tasnū iti ghr̥ta-snū | barhiḥ | ā-sade ||3.41.9||

IAST: ghṛtasnū barhir āsade
Griffith: Indra, to seat thee on the grass.
Devanāgarī: घृतस्नू बर्हिरासदे
pada pāṭha: arvāñcam | tvā | su-khe | rathe | vahatām | indra | keśinā || ghr̥tasnū iti ghr̥ta-snū | barhiḥ | ā-sade ||3.41.9||

IAST: upa naḥ sutam ā gahi somam indra gavāśiram
Griffith: COME to the juice that we have pressed, to Sorna, Indra, bleat with milk:
Devanāgarī: उप नः सुतमा गहि सोममिन्द्र गवाशिरम्
pada pāṭha: upa | naḥ | sutam | ā | gahi | somam | indra | go-āśiram || hari-bhyām | yaḥ | te | asma-yuḥ ||3.42.1||

IAST: haribhyāṁ yas te asmayuḥ
Griffith: Come, favouring us, thy Bay-drawn car!
Devanāgarī: हरिभ्यां यस्ते अस्मयुः
pada pāṭha: upa | naḥ | sutam | ā | gahi | somam | indra | go-āśiram || hari-bhyām | yaḥ | te | asma-yuḥ ||3.42.1||

IAST: tam indra madam ā gahi barhiḥṣṭhāṁ grāvabhiḥ sutam
Griffith: Come, Indra, to this gladdening drink, placed on the grass, pressed out with stones:
Devanāgarī: तमिन्द्र मदमा गहि बर्हिःष्ठां ग्रावभिः सुतम्
pada pāṭha: tam | indra | madam | ā | gahi | barhiḥ-sthām | grāva-bhiḥ | sutam || kuvit | nu | asya | tr̥ṣṇavaḥ ||3.42.2||

IAST: kuvin nv asya tṛpṇavaḥ
Griffith: Wilt thou not drink thy fill thereof?
Devanāgarī: कुविन्न्वस्य तृप्णवः
pada pāṭha: tam | indra | madam | ā | gahi | barhiḥ-sthām | grāva-bhiḥ | sutam || kuvit | nu | asya | tr̥ṣṇavaḥ ||3.42.2||

IAST: indram itthā giro mamācchāgur iṣitā itaḥ
Griffith: To Indra have my songs of praise gone forth, thus rapidly sent hence,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रमित्था गिरो ममाच्छागुरिषिता इतः
