pada pāṭha: indram | itthā | giraḥ | mama | accha | aguḥ | iṣitāḥ | itaḥ || ā-vr̥te | soma-pītaye ||3.42.3||

IAST: āvṛte somapītaye
Griffith: To turn him to the Soma-draught.
Devanāgarī: आवृते सोमपीतये
pada pāṭha: indram | itthā | giraḥ | mama | accha | aguḥ | iṣitāḥ | itaḥ || ā-vr̥te | soma-pītaye ||3.42.3||

IAST: indraṁ somasya pītaye stomair iha havāmahe
Griffith: Hither with songs of praise we call Indra to drink the Soma juice:
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं सोमस्य पीतये स्तोमैरिह हवामहे
pada pāṭha: indram | somasya | pītaye | stomaiḥ | iha | havāmahe || ukthebhiḥ | kuvit | ā-gamat ||3.42.4||

IAST: ukthebhiḥ kuvid āgamat
Griffith: Will he not come to us by lauds?
Devanāgarī: उक्थेभिः कुविदागमत्
pada pāṭha: indram | somasya | pītaye | stomaiḥ | iha | havāmahe || ukthebhiḥ | kuvit | ā-gamat ||3.42.4||

IAST: indra somāḥ sutā ime tān dadhiṣva śatakrato
Griffith: Indra, these Somas are expressed. Take them within thy belly, Lord
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र सोमाः सुता इमे तान्दधिष्व शतक्रतो
pada pāṭha: indra | somāḥ | sutāḥ | ime | tān | dadhiṣva | śatakrato iti śata-krato || jaṭhare | vājinīvaso iti vājinī-vaso ||3.42.5||

IAST: jaṭhare vājinīvaso
Griffith: Of Hundred Powers, thou Prince of Wealth.
Devanāgarī: जठरे वाजिनीवसो
pada pāṭha: indra | somāḥ | sutāḥ | ime | tān | dadhiṣva | śatakrato iti śata-krato || jaṭhare | vājinīvaso iti vājinī-vaso ||3.42.5||

IAST: vidmā hi tvā dhanaṁjayaṁ vājeṣu dadhṛṣaṁ kave
Griffith: We know thee winner of the spoil, and resolute in battles, Sage!
Devanāgarī: विद्मा हि त्वा धनंजयं वाजेषु दधृषं कवे
pada pāṭha: vidma | hi | tvā | dhanam-jayam | vājeṣu | dadhr̥ṣam | kave || adha | te | sumnam | īmahe ||3.42.6||

IAST: adhā te sumnam īmahe
Griffith: Therefore thy blessing we implore.
Devanāgarī: अधा ते सुम्नमीमहे
pada pāṭha: vidma | hi | tvā | dhanam-jayam | vājeṣu | dadhr̥ṣam | kave || adha | te | sumnam | īmahe ||3.42.6||

IAST: imam indra gavāśiraṁ yavāśiraṁ ca naḥ piba
Griffith: Borne hither by thy Stallions, drink, Indra, this juice which we have pressed,
Devanāgarī: इममिन्द्र गवाशिरं यवाशिरं च नः पिब
pada pāṭha: imam | indra | go-āśiram | yava-āśiram | ca | naḥ | piba || ā-gatya | vr̥ṣa-bhiḥ | sutam ||3.42.7||

IAST: āgatyā vṛṣabhiḥ sutam
Griffith: Mingled with barley and with milk.
Devanāgarī: आगत्या वृषभिः सुतम्
pada pāṭha: imam | indra | go-āśiram | yava-āśiram | ca | naḥ | piba || ā-gatya | vr̥ṣa-bhiḥ | sutam ||3.42.7||

IAST: tubhyed indra sva okye somaṁ codāmi pītaye
Griffith: Indra, for thee, in thine own place, I urge the Soma for thy draught:
Devanāgarī: तुभ्येदिन्द्र स्व ओक्ये सोमं चोदामि पीतये
pada pāṭha: tubhya | it | indra | sve | okye | somam | codāmi | pītaye || eṣaḥ | rarantu | te | hr̥di ||3.42.8||

IAST: eṣa rārantu te hṛdi
Griffith: Deep in thy heart let it remain,
Devanāgarī: एष रारन्तु ते हृदि
pada pāṭha: tubhya | it | indra | sve | okye | somam | codāmi | pītaye || eṣaḥ | rarantu | te | hr̥di ||3.42.8||

IAST: tvāṁ sutasya pītaye pratnam indra havāmahe
Griffith: We call on thee, the Ancient One, Indra, to drink the Soma juice,
Devanāgarī: त्वां सुतस्य पीतये प्रत्नमिन्द्र हवामहे
pada pāṭha: tvām | sutasya | pītaye | pratnam | indra | havāmahe || kuśikāsaḥ | avasyavaḥ ||3.42.9||

IAST: kuśikāso avasyavaḥ
Griffith: We Kusikas who seek thine aid.
Devanāgarī: कुशिकासो अवस्यवः
pada pāṭha: tvām | sutasya | pītaye | pratnam | indra | havāmahe || kuśikāsaḥ | avasyavaḥ ||3.42.9||

IAST: ā yāhy arvāṅ upa vandhureṣṭhās taved anu pradivaḥ somapeyam
Griffith: MOUNTED upon thy chariot-seat approach us: thine is the Sorna-draught from days aforetime.
Devanāgarī: आ याह्यर्वाङुप वन्धुरेष्ठास्तवेदनु प्रदिवः सोमपेयम्
pada pāṭha: ā | yāhi | arvāṅ | upa | vandhure-sthāḥ | tava | it | anu | pra-divaḥ | soma-peyam || priyā | sakhāyā | vi | muca | upa | barhiḥ | tvām | ime | havya-vāhaḥ | havante ||3.43.1||

IAST: priyā sakhāyā vi mucopa barhis tvām ime havyavāho havante
Griffith: Loose for the sacred grass thy dear companions. These men who bring oblation call thee hither.
Devanāgarī: प्रिया सखाया वि मुचोप बर्हिस्त्वामिमे हव्यवाहो हवन्ते
pada pāṭha: ā | yāhi | arvāṅ | upa | vandhure-sthāḥ | tava | it | anu | pra-divaḥ | soma-peyam || priyā | sakhāyā | vi | muca | upa | barhiḥ | tvām | ime | havya-vāhaḥ | havante ||3.43.1||

IAST: ā yāhi pūrvīr ati carṣaṇīr ām̐ arya āśiṣa upa no haribhyām
Griffith: Come our true Friend, passing by many people; come with thy two Bay Steeds to our devotions;
Devanāgarī: आ याहि पूर्वीरति चर्षणीराँ अर्य आशिष उप नो हरिभ्याम्
pada pāṭha: ā | yāhi | pūrvīḥ | ati | carṣaṇīḥ | ā | aryaḥ | ā-śiṣaḥ | upa | naḥ | hari-bhyām || imāḥ | hi | tvā | matayaḥ | stoma-taṣṭāḥ | indra | havante | sakhyam | juṣāṇāḥ ||3.43.2||

IAST: imā hi tvā matayaḥ stomataṣṭā indra havante sakhyaṁ juṣāṇāḥ
Griffith: For these our hymns are calling thee, O Indra, hymns formed for praise, soliciting thy friendship.
Devanāgarī: इमा हि त्वा मतयः स्तोमतष्टा इन्द्र हवन्ते सख्यं जुषाणाः
pada pāṭha: ā | yāhi | pūrvīḥ | ati | carṣaṇīḥ | ā | aryaḥ | ā-śiṣaḥ | upa | naḥ | hari-bhyām || imāḥ | hi | tvā | matayaḥ | stoma-taṣṭāḥ | indra | havante | sakhyam | juṣāṇāḥ ||3.43.2||

IAST: ā no yajñaṁ namovṛdhaṁ sajoṣā indra deva haribhir yāhi tūyam
Griffith: Pleased, with thy Bay Steeds, Indra, God, come quickly to this our sacrifice that heightens worship;
Devanāgarī: आ नो यज्ञं नमोवृधं सजोषा इन्द्र देव हरिभिर्याहि तूयम्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | yajñam | namaḥ-vr̥dham | sa-joṣāḥ | indra | deva | hari-bhiḥ | yāhi | tūyam || aham | hi | tvā | mati-bhiḥ | johavīmi | ghr̥ta-prayāḥ | sadha-māde | madhūnām ||3.43.3||

IAST: ahaṁ hi tvā matibhir johavīmi ghṛtaprayāḥ sadhamāde madhūnām
Griffith: For with my thoughts, presenting oil to feed thee, I call thee to the feast of sweet libations.
Devanāgarī: अहं हि त्वा मतिभिर्जोहवीमि घृतप्रयाः सधमादे मधूनाम्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | yajñam | namaḥ-vr̥dham | sa-joṣāḥ | indra | deva | hari-bhiḥ | yāhi | tūyam || aham | hi | tvā | mati-bhiḥ | johavīmi | ghr̥ta-prayāḥ | sadha-māde | madhūnām ||3.43.3||

IAST: ā ca tvām etā vṛṣaṇā vahāto harī sakhāyā sudhurā svaṅgā
Griffith: Yea, let thy two Bay Stallions bear thee hither, well limbed and good to draw, thy dear companions.
Devanāgarī: आ च त्वामेता वृषणा वहातो हरी सखाया सुधुरा स्वङ्गा
pada pāṭha: ā | ca | tvām | etā | vr̥ṣaṇā | vahātaḥ | harī iti | sakhāyā | su-dhurā | su-aṅgā || dhānā-vat | indraḥ | savanam | juṣāṇaḥ | sakhā | sakhyuḥ | śr̥ṇavat | vandanāni ||3.43.4||

IAST: dhānāvad indraḥ savanaṁ juṣāṇaḥ sakhā sakhyuḥ śṛṇavad vandanāni
Griffith: Pleased with the corn-blent offering which we bring thee, may Indra, Friend, hear his friend's adoration.
Devanāgarī: धानावदिन्द्रः सवनं जुषाणः सखा सख्युः शृणवद्वन्दनानि
pada pāṭha: ā | ca | tvām | etā | vr̥ṣaṇā | vahātaḥ | harī iti | sakhāyā | su-dhurā | su-aṅgā || dhānā-vat | indraḥ | savanam | juṣāṇaḥ | sakhā | sakhyuḥ | śr̥ṇavat | vandanāni ||3.43.4||

IAST: kuvin mā gopāṁ karase janasya kuvid rājānam maghavann ṛjīṣin
Griffith: Wilt thou not make me guardian of the people, make me, impetuous Maghavan, their ruler?
Devanāgarī: कुविन्मा गोपां करसे जनस्य कुविद्राजानं मघवन्नृजीषिन्
pada pāṭha: kuvit | mā | gopām | karase | janasya | kuvit | rājānam | magha-van | r̥jīṣin || kuvit | mā | r̥ṣim | papi-vāṁsam | sutasya | kuvit | me | vasvaḥ | amr̥tasya | śikṣāḥ ||3.43.5||

IAST: kuvin ma ṛṣim papivāṁsaṁ sutasya kuvin me vasvo amṛtasya śikṣāḥ
Griffith: Make me a Rsi having drunk of Soma? Wilt thou not give me wealth that lasts for ever?
Devanāgarī: कुविन्म ऋषिं पपिवांसं सुतस्य कुविन्मे वस्वो अमृतस्य शिक्षाः
pada pāṭha: kuvit | mā | gopām | karase | janasya | kuvit | rājānam | magha-van | r̥jīṣin || kuvit | mā | r̥ṣim | papi-vāṁsam | sutasya | kuvit | me | vasvaḥ | amr̥tasya | śikṣāḥ ||3.43.5||

IAST: ā tvā bṛhanto harayo yujānā arvāg indra sadhamādo vahantu
Griffith: Yoked to thy chariot, led thy tall Bays, Indra, companions of thy banquet, bear thee hither,
Devanāgarī: आ त्वा बृहन्तो हरयो युजाना अर्वागिन्द्र सधमादो वहन्तु
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | br̥hantaḥ | harayaḥ | yujānāḥ | arvāk | indra | sadha-mādaḥ | vahantu || pra | ye | dvitā | divaḥ | r̥ñjanti | ātāḥ | su-saṁmr̥ṣṭāsaḥ | vr̥ṣabhasya | mūrāḥ ||3.43.6||

IAST: pra ye dvitā diva ṛñjanty ātāḥ susammṛṣṭāso vṛṣabhasya mūrāḥ
Griffith: Who from of old press to heaven's farthest limits, the Bull's impetuous and well-groomed Horses.
Devanāgarī: प्र ये द्विता दिव ऋञ्जन्त्याताः सुसम्मृष्टासो वृषभस्य मूराः
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | br̥hantaḥ | harayaḥ | yujānāḥ | arvāk | indra | sadha-mādaḥ | vahantu || pra | ye | dvitā | divaḥ | r̥ñjanti | ātāḥ | su-saṁmr̥ṣṭāsaḥ | vr̥ṣabhasya | mūrāḥ ||3.43.6||

IAST: indra piba vṛṣadhūtasya vṛṣṇa ā yaṁ te śyena uśate jabhāra
Griffith: Drink of the strong pressed out by strong ones, Indra, that which the Falcon brought thee when thou longedst;
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र पिब वृषधूतस्य वृष्ण आ यं ते श्येन उशते जभार
pada pāṭha: indra | piba | vr̥ṣa-dhūtasya | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | ā | yam | te | śyenaḥ | uśate | jabhāra || yasya | made | cyavayasi | pra | kr̥ṣṭīḥ | yasya | made | apa | gotrā | vavartha ||3.43.7||

IAST: yasya made cyāvayasi pra kṛṣṭīr yasya made apa gotrā vavartha
Griffith: In whose wild joy thou stirrest up the people, in whose wild joy thou didst unbar the cow-stalls.
Devanāgarī: यस्य मदे च्यावयसि प्र कृष्टीर्यस्य मदे अप गोत्रा ववर्थ
pada pāṭha: indra | piba | vr̥ṣa-dhūtasya | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | ā | yam | te | śyenaḥ | uśate | jabhāra || yasya | made | cyavayasi | pra | kr̥ṣṭīḥ | yasya | made | apa | gotrā | vavartha ||3.43.7||

IAST: śunaṁ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṁ vājasātau
Griffith: Call we on Indra, Makhavan, auspicious, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered;
Devanāgarī: शुनं हुवेम मघवानमिन्द्रमस्मिन्भरे नृतमं वाजसातौ
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.43.8||

IAST: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṁ vṛtrāṇi saṁjitaṁ dhanānām
Griffith: The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vrtras, wins and gathers riches.
Devanāgarī: शृण्वन्तमुग्रमूतये समत्सु घ्नन्तं वृत्राणि संजितं धनानाम्
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.43.8||

IAST: ayaṁ te astu haryataḥ soma ā haribhiḥ sutaḥ
Griffith: May this delightsome Soma be expressed for thee by tawny stones.
Devanāgarī: अयं ते अस्तु हर्यतः सोम आ हरिभिः सुतः
pada pāṭha: ayam | te | astu | haryataḥ | somaḥ | ā | hari-bhiḥ | sutaḥ || juṣāṇaḥ | indra | hari-bhiḥ | naḥ | ā | gahi | ā | tiṣṭha | haritam | ratham ||3.44.1||

IAST: juṣāṇa indra haribhir na ā gahy ā tiṣṭha haritaṁ ratham
Griffith: Joying thereat, O Indra, with thy Bay Steeds come:. ascend thy golden-coloured car.
Devanāgarī: जुषाण इन्द्र हरिभिर्न आ गह्या तिष्ठ हरितं रथम्
pada pāṭha: ayam | te | astu | haryataḥ | somaḥ | ā | hari-bhiḥ | sutaḥ || juṣāṇaḥ | indra | hari-bhiḥ | naḥ | ā | gahi | ā | tiṣṭha | haritam | ratham ||3.44.1||

IAST: haryann uṣasam arcayaḥ sūryaṁ haryann arocayaḥ
Griffith: In love thou madest Usas glow, in love thou madest Surya shine.
Devanāgarī: हर्यन्नुषसमर्चयः सूर्यं हर्यन्नरोचयः
pada pāṭha: haryan | uṣasam | arcayaḥ | sūryam | haryan | arocayaḥ || vidvān | cikitvān | hari-aśva | vardhase | indra | viśvāḥ | abhi | śriyaḥ ||3.44.2||

IAST: vidvām̐ś cikitvān haryaśva vardhasa indra viśvā abhi śriyaḥ
Griffith: Thou, Indra, knowing, thinking, Lord of Tawny Steeds, above all glories waxest great.
Devanāgarī: विद्वाँश्चिकित्वान्हर्यश्व वर्धस इन्द्र विश्वा अभि श्रियः
pada pāṭha: haryan | uṣasam | arcayaḥ | sūryam | haryan | arocayaḥ || vidvān | cikitvān | hari-aśva | vardhase | indra | viśvāḥ | abhi | śriyaḥ ||3.44.2||

IAST: dyām indro haridhāyasam pṛthivīṁ harivarpasam
Griffith: The heaven with streams of golden hue, earth with her tints of green and gold-
Devanāgarī: द्यामिन्द्रो हरिधायसं पृथिवीं हरिवर्पसम्
pada pāṭha: dyām | indraḥ | hari-dhāyasam | pr̥thivīm | hari-varpasam || adhārayat | haritoḥ | bhūri | bhojanam | yayoḥ | antaḥ | hariḥ | carat ||3.44.3||

IAST: adhārayad dharitor bhūri bhojanaṁ yayor antar hariś carat
Griffith: The golden Pair yield Indra plenteous nourishment: between them moves the golden One.
Devanāgarī: अधारयद्धरितोर्भूरि भोजनं ययोरन्तर्हरिश्चरत्
pada pāṭha: dyām | indraḥ | hari-dhāyasam | pr̥thivīm | hari-varpasam || adhārayat | haritoḥ | bhūri | bhojanam | yayoḥ | antaḥ | hariḥ | carat ||3.44.3||

IAST: jajñāno harito vṛṣā viśvam ā bhāti rocanam
Griffith: When born to life the golden Bull illumines all the realm of light.
Devanāgarī: जज्ञानो हरितो वृषा विश्वमा भाति रोचनम्
pada pāṭha: jajñānaḥ | haritaḥ | vr̥ṣā | viśvam | ā | bhāti | rocanam || hari-aśvaḥ | haritam | dhatte | āyudham | ā | vajram | bāhvoḥ | harim ||3.44.4||

IAST: haryaśvo haritaṁ dhatta āyudham ā vajram bāhvor harim
Griffith: He takes his golden weapon, Lord of Tawny Steeds, the golden thunder in his arms.
Devanāgarī: हर्यश्वो हरितं धत्त आयुधमा वज्रं बाह्वोर्हरिम्
pada pāṭha: jajñānaḥ | haritaḥ | vr̥ṣā | viśvam | ā | bhāti | rocanam || hari-aśvaḥ | haritam | dhatte | āyudham | ā | vajram | bāhvoḥ | harim ||3.44.4||

IAST: indro haryantam arjunaṁ vajraṁ śukrair abhīvṛtam
Griffith: The bright, the well-loved thunderbolt, girt with the bright, Indra disclosed,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो हर्यन्तमर्जुनं वज्रं शुक्रैरभीवृतम्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | haryantam | arjunam | vajram | śukraiḥ | abhi-vr̥tam || apa | avr̥ṇot | hari-bhiḥ | adri-bhiḥ | sutam | ut | gāḥ | hari-bhiḥ | ājata ||3.44.5||

IAST: apāvṛṇod dharibhir adribhiḥ sutam ud gā haribhir ājata
Griffith: Disclosed the Soma juice pressed out by tawny stones, with tawny steeds drave forth the kine.
Devanāgarī: अपावृणोद्धरिभिरद्रिभिः सुतमुद्गा हरिभिराजत
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | haryantam | arjunam | vajram | śukraiḥ | abhi-vr̥tam || apa | avr̥ṇot | hari-bhiḥ | adri-bhiḥ | sutam | ut | gāḥ | hari-bhiḥ | ājata ||3.44.5||

IAST: ā mandrair indra haribhir yāhi mayūraromabhiḥ
Griffith: COME hither, Indra, with Bay Steeds, joyous, with tails like peacocks' plumes.
Devanāgarī: आ मन्द्रैरिन्द्र हरिभिर्याहि मयूररोमभिः
pada pāṭha: ā | mandraiḥ | indra | hari-bhiḥ | yāhi | mayūraroma-bhiḥ || mā | tvā | ke | cit | ni | yaman | vim | na | pāśinaḥ | ati | dhanva-iva | tān | ihi ||3.45.1||

IAST: mā tvā ke cin ni yaman viṁ na pāśino 'ti dhanveva tām̐ ihi
Griffith: Let no men cheek thy course as fowlers stay the bird: pass o'er them as o'er desert lands.
Devanāgarī: मा त्वा के चिन्नि यमन्विं न पाशिनोऽति धन्वेव ताँ इहि
pada pāṭha: ā | mandraiḥ | indra | hari-bhiḥ | yāhi | mayūraroma-bhiḥ || mā | tvā | ke | cit | ni | yaman | vim | na | pāśinaḥ | ati | dhanva-iva | tān | ihi ||3.45.1||

IAST: vṛtrakhādo valaṁrujaḥ purāṁ darmo apām ajaḥ
Griffith: He who slew Vrtra, burst the cloud, brake the strongholds and drave the floods,
Devanāgarī: वृत्रखादो वलंरुजः पुरां दर्मो अपामजः
pada pāṭha: vr̥tra-khādaḥ | valam-rujaḥ | purām | darmaḥ | apām | ajaḥ || sthātā | rathasya | haryoḥ | abhi-svare | indraḥ | dr̥ḷhā | cit | ā-rujaḥ ||3.45.2||

IAST: sthātā rathasya haryor abhisvara indro dṛḻhā cid ārujaḥ
Griffith: Indra who mounts his chariot at his Bay Steeds' cry, shatters e'en things that stand most firm.
Devanāgarī: स्थाता रथस्य हर्योरभिस्वर इन्द्रो दृळ्हा चिदारुजः
pada pāṭha: vr̥tra-khādaḥ | valam-rujaḥ | purām | darmaḥ | apām | ajaḥ || sthātā | rathasya | haryoḥ | abhi-svare | indraḥ | dr̥ḷhā | cit | ā-rujaḥ ||3.45.2||

IAST: gambhīrām̐ udadhīm̐r iva kratum puṣyasi gā iva
Griffith: Like pools of water deep and full, like kine thou cherishest thy might;
Devanāgarī: गम्भीराँ उदधीँरिव क्रतुं पुष्यसि गा इव
pada pāṭha: gambhīrān | udadhīn-iva | kratum | puṣyasi | gāḥ-iva || pra | su-gopāḥ | yavasam | dhenavaḥ | yathā | hradam | kulyāḥ-iva | āśata ||3.45.3||

IAST: pra sugopā yavasaṁ dhenavo yathā hradaṁ kulyā ivāśata
Griffith: Like the milch-cows that go well-guarded to the mead, like water-brooks that reach the lake.
Devanāgarī: प्र सुगोपा यवसं धेनवो यथा ह्रदं कुल्या इवाशत
pada pāṭha: gambhīrān | udadhīn-iva | kratum | puṣyasi | gāḥ-iva || pra | su-gopāḥ | yavasam | dhenavaḥ | yathā | hradam | kulyāḥ-iva | āśata ||3.45.3||

IAST: ā nas tujaṁ rayim bharāṁśaṁ na pratijānate
Griffith: Bring thou us wealth with power to strike, our share, 'gainst him who calls it his.
Devanāgarī: आ नस्तुजं रयिं भरांशं न प्रतिजानते
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | tujam | rayim | bhara | aṁśam | na | prati-jānate || vr̥kṣam | pakvam | phalam | aṅkī-iva | dhūnuhi | indra | sam-pāraṇam | vasu ||3.45.4||

IAST: vṛkṣam pakvam phalam aṅkīva dhūnuhīndra sampāraṇaṁ vasu
Griffith: Shake, Indra, as with hooks, the tree for ripened fruit, for wealth to satisfy our wish.
Devanāgarī: वृक्षं पक्वं फलमङ्कीव धूनुहीन्द्र सम्पारणं वसु
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | tujam | rayim | bhara | aṁśam | na | prati-jānate || vr̥kṣam | pakvam | phalam | aṅkī-iva | dhūnuhi | indra | sam-pāraṇam | vasu ||3.45.4||

IAST: svayur indra svarāḻ asi smaddiṣṭiḥ svayaśastaraḥ
Griffith: Indra, self-ruling Lord art thou, good Leader, of most glorious fame.
Devanāgarī: स्वयुरिन्द्र स्वराळसि स्मद्दिष्टिः स्वयशस्तरः
pada pāṭha: sva-yuḥ | indra | sva-rāṭ | asi | smat-diṣṭiḥ | svayaśaḥ-taraḥ || saḥ | vavr̥dhānaḥ | ojasā | puru-stuta | bhava | naḥ | suśravaḥ-tamaḥ ||3.45.5||

IAST: sa vāvṛdhāna ojasā puruṣṭuta bhavā naḥ suśravastamaḥ
Griffith: So, waxen in thy strength, O thou whom many praise, be thou most swift to hear our call.
Devanāgarī: स वावृधान ओजसा पुरुष्टुत भवा नः सुश्रवस्तमः
pada pāṭha: sva-yuḥ | indra | sva-rāṭ | asi | smat-diṣṭiḥ | svayaśaḥ-taraḥ || saḥ | vavr̥dhānaḥ | ojasā | puru-stuta | bhava | naḥ | suśravaḥ-tamaḥ ||3.45.5||

IAST: yudhmasya te vṛṣabhasya svarāja ugrasya yūnaḥ sthavirasya ghṛṣveḥ
Griffith: OF thee, the Bull, the Warrior, Sovran Ruler, joyous and fierce, ancient and ever youthful,
Devanāgarī: युध्मस्य ते वृषभस्य स्वराज उग्रस्य यूनः स्थविरस्य घृष्वेः
pada pāṭha: yudhmasya | te | vr̥ṣabhasya | sva-rājaḥ | ugrasya | yūnaḥ | sthavirasya | ghr̥ṣveḥ || ajūryataḥ | vajriṇaḥ | vīryāṇi | indra | śrutasya | mahataḥ | mahāni ||3.46.1||

IAST: ajūryato vajriṇo vīryāṇīndra śrutasya mahato mahāni
Griffith: The undecaying One who wields the thunder, renowned and great, great are the exploits, Indra.
Devanāgarī: अजूर्यतो वज्रिणो वीर्याणीन्द्र श्रुतस्य महतो महानि
pada pāṭha: yudhmasya | te | vr̥ṣabhasya | sva-rājaḥ | ugrasya | yūnaḥ | sthavirasya | ghr̥ṣveḥ || ajūryataḥ | vajriṇaḥ | vīryāṇi | indra | śrutasya | mahataḥ | mahāni ||3.46.1||

IAST: mahām̐ asi mahiṣa vṛṣṇyebhir dhanaspṛd ugra sahamāno anyān
Griffith: Great art thou, Mighty Lord, through manly vigour, O fierce One, gathering spoil, subduing others,
Devanāgarī: महाँ असि महिष वृष्ण्येभिर्धनस्पृदुग्र सहमानो अन्यान्
pada pāṭha: mahān | asi | mahiṣa | vr̥ṣṇyebhiḥ | dhana-spr̥t | ugra | sahamānaḥ | anyān || ekaḥ | viśvasya | bhuvanasya | rājā | saḥ | yodhaya | ca | kṣayaya | ca | janān ||3.46.2||

IAST: eko viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā sa yodhayā ca kṣayayā ca janān
Griffith: Thyself alone the universe's Sovran: so send forth men to combat and to rest them.
Devanāgarī: एको विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजा स योधया च क्षयया च जनान्
pada pāṭha: mahān | asi | mahiṣa | vr̥ṣṇyebhiḥ | dhana-spr̥t | ugra | sahamānaḥ | anyān || ekaḥ | viśvasya | bhuvanasya | rājā | saḥ | yodhaya | ca | kṣayaya | ca | janān ||3.46.2||

IAST: pra mātrābhī ririce rocamānaḥ pra devebhir viśvato apratītaḥ
Griffith: He hath surpassed all measure in his brightness, yea, and the Gods, for none may be his equal.
Devanāgarī: प्र मात्राभी रिरिचे रोचमानः प्र देवेभिर्विश्वतो अप्रतीतः
pada pāṭha: pra | mātrābhiḥ | ririce | rocamānaḥ | pra | devebhiḥ | viśvataḥ | aprati-itaḥ || pra | majmanā | divaḥ | indraḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ | pra | uroḥ | mahaḥ | antarikṣāt | r̥jīṣī ||3.46.3||

IAST: pra majmanā diva indraḥ pṛthivyāḥ proror maho antarikṣād ṛjīṣī
Griffith: Impetuous Indra in his might cxccedcth wide vast mid-air and heaven and earth together.
Devanāgarī: प्र मज्मना दिव इन्द्रः पृथिव्याः प्रोरोर्महो अन्तरिक्षादृजीषी
pada pāṭha: pra | mātrābhiḥ | ririce | rocamānaḥ | pra | devebhiḥ | viśvataḥ | aprati-itaḥ || pra | majmanā | divaḥ | indraḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ | pra | uroḥ | mahaḥ | antarikṣāt | r̥jīṣī ||3.46.3||

IAST: uruṁ gabhīraṁ januṣābhy ugraṁ viśvavyacasam avatam matīnām
Griffith: To Indra, even as rivers to the ocean, flow forth from days of old the Soma juices;
Devanāgarī: उरुं गभीरं जनुषाभ्युग्रं विश्वव्यचसमवतं मतीनाम्
pada pāṭha: urum | gabhīram | januṣā | abhi | ugram | viśva-vyacasam | avatam | matīnām || indram | somāsaḥ | pra-divi | sutāsaḥ | samudram | na | sravataḥ | ā | viśanti ||3.46.4||

IAST: indraṁ somāsaḥ pradivi sutāsaḥ samudraṁ na sravata ā viśanti
Griffith: To him wide deep and mighty from his birth-time, the well of holy thoughts, aIl-comprehending.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं सोमासः प्रदिवि सुतासः समुद्रं न स्रवत आ विशन्ति
pada pāṭha: urum | gabhīram | januṣā | abhi | ugram | viśva-vyacasam | avatam | matīnām || indram | somāsaḥ | pra-divi | sutāsaḥ | samudram | na | sravataḥ | ā | viśanti ||3.46.4||

IAST: yaṁ somam indra pṛthivīdyāvā garbhaṁ na mātā bibhṛtas tvāyā
Griffith: The Soma, Indra, which the earth and heaven bear for thee as a mother bears her infant,
Devanāgarī: यं सोममिन्द्र पृथिवीद्यावा गर्भं न माता बिभृतस्त्वाया
pada pāṭha: yam | somam | indra | pr̥thivīdyāvā | garbham | na | mātā | bibhr̥taḥ | tvā-yā || tam | te | hinvanti | tam | ūm̐ iti | te | mr̥janti | adhvaryavaḥ | vr̥ṣabha | pātavai | ūm̐ iti ||3.46.5||

IAST: taṁ te hinvanti tam u te mṛjanty adhvaryavo vṛṣabha pātavā u
Griffith: This they send forth to thee, this, vigorous Hero! Adhvaryus purify for thee to drink of.
Devanāgarī: तं ते हिन्वन्ति तमु ते मृजन्त्यध्वर्यवो वृषभ पातवा उ
pada pāṭha: yam | somam | indra | pr̥thivīdyāvā | garbham | na | mātā | bibhr̥taḥ | tvā-yā || tam | te | hinvanti | tam | ūm̐ iti | te | mr̥janti | adhvaryavaḥ | vr̥ṣabha | pātavai | ūm̐ iti ||3.46.5||

IAST: marutvām̐ indra vṛṣabho raṇāya pibā somam anuṣvadham madāya
Griffith: DRINK, Indra, Marut-girt, as Bull, the Soma, for joy, for rapture even as thou listest.
Devanāgarī: मरुत्वाँ इन्द्र वृषभो रणाय पिबा सोममनुष्वधं मदाय
pada pāṭha: marutvān | indra | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | raṇāya | piba | somam | anu-svadham | madāya || ā | siñcasva | jaṭhare | madhvaḥ | ūrmim | tvam | rājā | asi | pra-divaḥ | sutānām ||3.47.1||

IAST: ā siñcasva jaṭhare madhva ūrmiṁ tvaṁ rājāsi pradivaḥ sutānām
Griffith: Pour down the flood of meath within thy belly: thou from of old art King of Soma juices.
Devanāgarī: आ सिञ्चस्व जठरे मध्व ऊर्मिं त्वं राजासि प्रदिवः सुतानाम्
pada pāṭha: marutvān | indra | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | raṇāya | piba | somam | anu-svadham | madāya || ā | siñcasva | jaṭhare | madhvaḥ | ūrmim | tvam | rājā | asi | pra-divaḥ | sutānām ||3.47.1||

IAST: sajoṣā indra sagaṇo marudbhiḥ somam piba vṛtrahā śūra vidvān
Griffith: Indra, accordant, with the banded Maruts, drink Soma, Hero, as wise Vrtra-slayer.
Devanāgarī: सजोषा इन्द्र सगणो मरुद्भिः सोमं पिब वृत्रहा शूर विद्वान्
pada pāṭha: sa-joṣāḥ | indra | sa-gaṇaḥ | marut-bhiḥ | somam | piba | vr̥tra-hā | śūra | vidvān || jahi | śatrūn | apa | mr̥dhaḥ | nudasva | atha | abhayam | kr̥ṇuhi | viśvataḥ | naḥ ||3.47.2||

IAST: jahi śatrūm̐r apa mṛdho nudasvāthābhayaṁ kṛṇuhi viśvato naḥ
Griffith: Slay thou our foemen, drive away assailants and make us safe on every side from danger.
Devanāgarī: जहि शत्रूँरप मृधो नुदस्वाथाभयं कृणुहि विश्वतो नः
pada pāṭha: sa-joṣāḥ | indra | sa-gaṇaḥ | marut-bhiḥ | somam | piba | vr̥tra-hā | śūra | vidvān || jahi | śatrūn | apa | mr̥dhaḥ | nudasva | atha | abhayam | kr̥ṇuhi | viśvataḥ | naḥ ||3.47.2||

IAST: uta ṛtubhir ṛtupāḥ pāhi somam indra devebhiḥ sakhibhiḥ sutaṁ naḥ
Griffith: And, drinker at due seasons, drink in season, Indra, with friendly Gods, our pressed-out Soma.
Devanāgarī: उत ऋतुभिरृतुपाः पाहि सोममिन्द्र देवेभिः सखिभिः सुतं नः
pada pāṭha: uta | r̥tu-bhiḥ | r̥tu-pāḥ | pāhi | somam | indra | devebhiḥ | sakhi-bhiḥ | sutam | naḥ || yān | ā | abhajaḥ | marutaḥ | ye | tvā | anu | ahan | vr̥tram | adadhuḥ | tubhyam | ojaḥ ||3.47.3||

IAST: yām̐ ābhajo maruto ye tvānv ahan vṛtram adadhus tubhyam ojaḥ
Griffith: The Maruts following, whom thou madest sharers, gave thee the victory, and thou slewest Vrtra.
Devanāgarī: याँ आभजो मरुतो ये त्वान्वहन्वृत्रमदधुस्तुभ्यमोजः
pada pāṭha: uta | r̥tu-bhiḥ | r̥tu-pāḥ | pāhi | somam | indra | devebhiḥ | sakhi-bhiḥ | sutam | naḥ || yān | ā | abhajaḥ | marutaḥ | ye | tvā | anu | ahan | vr̥tram | adadhuḥ | tubhyam | ojaḥ ||3.47.3||

IAST: ye tvāhihatye maghavann avardhan ye śāmbare harivo ye gaviṣṭau
Griffith: Drink Soma, Indra, banded with the Maruts who, Maghavan, strengthened thee at Ahi's slaughter,
Devanāgarī: ये त्वाहिहत्ये मघवन्नवर्धन्ये शाम्बरे हरिवो ये गविष्टौ
pada pāṭha: ye | tvā | ahi-hatye | magha-van | avardhan | ye | śāmbare | hari-vaḥ | ye | go-iṣṭau || ye | tvā | nūnam | anu-madanti | viprāḥ | piba | indra | somam | sa-gaṇaḥ | marut-bhiḥ ||3.47.4||

IAST: ye tvā nūnam anumadanti viprāḥ pibendra somaṁ sagaṇo marudbhiḥ
Griffith: Gainst Sambara, Lord of Bays! in winning cattle, and now rejoice in thee, the holy Singers.
Devanāgarī: ये त्वा नूनमनुमदन्ति विप्राः पिबेन्द्र सोमं सगणो मरुद्भिः
pada pāṭha: ye | tvā | ahi-hatye | magha-van | avardhan | ye | śāmbare | hari-vaḥ | ye | go-iṣṭau || ye | tvā | nūnam | anu-madanti | viprāḥ | piba | indra | somam | sa-gaṇaḥ | marut-bhiḥ ||3.47.4||

IAST: marutvantaṁ vṛṣabhaṁ vāvṛdhānam akavāriṁ divyaṁ śāsam indram
Griffith: The Bull whose strength hath waxed, whom Maruts follow, free-giving Indra, the celestial Ruler,
Devanāgarī: मरुत्वन्तं वृषभं वावृधानमकवारिं दिव्यं शासमिन्द्रम्
pada pāṭha: marutvantam | vr̥ṣabham | vavr̥dhānam | akava-arim | divyam | śāsam | indram || viśva-saham | avase | nūtanāya | ugram | sahaḥ-dām | iha | tam | huvema ||3.47.5||

IAST: viśvāsāham avase nūtanāyograṁ sahodām iha taṁ huvema
Griffith: Mighty, all-conquering, the victory-giver, him let us call to grant us new protection.
Devanāgarī: विश्वासाहमवसे नूतनायोग्रं सहोदामिह तं हुवेम
pada pāṭha: marutvantam | vr̥ṣabham | vavr̥dhānam | akava-arim | divyam | śāsam | indram || viśva-saham | avase | nūtanāya | ugram | sahaḥ-dām | iha | tam | huvema ||3.47.5||

IAST: sadyo ha jāto vṛṣabhaḥ kanīnaḥ prabhartum āvad andhasaḥ sutasya
Griffith: SOON as the young Bull sprang into existence he longed to taste the pressed-out Soma's liquor.
Devanāgarī: सद्यो ह जातो वृषभः कनीनः प्रभर्तुमावदन्धसः सुतस्य
pada pāṭha: sadyaḥ | ha | jātaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | kanīnaḥ | pra-bhartum | āvat | andhasaḥ | sutasya || sādhoḥ | piba | prati-kāmam | yathā | te | rasa-āśiraḥ | prathamam | somyasya ||3.48.1||

IAST: sādhoḥ piba pratikāmaṁ yathā te rasāśiraḥ prathamaṁ somyasya
Griffith: Drink thou thy fill, according to thy longing, first, of the goodly mixture blent with Soma.
Devanāgarī: साधोः पिब प्रतिकामं यथा ते रसाशिरः प्रथमं सोम्यस्य
pada pāṭha: sadyaḥ | ha | jātaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | kanīnaḥ | pra-bhartum | āvat | andhasaḥ | sutasya || sādhoḥ | piba | prati-kāmam | yathā | te | rasa-āśiraḥ | prathamam | somyasya ||3.48.1||

IAST: yaj jāyathās tad ahar asya kāme 'ṁśoḥ pīyūṣam apibo giriṣṭhām
Griffith: That day when thou wast born thou, fain to taste it, drankest the plant's milk which the mountains nourish.
Devanāgarī: यज्जायथास्तदहरस्य कामेंऽशोः पीयूषमपिबो गिरिष्ठाम्
pada pāṭha: yat | jāyathāḥ | tat | ahaḥ | asya | kāme | aṁśoḥ | pīyūṣam | apibaḥ | giri-sthām || tam | te | mātā | pari | yoṣā | janitrī | mahaḥ | pituḥ | dame | ā | asiñcat | agre ||3.48.2||

IAST: taṁ te mātā pari yoṣā janitrī mahaḥ pitur dama āsiñcad agre
Griffith: That milk thy Mother first, the Dame who bare thee, poured for thee in thy mighty Father's dwelling.
Devanāgarī: तं ते माता परि योषा जनित्री महः पितुर्दम आसिञ्चदग्रे
pada pāṭha: yat | jāyathāḥ | tat | ahaḥ | asya | kāme | aṁśoḥ | pīyūṣam | apibaḥ | giri-sthām || tam | te | mātā | pari | yoṣā | janitrī | mahaḥ | pituḥ | dame | ā | asiñcat | agre ||3.48.2||

IAST: upasthāya mātaram annam aiṭṭa tigmam apaśyad abhi somam ūdhaḥ
Griffith: Desiring food he came unto his Mother, and on her breast beheld the pungent Soma.
Devanāgarī: उपस्थाय मातरमन्नमैट्ट तिग्ममपश्यदभि सोममूधः
pada pāṭha: upa-sthāya | mātaram | annam | aiṭṭa | tigmam | apaśyat | abhi | somam | ūdhaḥ || pra-yavayan | acarat | gr̥tsaḥ | anyān | mahāni | cakre | purudha-pratīkaḥ ||3.48.3||

IAST: prayāvayann acarad gṛtso anyān mahāni cakre purudhapratīkaḥ
Griffith: Wise, he moved on, keeping aloof the others, and wrought great exploits in his varied aspects.
Devanāgarī: प्रयावयन्नचरद्गृत्सो अन्यान्महानि चक्रे पुरुधप्रतीकः
pada pāṭha: upa-sthāya | mātaram | annam | aiṭṭa | tigmam | apaśyat | abhi | somam | ūdhaḥ || pra-yavayan | acarat | gr̥tsaḥ | anyān | mahāni | cakre | purudha-pratīkaḥ ||3.48.3||

IAST: ugras turāṣāḻ abhibhūtyojā yathāvaśaṁ tanvaṁ cakra eṣaḥ
Griffith: Fierce, quickly conquering, of surpassing vigour, he framed his body even as he listed.
Devanāgarī: उग्रस्तुराषाळभिभूत्योजा यथावशं तन्वं चक्र एषः
pada pāṭha: ugraḥ | turāṣāṭ | abhibhūti-ojāḥ | yathā-vaśam | tanvam | cakre | eṣaḥ || tvaṣṭāram | indraḥ | januṣā | abhi-bhūya | ā-muṣya | somam | apibat | camūṣu ||3.48.4||

IAST: tvaṣṭāram indro januṣābhibhūyāmuṣyā somam apibac camūṣu
Griffith: E'en from his birth-time Indra conquered Tvastar, bore off the Soma and in beakers drank it.
Devanāgarī: त्वष्टारमिन्द्रो जनुषाभिभूयामुष्या सोममपिबच्चमूषु
pada pāṭha: ugraḥ | turāṣāṭ | abhibhūti-ojāḥ | yathā-vaśam | tanvam | cakre | eṣaḥ || tvaṣṭāram | indraḥ | januṣā | abhi-bhūya | ā-muṣya | somam | apibat | camūṣu ||3.48.4||

IAST: śunaṁ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṁ vājasātau
Griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered;
Devanāgarī: शुनं हुवेम मघवानमिन्द्रमस्मिन्भरे नृतमं वाजसातौ
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.48.5||

IAST: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṁ vṛtrāṇi saṁjitaṁ dhanānām
Griffith: The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vrtras, wins and gathers riches.
Devanāgarī: शृण्वन्तमुग्रमूतये समत्सु घ्नन्तं वृत्राणि संजितं धनानाम्
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.48.5||

IAST: śaṁsā mahām indraṁ yasmin viśvā ā kṛṣṭayaḥ somapāḥ kāmam avyan
Griffith: GREAT Indra will I laud, in whom all people who drink the Soma have attained their longing;
Devanāgarī: शंसा महामिन्द्रं यस्मिन्विश्वा आ कृष्टयः सोमपाः काममव्यन्
pada pāṭha: śaṁsa | mahām | indram | yasmin | viśvāḥ | ā | kr̥ṣṭayaḥ | soma-pāḥ | kāmam | avyan || yam | su-kratum | dhiṣaṇe iti | vibhva-taṣṭam | ghanam | vr̥trāṇām | janayanta | devāḥ ||3.49.1||

IAST: yaṁ sukratuṁ dhiṣaṇe vibhvataṣṭaṁ ghanaṁ vṛtrāṇāṁ janayanta devāḥ
Griffith: Whom, passing wise, Gods, Heaven and Earth, engendered, formed by a Master's hand, to crush the Vrtras.
Devanāgarī: यं सुक्रतुं धिषणे विभ्वतष्टं घनं वृत्राणां जनयन्त देवाः
pada pāṭha: śaṁsa | mahām | indram | yasmin | viśvāḥ | ā | kr̥ṣṭayaḥ | soma-pāḥ | kāmam | avyan || yam | su-kratum | dhiṣaṇe iti | vibhva-taṣṭam | ghanam | vr̥trāṇām | janayanta | devāḥ ||3.49.1||

IAST: yaṁ nu nakiḥ pṛtanāsu svarājaṁ dvitā tarati nṛtamaṁ hariṣṭhām
Griffith: Whom, most heroic, borne by Tawny Coursers, verily none subdueth in the battle;
Devanāgarī: यं नु नकिः पृतनासु स्वराजं द्विता तरति नृतमं हरिष्ठाम्
pada pāṭha: yam | nu | nakiḥ | pr̥tanāsu | sva-rājam | dvitā | tarati | nr̥-tamam | hari-sthām || ina-tamaḥ | satva-bhiḥ | yaḥ | ha | śūṣaiḥ | pr̥thu-jrayāḥ | amināt | āyuḥ | dasyoḥ ||3.49.2||

IAST: inatamaḥ satvabhir yo ha śūṣaiḥ pṛthujrayā aminād āyur dasyoḥ
Griffith: Who, reaching far, most vigorous, hath shortened the Dasyu's life with Warriors bold of spirit.
Devanāgarī: इनतमः सत्वभिर्यो ह शूषैः पृथुज्रया अमिनादायुर्दस्योः
pada pāṭha: yam | nu | nakiḥ | pr̥tanāsu | sva-rājam | dvitā | tarati | nr̥-tamam | hari-sthām || ina-tamaḥ | satva-bhiḥ | yaḥ | ha | śūṣaiḥ | pr̥thu-jrayāḥ | amināt | āyuḥ | dasyoḥ ||3.49.2||

IAST: sahāvā pṛtsu taraṇir nārvā vyānaśī rodasī mehanāvān
Griffith: Victor in fight, swift mover like a warhorse, pervading both worlds, rainer down of blessings,
Devanāgarī: सहावा पृत्सु तरणिर्नार्वा व्यानशी रोदसी मेहनावान्
pada pāṭha: saha-vā | pr̥t-su | taraṇiḥ | na | arvā | vi-ānaśiḥ | rodasī iti | mehanā-vān || bhagaḥ | na | kāre | havyaḥ | matīnām | pitā-iva | cāruḥ | su-havaḥ | vayaḥ-dhāḥ ||3.49.3||

IAST: bhago na kāre havyo matīnām piteva cāruḥ suhavo vayodhāḥ
Griffith: To he invoked in war like Bhaga, Father, as 'twere, of hymns, fair, prompt to hear, strength-giver.
Devanāgarī: भगो न कारे हव्यो मतीनां पितेव चारुः सुहवो वयोधाः
pada pāṭha: saha-vā | pr̥t-su | taraṇiḥ | na | arvā | vi-ānaśiḥ | rodasī iti | mehanā-vān || bhagaḥ | na | kāre | havyaḥ | matīnām | pitā-iva | cāruḥ | su-havaḥ | vayaḥ-dhāḥ ||3.49.3||

IAST: dhartā divo rajasas pṛṣṭa ūrdhvo ratho na vāyur vasubhir niyutvān
Griffith: Supporting heaven, the high back of the region, his car is Vayu with his team of Vasus.
Devanāgarī: धर्ता दिवो रजसस्पृष्ट ऊर्ध्वो रथो न वायुर्वसुभिर्नियुत्वान्
pada pāṭha: dhartā | divaḥ | rajasaḥ | pr̥ṣṭaḥ | ūrdhvaḥ | rathaḥ | na | vāyuḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | niyutvān || kṣapām | vastā | janitā | sūryasya | vi-bhaktā | bhāgam | dhiṣaṇā-iva | vājam ||3.49.4||

IAST: kṣapāṁ vastā janitā sūryasya vibhaktā bhāgaṁ dhiṣaṇeva vājam
Griffith: Illumining the nights, the Sun's creator, like Dhisana he deals forth strength and riches.
Devanāgarī: क्षपां वस्ता जनिता सूर्यस्य विभक्ता भागं धिषणेव वाजम्
pada pāṭha: dhartā | divaḥ | rajasaḥ | pr̥ṣṭaḥ | ūrdhvaḥ | rathaḥ | na | vāyuḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | niyutvān || kṣapām | vastā | janitā | sūryasya | vi-bhaktā | bhāgam | dhiṣaṇā-iva | vājam ||3.49.4||

IAST: śunaṁ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṁ vājasātau
Griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered;
Devanāgarī: शुनं हुवेम मघवानमिन्द्रमस्मिन्भरे नृतमं वाजसातौ
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.49.5||

IAST: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṁ vṛtrāṇi saṁjitaṁ dhanānām
Griffith: The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vrtras, wins and gathers treasure.
Devanāgarī: शृण्वन्तमुग्रमूतये समत्सु घ्नन्तं वृत्राणि संजितं धनानाम्
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.49.5||

IAST: indraḥ svāhā pibatu yasya soma āgatyā tumro vṛṣabho marutvān
Griffith: LET Indra drink, All-hail! for his is Soma,-the mighty Bull come, girt by Maruts, hither.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रः स्वाहा पिबतु यस्य सोम आगत्या तुम्रो वृषभो मरुत्वान्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | svāhā | pibatu | yasya | somaḥ | ā-gatya | tumraḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | marutvān || ā | uru-vyacāḥ | pr̥ṇatām | ebhiḥ | annaiḥ | ā | asya | haviḥ | tanvaḥ | kāmam | r̥dhyāḥ ||3.50.1||

IAST: oruvyacāḥ pṛṇatām ebhir annair āsya havis tanvaḥ kāmam ṛdhyāḥ
Griffith: Far-reaching, let him fill him with these viands, and let our offering sate his body's longing.
Devanāgarī: ओरुव्यचाः पृणतामेभिरन्नैरास्य हविस्तन्वः काममृध्याः
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | svāhā | pibatu | yasya | somaḥ | ā-gatya | tumraḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | marutvān || ā | uru-vyacāḥ | pr̥ṇatām | ebhiḥ | annaiḥ | ā | asya | haviḥ | tanvaḥ | kāmam | r̥dhyāḥ ||3.50.1||

IAST: ā te saparyū javase yunajmi yayor anu pradivaḥ śruṣṭim āvaḥ
Griffith: I yoke thy pair of trusty Steeds for swiftness, whose faithful service from of old thou lovest.
Devanāgarī: आ ते सपर्यू जवसे युनज्मि ययोरनु प्रदिवः श्रुष्टिमावः
pada pāṭha: ā | te | saparyū iti | javase | yunajmi | yayoḥ | anu | pra-divaḥ | śruṣṭim | āvaḥ || iha | tvā | dheyuḥ | harayaḥ | su-śipra | piba | tu | asya | su-sutasya | cāroḥ ||3.50.2||

IAST: iha tvā dheyur harayaḥ suśipra pibā tv asya suṣutasya cāroḥ
Griffith: Here, fair of cheek! let thy Bay Coursers place thee: drink of this lovely welleffused libation.
Devanāgarī: इह त्वा धेयुर्हरयः सुशिप्र पिबा त्वस्य सुषुतस्य चारोः
pada pāṭha: ā | te | saparyū iti | javase | yunajmi | yayoḥ | anu | pra-divaḥ | śruṣṭim | āvaḥ || iha | tvā | dheyuḥ | harayaḥ | su-śipra | piba | tu | asya | su-sutasya | cāroḥ ||3.50.2||

IAST: gobhir mimikṣuṁ dadhire supāram indraṁ jyaiṣṭhyāya dhāyase gṛṇānāḥ
Griffith: With milk they made Indra their good Preserver, lauding for help and rule the bounteous rainer.
Devanāgarī: गोभिर्मिमिक्षुं दधिरे सुपारमिन्द्रं ज्यैष्ठ्याय धायसे गृणानाः
pada pāṭha: gobhiḥ | mimikṣum | dadhire | su-pāram | indram | jyaiṣṭhyāya | dhāyase | gr̥ṇānāḥ || mandānaḥ | somam | papi-vān | r̥jīṣin | sam | asmabhyam | purudhā | gāḥ | iṣaṇya ||3.50.3||

IAST: mandānaḥ somam papivām̐ ṛjīṣin sam asmabhyam purudhā gā iṣaṇya
Griffith: Impetuous God, when thou hast drunk the Soma, enraptured send us cattle in abundance.
Devanāgarī: मन्दानः सोमं पपिवाँ ऋजीषिन्समस्मभ्यं पुरुधा गा इषण्य
pada pāṭha: gobhiḥ | mimikṣum | dadhire | su-pāram | indram | jyaiṣṭhyāya | dhāyase | gr̥ṇānāḥ || mandānaḥ | somam | papi-vān | r̥jīṣin | sam | asmabhyam | purudhā | gāḥ | iṣaṇya ||3.50.3||

IAST: imaṁ kāmam mandayā gobhir aśvaiś candravatā rādhasā paprathaś ca
Griffith: With kine and horses satisfy this longing with very splendid bounty still extend it.
Devanāgarī: इमं कामं मन्दया गोभिरश्वैश्चन्द्रवता राधसा पप्रथश्च
pada pāṭha: imam | kāmam | mandaya | gobhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | candra-vatā | rādhasā | paprathaḥ | ca || svaḥ-yavaḥ | mati-bhiḥ | tubhyam | viprāḥ | indrāya | vāhaḥ | kuśikāsaḥ | akran ||3.50.4||

IAST: svaryavo matibhis tubhyaṁ viprā indrāya vāhaḥ kuśikāso akran
Griffith: Seeking the light, with hymns to thee, O Indra, the Kusikas have brought their gift, the singers.
Devanāgarī: स्वर्यवो मतिभिस्तुभ्यं विप्रा इन्द्राय वाहः कुशिकासो अक्रन्
pada pāṭha: imam | kāmam | mandaya | gobhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | candra-vatā | rādhasā | paprathaḥ | ca || svaḥ-yavaḥ | mati-bhiḥ | tubhyam | viprāḥ | indrāya | vāhaḥ | kuśikāsaḥ | akran ||3.50.4||

IAST: śunaṁ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṁ vājasātau
Griffith: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered;
Devanāgarī: शुनं हुवेम मघवानमिन्द्रमस्मिन्भरे नृतमं वाजसातौ
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.50.5||

IAST: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṁ vṛtrāṇi saṁjitaṁ dhanānām
Griffith: The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vrtras, wins and gathers riches.
Devanāgarī: शृण्वन्तमुग्रमूतये समत्सु घ्नन्तं वृत्राणि संजितं धनानाम्
pada pāṭha: śunam | huvema | magha-vānam | indram | asmin | bhare | nr̥-tamam | vāja-sātau || śr̥ṇvantam | ugram | ūtaye | samat-su | ghnantam | vr̥trāṇi | sam-jitam | dhanānām ||3.50.5||

IAST: carṣaṇīdhṛtam maghavānam ukthyam indraṁ giro bṛhatīr abhy anūṣata
Griffith: HIGH hymns have sounded forth the praise of Maghavan, supporter of mankind, of Indra meet for lauds;
Devanāgarī: चर्षणीधृतं मघवानमुक्थ्यमिन्द्रं गिरो बृहतीरभ्यनूषत
pada pāṭha: carṣaṇi-dhr̥tam | magha-vānam | ukthyam | indram | giraḥ | br̥hatīḥ | abhi | anūṣata || vavr̥dhānam | puru-hūtam | suvr̥kti-bhiḥ | amartyam | jaramāṇam | dive-dive ||3.51.1||

IAST: vāvṛdhānam puruhūtaṁ suvṛktibhir amartyaṁ jaramāṇaṁ dive-dive
Griffith: Him who hath waxen great, invoked with beauteous songs, Immortal One, whose praise each day is sung aloud.
Devanāgarī: वावृधानं पुरुहूतं सुवृक्तिभिरमर्त्यं जरमाणं दिवेदिवे
pada pāṭha: carṣaṇi-dhr̥tam | magha-vānam | ukthyam | indram | giraḥ | br̥hatīḥ | abhi | anūṣata || vavr̥dhānam | puru-hūtam | suvr̥kti-bhiḥ | amartyam | jaramāṇam | dive-dive ||3.51.1||

IAST: śatakratum arṇavaṁ śākinaṁ naraṁ giro ma indram upa yanti viśvataḥ
Griffith: To Indra from all sides go forth my songs of praise, the Lord of Hundred Powers, strong, Hero, like the sea,
Devanāgarī: शतक्रतुमर्णवं शाकिनं नरं गिरो म इन्द्रमुप यन्ति विश्वतः
pada pāṭha: śata-kratum | arṇavam | śākinam | naram | giraḥ | me | indram | upa | yanti | viśvataḥ || vāja-sanim | pūḥ-bhidam | tūrṇim | ap-turam | dhāma-sācam | abhi-sācam | svaḥ-vidam ||3.51.2||

IAST: vājasanim pūrbhidaṁ tūrṇim apturaṁ dhāmasācam abhiṣācaṁ svarvidam
Griffith: Swift, winner of the booty, breaker-down of forts, faithful and ever-glorious, finder of the light.
Devanāgarī: वाजसनिं पूर्भिदं तूर्णिमप्तुरं धामसाचमभिषाचं स्वर्विदम्
pada pāṭha: śata-kratum | arṇavam | śākinam | naram | giraḥ | me | indram | upa | yanti | viśvataḥ || vāja-sanim | pūḥ-bhidam | tūrṇim | ap-turam | dhāma-sācam | abhi-sācam | svaḥ-vidam ||3.51.2||

IAST: ākare vasor jaritā panasyate 'nehasaḥ stubha indro duvasyati
Griffith: Where battle's spoil is piled the singer winneth praise, for Indra taketh care of matchless worshippers.
Devanāgarī: आकरे वसोर्जरिता पनस्यतेऽनेहसः स्तुभ इन्द्रो दुवस्यति
pada pāṭha: ā-kare | vasoḥ | jaritā | panasyate | anehasaḥ | stubhaḥ | indraḥ | duvasyati || vivasvataḥ | sadane | ā | hi | pipriye | satrā-saham | abhimāti-hanam | stuhi ||3.51.3||

IAST: vivasvataḥ sadana ā hi pipriye satrāsāham abhimātihanaṁ stuhi
Griffith: He in Vivasvan's dwelling findeth his delight: praise thou the ever-conquering slayer of the foe.
Devanāgarī: विवस्वतः सदन आ हि पिप्रिये सत्रासाहमभिमातिहनं स्तुहि
pada pāṭha: ā-kare | vasoḥ | jaritā | panasyate | anehasaḥ | stubhaḥ | indraḥ | duvasyati || vivasvataḥ | sadane | ā | hi | pipriye | satrā-saham | abhimāti-hanam | stuhi ||3.51.3||

IAST: nṛṇām u tvā nṛtamaṁ gīrbhir ukthair abhi pra vīram arcatā sabādhaḥ
Griffith: Thee, valorous, most heroic of the heroes, shall the priests glorify with songg and praises.
Devanāgarī: नृणामु त्वा नृतमं गीर्भिरुक्थैरभि प्र वीरमर्चता सबाधः
pada pāṭha: nr̥ṇām | ūm̐ iti | tvā | nr̥-tamam | gīḥ-bhiḥ | ukthaiḥ | abhi | pra | vīram | arcata | sa-bādhaḥ || sam | sahase | puru-māyaḥ | jihīte | namaḥ | asya | pra-divaḥ | ekaḥ | īśe ||3.51.4||

IAST: saṁ sahase purumāyo jihīte namo asya pradiva eka īśe
Griffith: Full of all wondrous power he goes to conquest: worship is his, sole Lord from days aforetime.
Devanāgarī: सं सहसे पुरुमायो जिहीते नमो अस्य प्रदिव एक ईशे
pada pāṭha: nr̥ṇām | ūm̐ iti | tvā | nr̥-tamam | gīḥ-bhiḥ | ukthaiḥ | abhi | pra | vīram | arcata | sa-bādhaḥ || sam | sahase | puru-māyaḥ | jihīte | namaḥ | asya | pra-divaḥ | ekaḥ | īśe ||3.51.4||

IAST: pūrvīr asya niṣṣidho martyeṣu purū vasūni pṛthivī bibharti
Griffith: Abundant are the gifts he gives to mortals: for him the earth bears a rich store of treasures.
Devanāgarī: पूर्वीरस्य निष्षिधो मर्त्येषु पुरू वसूनि पृथिवी बिभर्ति
pada pāṭha: pūrvīḥ | asya | niḥ-sidhaḥ | martyeṣu | puru | vasūni | pr̥thivī | bibharti || indrāya | dyāvaḥ | oṣadhīḥ | uta | āpaḥ | rayim | rakṣanti | jīrayaḥ | vanāni ||3.51.5||

IAST: indrāya dyāva oṣadhīr utāpo rayiṁ rakṣanti jīrayo vanāni
Griffith: The heavens, the growing plants, the living waters, the forest trees preserve their wealth for Indra.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राय द्याव ओषधीरुतापो रयिं रक्षन्ति जीरयो वनानि
pada pāṭha: pūrvīḥ | asya | niḥ-sidhaḥ | martyeṣu | puru | vasūni | pr̥thivī | bibharti || indrāya | dyāvaḥ | oṣadhīḥ | uta | āpaḥ | rayim | rakṣanti | jīrayaḥ | vanāni ||3.51.5||

IAST: tubhyam brahmāṇi gira indra tubhyaṁ satrā dadhire harivo juṣasva
Griffith: To thee, O Indra, Lord of Bays, for ever are offered prayers and songs: accept them gladly.
Devanāgarī: तुभ्यं ब्रह्माणि गिर इन्द्र तुभ्यं सत्रा दधिरे हरिवो जुषस्व
pada pāṭha: tubhyam | brahmāṇi | giraḥ | indra | tubhyam | satrā | dadhire | hari-vaḥ | juṣasva || bodhi | āpiḥ | avasaḥ | nūtanasya | sakhe | vaso iti | jaritr̥-bhyaḥ | vayaḥ | dhāḥ ||3.51.6||

IAST: bodhy āpir avaso nūtanasya sakhe vaso jaritṛbhyo vayo dhāḥ
Griffith: As Kinsman think thou of some fresh assistance; good Friend, give strength and life to those who praise thee.
Devanāgarī: बोध्यापिरवसो नूतनस्य सखे वसो जरितृभ्यो वयो धाः
pada pāṭha: tubhyam | brahmāṇi | giraḥ | indra | tubhyam | satrā | dadhire | hari-vaḥ | juṣasva || bodhi | āpiḥ | avasaḥ | nūtanasya | sakhe | vaso iti | jaritr̥-bhyaḥ | vayaḥ | dhāḥ ||3.51.6||

IAST: indra marutva iha pāhi somaṁ yathā śāryāte apibaḥ sutasya
Griffith: Here, Indra, drink thou Soma with the Maruts, as thou didst drink the juice beside Saryata.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र मरुत्व इह पाहि सोमं यथा शार्याते अपिबः सुतस्य
pada pāṭha: indra | marutvaḥ | iha | pāhi | somam | yathā | śāryāte | apibaḥ | sutasya || tava | pra-nītī | tava | śūra | śarman | ā | vivāsanti | kavayaḥ | su-yajñāḥ ||3.51.7||

IAST: tava praṇītī tava śūra śarmann ā vivāsanti kavayaḥ suyajñāḥ
Griffith: Under thy guidance, in thy keeping, Hero, the singers serve, skilled in fair sacrifices.
Devanāgarī: तव प्रणीती तव शूर शर्मन्ना विवासन्ति कवयः सुयज्ञाः
pada pāṭha: indra | marutvaḥ | iha | pāhi | somam | yathā | śāryāte | apibaḥ | sutasya || tava | pra-nītī | tava | śūra | śarman | ā | vivāsanti | kavayaḥ | su-yajñāḥ ||3.51.7||

IAST: sa vāvaśāna iha pāhi somam marudbhir indra sakhibhiḥ sutaṁ naḥ
Griffith: So eagerly desirous drink the Soma, our juice, O Indra, with thy friends the Maruts,
Devanāgarī: स वावशान इह पाहि सोमं मरुद्भिरिन्द्र सखिभिः सुतं नः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vāvaśānaḥ | iha | pāhi | somam | marut-bhiḥ | indra | sakhi-bhiḥ | sutam | naḥ || jātam | yat | tvā | pari | devāḥ | abhūṣan | mahe | bharāya | puru-hūta | viśve ||3.51.8||

IAST: jātaṁ yat tvā pari devā abhūṣan mahe bharāya puruhūta viśve
Griffith: Since at thy birth all Deities adorned thee for the great fight, O thou invoked of many.
Devanāgarī: जातं यत्त्वा परि देवा अभूषन्महे भराय पुरुहूत विश्वे
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vāvaśānaḥ | iha | pāhi | somam | marut-bhiḥ | indra | sakhi-bhiḥ | sutam | naḥ || jātam | yat | tvā | pari | devāḥ | abhūṣan | mahe | bharāya | puru-hūta | viśve ||3.51.8||

IAST: aptūrye maruta āpir eṣo 'mandann indram anu dātivārāḥ
Griffith: He was your comrade in your zeal, O Maruts: they, rich in noble gifts, rejoiced in Indra.
Devanāgarī: अप्तूर्ये मरुत आपिरेषोऽमन्दन्निन्द्रमनु दातिवाराः
pada pāṭha: ap-tūrye | marutaḥ | āpiḥ | eṣaḥ | amandan | indram | anu | dāti-vārāḥ || tebhiḥ | sākam | pibatu | vr̥tra-khādaḥ | sutam | somam | dāśuṣaḥ | sve | sadha-sthe ||3.51.9||

IAST: tebhiḥ sākam pibatu vṛtrakhādaḥ sutaṁ somaṁ dāśuṣaḥ sve sadhasthe
Griffith: With them together let the Vrtra-slayer drink in his home the worshipper's libation.
Devanāgarī: तेभिः साकं पिबतु वृत्रखादः सुतं सोमं दाशुषः स्वे सधस्थे
pada pāṭha: ap-tūrye | marutaḥ | āpiḥ | eṣaḥ | amandan | indram | anu | dāti-vārāḥ || tebhiḥ | sākam | pibatu | vr̥tra-khādaḥ | sutam | somam | dāśuṣaḥ | sve | sadha-sthe ||3.51.9||

IAST: idaṁ hy anv ojasā sutaṁ rādhānām pate
Griffith: So, Lord of affluent gifts, this juice hath been pressed for thee with strength
Devanāgarī: इदं ह्यन्वोजसा सुतं राधानां पते
pada pāṭha: idam | hi | anu | ojasā | sutam | rādhānām | pate || piba | tu | asya | girvaṇaḥ ||3.51.10||

IAST: pibā tv asya girvaṇaḥ
Griffith: Drink of it, thou who lovest song.
Devanāgarī: पिबा त्वस्य गिर्वणः
pada pāṭha: idam | hi | anu | ojasā | sutam | rādhānām | pate || piba | tu | asya | girvaṇaḥ ||3.51.10||

IAST: yas te anu svadhām asat sute ni yaccha tanvam
Griffith: Incline thy body to this juice which suits thy Godlike nature well:
Devanāgarī: यस्ते अनु स्वधामसत्सुते नि यच्छ तन्वम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | anu | svadhām | asat | sute | ni | yaccha | tanvam || saḥ | tvā | mamattu | somyam ||3.51.11||

IAST: sa tvā mamattu somyam
Griffith: May it cheer thee who lovest it.
Devanāgarī: स त्वा ममत्तु सोम्यम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | anu | svadhām | asat | sute | ni | yaccha | tanvam || saḥ | tvā | mamattu | somyam ||3.51.11||

IAST: pra te aśnotu kukṣyoḥ prendra brahmaṇā śiraḥ
Griffith: Brave Indra, let it work through both thy flanks, and through thy head by prayer,
Devanāgarī: प्र ते अश्नोतु कुक्ष्योः प्रेन्द्र ब्रह्मणा शिरः
pada pāṭha: pra | te | aśnotu | kukṣyoḥ | pra | indra | brahmaṇā | śiraḥ || pra | bāhū iti | śūra | rādhase ||3.51.12||

IAST: pra bāhū śūra rādhase
Griffith: And through thine arms, to prosper us.
Devanāgarī: प्र बाहू शूर राधसे
pada pāṭha: pra | te | aśnotu | kukṣyoḥ | pra | indra | brahmaṇā | śiraḥ || pra | bāhū iti | śūra | rādhase ||3.51.12||

IAST: dhānāvantaṁ karambhiṇam apūpavantam ukthinam
Griffith: INDRA, accept at break of day our Soma mixt with roasted corn,
Devanāgarī: धानावन्तं करम्भिणमपूपवन्तमुक्थिनम्
pada pāṭha: dhānā-vantam | karambhiṇam | apūpa-vantam | ukthinam || indra | prātaḥ | juṣasva | naḥ ||3.52.1||

IAST: indra prātar juṣasva naḥ
Griffith: With groats with cake, with eulogies.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र प्रातर्जुषस्व नः
pada pāṭha: dhānā-vantam | karambhiṇam | apūpa-vantam | ukthinam || indra | prātaḥ | juṣasva | naḥ ||3.52.1||

IAST: puroḻāśam pacatyaṁ juṣasvendrā gurasva ca
Griffith: Accept, O Indra, and enjoy the well-dressed sacrificial cake:
Devanāgarī: पुरोळाशं पचत्यं जुषस्वेन्द्रा गुरस्व च
pada pāṭha: puroḷāśam | pacatyam | juṣasva | indra | ā | gurasva | ca || tubhyam | havyāni | sisrate ||3.52.2||

IAST: tubhyaṁ havyāni sisrate
Griffith: Oblations are poured forth to thee.
Devanāgarī: तुभ्यं हव्यानि सिस्रते
pada pāṭha: puroḷāśam | pacatyam | juṣasva | indra | ā | gurasva | ca || tubhyam | havyāni | sisrate ||3.52.2||

IAST: puroḻāśaṁ ca no ghaso joṣayāse giraś ca naḥ
Griffith: Consume our sacrificial cake, accept the songs of praise we sing,
Devanāgarī: पुरोळाशं च नो घसो जोषयासे गिरश्च नः
pada pāṭha: puroḷāśam | ca | naḥ | ghasaḥ | joṣayāse | giraḥ | ca | naḥ || vadhūyuḥ-iva | yoṣaṇām ||3.52.3||

IAST: vadhūyur iva yoṣaṇām
Griffith: As he who woes accepts his bride.
Devanāgarī: वधूयुरिव योषणाम्
pada pāṭha: puroḷāśam | ca | naḥ | ghasaḥ | joṣayāse | giraḥ | ca | naḥ || vadhūyuḥ-iva | yoṣaṇām ||3.52.3||

IAST: puroḻāśaṁ sanaśruta prātaḥsāve juṣasva naḥ
Griffith: Famed from of old, accept the cake at our libation poured at dawn,
Devanāgarī: पुरोळाशं सनश्रुत प्रातःसावे जुषस्व नः
pada pāṭha: puroḷāśam | sana-śruta | prātaḥ-sāve | juṣasva | naḥ || indra | kratuḥ | hi | te | br̥han ||3.52.4||

IAST: indra kratur hi te bṛhan
Griffith: Forgreat, O Indra, is thy power.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र क्रतुर्हि ते बृहन्
pada pāṭha: puroḷāśam | sana-śruta | prātaḥ-sāve | juṣasva | naḥ || indra | kratuḥ | hi | te | br̥han ||3.52.4||

IAST: mādhyaṁdinasya savanasya dhānāḥ puroḻāśam indra kṛṣveha cārum
Griffith: Let roasted corn of our midday libation, and sacrificial cake here please thee, Indra,
Devanāgarī: माध्यंदिनस्य सवनस्य धानाः पुरोळाशमिन्द्र कृष्वेह चारुम्
pada pāṭha: mādhyaṁdinasya | savanasya | dhānāḥ | puroḷāśam | indra | kr̥ṣva | iha | cārum || pra | yat | stotā | jaritā | tūrṇi-arthaḥ | vr̥ṣa-yamāṇaḥ | upa | gīḥ-bhiḥ | īṭṭe ||3.52.5||

IAST: pra yat stotā jaritā tūrṇyartho vṛṣāyamāṇa upa gīrbhir īṭṭe
Griffith: What time the lauding singer, keen of purpose and eager as a bull, with hymns implores thee.
Devanāgarī: प्र यत्स्तोता जरिता तूर्ण्यर्थो वृषायमाण उप गीर्भिरीट्टे
pada pāṭha: mādhyaṁdinasya | savanasya | dhānāḥ | puroḷāśam | indra | kr̥ṣva | iha | cārum || pra | yat | stotā | jaritā | tūrṇi-arthaḥ | vr̥ṣa-yamāṇaḥ | upa | gīḥ-bhiḥ | īṭṭe ||3.52.5||

IAST: tṛtīye dhānāḥ savane puruṣṭuta puroḻāśam āhutam māmahasva naḥ
Griffith: At the third sacrifice, O thou whom many praise, give glory to the roasted corn and holy cake.
Devanāgarī: तृतीये धानाः सवने पुरुष्टुत पुरोळाशमाहुतं मामहस्व नः
pada pāṭha: tr̥tīye | dhānāḥ | savane | puru-stuta | puroḷāśam | ā-hutam | mamahasva | naḥ || r̥bhu-mantam | vāja-vantam | tvā | kave | prayasvantaḥ | upa | śikṣema | dhīti-bhiḥ ||3.52.6||

IAST: ṛbhumantaṁ vājavantaṁ tvā kave prayasvanta upa śikṣema dhītibhiḥ
Griffith: With offered viands and with songs may we assist thee, Sage, whom Vaja and the Rbhus wait upon.
Devanāgarī: ऋभुमन्तं वाजवन्तं त्वा कवे प्रयस्वन्त उप शिक्षेम धीतिभिः
pada pāṭha: tr̥tīye | dhānāḥ | savane | puru-stuta | puroḷāśam | ā-hutam | mamahasva | naḥ || r̥bhu-mantam | vāja-vantam | tvā | kave | prayasvantaḥ | upa | śikṣema | dhīti-bhiḥ ||3.52.6||

IAST: pūṣaṇvate te cakṛmā karambhaṁ harivate haryaśvāya dhānāḥ
Griffith: The groats have we prepared for thee with Pusan, corn for thee, Lord of Bay Steeds, with thy horses.
Devanāgarī: पूषण्वते ते चकृमा करम्भं हरिवते हर्यश्वाय धानाः
pada pāṭha: pūṣaṇ-vate | te | cakr̥ma | karambham | hari-vate | hari-aśvāya | dhānāḥ || apūpam | addhi | sa-gaṇaḥ | marut-bhiḥ | somam | piba | vr̥tra-hā | śūra | vidvān ||3.52.7||

IAST: apūpam addhi sagaṇo marudbhiḥ somam piba vṛtrahā śūra vidvān
Griffith: Eat thou the meal-cake, banded with the Maruts, wise Hero, Vrtra-slayer, drink the Soma.
Devanāgarī: अपूपमद्धि सगणो मरुद्भिः सोमं पिब वृत्रहा शूर विद्वान्
pada pāṭha: pūṣaṇ-vate | te | cakr̥ma | karambham | hari-vate | hari-aśvāya | dhānāḥ || apūpam | addhi | sa-gaṇaḥ | marut-bhiḥ | somam | piba | vr̥tra-hā | śūra | vidvān ||3.52.7||

IAST: prati dhānā bharata tūyam asmai puroḻāśaṁ vīratamāya nṛṇām
Griffith: Bring forth the roasted corn to meet him quickly, cake for the bravest Hero mid the heroes.
Devanāgarī: प्रति धाना भरत तूयमस्मै पुरोळाशं वीरतमाय नृणाम्
pada pāṭha: prati | dhānāḥ | bharata | tūyam | asmai | puroḷāśam | vīra-tamāya | nr̥ṇām || dive-dive | sa-dr̥śīḥ | indra | tubhyam | vardhantu | tvā | soma-peyāya | dhr̥ṣṇo iti ||3.52.8||

IAST: dive-dive sadṛśīr indra tubhyaṁ vardhantu tvā somapeyāya dhṛṣṇo
Griffith: Indra, may hymns accordant with thee daily strengthen thee, Bold One, for the draught of Soma.
Devanāgarī: दिवेदिवे सदृशीरिन्द्र तुभ्यं वर्धन्तु त्वा सोमपेयाय धृष्णो
pada pāṭha: prati | dhānāḥ | bharata | tūyam | asmai | puroḷāśam | vīra-tamāya | nr̥ṇām || dive-dive | sa-dr̥śīḥ | indra | tubhyam | vardhantu | tvā | soma-peyāya | dhr̥ṣṇo iti ||3.52.8||

IAST: indrāparvatā bṛhatā rathena vāmīr iṣa ā vahataṁ suvīrāḥ
Griffith: ON a high car, O Parvata and Indra, bring pleasant viands, with brave heroes, hither.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रापर्वता बृहता रथेन वामीरिष आ वहतं सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: indrāparvatā | br̥hatā | rathena | vāmīḥ | iṣaḥ | ā | vahatam | su-vīrāḥ || vītam | havyāni | adhvareṣu | devā | vardhethām | gīḥ-bhiḥ | iḷayā | madantā ||3.53.1||

IAST: vītaṁ havyāny adhvareṣu devā vardhethāṁ gīrbhir iḻayā madantā
Griffith: Enjoy the gifts, Gods, at our sacrifices wax strong by hymns, rejoice in our oblation.
Devanāgarī: वीतं हव्यान्यध्वरेषु देवा वर्धेथां गीर्भिरिळया मदन्ता
pada pāṭha: indrāparvatā | br̥hatā | rathena | vāmīḥ | iṣaḥ | ā | vahatam | su-vīrāḥ || vītam | havyāni | adhvareṣu | devā | vardhethām | gīḥ-bhiḥ | iḷayā | madantā ||3.53.1||

IAST: tiṣṭhā su kam maghavan mā parā gāḥ somasya nu tvā suṣutasya yakṣi
Griffith: Stay still, O Maghavan, advance no farther. a draught of well-pressed Soma will I give thee.
Devanāgarī: तिष्ठा सु कं मघवन्मा परा गाः सोमस्य नु त्वा सुषुतस्य यक्षि
pada pāṭha: tiṣṭha | su | kam | magha-van | mā | parā | gāḥ | somasya | nu | tvā | su-sutasya | yakṣi || pituḥ | na | putraḥ | sicam | ā | rabhe | te | indra | svādiṣṭhayā | girā | śacī-vaḥ ||3.53.2||

IAST: pitur na putraḥ sicam ā rabhe ta indra svādiṣṭhayā girā śacīvaḥ
Griffith: With sweetest song I grasp, O Mighty Indra, thy garment's hem as a child grasps his father's.
Devanāgarī: पितुर्न पुत्रः सिचमा रभे त इन्द्र स्वादिष्ठया गिरा शचीवः
pada pāṭha: tiṣṭha | su | kam | magha-van | mā | parā | gāḥ | somasya | nu | tvā | su-sutasya | yakṣi || pituḥ | na | putraḥ | sicam | ā | rabhe | te | indra | svādiṣṭhayā | girā | śacī-vaḥ ||3.53.2||

IAST: śaṁsāvādhvaryo prati me gṛṇīhīndrāya vāhaḥ kṛṇavāva juṣṭam
Griffith: Adhvaryu, sing we both; sing thou in answer: make we a laud acceptable to Indra.
Devanāgarī: शंसावाध्वर्यो प्रति मे गृणीहीन्द्राय वाहः कृणवाव जुष्टम्
pada pāṭha: śaṁsāva | adhvaryo iti | prati | me | gr̥ṇīhi | indrāya | vāhaḥ | kr̥ṇavāva | juṣṭam || ā | idam | barhiḥ | yajamānasya | sīda | atha | ca | bhūt | uktham | indrāya | śastam ||3.53.3||

IAST: edam barhir yajamānasya sīdāthā ca bhūd uktham indrāya śastam
Griffith: Upon this sacrificer's grass he seated: to Indra shall our eulogy be uttered.
Devanāgarī: एदं बर्हिर्यजमानस्य सीदाथा च भूदुक्थमिन्द्राय शस्तम्
pada pāṭha: śaṁsāva | adhvaryo iti | prati | me | gr̥ṇīhi | indrāya | vāhaḥ | kr̥ṇavāva | juṣṭam || ā | idam | barhiḥ | yajamānasya | sīda | atha | ca | bhūt | uktham | indrāya | śastam ||3.53.3||

IAST: jāyed astam maghavan sed u yonis tad it tvā yuktā harayo vahantu
Griffith: A wife, O Maghavan is home and dwelling: so let thy Bay Steeds yoked convey thee hither.
Devanāgarī: जायेदस्तं मघवन्सेदु योनिस्तदित्त्वा युक्ता हरयो वहन्तु
pada pāṭha: jāyā | it | astam | magha-van | sā | it | ūm̐ iti | yoniḥ | tat | it | tvā | yuktāḥ | harayaḥ | vahantu || yadā | kadā | ca | sunavāma | somam | agniḥ | tvā | dūtaḥ | dhanvāti | accha ||3.53.4||

IAST: yadā kadā ca sunavāma somam agniṣ ṭvā dūto dhanvāty accha
Griffith: Whenever we press out for thee the Soma, let Agni as our Herald speed to call thee.
Devanāgarī: यदा कदा च सुनवाम सोममग्निष्ट्वा दूतो धन्वात्यच्छ
pada pāṭha: jāyā | it | astam | magha-van | sā | it | ūm̐ iti | yoniḥ | tat | it | tvā | yuktāḥ | harayaḥ | vahantu || yadā | kadā | ca | sunavāma | somam | agniḥ | tvā | dūtaḥ | dhanvāti | accha ||3.53.4||

IAST: parā yāhi maghavann ā ca yāhīndra bhrātar ubhayatrā te artham
Griffith: Depart, O Maghavan;again come hither: both there and here thy goat is Indra, Brother,
Devanāgarī: परा याहि मघवन्ना च याहीन्द्र भ्रातरुभयत्रा ते अर्थम्
pada pāṭha: parā | yāhi | magha-van | ā | ca | yāhi | indra | bhrātaḥ | ubhayatra | te | artham || yatra | rathasya | br̥hataḥ | ni-dhānam | vi-mocanam | vājinaḥ | rāsabhasya ||3.53.5||

IAST: yatrā rathasya bṛhato nidhānaṁ vimocanaṁ vājino rāsabhasya
Griffith: Where thy tall chariot hath a place to rest in, and where thqu loosest thy loud-neighing Courser.
Devanāgarī: यत्रा रथस्य बृहतो निधानं विमोचनं वाजिनो रासभस्य
pada pāṭha: parā | yāhi | magha-van | ā | ca | yāhi | indra | bhrātaḥ | ubhayatra | te | artham || yatra | rathasya | br̥hataḥ | ni-dhānam | vi-mocanam | vājinaḥ | rāsabhasya ||3.53.5||

IAST: apāḥ somam astam indra pra yāhi kalyāṇīr jāyā suraṇaṁ gṛhe te
Griffith: Thou hast drunk Soma, Indra, turn thee homeward; thy joy is in thy home, thy racious Consort;
Devanāgarī: अपाः सोममस्तमिन्द्र प्र याहि कल्याणीर्जाया सुरणं गृहे ते
pada pāṭha: apāḥ | somam | astam | indra | pra | yāhi | kalyāṇīḥ | jāyā | su-raṇam | gr̥he | te || yatra | rathasya | br̥hataḥ | ni-dhānam | vi-mocanam | vājinaḥ | dakṣiṇā-vat ||3.53.6||

IAST: yatrā rathasya bṛhato nidhānaṁ vimocanaṁ vājino dakṣiṇāvat
Griffith: Where thy tall chariot hath a place to rest in, and thy strong Courser is set free with guerdon.
Devanāgarī: यत्रा रथस्य बृहतो निधानं विमोचनं वाजिनो दक्षिणावत्
pada pāṭha: apāḥ | somam | astam | indra | pra | yāhi | kalyāṇīḥ | jāyā | su-raṇam | gr̥he | te || yatra | rathasya | br̥hataḥ | ni-dhānam | vi-mocanam | vājinaḥ | dakṣiṇā-vat ||3.53.6||

IAST: ime bhojā aṅgiraso virūpā divas putrāso asurasya vīrāḥ
Griffith: Bounteous are these, Angirases, Virupas: the Asura's Heroes and the Sons of Heaven.
Devanāgarī: इमे भोजा अङ्गिरसो विरूपा दिवस्पुत्रासो असुरस्य वीराः
pada pāṭha: ime | bhojāḥ | aṅgirasaḥ | vi-rūpāḥ | divaḥ | putrāsaḥ | asurasya | vīrāḥ || viśvāmitrāya | dadataḥ | maghāni | sahasra-sāve | pra | tirante | āyuḥ ||3.53.7||

IAST: viśvāmitrāya dadato maghāni sahasrasāve pra tiranta āyuḥ
Griffith: They, giving store of wealth to Visvamitra, prolong his life through countless Soma-pressings.
Devanāgarī: विश्वामित्राय ददतो मघानि सहस्रसावे प्र तिरन्त आयुः
pada pāṭha: ime | bhojāḥ | aṅgirasaḥ | vi-rūpāḥ | divaḥ | putrāsaḥ | asurasya | vīrāḥ || viśvāmitrāya | dadataḥ | maghāni | sahasra-sāve | pra | tirante | āyuḥ ||3.53.7||

IAST: rūpaṁ-rūpam maghavā bobhavīti māyāḥ kṛṇvānas tanvam pari svām
Griffith: Maghavan weareth every shape at pleasure, effecting magic changes in his body,
Devanāgarī: रूपंरूपं मघवा बोभवीति मायाः कृण्वानस्तन्वं परि स्वाम्
pada pāṭha: rūpam-rūpam | magha-vā | bobhavīti | māyāḥ | kr̥ṇvānaḥ | tanvam | pari | svām || triḥ | yat | divaḥ | pari | muhūrtam | ā | agāt | svaiḥ | mantraiḥ | anr̥tu-pāḥ | r̥ta-vā ||3.53.8||

IAST: trir yad divaḥ pari muhūrtam āgāt svair mantrair anṛtupā ṛtāvā
Griffith: Holy One, drinker out of season, coming thrice, in a moment, through fit prayers, from heaven.
Devanāgarī: त्रिर्यद्दिवः परि मुहूर्तमागात्स्वैर्मन्त्रैरनृतुपा ऋतावा
pada pāṭha: rūpam-rūpam | magha-vā | bobhavīti | māyāḥ | kr̥ṇvānaḥ | tanvam | pari | svām || triḥ | yat | divaḥ | pari | muhūrtam | ā | agāt | svaiḥ | mantraiḥ | anr̥tu-pāḥ | r̥ta-vā ||3.53.8||

IAST: mahām̐ ṛṣir devajā devajūto 'stabhnāt sindhum arṇavaṁ nṛcakṣāḥ
Griffith: The mighty sage, God-born and God-incited, who looks on men, restrained the billowy river.
Devanāgarī: महाँ ऋषिर्देवजा देवजूतोऽस्तभ्नात्सिन्धुमर्णवं नृचक्षाः
pada pāṭha: mahān | r̥ṣiḥ | deva-jāḥ | deva-jūtaḥ | astabhnāt | sindhum | arṇavam | nr̥-cakṣāḥ || viśvāmitraḥ | yat | avahat | su-dāsam | apriyāyata | kuśikebhiḥ | indraḥ ||3.53.9||

IAST: viśvāmitro yad avahat sudāsam apriyāyata kuśikebhir indraḥ
Griffith: When Visvamitra was Sudas's escort, then Indra through the Kusikas grew friendly.
Devanāgarī: विश्वामित्रो यदवहत्सुदासमप्रियायत कुशिकेभिरिन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: mahān | r̥ṣiḥ | deva-jāḥ | deva-jūtaḥ | astabhnāt | sindhum | arṇavam | nr̥-cakṣāḥ || viśvāmitraḥ | yat | avahat | su-dāsam | apriyāyata | kuśikebhiḥ | indraḥ ||3.53.9||

IAST: haṁsā iva kṛṇutha ślokam adribhir madanto gīrbhir adhvare sute sacā
Griffith: Like swans, prepare a song of praise with pressing-stones, glad in your hymns with juice poured forth in sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: हंसा इव कृणुथ श्लोकमद्रिभिर्मदन्तो गीर्भिरध्वरे सुते सचा
pada pāṭha: haṁsāḥ-iva | kr̥ṇutha | ślokam | adri-bhiḥ | madantaḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | adhvare | sute | sacā || devebhiḥ | viprāḥ | r̥ṣayaḥ | nr̥-cakṣasaḥ | vi | pibadhvam | kuśikāḥ | somyam | madhu ||3.53.10||

IAST: devebhir viprā ṛṣayo nṛcakṣaso vi pibadhvaṁ kuśikāḥ somyam madhu
Griffith: Ye singers, with the Gods, sages who look on men, ye Kutikas drink up the Soma's savoury meath.
Devanāgarī: देवेभिर्विप्रा ऋषयो नृचक्षसो वि पिबध्वं कुशिकाः सोम्यं मधु
pada pāṭha: haṁsāḥ-iva | kr̥ṇutha | ślokam | adri-bhiḥ | madantaḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | adhvare | sute | sacā || devebhiḥ | viprāḥ | r̥ṣayaḥ | nr̥-cakṣasaḥ | vi | pibadhvam | kuśikāḥ | somyam | madhu ||3.53.10||

IAST: upa preta kuśikāś cetayadhvam aśvaṁ rāye pra muñcatā sudāsaḥ
Griffith: Come forward, Kusikas, and be attentive; let loose Sudas's horse to win him riches.
Devanāgarī: उप प्रेत कुशिकाश्चेतयध्वमश्वं राये प्र मुञ्चता सुदासः
pada pāṭha: upa | pra | ita | kuśikāḥ | cetayadhvam | aśvam | rāye | pra | muñcata | su-dāsaḥ || rājā | vr̥tram | jaṅghanat | prāk | apāk | udak | atha | yajāte | vare | ā | pr̥thivyāḥ ||3.53.11||

IAST: rājā vṛtraṁ jaṅghanat prāg apāg udag athā yajāte vara ā pṛthivyāḥ
Griffith: East, west, and north, let the King slay the foeman, then at earth's choicest place perform his worship.
Devanāgarī: राजा वृत्रं जङ्घनत्प्रागपागुदगथा यजाते वर आ पृथिव्याः
pada pāṭha: upa | pra | ita | kuśikāḥ | cetayadhvam | aśvam | rāye | pra | muñcata | su-dāsaḥ || rājā | vr̥tram | jaṅghanat | prāk | apāk | udak | atha | yajāte | vare | ā | pr̥thivyāḥ ||3.53.11||

IAST: ya ime rodasī ubhe aham indram atuṣṭavam
Griffith: Praises to Indra have I sung, sustainer of this earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: य इमे रोदसी उभे अहमिन्द्रमतुष्टवम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ime iti | rodasī iti | ubhe iti | aham | indram | atustavam || viśvāmitrasya | rakṣati | brahma | idam | bhāratam | janam ||3.53.12||

IAST: viśvāmitrasya rakṣati brahmedam bhārataṁ janam
Griffith: This prayer of Visvamitra keeps secure the race of Bharatas.
Devanāgarī: विश्वामित्रस्य रक्षति ब्रह्मेदं भारतं जनम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ime iti | rodasī iti | ubhe iti | aham | indram | atustavam || viśvāmitrasya | rakṣati | brahma | idam | bhāratam | janam ||3.53.12||

IAST: viśvāmitrā arāsata brahmendrāya vajriṇe
Griffith: The Visvamitras have sung forth this prayer to Indra Thunder-aimed:
Devanāgarī: विश्वामित्रा अरासत ब्रह्मेन्द्राय वज्रिणे
pada pāṭha: viśvāmitrāḥ | arāsata | brahma | indrāya | vajriṇe || karat | it | naḥ | su-rādhasaḥ ||3.53.13||

IAST: karad in naḥ surādhasaḥ
Griffith: So let him make us prosperous.
Devanāgarī: करदिन्नः सुराधसः
pada pāṭha: viśvāmitrāḥ | arāsata | brahma | indrāya | vajriṇe || karat | it | naḥ | su-rādhasaḥ ||3.53.13||

IAST: kiṁ te kṛṇvanti kīkaṭeṣu gāvo nāśiraṁ duhre na tapanti gharmam
Griffith: Among the Kikatas what do thy cattle? They pour no milky draught, they heat no caldron.
Devanāgarī: किं ते कृण्वन्ति कीकटेषु गावो नाशिरं दुह्रे न तपन्ति घर्मम्
pada pāṭha: kim | te | kr̥ṇvanti | kīkaṭeṣu | gāvaḥ | na | ā-śiran | duhre | na | tapanti | gharmam || ā | naḥ | bhara | pra-magandasya | vedaḥ | naicā-śākham | magha-van | randhaya | naḥ ||3.53.14||

IAST: ā no bhara pramagandasya vedo naicāśākham maghavan randhayā naḥ
Griffith: Bring thou to us the wealth of Pramaganda;give up to us, O Maghavan, the low-born.
Devanāgarī: आ नो भर प्रमगन्दस्य वेदो नैचाशाखं मघवन्रन्धया नः
pada pāṭha: kim | te | kr̥ṇvanti | kīkaṭeṣu | gāvaḥ | na | ā-śiran | duhre | na | tapanti | gharmam || ā | naḥ | bhara | pra-magandasya | vedaḥ | naicā-śākham | magha-van | randhaya | naḥ ||3.53.14||

IAST: sasarparīr amatim bādhamānā bṛhan mimāya jamadagnidattā
Griffith: Sasarpari, the gift of Jamadagnis, hath lowed with mighty voice dispelling famine.
Devanāgarī: ससर्परीरमतिं बाधमाना बृहन्मिमाय जमदग्निदत्ता
pada pāṭha: sasarparīḥ | amatim | bādhamānā | br̥hat | mimāya | jamadagni-dattā || ā | sūryasya | duhitā | tatāna | śravaḥ | deveṣu | amr̥tam | ajuryam ||3.53.15||

IAST: ā sūryasya duhitā tatāna śravo deveṣv amṛtam ajuryam
Griffith: The Daughter of the Sun hath spread our glory among the Gods, imperishable, deathless.
Devanāgarī: आ सूर्यस्य दुहिता ततान श्रवो देवेष्वमृतमजुर्यम्
pada pāṭha: sasarparīḥ | amatim | bādhamānā | br̥hat | mimāya | jamadagni-dattā || ā | sūryasya | duhitā | tatāna | śravaḥ | deveṣu | amr̥tam | ajuryam ||3.53.15||

IAST: sasarparīr abharat tūyam ebhyo 'dhi śravaḥ pāñcajanyāsu kṛṣṭiṣu
Griffith: Sasarpari brought glory speedily to these, over the generations of the Fivefold Race;
Devanāgarī: ससर्परीरभरत्तूयमेभ्योऽधि श्रवः पाञ्चजन्यासु कृष्टिषु
pada pāṭha: sasarparīḥ | abharat | tūyam | ebhyaḥ | adhi | śravaḥ | pāñca-janyāsu | kr̥ṣṭiṣu || sā | pakṣyā | navyam | āyuḥ | dadhānā | yām | me | palasti-jamadagnayaḥ | daduḥ ||3.53.16||

IAST: sā pakṣyā navyam āyur dadhānā yām me palastijamadagnayo daduḥ
Griffith: Daughter of Paksa, she bestows new vital power, she whom the ancient Jamadagnis gave to me.
Devanāgarī: सा पक्ष्या नव्यमायुर्दधाना यां मे पलस्तिजमदग्नयो ददुः
pada pāṭha: sasarparīḥ | abharat | tūyam | ebhyaḥ | adhi | śravaḥ | pāñca-janyāsu | kr̥ṣṭiṣu || sā | pakṣyā | navyam | āyuḥ | dadhānā | yām | me | palasti-jamadagnayaḥ | daduḥ ||3.53.16||

IAST: sthirau gāvau bhavatāṁ vīḻur akṣo meṣā vi varhi mā yugaṁ vi śāri
Griffith: Strong be the pair of oxen, firm the axles, let not the pole slip nor the yoke be broken.
Devanāgarī: स्थिरौ गावौ भवतां वीळुरक्षो मेषा वि वर्हि मा युगं वि शारि
pada pāṭha: sthirau | gāvau | bhavatām | vīḷuḥ | akṣaḥ | mā | īṣā | vi | varhi | mā | yugam | vi | śāri || indraḥ | pātalye iti | dadatām | śarītoḥ | ariṣṭa-neme | abhi | naḥ | sacasva ||3.53.17||

IAST: indraḥ pātalye dadatāṁ śarītor ariṣṭaneme abhi naḥ sacasva
Griffith: May Indra, keep the yoke-pins from decaying: attend us, thou whose fellies are uninjured.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रः पातल्ये ददतां शरीतोररिष्टनेमे अभि नः सचस्व
pada pāṭha: sthirau | gāvau | bhavatām | vīḷuḥ | akṣaḥ | mā | īṣā | vi | varhi | mā | yugam | vi | śāri || indraḥ | pātalye iti | dadatām | śarītoḥ | ariṣṭa-neme | abhi | naḥ | sacasva ||3.53.17||

IAST: balaṁ dhehi tanūṣu no balam indrānaḻutsu naḥ
Griffith: O Indra, give our bodies strength, strength to the bulls who draw the wains,
Devanāgarī: बलं धेहि तनूषु नो बलमिन्द्रानळुत्सु नः
pada pāṭha: balam | dhehi | tanūṣu | naḥ | balam | indra | anaḷut-su | naḥ || balam | tokāya | tanayāya | jīvase | tvam | hi | bala-dāḥ | asi ||3.53.18||

IAST: balaṁ tokāya tanayāya jīvase tvaṁ hi baladā asi
Griffith: Strength to our seed and progeny that they may live, for thou art he who giveth strength.
Devanāgarī: बलं तोकाय तनयाय जीवसे त्वं हि बलदा असि
pada pāṭha: balam | dhehi | tanūṣu | naḥ | balam | indra | anaḷut-su | naḥ || balam | tokāya | tanayāya | jīvase | tvam | hi | bala-dāḥ | asi ||3.53.18||

IAST: abhi vyayasva khadirasya sāram ojo dhehi spandane śiṁśapāyām
Griffith: Enclose thee in the heart of Khayar timber, in the car wrought of Sinsapa put firmness.
Devanāgarī: अभि व्ययस्व खदिरस्य सारमोजो धेहि स्पन्दने शिंशपायाम्
pada pāṭha: abhi | vyayasva | khadirasya | sāram | ojaḥ | dhehi | spandane | śiṁśapāyām || akṣa | vīḷo iti | vīḷita | vīḷayasva | mā | yāmāt | asmāt | ava | jīhipaḥ | naḥ ||3.53.19||

IAST: akṣa vīḻo vīḻita vīḻayasva mā yāmād asmād ava jīhipo naḥ
Griffith: Show thyself strong, O Axle, fixed and strengthened: throw us not from the car whereon we travel.
Devanāgarī: अक्ष वीळो वीळित वीळयस्व मा यामादस्मादव जीहिपो नः
pada pāṭha: abhi | vyayasva | khadirasya | sāram | ojaḥ | dhehi | spandane | śiṁśapāyām || akṣa | vīḷo iti | vīḷita | vīḷayasva | mā | yāmāt | asmāt | ava | jīhipaḥ | naḥ ||3.53.19||

IAST: ayam asmān vanaspatir mā ca hā mā ca rīriṣat
Griffith: Let not this sovran of the wood leave us forlorn or injure us.
Devanāgarī: अयमस्मान्वनस्पतिर्मा च हा मा च रीरिषत्
pada pāṭha: ayam | asmān | vanaspatiḥ | mā | ca | hāḥ | mā | ca | ririṣat || svasti | ā | gr̥hebhyaḥ | ā | ava-sai | ā | vi-mocanāt ||3.53.20||

IAST: svasty ā gṛhebhya āvasā ā vimocanāt
Griffith: Safe may we be until we reach our homes and rest us and unyoke.
Devanāgarī: स्वस्त्या गृहेभ्य आवसा आ विमोचनात्
pada pāṭha: ayam | asmān | vanaspatiḥ | mā | ca | hāḥ | mā | ca | ririṣat || svasti | ā | gr̥hebhyaḥ | ā | ava-sai | ā | vi-mocanāt ||3.53.20||

IAST: indrotibhir bahulābhir no adya yācchreṣṭhābhir maghavañ chūra jinva
Griffith: With various aids this day come to us, Indra, with best aids speed us, Maghavan, thou Hero.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रोतिभिर्बहुलाभिर्नो अद्य याच्छ्रेष्ठाभिर्मघवञ्छूर जिन्व
pada pāṭha: indra | ūti-bhiḥ | bahulābhiḥ | naḥ | adya | yāt-śreṣṭhābhiḥ | magha-van | śūra | jinva || yaḥ | naḥ | dveṣṭi | adharaḥ | saḥ | padīṣṭa | yam | ūm̐ iti | dviṣmaḥ | tam | ūm̐ iti | prāṇaḥ | jahātu ||3.53.21||

IAST: yo no dveṣṭy adharaḥ sas padīṣṭa yam u dviṣmas tam u prāṇo jahātu
Griffith: Let him who hatcth us fall headlong downward: him whom we hate let vital breath abandon.
Devanāgarī: यो नो द्वेष्ट्यधरः सस्पदीष्ट यमु द्विष्मस्तमु प्राणो जहातु
pada pāṭha: indra | ūti-bhiḥ | bahulābhiḥ | naḥ | adya | yāt-śreṣṭhābhiḥ | magha-van | śūra | jinva || yaḥ | naḥ | dveṣṭi | adharaḥ | saḥ | padīṣṭa | yam | ūm̐ iti | dviṣmaḥ | tam | ūm̐ iti | prāṇaḥ | jahātu ||3.53.21||

IAST: paraśuṁ cid vi tapati śimbalaṁ cid vi vṛścati
Griffith: He heats his very axe, and then cuts a mere Semal blossom off.
Devanāgarī: परशुं चिद्वि तपति शिम्बलं चिद्वि वृश्चति
pada pāṭha: paraśum | cit | vi | tapati | śimbalam | cit | vi | vr̥ścati || ukhā | cit | indra | yeṣantī | pra-yastā | phenam | asyati ||3.53.22||

IAST: ukhā cid indra yeṣantī prayastā phenam asyati
Griffith: O Indra, like a caldron cracked and seething, so he pours out foam.
Devanāgarī: उखा चिदिन्द्र येषन्ती प्रयस्ता फेनमस्यति
pada pāṭha: paraśum | cit | vi | tapati | śimbalam | cit | vi | vr̥ścati || ukhā | cit | indra | yeṣantī | pra-yastā | phenam | asyati ||3.53.22||

IAST: na sāyakasya cikite janāso lodhaṁ nayanti paśu manyamānāḥ
Griffith: Men notice not the arrow, O ye people; they bring the red beast deeming it a bullock.
Devanāgarī: न सायकस्य चिकिते जनासो लोधं नयन्ति पशु मन्यमानाः
pada pāṭha: na | sāyakasya | cikite | janāsaḥ | lodham | nayanti | paśu | manyamānāḥ || na | avājinam | vājinā | hāsayanti | na | gardabham | puraḥ | aśvāt | nayanti ||3.53.23||

IAST: nāvājinaṁ vājinā hāsayanti na gardabham puro aśvān nayanti
Griffith: A sluggish steed men run not with the courser, nor ever lead an ass before a charger.
Devanāgarī: नावाजिनं वाजिना हासयन्ति न गर्दभं पुरो अश्वान्नयन्ति
pada pāṭha: na | sāyakasya | cikite | janāsaḥ | lodham | nayanti | paśu | manyamānāḥ || na | avājinam | vājinā | hāsayanti | na | gardabham | puraḥ | aśvāt | nayanti ||3.53.23||

IAST: ima indra bharatasya putrā apapitvaṁ cikitur na prapitvam
Griffith: These men, the sons of Bharata, O Indra, regard not severance or close connexion.
Devanāgarī: इम इन्द्र भरतस्य पुत्रा अपपित्वं चिकितुर्न प्रपित्वम्
pada pāṭha: ime | indra | bharatasya | putrāḥ | apa-pitvam | cikituḥ | na | pra-pitvam || hinvanti | aśvam | araṇam | na | nityam | jyā-vājam | pari | nayanti | ājau ||3.53.24||

IAST: hinvanty aśvam araṇaṁ na nityaṁ jyāvājam pari ṇayanty ājau
Griffith: They urge their own steed as it were another's, and take him, swift as the bow's string, to battle.
Devanāgarī: हिन्वन्त्यश्वमरणं न नित्यं ज्यावाजं परि णयन्त्याजौ
pada pāṭha: ime | indra | bharatasya | putrāḥ | apa-pitvam | cikituḥ | na | pra-pitvam || hinvanti | aśvam | araṇam | na | nityam | jyā-vājam | pari | nayanti | ājau ||3.53.24||

IAST: imam mahe vidathyāya śūṣaṁ śaśvat kṛtva īḍyāya pra jabhruḥ
Griffith: To him adorable, mighty, meet for synods, this strengthening hymn, unceasing, have they offered.
Devanāgarī: इमं महे विदथ्याय शूषं शश्वत्कृत्व ईड्याय प्र जभ्रुः
pada pāṭha: imam | mahe | vidathyāya | śūṣam | śaśvat | kr̥tvaḥ | īḍyāya | pra | jabhruḥ || śr̥ṇotu | naḥ | damyebhiḥ | anīkaiḥ | śr̥ṇotu | agniḥ | divyaiḥ | ajasraḥ ||3.54.1||

IAST: śṛṇotu no damyebhir anīkaiḥ śṛṇotv agnir divyair ajasraḥ
Griffith: May Agni hear us with his homely splendours, hear us, Eternal One, with heavenly lustre.
Devanāgarī: शृणोतु नो दम्येभिरनीकैः शृणोत्वग्निर्दिव्यैरजस्रः
pada pāṭha: imam | mahe | vidathyāya | śūṣam | śaśvat | kr̥tvaḥ | īḍyāya | pra | jabhruḥ || śr̥ṇotu | naḥ | damyebhiḥ | anīkaiḥ | śr̥ṇotu | agniḥ | divyaiḥ | ajasraḥ ||3.54.1||

IAST: mahi mahe dive arcā pṛthivyai kāmo ma icchañ carati prajānan
Griffith: To mighty Heaven and Earth I sing forth loudly: my wish goes out desirous and well knowing
Devanāgarī: महि महे दिवे अर्चा पृथिव्यै कामो म इच्छञ्चरति प्रजानन्
pada pāṭha: mahi | mahe | dive | arca | pr̥thivyai | kāmaḥ | me | icchan | carati | pra-jānan || yayoḥ | ha | stome | vidatheṣu | devāḥ | saparyavaḥ | mādayante | sacā | āyoḥ ||3.54.2||

IAST: yayor ha stome vidatheṣu devāḥ saparyavo mādayante sacāyoḥ
Griffith: Both, at whose laud in synods, showing favour, the Gods rejoice them with the living mortal.
Devanāgarī: ययोर्ह स्तोमे विदथेषु देवाः सपर्यवो मादयन्ते सचायोः
pada pāṭha: mahi | mahe | dive | arca | pr̥thivyai | kāmaḥ | me | icchan | carati | pra-jānan || yayoḥ | ha | stome | vidatheṣu | devāḥ | saparyavaḥ | mādayante | sacā | āyoḥ ||3.54.2||

IAST: yuvor ṛtaṁ rodasī satyam astu mahe ṣu ṇaḥ suvitāya pra bhūtam
Griffith: O Heaven and Earth, may your great law he faithful: he ye our leaders for our high advantage.
Devanāgarī: युवोरृतं रोदसी सत्यमस्तु महे षु णः सुविताय प्र भूतम्
pada pāṭha: yuvoḥ | r̥tam | rodasī iti | satyam | astu | mahe | su | naḥ | su-vitāya | pra | bhūtam || idam | dive | namaḥ | agne | pr̥thivyai | saparyāmi | prayasā | yāmi | ratnam ||3.54.3||

IAST: idaṁ dive namo agne pṛthivyai saparyāmi prayasā yāmi ratnam
Griffith: To Heaven and Earth I offer this my homage, with food, O Agni, as I pray for riches.
Devanāgarī: इदं दिवे नमो अग्ने पृथिव्यै सपर्यामि प्रयसा यामि रत्नम्
pada pāṭha: yuvoḥ | r̥tam | rodasī iti | satyam | astu | mahe | su | naḥ | su-vitāya | pra | bhūtam || idam | dive | namaḥ | agne | pr̥thivyai | saparyāmi | prayasā | yāmi | ratnam ||3.54.3||

IAST: uto hi vām pūrvyā āvividra ṛtāvarī rodasī satyavācaḥ
Griffith: Yea, holy Heaven and Earth, the ancient sages whose word was ever true had power to find you;
Devanāgarī: उतो हि वां पूर्व्या आविविद्र ऋतावरी रोदसी सत्यवाचः
pada pāṭha: uto iti | hi | vām | pūrvyāḥ | ā-vividre | r̥tavarī ityr̥ta-varī | rodasī iti | satya-vācaḥ || naraḥ | cit | vām | sam-ithe | śūra-sātau | vavandire | pr̥thivi | vevidānāḥ ||3.54.4||

IAST: naraś cid vāṁ samithe śūrasātau vavandire pṛthivi vevidānāḥ
Griffith: And brave men in the fightwhere heroes conquer, O Earth, have known you well and paid you honour.
Devanāgarī: नरश्चिद्वां समिथे शूरसातौ ववन्दिरे पृथिवि वेविदानाः
pada pāṭha: uto iti | hi | vām | pūrvyāḥ | ā-vividre | r̥tavarī ityr̥ta-varī | rodasī iti | satya-vācaḥ || naraḥ | cit | vām | sam-ithe | śūra-sātau | vavandire | pr̥thivi | vevidānāḥ ||3.54.4||

IAST: ko addhā veda ka iha pra vocad devām̐ acchā pathyā kā sam eti
Griffith: What pathway leadeth to the Gods? Who knoweth this of a truth, and who will now declare it?
Devanāgarī: को अद्धा वेद क इह प्र वोचद्देवाँ अच्छा पथ्या का समेति
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | addhā | veda | kaḥ | iha | pra | vocat | devān | accha | pathyā | kā | sam | eti || dadr̥śre | eṣām | avamā | sadāṁsi | pareṣu | yā | guhyeṣu | vrateṣu ||3.54.5||

IAST: dadṛśra eṣām avamā sadāṁsi pareṣu yā guhyeṣu vrateṣu
Griffith: Seen are their lowest dwelling-places only, but they are in remote and secret regions.
Devanāgarī: ददृश्र एषामवमा सदांसि परेषु या गुह्येषु व्रतेषु
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | addhā | veda | kaḥ | iha | pra | vocat | devān | accha | pathyā | kā | sam | eti || dadr̥śre | eṣām | avamā | sadāṁsi | pareṣu | yā | guhyeṣu | vrateṣu ||3.54.5||

IAST: kavir nṛcakṣā abhi ṣīm acaṣṭa ṛtasya yonā vighṛte madantī
Griffith: The Sage who looketh on mankind hath viewed them bedewed, rejoicing in the seat of Order.
Devanāgarī: कविर्नृचक्षा अभि षीमचष्ट ऋतस्य योना विघृते मदन्ती
pada pāṭha: kaviḥ | nr̥-cakṣāḥ | abhi | sīm | acaṣṭa | r̥tasya | yonā | vighr̥te iti vi-ghr̥te | madantī iti || nānā | cakrāte iti | sadanam | yathā | veḥ | samānena | kratunā | saṁvidāne iti sam-vidāne ||3.54.6||

IAST: nānā cakrāte sadanaṁ yathā veḥ samānena kratunā saṁvidāne
Griffith: They make a home as for a bird, though parted, with one same will finding themselves together.
Devanāgarī: नाना चक्राते सदनं यथा वेः समानेन क्रतुना संविदाने
pada pāṭha: kaviḥ | nr̥-cakṣāḥ | abhi | sīm | acaṣṭa | r̥tasya | yonā | vighr̥te iti vi-ghr̥te | madantī iti || nānā | cakrāte iti | sadanam | yathā | veḥ | samānena | kratunā | saṁvidāne iti sam-vidāne ||3.54.6||

IAST: samānyā viyute dūreante dhruve pade tasthatur jāgarūke
Griffith: Partners though parted, with far-distant limits, on one firm place both stand for ever watchful,
Devanāgarī: समान्या वियुते दूरेअन्ते ध्रुवे पदे तस्थतुर्जागरूके
pada pāṭha: samānyā | viyute iti vi-yute | dūreante iti dūre-ante | dhruve | pade | tasthatuḥ | jāgarūke || uta | svasārā | yuvatī iti | bhavantī iti | āt | ūm̐ iti | bruvāte iti | mithunāni | nāma ||3.54.7||

IAST: uta svasārā yuvatī bhavantī ād u bruvāte mithunāni nāma
Griffith: And, being young for evermore, as sisters, speak to each other names that are united.
Devanāgarī: उत स्वसारा युवती भवन्ती आदु ब्रुवाते मिथुनानि नाम
pada pāṭha: samānyā | viyute iti vi-yute | dūreante iti dūre-ante | dhruve | pade | tasthatuḥ | jāgarūke || uta | svasārā | yuvatī iti | bhavantī iti | āt | ūm̐ iti | bruvāte iti | mithunāni | nāma ||3.54.7||

IAST: viśved ete janimā saṁ vivikto maho devān bibhratī na vyathete
Griffith: All living things they part and keep asunder; though bearing up the mighty Gods they reel not.
Devanāgarī: विश्वेदेते जनिमा सं विविक्तो महो देवान्बिभ्रती न व्यथेते
pada pāṭha: viśvā | it | ete iti | janima | sam | viviktaḥ | mahaḥ | devān | bibhratī iti | na | vyathete iti || ejat | dhruvam | patyate | viśvam | ekam | carat | patatri | viṣuṇam | vi | jātam ||3.54.8||

IAST: ejad dhruvam patyate viśvam ekaṁ carat patatri viṣuṇaṁ vi jātam
Griffith: One All is Lord of what is fixed and moving, that walks, that flies, this multiform creation.
Devanāgarī: एजद्ध्रुवं पत्यते विश्वमेकं चरत्पतत्रि विषुणं वि जातम्
pada pāṭha: viśvā | it | ete iti | janima | sam | viviktaḥ | mahaḥ | devān | bibhratī iti | na | vyathete iti || ejat | dhruvam | patyate | viśvam | ekam | carat | patatri | viṣuṇam | vi | jātam ||3.54.8||

IAST: sanā purāṇam adhy emy ārān mahaḥ pitur janitur jāmi tan naḥ
Griffith: Afar the Ancient from of old I ponder, our kinship with our mighty Sire and Father,-
Devanāgarī: सना पुराणमध्येम्यारान्महः पितुर्जनितुर्जामि तन्नः
pada pāṭha: sanā | purāṇam | adhi | emi | ārāt | mahaḥ | pituḥ | janituḥ | jāmi | tat | naḥ || devāsaḥ | yatra | panitāraḥ | evaiḥ | urau | pathi | vi-ute | tasthuḥ | antariti ||3.54.9||

IAST: devāso yatra panitāra evair urau pathi vyute tasthur antaḥ
