Griffith: Singing the praise whereof the Gods by custom stand on the spacious far-extended pathway.
Devanāgarī: देवासो यत्र पनितार एवैरुरौ पथि व्युते तस्थुरन्तः
pada pāṭha: sanā | purāṇam | adhi | emi | ārāt | mahaḥ | pituḥ | janituḥ | jāmi | tat | naḥ || devāsaḥ | yatra | panitāraḥ | evaiḥ | urau | pathi | vi-ute | tasthuḥ | antariti ||3.54.9||

IAST: imaṁ stomaṁ rodasī pra bravīmy ṛdūdarāḥ śṛṇavann agnijihvāḥ
Griffith: This laud, O Heaven and Earth, to you I utter: let the kind-hearted hear, whose tongue is Agni,
Devanāgarī: इमं स्तोमं रोदसी प्र ब्रवीम्यृदूदराः शृणवन्नग्निजिह्वाः
pada pāṭha: imam | stomam | rodasī iti | pra | bravīmi | r̥dūdarāḥ | śr̥ṇavan | agni-jihvāḥ || mitraḥ | sam-rājaḥ | varuṇaḥ | yuvānaḥ | ādityāsaḥ | kavayaḥ | paprathānāḥ ||3.54.10||

IAST: mitraḥ samrājo varuṇo yuvāna ādityāsaḥ kavayaḥ paprathānāḥ
Griffith: Young, Sovran Rulers, Varuna and Mitra, the wise and very glorious Adityas.
Devanāgarī: मित्रः सम्राजो वरुणो युवान आदित्यासः कवयः पप्रथानाः
pada pāṭha: imam | stomam | rodasī iti | pra | bravīmi | r̥dūdarāḥ | śr̥ṇavan | agni-jihvāḥ || mitraḥ | sam-rājaḥ | varuṇaḥ | yuvānaḥ | ādityāsaḥ | kavayaḥ | paprathānāḥ ||3.54.10||

IAST: hiraṇyapāṇiḥ savitā sujihvas trir ā divo vidathe patyamānaḥ
Griffith: The fair-tongued Savitar, the golden-handed, comes thrice from heaven as Lord in our assembly.
Devanāgarī: हिरण्यपाणिः सविता सुजिह्वस्त्रिरा दिवो विदथे पत्यमानः
pada pāṭha: hiraṇya-pāṇiḥ | savitā | su-jihvaḥ | triḥ | ā | divaḥ | vidathe | patyamānaḥ || deveṣu | ca | savitariti | ślokam | aśreḥ | āt | asmabhyam | ā | suva | sarva-tātim ||3.54.11||

IAST: deveṣu ca savitaḥ ślokam aśrer ād asmabhyam ā suva sarvatātim
Griffith: Bear to the Gods this song of praise, and send us, then, Savitar, complete and perfect safety.
Devanāgarī: देवेषु च सवितः श्लोकमश्रेरादस्मभ्यमा सुव सर्वतातिम्
pada pāṭha: hiraṇya-pāṇiḥ | savitā | su-jihvaḥ | triḥ | ā | divaḥ | vidathe | patyamānaḥ || deveṣu | ca | savitariti | ślokam | aśreḥ | āt | asmabhyam | ā | suva | sarva-tātim ||3.54.11||

IAST: sukṛt supāṇiḥ svavām̐ ṛtāvā devas tvaṣṭāvase tāni no dhāt
Griffith: Deft worker, skiful-handed, helpful, holy, may Tvastar, God, give us these things to aid us,
Devanāgarī: सुकृत्सुपाणिः स्ववाँ ऋतावा देवस्त्वष्टावसे तानि नो धात्
pada pāṭha: su-kr̥t | su-pāṇiḥ | sva-vān | r̥ta-vā | devaḥ | tvaṣṭā | avase | tāni | naḥ | dhāt || pūṣaṇ-vantaḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | mādayadhvam | ūrdhva-grāvāṇaḥ | adhvaram | ataṣṭa ||3.54.12||

IAST: pūṣaṇvanta ṛbhavo mādayadhvam ūrdhvagrāvāṇo adhvaram ataṣṭa
Griffith: Take your delight, Ye Rbhus joined with Pusan: ye have prepared the rite with stones adjusted.
Devanāgarī: पूषण्वन्त ऋभवो मादयध्वमूर्ध्वग्रावाणो अध्वरमतष्ट
pada pāṭha: su-kr̥t | su-pāṇiḥ | sva-vān | r̥ta-vā | devaḥ | tvaṣṭā | avase | tāni | naḥ | dhāt || pūṣaṇ-vantaḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | mādayadhvam | ūrdhva-grāvāṇaḥ | adhvaram | ataṣṭa ||3.54.12||

IAST: vidyudrathā maruta ṛṣṭimanto divo maryā ṛtajātā ayāsaḥ
Griffith: Borne on their flashing car, the spear-armed Maruts, the nimble Youths of Heaven, the Sons of Order,
Devanāgarī: विद्युद्रथा मरुत ऋष्टिमन्तो दिवो मर्या ऋतजाता अयासः
pada pāṭha: vidyut-rathāḥ | marutaḥ | r̥ṣṭi-mantaḥ | divaḥ | maryāḥ | r̥ta-jātāḥ | ayāsaḥ || sarasvatī | śr̥ṇavan | yajñiyāsaḥ | dhāta | rayim | saha-vīram | turāsaḥ ||3.54.13||

IAST: sarasvatī śṛṇavan yajñiyāso dhātā rayiṁ sahavīraṁ turāsaḥ
Griffith: The Holy, and Sarasvati, shall hear us: ye Mighty, give us wealth with noble offspring.
Devanāgarī: सरस्वती शृणवन्यज्ञियासो धाता रयिं सहवीरं तुरासः
pada pāṭha: vidyut-rathāḥ | marutaḥ | r̥ṣṭi-mantaḥ | divaḥ | maryāḥ | r̥ta-jātāḥ | ayāsaḥ || sarasvatī | śr̥ṇavan | yajñiyāsaḥ | dhāta | rayim | saha-vīram | turāsaḥ ||3.54.13||

IAST: viṣṇuṁ stomāsaḥ purudasmam arkā bhagasyeva kāriṇo yāmani gman
Griffith: To Visnu rich in marvels, songs And praises shall go as singers on the road of Bhaga,-
Devanāgarī: विष्णुं स्तोमासः पुरुदस्ममर्का भगस्येव कारिणो यामनि ग्मन्
pada pāṭha: viṣṇum | stomāsaḥ | puru-dasmam | arkāḥ | bhagasya-iva | kāriṇaḥ | yāmani | gman || uru-kramaḥ | kakuhaḥ | yasya | pūrvīḥ | na | mardhanti | yuvatayaḥ | janitrīḥ ||3.54.14||

IAST: urukramaḥ kakuho yasya pūrvīr na mardhanti yuvatayo janitrīḥ
Griffith: The Chieftain of the Mighty Stride, whose Mothers, the many young Dames, never disregard him.
Devanāgarī: उरुक्रमः ककुहो यस्य पूर्वीर्न मर्धन्ति युवतयो जनित्रीः
pada pāṭha: viṣṇum | stomāsaḥ | puru-dasmam | arkāḥ | bhagasya-iva | kāriṇaḥ | yāmani | gman || uru-kramaḥ | kakuhaḥ | yasya | pūrvīḥ | na | mardhanti | yuvatayaḥ | janitrīḥ ||3.54.14||

IAST: indro viśvair vīryaiḥ patyamāna ubhe ā paprau rodasī mahitvā
Griffith: Indra, who rules through all his powers heroic, hath with his majesty filled earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो विश्वैर्वीर्यैः पत्यमान उभे आ पप्रौ रोदसी महित्वा
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | viśvaiḥ | vīryaiḥ | patyamānaḥ | ubhe iti | ā | paprau | rodasī iti | mahi-tvā || puram-daraḥ | vr̥tra-hā | dhr̥ṣṇu-senaḥ | sam-gr̥bhya | naḥ | ā | bhara | bhūri | paśvaḥ ||3.54.15||

IAST: puraṁdaro vṛtrahā dhṛṣṇuṣeṇaḥ saṁgṛbhyā na ā bharā bhūri paśvaḥ
Griffith: Lord of brave hosts, Fort-crusher, Vrtra-slayer, gather thou up and bring us store of cattle.
Devanāgarī: पुरंदरो वृत्रहा धृष्णुषेणः संगृभ्या न आ भरा भूरि पश्वः
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | viśvaiḥ | vīryaiḥ | patyamānaḥ | ubhe iti | ā | paprau | rodasī iti | mahi-tvā || puram-daraḥ | vr̥tra-hā | dhr̥ṣṇu-senaḥ | sam-gr̥bhya | naḥ | ā | bhara | bhūri | paśvaḥ ||3.54.15||

IAST: nāsatyā me pitarā bandhupṛcchā sajātyam aśvinoś cāru nāma
Griffith: My Sires are the Nasatyas, kind tokinsmen: the Asvins' kinship is a glorious title.
Devanāgarī: नासत्या मे पितरा बन्धुपृच्छा सजात्यमश्विनोश्चारु नाम
pada pāṭha: nāsatyā | me | pitarā | bandhu-pr̥cchā | sa-jātyam | aśvinoḥ | cāru | nāma || yuvam | hi | sthaḥ | rayi-dau | naḥ | rayīṇām | dātram | rakṣethe iti | akavaiḥ | adabdhā ||3.54.16||

IAST: yuvaṁ hi stho rayidau no rayīṇāṁ dātraṁ rakṣethe akavair adabdhā
Griffith: For ye are they who give us store of riches: ye guard your gift uncheated by the bounteous.
Devanāgarī: युवं हि स्थो रयिदौ नो रयीणां दात्रं रक्षेथे अकवैरदब्धा
pada pāṭha: nāsatyā | me | pitarā | bandhu-pr̥cchā | sa-jātyam | aśvinoḥ | cāru | nāma || yuvam | hi | sthaḥ | rayi-dau | naḥ | rayīṇām | dātram | rakṣethe iti | akavaiḥ | adabdhā ||3.54.16||

IAST: mahat tad vaḥ kavayaś cāru nāma yad dha devā bhavatha viśva indre
Griffith: This is, ye Wise, your great and glorious title, that all ye Deities abide in Indra.
Devanāgarī: महत्तद्वः कवयश्चारु नाम यद्ध देवा भवथ विश्व इन्द्रे
pada pāṭha: mahat | tat | vaḥ | kavayaḥ | cāru | nāma | yat | ha | devāḥ | bhavatha | viśve | indre || sakhā | r̥bhu-bhiḥ | puru-hūta | priyebhiḥ | imām | dhiyam | sātaye | takṣata | naḥ ||3.54.17||

IAST: sakha ṛbhubhiḥ puruhūta priyebhir imāṁ dhiyaṁ sātaye takṣatā naḥ
Griffith: Friend, Much-invoked! art thou with thy dear Rbhus: fashion ye this our hymn for our advantage.
Devanāgarī: सख ऋभुभिः पुरुहूत प्रियेभिरिमां धियं सातये तक्षता नः
pada pāṭha: mahat | tat | vaḥ | kavayaḥ | cāru | nāma | yat | ha | devāḥ | bhavatha | viśve | indre || sakhā | r̥bhu-bhiḥ | puru-hūta | priyebhiḥ | imām | dhiyam | sātaye | takṣata | naḥ ||3.54.17||

IAST: aryamā ṇo aditir yajñiyāso 'dabdhāni varuṇasya vratāni
Griffith: Aryaman, Aditi deserve our worship: the laws of Varuna remain unbroken.
Devanāgarī: अर्यमा णो अदितिर्यज्ञियासोऽदब्धानि वरुणस्य व्रतानि
pada pāṭha: aryamā | naḥ | aditiḥ | yajñiyāsaḥ | adabdhāni | varuṇasya | vratāni || yuyota | naḥ | anapatyāni | gantoḥ | prajā-vān | naḥ | paśu-mān | astu | gātuḥ ||3.54.18||

IAST: yuyota no anapatyāni gantoḥ prajāvān naḥ paśumām̐ astu gātuḥ
Griffith: The lot of childlessness remove ye from us, and let our course be rich in kine and offspring.
Devanāgarī: युयोत नो अनपत्यानि गन्तोः प्रजावान्नः पशुमाँ अस्तु गातुः
pada pāṭha: aryamā | naḥ | aditiḥ | yajñiyāsaḥ | adabdhāni | varuṇasya | vratāni || yuyota | naḥ | anapatyāni | gantoḥ | prajā-vān | naḥ | paśu-mān | astu | gātuḥ ||3.54.18||

IAST: devānāṁ dūtaḥ purudha prasūto 'nāgān no vocatu sarvatātā
Griffith: May the Gods' envoy, sent to many a quarter, proclaim us sinless for our perfect safety.
Devanāgarī: देवानां दूतः पुरुध प्रसूतोऽनागान्नो वोचतु सर्वताता
pada pāṭha: devānām | dūtaḥ | purudha | pra-sūtaḥ | anāgān | naḥ | vocatu | sarva-tātā || śr̥ṇotu | naḥ | pr̥thivī | dyauḥ | uta | āpaḥ | sūryaḥ | nakṣatraiḥ | uru | antarikṣam ||3.54.19||

IAST: śṛṇotu naḥ pṛthivī dyaur utāpaḥ sūryo nakṣatrair urv antarikṣam
Griffith: May Earth and Heaven, the Sun, the waters, hear us, and the wide firmament and constellations.
Devanāgarī: शृणोतु नः पृथिवी द्यौरुतापः सूर्यो नक्षत्रैरुर्वन्तरिक्षम्
pada pāṭha: devānām | dūtaḥ | purudha | pra-sūtaḥ | anāgān | naḥ | vocatu | sarva-tātā || śr̥ṇotu | naḥ | pr̥thivī | dyauḥ | uta | āpaḥ | sūryaḥ | nakṣatraiḥ | uru | antarikṣam ||3.54.19||

IAST: śṛṇvantu no vṛṣaṇaḥ parvatāso dhruvakṣemāsa iḻayā madantaḥ
Griffith: Hear us the mouatains which distil the rain-drops, and, resting firm, rejoice in freshening moisture.
Devanāgarī: शृण्वन्तु नो वृषणः पर्वतासो ध्रुवक्षेमास इळया मदन्तः
pada pāṭha: śr̥ṇvantu | naḥ | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | parvatāsaḥ | dhruva-kṣemāsaḥ | iḷayā | madantaḥ || ādityaiḥ | naḥ | aditiḥ | śr̥ṇotu | yacchantu | naḥ | marutaḥ | śarma | bhadram ||3.54.20||

IAST: ādityair no aditiḥ śṛṇotu yacchantu no marutaḥ śarma bhadram
Griffith: May Aditi with the Adityas hear us, and Maruts grant us their auspicious shelter.
Devanāgarī: आदित्यैर्नो अदितिः शृणोतु यच्छन्तु नो मरुतः शर्म भद्रम्
pada pāṭha: śr̥ṇvantu | naḥ | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | parvatāsaḥ | dhruva-kṣemāsaḥ | iḷayā | madantaḥ || ādityaiḥ | naḥ | aditiḥ | śr̥ṇotu | yacchantu | naḥ | marutaḥ | śarma | bhadram ||3.54.20||

IAST: sadā sugaḥ pitumām̐ astu panthā madhvā devā oṣadhīḥ sam pipṛkta
Griffith: Soft be our path for ever, well-provisioned: with pleasant meath, O Gods, the herbs besprinkle.
Devanāgarī: सदा सुगः पितुमाँ अस्तु पन्था मध्वा देवा ओषधीः सं पिपृक्त
pada pāṭha: sadā | su-gaḥ | pitu-mān | astu | panthā | madhvā | devāḥ | oṣadhīḥ | sam | pipr̥kta || bhagaḥ | me | agne | sakhye | na | mr̥dhyāḥ | ut | rāyaḥ | aśyām | sadanam | puru-kṣoḥ ||3.54.21||

IAST: bhago me agne sakhye na mṛdhyā ud rāyo aśyāṁ sadanam purukṣoḥ
Griffith: Safe be my bliss, O Agni, in thy friendship: may I attain the seat of foodful. riches,
Devanāgarī: भगो मे अग्ने सख्ये न मृध्या उद्रायो अश्यां सदनं पुरुक्षोः
pada pāṭha: sadā | su-gaḥ | pitu-mān | astu | panthā | madhvā | devāḥ | oṣadhīḥ | sam | pipr̥kta || bhagaḥ | me | agne | sakhye | na | mr̥dhyāḥ | ut | rāyaḥ | aśyām | sadanam | puru-kṣoḥ ||3.54.21||

IAST: svadasva havyā sam iṣo didīhy asmadryak sam mimīhi śravāṁsi
Griffith: Enjoy the offering: beam thou strength upon us; combine thou for our good all kinds of glory.
Devanāgarī: स्वदस्व हव्या समिषो दिदीह्यस्मद्र्यक्सं मिमीहि श्रवांसि
pada pāṭha: svadasva | havyā | sam | iṣaḥ | didīhi | asmadryak | sam | mimīhi | śravāṁsi || viśvān | agne | pr̥t-su | tān | jeṣi | śatrūn | ahā | viśvā | su-manāḥ | dīdihi | naḥ ||3.54.22||

IAST: viśvām̐ agne pṛtsu tāñ jeṣi śatrūn ahā viśvā sumanā dīdihī naḥ
Griffith: Conquer in battle, Agni, all those foemen, and light us every day with loving kindness.
Devanāgarī: विश्वाँ अग्ने पृत्सु ताञ्जेषि शत्रूनहा विश्वा सुमना दीदिही नः
pada pāṭha: svadasva | havyā | sam | iṣaḥ | didīhi | asmadryak | sam | mimīhi | śravāṁsi || viśvān | agne | pr̥t-su | tān | jeṣi | śatrūn | ahā | viśvā | su-manāḥ | dīdihi | naḥ ||3.54.22||

IAST: uṣasaḥ pūrvā adha yad vyūṣur mahad vi jajñe akṣaram pade goḥ
Griffith: AT the first shining of the earliest Mornings, in the Cow's home was born the Great Eternal.
Devanāgarī: उषसः पूर्वा अध यद्व्यूषुर्महद्वि जज्ञे अक्षरं पदे गोः
pada pāṭha: uṣasaḥ | pūrvāḥ | adha | yat | vi-ūṣuḥ | mahat | vi | jajñe | akṣaram | pade | goḥ || vratā | devānām | upa | nu | pra-bhūṣan | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.1||

IAST: vratā devānām upa nu prabhūṣan mahad devānām asuratvam ekam
Griffith: Now shall the statutes of the Gods be valid. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion -
Devanāgarī: व्रता देवानामुप नु प्रभूषन्महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकम्
pada pāṭha: uṣasaḥ | pūrvāḥ | adha | yat | vi-ūṣuḥ | mahat | vi | jajñe | akṣaram | pade | goḥ || vratā | devānām | upa | nu | pra-bhūṣan | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.1||

IAST: mo ṣū ṇo atra juhuranta devā mā pūrve agne pitaraḥ padajñāḥ
Griffith: Let not the Gods here injure us, O Agni, nor Fathers of old time who know the region,
Devanāgarī: मो षू णो अत्र जुहुरन्त देवा मा पूर्वे अग्ने पितरः पदज्ञाः
pada pāṭha: mo iti | su | naḥ | atra | juhuranta | devāḥ | mā | pūrve | agne | pitaraḥ | pada-jñāḥ || purāṇyoḥ | sadmanoḥ | ketuḥ | antaḥ | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.2||

IAST: purāṇyoḥ sadmanoḥ ketur antar mahad devānām asuratvam ekam
Griffith: Nor the sign set between two ancient dwellings. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.
Devanāgarī: पुराण्योः सद्मनोः केतुरन्तर्महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकम्
pada pāṭha: mo iti | su | naḥ | atra | juhuranta | devāḥ | mā | pūrve | agne | pitaraḥ | pada-jñāḥ || purāṇyoḥ | sadmanoḥ | ketuḥ | antaḥ | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.2||

IAST: vi me purutrā patayanti kāmāḥ śamy acchā dīdye pūrvyāṇi
Griffith: My wishes fly abroad to many places: I glance back to the ancient sacrifices.
Devanāgarī: वि मे पुरुत्रा पतयन्ति कामाः शम्यच्छा दीद्ये पूर्व्याणि
pada pāṭha: vi | me | puru-trā | patayanti | kāmāḥ | śami | accha | dīdye | pūrvyāṇi || sam-iddhe | agnau | r̥tam | it | vadema | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.3||

IAST: samiddhe agnāv ṛtam id vadema mahad devānām asuratvam ekam
Griffith: Let us declare the truth when fire is kindled. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.
Devanāgarī: समिद्धे अग्नावृतमिद्वदेम महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकम्
pada pāṭha: vi | me | puru-trā | patayanti | kāmāḥ | śami | accha | dīdye | pūrvyāṇi || sam-iddhe | agnau | r̥tam | it | vadema | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.3||

IAST: samāno rājā vibhṛtaḥ purutrā śaye śayāsu prayuto vanānu
Griffith: King Universal, born to sundry quarters, extended through the wood be lies on couches.
Devanāgarī: समानो राजा विभृतः पुरुत्रा शये शयासु प्रयुतो वनानु
pada pāṭha: samānaḥ | rājā | vi-bhr̥taḥ | puru-trā | śaye | śayāsu | pra-yutaḥ | vanā | anu || anyā | vatsam | bharati | kṣeti | mātā | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.4||

IAST: anyā vatsam bharati kṣeti mātā mahad devānām asuratvam ekam
Griffith: One Mother rests: another feeds the Infant. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.
Devanāgarī: अन्या वत्सं भरति क्षेति माता महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकम्
pada pāṭha: samānaḥ | rājā | vi-bhr̥taḥ | puru-trā | śaye | śayāsu | pra-yutaḥ | vanā | anu || anyā | vatsam | bharati | kṣeti | mātā | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.4||

IAST: ākṣit pūrvāsv aparā anūrut sadyo jātāsu taruṇīṣv antaḥ
Griffith: Lodged in old plants, he grows again in younger, swiftly within the newly-born and tender.
Devanāgarī: आक्षित्पूर्वास्वपरा अनूरुत्सद्यो जातासु तरुणीष्वन्तः
pada pāṭha: ā-kṣit | pūrvāsu | aparāḥ | anūrut | sadyaḥ | jātāsu | taruṇīṣu | antariti || antaḥ-vatīḥ | suvate | apra-vītāḥ | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.5||

IAST: antarvatīḥ suvate apravītā mahad devānām asuratvam ekam
Griffith: Though they are unimpregned, he makes them fruitful. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.
Devanāgarī: अन्तर्वतीः सुवते अप्रवीता महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकम्
pada pāṭha: ā-kṣit | pūrvāsu | aparāḥ | anūrut | sadyaḥ | jātāsu | taruṇīṣu | antariti || antaḥ-vatīḥ | suvate | apra-vītāḥ | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.5||

IAST: śayuḥ parastād adha nu dvimātābandhanaś carati vatsa ekaḥ
Griffith: Now lying far away, Child of two Mothers, he wanders unrestrained, the single youngling.
Devanāgarī: शयुः परस्तादध नु द्विमाताबन्धनश्चरति वत्स एकः
pada pāṭha: śayuḥ | parastāt | adha | nu | dvi-mātā | abandhanaḥ | carati | vatsaḥ | ekaḥ || mitrasya | tā | varuṇasya | vratāni | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.6||

IAST: mitrasya tā varuṇasya vratāni mahad devānām asuratvam ekam
Griffith: These are the laws of Varuna and Mitra. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.
Devanāgarī: मित्रस्य ता वरुणस्य व्रतानि महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकम्
pada pāṭha: śayuḥ | parastāt | adha | nu | dvi-mātā | abandhanaḥ | carati | vatsaḥ | ekaḥ || mitrasya | tā | varuṇasya | vratāni | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.6||

IAST: dvimātā hotā vidatheṣu samrāḻ anv agraṁ carati kṣeti budhnaḥ
Griffith: Child of two Mothers, Priest, sole Lord in synods, he still precedes while resting as foundation.
Devanāgarī: द्विमाता होता विदथेषु सम्राळन्वग्रं चरति क्षेति बुध्नः
pada pāṭha: dvi-mātā | hotā | vidatheṣu | sam-rāṭ | anu | agram | carati | kṣeti | budhnaḥ || pra | raṇyāni | raṇya-vācaḥ | bharante | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.7||

IAST: pra raṇyāni raṇyavāco bharante mahad devānām asuratvam ekam
Griffith: They who speak sweetly bring him sweet addresses. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.
Devanāgarī: प्र रण्यानि रण्यवाचो भरन्ते महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकम्
pada pāṭha: dvi-mātā | hotā | vidatheṣu | sam-rāṭ | anu | agram | carati | kṣeti | budhnaḥ || pra | raṇyāni | raṇya-vācaḥ | bharante | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.7||

IAST: śūrasyeva yudhyato antamasya pratīcīnaṁ dadṛśe viśvam āyat
Griffith: As to a friendly warrior when he battles, each thing that comes anear is seen to meet him.
Devanāgarī: शूरस्येव युध्यतो अन्तमस्य प्रतीचीनं ददृशे विश्वमायत्
pada pāṭha: śūrasya-iva | yudhyataḥ | antamasya | pratīcīnam | dadr̥śe | viśvam | ā-yat || antaḥ | matiḥ | carati | niḥ-sidham | goḥ | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.8||

IAST: antar matiś carati niṣṣidhaṁ gor mahad devānām asuratvam ekam
Griffith: The hymn commingles with the cow's oblation. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.
Devanāgarī: अन्तर्मतिश्चरति निष्षिधं गोर्महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकम्
pada pāṭha: śūrasya-iva | yudhyataḥ | antamasya | pratīcīnam | dadr̥śe | viśvam | ā-yat || antaḥ | matiḥ | carati | niḥ-sidham | goḥ | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.8||

IAST: ni veveti palito dūta āsv antar mahām̐ś carati rocanena
Griffith: Deep within these the hoary envoy pierceth; mighty, he goeth to the realm of splendour,
Devanāgarī: नि वेवेति पलितो दूत आस्वन्तर्महाँश्चरति रोचनेन
pada pāṭha: ni | veveti | palitaḥ | dūtaḥ | āsu | antaḥ | mahān | carati | rocanena || vapūṁṣi | bibhrat | abhi | naḥ | vi | caṣṭe | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.9||

IAST: vapūṁṣi bibhrad abhi no vi caṣṭe mahad devānām asuratvam ekam
Griffith: And looketh on us, clad in wondrous beauty. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.
Devanāgarī: वपूंषि बिभ्रदभि नो वि चष्टे महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकम्
pada pāṭha: ni | veveti | palitaḥ | dūtaḥ | āsu | antaḥ | mahān | carati | rocanena || vapūṁṣi | bibhrat | abhi | naḥ | vi | caṣṭe | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.9||

IAST: viṣṇur gopāḥ paramam pāti pāthaḥ priyā dhāmāny amṛtā dadhānaḥ
Griffith: Visnu, the guardian, keeps the loftiest station, upholding dear, immortal dwelling-places.
Devanāgarī: विष्णुर्गोपाः परमं पाति पाथः प्रिया धामान्यमृता दधानः
pada pāṭha: viṣṇuḥ | gopāḥ | paramam | pāti | pāthaḥ | priyā | dhāmāni | amr̥tā | dadhānaḥ || agniḥ | tā | viśvā | bhuvanāni | veda | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.10||

IAST: agniṣ ṭā viśvā bhuvanāni veda mahad devānām asuratvam ekam
Griffith: Agni knows well all these created beings. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.
Devanāgarī: अग्निष्टा विश्वा भुवनानि वेद महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकम्
pada pāṭha: viṣṇuḥ | gopāḥ | paramam | pāti | pāthaḥ | priyā | dhāmāni | amr̥tā | dadhānaḥ || agniḥ | tā | viśvā | bhuvanāni | veda | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.10||

IAST: nānā cakrāte yamyā vapūṁṣi tayor anyad rocate kṛṣṇam anyat
Griffith: Ye, variant Pair, have made yourselves twin beauties: one of the Twain is dark, bright shines the other;
Devanāgarī: नाना चक्राते यम्या वपूंषि तयोरन्यद्रोचते कृष्णमन्यत्
pada pāṭha: nānā | cakrāte iti | yamyā | vapūṁṣi | tayoḥ | anyat | rocate | kr̥ṣṇam | anyat || śyāvī | ca | yat | aruṣī | ca | svasārau | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.11||

IAST: śyāvī ca yad aruṣī ca svasārau mahad devānām asuratvam ekam
Griffith: And yet these two, the dark, the red, are Sisters. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.
Devanāgarī: श्यावी च यदरुषी च स्वसारौ महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकम्
pada pāṭha: nānā | cakrāte iti | yamyā | vapūṁṣi | tayoḥ | anyat | rocate | kr̥ṣṇam | anyat || śyāvī | ca | yat | aruṣī | ca | svasārau | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.11||

IAST: mātā ca yatra duhitā ca dhenū sabardughe dhāpayete samīcī
Griffith: Where the two Cows, the Mother and the Daughter, meet and give suck yielding their lordly nectar,
Devanāgarī: माता च यत्र दुहिता च धेनू सबर्दुघे धापयेते समीची
pada pāṭha: mātā | ca | yatra | duhitā | ca | dhenū iti | sabardughe iti sabaḥ-dughe | dhāpayete iti | samīcī iti sam-īcī || r̥tasya | te iti | sadasi | īḷe | antaḥ | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.12||

IAST: ṛtasya te sadasīḻe antar mahad devānām asuratvam ekam
Griffith: I praise them at the seat of law eternal. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य ते सदसीळे अन्तर्महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकम्
pada pāṭha: mātā | ca | yatra | duhitā | ca | dhenū iti | sabardughe iti sabaḥ-dughe | dhāpayete iti | samīcī iti sam-īcī || r̥tasya | te iti | sadasi | īḷe | antaḥ | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.12||

IAST: anyasyā vatsaṁ rihatī mimāya kayā bhuvā ni dadhe dhenur ūdhaḥ
Griffith: Loud hath she lowed, licking the other's youngling. On what world hath the Milch-cow laid her udder?
Devanāgarī: अन्यस्या वत्सं रिहती मिमाय कया भुवा नि दधे धेनुरूधः
pada pāṭha: anyasyāḥ | vatsam | rihatī | mimāya | kayā | bhuvā | ni | dadhe | dhenuḥ | ūdhaḥ || r̥tasya | sā | payasā | apinvata | iḷā | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.13||

IAST: ṛtasya sā payasāpinvateḻā mahad devānām asuratvam ekam
Griffith: This Ila streameth with the milk of Order. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य सा पयसापिन्वतेळा महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकम्
pada pāṭha: anyasyāḥ | vatsam | rihatī | mimāya | kayā | bhuvā | ni | dadhe | dhenuḥ | ūdhaḥ || r̥tasya | sā | payasā | apinvata | iḷā | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.13||

IAST: padyā vaste pururūpā vapūṁṣy ūrdhvā tasthau tryaviṁ rerihāṇā
Griffith: Earth weareth beauties manifold: uplifted, licking her Calf of eighteen months, she standeth.
Devanāgarī: पद्या वस्ते पुरुरूपा वपूंष्यूर्ध्वा तस्थौ त्र्यविं रेरिहाणा
pada pāṭha: padyā | vaste | puru-rūpā | vapūṁṣi | ūrdhvā | tasthau | tri-avim | rerihāṇā || r̥tasya | sadma | vi | carāmi | vidvān | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.14||

IAST: ṛtasya sadma vi carāmi vidvān mahad devānām asuratvam ekam
Griffith: Well-skilled I seek the seat of law eternal. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य सद्म वि चरामि विद्वान्महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकम्
pada pāṭha: padyā | vaste | puru-rūpā | vapūṁṣi | ūrdhvā | tasthau | tri-avim | rerihāṇā || r̥tasya | sadma | vi | carāmi | vidvān | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.14||

IAST: pade iva nihite dasme antas tayor anyad guhyam āvir anyat
Griffith: Within a wondrous place the Twain are treasured: the one is manifest, the other hidden.
Devanāgarī: पदे इव निहिते दस्मे अन्तस्तयोरन्यद्गुह्यमाविरन्यत्
pada pāṭha: pade iveti pade-iva | nihite iti ni-hite | dasme | antariti | tayoḥ | anyat | guhyam | āviḥ | anyat || sadhrīcīnā | pathyā | sā | viṣūcī | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.15||

IAST: sadhrīcīnā pathyā sā viṣūcī mahad devānām asuratvam ekam
Griffith: One common pathway leads in two directions. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.
Devanāgarī: सध्रीचीना पथ्या सा विषूची महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकम्
pada pāṭha: pade iveti pade-iva | nihite iti ni-hite | dasme | antariti | tayoḥ | anyat | guhyam | āviḥ | anyat || sadhrīcīnā | pathyā | sā | viṣūcī | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.15||

IAST: ā dhenavo dhunayantām aśiśvīḥ sabardughāḥ śaśayā apradugdhāḥ
Griffith: Let the milch-kine that have no calves storm downward, yielding rich nectar, streaming, unexhausted,
Devanāgarī: आ धेनवो धुनयन्तामशिश्वीः सबर्दुघाः शशया अप्रदुग्धाः
pada pāṭha: ā | dhenavaḥ | dhunayantām | aśiśvīḥ | sabaḥ-dughāḥ | śaśayāḥ | apra-dugdhāḥ || navyāḥ-navyāḥ | yuvatayaḥ | bhavantīḥ | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.16||

IAST: navyā-navyā yuvatayo bhavantīr mahad devānām asuratvam ekam
Griffith: These who are ever new and fresh and youthful. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.
Devanāgarī: नव्यानव्या युवतयो भवन्तीर्महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकम्
pada pāṭha: ā | dhenavaḥ | dhunayantām | aśiśvīḥ | sabaḥ-dughāḥ | śaśayāḥ | apra-dugdhāḥ || navyāḥ-navyāḥ | yuvatayaḥ | bhavantīḥ | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.16||

IAST: yad anyāsu vṛṣabho roravīti so anyasmin yūthe ni dadhāti retaḥ
Griffith: What time the Bull bellows in other regions, another herd receives the genial moisture;
Devanāgarī: यदन्यासु वृषभो रोरवीति सो अन्यस्मिन्यूथे नि दधाति रेतः
pada pāṭha: yat | anyāsu | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | roravīti | saḥ | anyasmin | yūthe | ni | dadhāti | retaḥ || saḥ | hi | kṣapā-vān | saḥ | bhagaḥ | saḥ | rājā | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.17||

IAST: sa hi kṣapāvān sa bhagaḥ sa rājā mahad devānām asuratvam ekam
Griffith: For he is Bhaga, King, the earth's Protector. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.
Devanāgarī: स हि क्षपावान्स भगः स राजा महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकम्
pada pāṭha: yat | anyāsu | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | roravīti | saḥ | anyasmin | yūthe | ni | dadhāti | retaḥ || saḥ | hi | kṣapā-vān | saḥ | bhagaḥ | saḥ | rājā | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.17||

IAST: vīrasya nu svaśvyaṁ janāsaḥ pra nu vocāma vidur asya devāḥ
Griffith: Let us declare the Hero's wealth in horses, O all ye folk: of this the Gods have knowledge.
Devanāgarī: वीरस्य नु स्वश्व्यं जनासः प्र नु वोचाम विदुरस्य देवाः
pada pāṭha: vīrasya | nu | su-aśvyam | janāsaḥ | pra | nu | vocāma | viduḥ | asya | devāḥ || ṣoḷhā | yuktāḥ | pañca-pañca | ā | vahanti | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.18||

IAST: ṣoḻhā yuktāḥ pañca-pañcā vahanti mahad devānām asuratvam ekam
Griffith: Sixfold they bear him, or by fives are harnessed. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.
Devanāgarī: षोळ्हा युक्ताः पञ्चपञ्चा वहन्ति महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकम्
pada pāṭha: vīrasya | nu | su-aśvyam | janāsaḥ | pra | nu | vocāma | viduḥ | asya | devāḥ || ṣoḷhā | yuktāḥ | pañca-pañca | ā | vahanti | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.18||

IAST: devas tvaṣṭā savitā viśvarūpaḥ pupoṣa prajāḥ purudhā jajāna
Griffith: Tvastar the God, the omniform. Creator, begets and feeds mankind in various manner.
Devanāgarī: देवस्त्वष्टा सविता विश्वरूपः पुपोष प्रजाः पुरुधा जजान
pada pāṭha: devaḥ | tvaṣṭā | savitā | viśva-rūpaḥ | pupoṣa | pra-jāḥ | purudhā | jajāna || imā | ca | viśvā | bhuvanāni | asya | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.19||

IAST: imā ca viśvā bhuvanāny asya mahad devānām asuratvam ekam
Griffith: His, verily, arc all these living creatures. Great is the Gods' supreme dominion.
Devanāgarī: इमा च विश्वा भुवनान्यस्य महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकम्
pada pāṭha: devaḥ | tvaṣṭā | savitā | viśva-rūpaḥ | pupoṣa | pra-jāḥ | purudhā | jajāna || imā | ca | viśvā | bhuvanāni | asya | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.19||

IAST: mahī sam airac camvā samīcī ubhe te asya vasunā nyṛṣṭe
Griffith: The two great meeting Bowls hath he united: each of the Pair is laden with histreasure.
Devanāgarī: मही समैरच्चम्वा समीची उभे ते अस्य वसुना न्यृष्टे
pada pāṭha: mahī iti | sam | airat | camvā | samīcī iti sam-īcī | ubhe iti | te iti | asya | vasunā | nyr̥ṣṭe iti ni-r̥ṣṭe || śr̥ṇve | vīraḥ | vindamānaḥ | vasūni | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.20||

IAST: śṛṇve vīro vindamāno vasūni mahad devānām asuratvam ekam
Griffith: The Hero is renowned for gathering riches. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.
Devanāgarī: शृण्वे वीरो विन्दमानो वसूनि महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकम्
pada pāṭha: mahī iti | sam | airat | camvā | samīcī iti sam-īcī | ubhe iti | te iti | asya | vasunā | nyr̥ṣṭe iti ni-r̥ṣṭe || śr̥ṇve | vīraḥ | vindamānaḥ | vasūni | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.20||

IAST: imāṁ ca naḥ pṛthivīṁ viśvadhāyā upa kṣeti hitamitro na rājā
Griffith: Yea, and on this our earth the All-Sustainer dwells like a King with noble friends about him.
Devanāgarī: इमां च नः पृथिवीं विश्वधाया उप क्षेति हितमित्रो न राजा
pada pāṭha: imām | ca | naḥ | pr̥thivīm | viśva-dhāyāḥ | upa | kṣeti | hita-mitraḥ | na | rājā || puraḥ-sadaḥ | śarma-sadaḥ | na | vīrāḥ | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.21||

IAST: puraḥsadaḥ śarmasado na vīrā mahad devānām asuratvam ekam
Griffith: In his protection heroes rest in safety. Great is the Cods' supreme and sole dominion.
Devanāgarī: पुरःसदः शर्मसदो न वीरा महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकम्
pada pāṭha: imām | ca | naḥ | pr̥thivīm | viśva-dhāyāḥ | upa | kṣeti | hita-mitraḥ | na | rājā || puraḥ-sadaḥ | śarma-sadaḥ | na | vīrāḥ | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.21||

IAST: niṣṣidhvarīs ta oṣadhīr utāpo rayiṁ ta indra pṛthivī bibharti
Griffith: Rich in their gifts for thee are herbs and waters, and earth brings all her wealth for thee, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: निष्षिध्वरीस्त ओषधीरुतापो रयिं त इन्द्र पृथिवी बिभर्ति
pada pāṭha: niḥ-sidhvarīḥ | te | oṣadhīḥ | uta | āpaḥ | rayim | te | indra | pr̥thivī | bibharti || sakhāyaḥ | te | vāma-bhājaḥ | syāma | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.22||

IAST: sakhāyas te vāmabhājaḥ syāma mahad devānām asuratvam ekam
Griffith: May we as friends of thine share goodly treasures. Great is the Gods' supreme and sole dominion.
Devanāgarī: सखायस्ते वामभाजः स्याम महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकम्
pada pāṭha: niḥ-sidhvarīḥ | te | oṣadhīḥ | uta | āpaḥ | rayim | te | indra | pr̥thivī | bibharti || sakhāyaḥ | te | vāma-bhājaḥ | syāma | mahat | devānām | asura-tvam | ekam ||3.55.22||

IAST: na tā minanti māyino na dhīrā vratā devānām prathamā dhruvāṇi
Griffith: NOT men of magic skill, not men of wisdom impair the Gods' first steadfast ordinances.
Devanāgarī: न ता मिनन्ति मायिनो न धीरा व्रता देवानां प्रथमा ध्रुवाणि
pada pāṭha: na | tā | minanti | māyinaḥ | na | dhīrāḥ | vratā | devānām | prathamā | dhruvāṇi || na | rodasī iti | adruhā | vedyābhiḥ | na | parvatāḥ | ni-name | tasthi-vāṁsaḥ ||3.56.1||

IAST: na rodasī adruhā vedyābhir na parvatā niname tasthivāṁsaḥ
Griffith: Ne'er may the earth and heaven which know not malice, nor the fixed hills, be bowed by sage devices.
Devanāgarī: न रोदसी अद्रुहा वेद्याभिर्न पर्वता निनमे तस्थिवांसः
pada pāṭha: na | tā | minanti | māyinaḥ | na | dhīrāḥ | vratā | devānām | prathamā | dhruvāṇi || na | rodasī iti | adruhā | vedyābhiḥ | na | parvatāḥ | ni-name | tasthi-vāṁsaḥ ||3.56.1||

IAST: ṣaḍ bhārām̐ eko acaran bibharty ṛtaṁ varṣiṣṭham upa gāva āguḥ
Griffith: One, moving not away, supports six burthens: the Cows proceed to him the true, the Highest.
Devanāgarī: षड्भाराँ एको अचरन्बिभर्त्यृतं वर्षिष्ठमुप गाव आगुः
pada pāṭha: ṣaṭ | bhārān | ekaḥ | acaran | bibharti | r̥tam | varṣiṣṭham | upa | gāvaḥ | ā | aguḥ || tisraḥ | mahīḥ | uparāḥ | tasthuḥ | atyāḥ | guhā | dve iti | nihite iti ni-hite | darśi | ekā ||3.56.2||

IAST: tisro mahīr uparās tasthur atyā guhā dve nihite darśy ekā
Griffith: Near stand three Mighty Ones who travel swiftly: two are concealed from sight, one is apparent.
Devanāgarī: तिस्रो महीरुपरास्तस्थुरत्या गुहा द्वे निहिते दर्श्येका
pada pāṭha: ṣaṭ | bhārān | ekaḥ | acaran | bibharti | r̥tam | varṣiṣṭham | upa | gāvaḥ | ā | aguḥ || tisraḥ | mahīḥ | uparāḥ | tasthuḥ | atyāḥ | guhā | dve iti | nihite iti ni-hite | darśi | ekā ||3.56.2||

IAST: tripājasyo vṛṣabho viśvarūpa uta tryudhā purudha prajāvān
Griffith: The Bull who wears all shapes, the triple-breasted, three-uddered, with a brood in many places,
Devanāgarī: त्रिपाजस्यो वृषभो विश्वरूप उत त्र्युधा पुरुध प्रजावान्
pada pāṭha: tri-pājasyaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | viśva-rūpaḥ | uta | tri-udhā | purudha | prajā-vān || tri-anīkaḥ | patyate | māhina-vān | saḥ | retaḥ-dhāḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | śaśvatīnām ||3.56.3||

IAST: tryanīkaḥ patyate māhināvān sa retodhā vṛṣabhaḥ śaśvatīnām
Griffith: Ruleth majestic with his triple aspect, the Bull, the Everlasting Ones' impregner.
Devanāgarī: त्र्यनीकः पत्यते माहिनावान्स रेतोधा वृषभः शश्वतीनाम्
pada pāṭha: tri-pājasyaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | viśva-rūpaḥ | uta | tri-udhā | purudha | prajā-vān || tri-anīkaḥ | patyate | māhina-vān | saḥ | retaḥ-dhāḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | śaśvatīnām ||3.56.3||

IAST: abhīka āsām padavīr abodhy ādityānām ahve cāru nāma
Griffith: When nigh them, as their tracer he observed them: he called aloud the dear name of Adityas.
Devanāgarī: अभीक आसां पदवीरबोध्यादित्यानामह्वे चारु नाम
pada pāṭha: abhīke | āsām | pada-vīḥ | abodhi | ādityānām | ahve | cāru | nāma || āpaḥ | cit | asmai | aramanta | devīḥ | pr̥thak | vrajantīḥ | pari | sīm | avr̥ñjan ||3.56.4||

IAST: āpaś cid asmā aramanta devīḥ pṛthag vrajantīḥ pari ṣīm avṛñjan
Griffith: The Goddesses, the Waters, stayed to meet him: they who were wandering separate enclosed him.
Devanāgarī: आपश्चिदस्मा अरमन्त देवीः पृथग्व्रजन्तीः परि षीमवृञ्जन्
pada pāṭha: abhīke | āsām | pada-vīḥ | abodhi | ādityānām | ahve | cāru | nāma || āpaḥ | cit | asmai | aramanta | devīḥ | pr̥thak | vrajantīḥ | pari | sīm | avr̥ñjan ||3.56.4||

IAST: trī ṣadhasthā sindhavas triḥ kavīnām uta trimātā vidatheṣu samrāṭ
Griffith: Streams! the wise Gods have thrice three habitations. Child of three Mothers, he is Lord in synods.
Devanāgarī: त्री षधस्था सिन्धवस्त्रिः कवीनामुत त्रिमाता विदथेषु सम्राट्
pada pāṭha: trī | sadha-sthā | sindhavaḥ | triḥ | kavīnām | uta | tri-mātā | vidatheṣu | sam-rāṭ || r̥ta-varīḥ | yoṣaṇāḥ | tisraḥ | apyāḥ | triḥ | ā | divaḥ | vidathe | patyamānāḥ ||3.56.5||

IAST: ṛtāvarīr yoṣaṇās tisro apyās trir ā divo vidathe patyamānāḥ
Griffith: Three are the holy Ladies of the Waters, thrice here from heaven supreme in our assembly.
Devanāgarī: ऋतावरीर्योषणास्तिस्रो अप्यास्त्रिरा दिवो विदथे पत्यमानाः
pada pāṭha: trī | sadha-sthā | sindhavaḥ | triḥ | kavīnām | uta | tri-mātā | vidatheṣu | sam-rāṭ || r̥ta-varīḥ | yoṣaṇāḥ | tisraḥ | apyāḥ | triḥ | ā | divaḥ | vidathe | patyamānāḥ ||3.56.5||

IAST: trir ā divaḥ savitar vāryāṇi dive-diva ā suva trir no ahnaḥ
Griffith: Do thou, O Savitar, from heaven thrice hither, three times a day, send down thy blessings daily.
Devanāgarī: त्रिरा दिवः सवितर्वार्याणि दिवेदिव आ सुव त्रिर्नो अह्नः
pada pāṭha: triḥ | ā | divaḥ | savitaḥ | vāryāṇi | dive-dive | ā | suva | triḥ | naḥ | ahnaḥ || tri-dhātu | rāyaḥ | ā | suva | vasūni | bhaga | trātaḥ | dhiṣaṇe | sātaye | dhāḥ ||3.56.6||

IAST: tridhātu rāya ā suvā vasūni bhaga trātar dhiṣaṇe sātaye dhāḥ
Griffith: Send us, O Bhaga, triple wealth and treasure; cause the two worlds to prosper us, Preserver!
Devanāgarī: त्रिधातु राय आ सुवा वसूनि भग त्रातर्धिषणे सातये धाः
pada pāṭha: triḥ | ā | divaḥ | savitaḥ | vāryāṇi | dive-dive | ā | suva | triḥ | naḥ | ahnaḥ || tri-dhātu | rāyaḥ | ā | suva | vasūni | bhaga | trātaḥ | dhiṣaṇe | sātaye | dhāḥ ||3.56.6||

IAST: trir ā divaḥ savitā soṣavīti rājānā mitrāvaruṇā supāṇī
Griffith: Savitar thrice from heaven pours down abundance, and the fair-handed Kings Varuna, Mitra;
Devanāgarī: त्रिरा दिवः सविता सोषवीति राजाना मित्रावरुणा सुपाणी
pada pāṭha: triḥ | ā | divaḥ | savitā | sosavīti | rājānā | mitrāvaruṇā | supāṇī iti su-pāṇī || āpaḥ | cit | asya | rodasī iti | cit | urvī iti | ratnam | bhikṣanta | savituḥ | savāya ||3.56.7||

IAST: āpaś cid asya rodasī cid urvī ratnam bhikṣanta savituḥ savāya
Griffith: And spacious Heaven and Earth, yea, and the Waters, solicit wealth that Savitar may send us.
Devanāgarī: आपश्चिदस्य रोदसी चिदुर्वी रत्नं भिक्षन्त सवितुः सवाय
pada pāṭha: triḥ | ā | divaḥ | savitā | sosavīti | rājānā | mitrāvaruṇā | supāṇī iti su-pāṇī || āpaḥ | cit | asya | rodasī iti | cit | urvī iti | ratnam | bhikṣanta | savituḥ | savāya ||3.56.7||

IAST: trir uttamā dūṇaśā rocanāni trayo rājanty asurasya vīrāḥ
Griffith: Three are the bright realms, best, beyond attainment, and three, the Asura's Heroes, rule as Sovrans,
Devanāgarī: त्रिरुत्तमा दूणशा रोचनानि त्रयो राजन्त्यसुरस्य वीराः
pada pāṭha: triḥ | ut-tamā | duḥ-naśā | rocanāni | trayaḥ | rājanti | asurasya | vīrāḥ || r̥ta-vānaḥ | iṣirāḥ | duḥ-dabhāsaḥ | triḥ | ā | divaḥ | vidathe | santu | devāḥ ||3.56.8||

IAST: ṛtāvāna iṣirā dūḻabhāsas trir ā divo vidathe santu devāḥ
Griffith: Holy and vigorous, never to be injured. Thrice may the Gods from heaven attend our synod.
Devanāgarī: ऋतावान इषिरा दूळभासस्त्रिरा दिवो विदथे सन्तु देवाः
pada pāṭha: triḥ | ut-tamā | duḥ-naśā | rocanāni | trayaḥ | rājanti | asurasya | vīrāḥ || r̥ta-vānaḥ | iṣirāḥ | duḥ-dabhāsaḥ | triḥ | ā | divaḥ | vidathe | santu | devāḥ ||3.56.8||

IAST: pra me vivikvām̐ avidan manīṣāṁ dhenuṁ carantīm prayutām agopām
Griffith: MY thought with fine discernment hath discovered the Cow who wanders free without a herdsman,
Devanāgarī: प्र मे विविक्वाँ अविदन्मनीषां धेनुं चरन्तीं प्रयुतामगोपाम्
pada pāṭha: pra | me | vivikvān | avidat | manīṣām | dhenum | carantīm | pra-yutām | agopām || sadyaḥ | cit | yā | duduhe | bhūri | dhāseḥ | indraḥ | tat | agniḥ | panitāraḥ | asyāḥ ||3.57.1||

IAST: sadyaś cid yā duduhe bhūri dhāser indras tad agniḥ panitāro asyāḥ
Griffith: Her who hath straightway poured me food in plenty: Indra and Agni therefore are her praisers.
Devanāgarī: सद्यश्चिद्या दुदुहे भूरि धासेरिन्द्रस्तदग्निः पनितारो अस्याः
pada pāṭha: pra | me | vivikvān | avidat | manīṣām | dhenum | carantīm | pra-yutām | agopām || sadyaḥ | cit | yā | duduhe | bhūri | dhāseḥ | indraḥ | tat | agniḥ | panitāraḥ | asyāḥ ||3.57.1||

IAST: indraḥ su pūṣā vṛṣaṇā suhastā divo na prītāḥ śaśayaṁ duduhre
Griffith: Indra and Pusan, deft of hand and mighty, well-pleased have drained the heaven's exhaustless udder.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रः सु पूषा वृषणा सुहस्ता दिवो न प्रीताः शशयं दुदुह्रे
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | su | pūṣā | vr̥ṣaṇā | su-hastā | divaḥ | na | prītāḥ | śaśayam | duduhre || viśve | yat | asyām | raṇayanta | devāḥ | pra | vaḥ | atra | vasavaḥ | sumnam | aśyām ||3.57.2||

IAST: viśve yad asyāṁ raṇayanta devāḥ pra vo 'tra vasavaḥ sumnam aśyām
Griffith: As in this praise the Gods have all delighted, may I win blessing here from you, O Vasus.
Devanāgarī: विश्वे यदस्यां रणयन्त देवाः प्र वोऽत्र वसवः सुम्नमश्याम्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | su | pūṣā | vr̥ṣaṇā | su-hastā | divaḥ | na | prītāḥ | śaśayam | duduhre || viśve | yat | asyām | raṇayanta | devāḥ | pra | vaḥ | atra | vasavaḥ | sumnam | aśyām ||3.57.2||

IAST: yā jāmayo vṛṣṇa icchanti śaktiṁ namasyantīr jānate garbham asmin
Griffith: Fain to lend vigour to the Bull, the siste.. with reverence recognize the germ within him.
Devanāgarī: या जामयो वृष्ण इच्छन्ति शक्तिं नमस्यन्तीर्जानते गर्भमस्मिन्
pada pāṭha: yāḥ | jāmayaḥ | vr̥ṣṇe | icchanti | śaktim | namasyantīḥ | jānate | garbham | asmin || accha | putram | dhenavaḥ | vāvaśānāḥ | mahaḥ | caranti | bibhratam | vapūṁṣi ||3.57.3||

IAST: acchā putraṁ dhenavo vāvaśānā mahaś caranti bibhrataṁ vapūṁṣi
Griffith: The Cows come lowing hither to the Youngling, to him endued with great and wondrous beauties.
Devanāgarī: अच्छा पुत्रं धेनवो वावशाना महश्चरन्ति बिभ्रतं वपूंषि
pada pāṭha: yāḥ | jāmayaḥ | vr̥ṣṇe | icchanti | śaktim | namasyantīḥ | jānate | garbham | asmin || accha | putram | dhenavaḥ | vāvaśānāḥ | mahaḥ | caranti | bibhratam | vapūṁṣi ||3.57.3||

IAST: acchā vivakmi rodasī sumeke grāvṇo yujāno adhvare manīṣā
Griffith: Fixing with thought, at sacrifice, the press-stones, I bid the well-formed Heaven and Earth come hither;
Devanāgarī: अच्छा विवक्मि रोदसी सुमेके ग्राव्णो युजानो अध्वरे मनीषा
pada pāṭha: accha | vivakmi | rodasī iti | sumeke iti su-meke | grāvṇaḥ | yujānaḥ | adhvare | manīṣā || imāḥ | ūm̐ iti | te | manave | bhūri-vārāḥ | ūrdhvāḥ | bhavanti | darśatāḥ | yajatrāḥ ||3.57.4||

IAST: imā u te manave bhūrivārā ūrdhvā bhavanti darśatā yajatrāḥ
Griffith: For these thy flames, which give men boons in plenty, rise up on high, the beautiful, the holy.
Devanāgarī: इमा उ ते मनवे भूरिवारा ऊर्ध्वा भवन्ति दर्शता यजत्राः
pada pāṭha: accha | vivakmi | rodasī iti | sumeke iti su-meke | grāvṇaḥ | yujānaḥ | adhvare | manīṣā || imāḥ | ūm̐ iti | te | manave | bhūri-vārāḥ | ūrdhvāḥ | bhavanti | darśatāḥ | yajatrāḥ ||3.57.4||

IAST: yā te jihvā madhumatī sumedhā agne deveṣūcyata urūcī
Griffith: Agni, thy meath-sweet tongue that tastes fair viands, which among Gods is called the far-extended,-
Devanāgarī: या ते जिह्वा मधुमती सुमेधा अग्ने देवेषूच्यत उरूची
pada pāṭha: yā | te | jihvā | madhu-matī | su-medhāḥ | agne | deveṣu | ucyate | urūcī || tayā | iha | viśvān | avase | yajatrān | ā | sādaya | pāyaya | ca | madhūni ||3.57.5||

IAST: tayeha viśvām̐ avase yajatrān ā sādaya pāyayā cā madhūni
Griffith: Therewith make all the Holy Odes be seated here for our help, and feed them with sweet juices.
Devanāgarī: तयेह विश्वाँ अवसे यजत्राना सादय पायया चा मधूनि
pada pāṭha: yā | te | jihvā | madhu-matī | su-medhāḥ | agne | deveṣu | ucyate | urūcī || tayā | iha | viśvān | avase | yajatrān | ā | sādaya | pāyaya | ca | madhūni ||3.57.5||

IAST: yā te agne parvatasyeva dhārāsaścantī pīpayad deva citrā
Griffith: Let thy stream give us drink, O God, O Agni, wonderful and exhaustless like the rain-clouds.
Devanāgarī: या ते अग्ने पर्वतस्येव धारासश्चन्ती पीपयद्देव चित्रा
pada pāṭha: yā | te | agne | parvatasya-iva | dhārā | asaścantī | pīpayat | deva | citrā || tām | asmabhyam | pra-matim | jāta-vedaḥ | vaso iti | rāsva | su-matim | viśva-janyām ||3.57.6||

IAST: tām asmabhyam pramatiṁ jātavedo vaso rāsva sumatiṁ viśvajanyām
Griffith: Thus care for us, O Vasu Jatavedas, show us thy loving-kindness, reaching all men.
Devanāgarī: तामस्मभ्यं प्रमतिं जातवेदो वसो रास्व सुमतिं विश्वजन्याम्
pada pāṭha: yā | te | agne | parvatasya-iva | dhārā | asaścantī | pīpayat | deva | citrā || tām | asmabhyam | pra-matim | jāta-vedaḥ | vaso iti | rāsva | su-matim | viśva-janyām ||3.57.6||

IAST: dhenuḥ pratnasya kāmyaṁ duhānāntaḥ putraś carati dakṣiṇāyāḥ
Griffith: THE Ancient's Milch-cow yields the things we long for: the Son of Daksina travels between them.
Devanāgarī: धेनुः प्रत्नस्य काम्यं दुहानान्तः पुत्रश्चरति दक्षिणायाः
pada pāṭha: dhenuḥ | pratnasya | kāmyam | duhānā | antariti | putraḥ | carati | dakṣiṇāyāḥ || ā | dyotanim | vahati | śubhra-yāmā | uṣasaḥ | stomaḥ | aśvinau | ajīgariti ||3.58.1||

IAST: ā dyotaniṁ vahati śubhrayāmoṣasaḥ stomo aśvināv ajīgaḥ
Griffith: She with the splendid chariot brings refulgence. The praise of Usas hath awoke the Asvins.
Devanāgarī: आ द्योतनिं वहति शुभ्रयामोषसः स्तोमो अश्विनावजीगः
pada pāṭha: dhenuḥ | pratnasya | kāmyam | duhānā | antariti | putraḥ | carati | dakṣiṇāyāḥ || ā | dyotanim | vahati | śubhra-yāmā | uṣasaḥ | stomaḥ | aśvinau | ajīgariti ||3.58.1||

IAST: suyug vahanti prati vām ṛtenordhvā bhavanti pitareva medhāḥ
Griffith: They bear you hither by well-orderd statute: our sacred offerings rise as if to parents.
Devanāgarī: सुयुग्वहन्ति प्रति वामृतेनोर्ध्वा भवन्ति पितरेव मेधाः
pada pāṭha: su-yuk | vahanti | prati | vām | r̥tena | ūrdhvāḥ | bhavanti | pitarā-iva | medhāḥ || jarethām | asmat | vi | paṇeḥ | manīṣām | yuvoḥ | avaḥ | cakr̥ma | ā | yātam | arvāk ||3.58.2||

IAST: jarethām asmad vi paṇer manīṣāṁ yuvor avaś cakṛmā yātam arvāk
Griffith: Destroy in us the counsel of the niggard come hitherward, for we have shown you favour.
Devanāgarī: जरेथामस्मद्वि पणेर्मनीषां युवोरवश्चकृमा यातमर्वाक्
pada pāṭha: su-yuk | vahanti | prati | vām | r̥tena | ūrdhvāḥ | bhavanti | pitarā-iva | medhāḥ || jarethām | asmat | vi | paṇeḥ | manīṣām | yuvoḥ | avaḥ | cakr̥ma | ā | yātam | arvāk ||3.58.2||

IAST: suyugbhir aśvaiḥ suvṛtā rathena dasrāv imaṁ śṛṇutaṁ ślokam adreḥ
Griffith: With lightly-rolling car and well-yoked horses hear this, the press-stone's song, ye Wonder-Workers.
Devanāgarī: सुयुग्भिरश्वैः सुवृता रथेन दस्राविमं शृणुतं श्लोकमद्रेः
pada pāṭha: suyuk-bhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | su-vr̥tā | rathena | dasrau | imam | śr̥ṇutam | ślokam | adreḥ || kim | aṅga | vām | prati | avartim | gamiṣṭhā | āhuḥ | viprāsaḥ | aśvinā | purā-jāḥ ||3.58.3||

IAST: kim aṅga vām praty avartiṁ gamiṣṭhāhur viprāso aśvinā purājāḥ
Griffith: Have not the sages of old time, ye Asvins, called you most prompt to come and stay misfortune?
Devanāgarī: किमङ्ग वां प्रत्यवर्तिं गमिष्ठाहुर्विप्रासो अश्विना पुराजाः
pada pāṭha: suyuk-bhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | su-vr̥tā | rathena | dasrau | imam | śr̥ṇutam | ślokam | adreḥ || kim | aṅga | vām | prati | avartim | gamiṣṭhā | āhuḥ | viprāsaḥ | aśvinā | purā-jāḥ ||3.58.3||

IAST: ā manyethām ā gataṁ kac cid evair viśve janāso aśvinā havante
Griffith: Remember us, and come to us, for ever men, as their wont is, invocate the Asvins.
Devanāgarī: आ मन्येथामा गतं कच्चिदेवैर्विश्वे जनासो अश्विना हवन्ते
pada pāṭha: ā | manyethām | ā | gatam | kat | cit | evaiḥ | viśve | janāsaḥ | aśvinā | havante || imā | hi | vām | go-r̥jīkā | madhūni | pra | mitrāsaḥ | na | daduḥ | usraḥ | agre ||3.58.4||

IAST: imā hi vāṁ goṛjīkā madhūni pra mitrāso na dadur usro agre
Griffith: Friends as it were have offered you these juices, sweet, blent with milk at the first break of morning.
Devanāgarī: इमा हि वां गोऋजीका मधूनि प्र मित्रासो न ददुरुस्रो अग्रे
pada pāṭha: ā | manyethām | ā | gatam | kat | cit | evaiḥ | viśve | janāsaḥ | aśvinā | havante || imā | hi | vām | go-r̥jīkā | madhūni | pra | mitrāsaḥ | na | daduḥ | usraḥ | agre ||3.58.4||

IAST: tiraḥ purū cid aśvinā rajāṁsy āṅgūṣo vām maghavānā janeṣu
Griffith: Even through many regions, O ye Asvins high praise is yours among mankind, ye Mighty-
Devanāgarī: तिरः पुरू चिदश्विना रजांस्याङ्गूषो वां मघवाना जनेषु
pada pāṭha: tiraḥ | puru | cit | aśvinā | rajāṁsi | āṅgūṣaḥ | vām | magha-vānā | janeṣu || ā | iha | yātam | pathi-bhiḥ | deva-yānaiḥ | dasrau | ime | vām | ni-dhayaḥ | madhūnām ||3.58.5||

IAST: eha yātam pathibhir devayānair dasrāv ime vāṁ nidhayo madhūnām
Griffith: Come, helpers, on the paths which Gods have travelled: here your libations of sweet meath are ready.
Devanāgarī: एह यातं पथिभिर्देवयानैर्दस्राविमे वां निधयो मधूनाम्
pada pāṭha: tiraḥ | puru | cit | aśvinā | rajāṁsi | āṅgūṣaḥ | vām | magha-vānā | janeṣu || ā | iha | yātam | pathi-bhiḥ | deva-yānaiḥ | dasrau | ime | vām | ni-dhayaḥ | madhūnām ||3.58.5||

IAST: purāṇam okaḥ sakhyaṁ śivaṁ vāṁ yuvor narā draviṇaṁ jahnāvyām
Griffith: Ancient your home, auspicious is your friendship: Heroes, your wealth is with the house of Jahnu.
Devanāgarī: पुराणमोकः सख्यं शिवं वां युवोर्नरा द्रविणं जह्नाव्याम्
pada pāṭha: purāṇam | okaḥ | sakhyam | śivam | vām | yuvoḥ | narā | draviṇam | jahnāvyām || punariti | kr̥ṇvānāḥ | sakhyā | śivāni | madhvā | madema | saha | nu | samānāḥ ||3.58.6||

IAST: punaḥ kṛṇvānāḥ sakhyā śivāni madhvā madema saha nū samānāḥ
Griffith: Forming again with you auspicious friendship, let us rejoice with draughts of meath together.
Devanāgarī: पुनः कृण्वानाः सख्या शिवानि मध्वा मदेम सह नू समानाः
pada pāṭha: purāṇam | okaḥ | sakhyam | śivam | vām | yuvoḥ | narā | draviṇam | jahnāvyām || punariti | kr̥ṇvānāḥ | sakhyā | śivāni | madhvā | madema | saha | nu | samānāḥ ||3.58.6||

IAST: aśvinā vāyunā yuvaṁ sudakṣā niyudbhiṣ ca sajoṣasā yuvānā
Griffith: O Asvins, Very Mighty ones, with Vayu and with his steeds, one-minded, ever-youthful,
Devanāgarī: अश्विना वायुना युवं सुदक्षा नियुद्भिष्च सजोषसा युवाना
pada pāṭha: aśvinā | vāyunā | yuvam | su-dakṣā | niyut-bhiḥ | ca | sa-joṣasā | yuvānā || nāsatyā | tiraḥ-ahnyam | juṣāṇā | somam | pibatam | asridhā | sudānū iti su-dānū ||3.58.7||

IAST: nāsatyā tiroahnyaṁ juṣāṇā somam pibatam asridhā sudānū
Griffith: Nasatyas, joying in the third day's Soma, drink it, not hostile, Very Bounteous Givers.
Devanāgarī: नासत्या तिरोअह्न्यं जुषाणा सोमं पिबतमस्रिधा सुदानू
pada pāṭha: aśvinā | vāyunā | yuvam | su-dakṣā | niyut-bhiḥ | ca | sa-joṣasā | yuvānā || nāsatyā | tiraḥ-ahnyam | juṣāṇā | somam | pibatam | asridhā | sudānū iti su-dānū ||3.58.7||

IAST: aśvinā pari vām iṣaḥ purūcīr īyur gīrbhir yatamānā amṛdhrāḥ
Griffith: Asvins, to you are brought abundant viands in rivalry with sacred songs, unceasing.
Devanāgarī: अश्विना परि वामिषः पुरूचीरीयुर्गीर्भिर्यतमाना अमृध्राः
pada pāṭha: aśvinā | pari | vām | iṣaḥ | purūcīḥ | īyuḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | yatamānāḥ | amr̥dhrāḥ || rathaḥ | ha | vām | r̥ta-jāḥ | adri-jūtaḥ | pari | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | yāti | sadyaḥ ||3.58.8||

IAST: ratho ha vām ṛtajā adrijūtaḥ pari dyāvāpṛthivī yāti sadyaḥ
Griffith: Sprung from high Law your car, urged on by press-stones, goes round the earth and heaven in one brief moment.
Devanāgarī: रथो ह वामृतजा अद्रिजूतः परि द्यावापृथिवी याति सद्यः
pada pāṭha: aśvinā | pari | vām | iṣaḥ | purūcīḥ | īyuḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | yatamānāḥ | amr̥dhrāḥ || rathaḥ | ha | vām | r̥ta-jāḥ | adri-jūtaḥ | pari | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | yāti | sadyaḥ ||3.58.8||

IAST: aśvinā madhuṣuttamo yuvākuḥ somas tam pātam ā gataṁ duroṇe
Griffith: Asvins, your Soma sheds delicious sweetness: drink ye thereof and come unto our dwelling.
Devanāgarī: अश्विना मधुषुत्तमो युवाकुः सोमस्तं पातमा गतं दुरोणे
pada pāṭha: aśvinā | madhusut-tamaḥ | yuvākuḥ | somaḥ | tam | pātam | ā | gatam | duroṇe || rathaḥ | ha | vām | bhūri | varpaḥ | karikrat | suta-vataḥ | niḥ-kr̥tam | ā-gamiṣṭhaḥ ||3.58.9||

IAST: ratho ha vām bhūri varpaḥ karikrat sutāvato niṣkṛtam āgamiṣṭhaḥ
Griffith: Your car, assuming many a shape, most often goes to the Soma-presser's place of meeting.
Devanāgarī: रथो ह वां भूरि वर्पः करिक्रत्सुतावतो निष्कृतमागमिष्ठः
pada pāṭha: aśvinā | madhusut-tamaḥ | yuvākuḥ | somaḥ | tam | pātam | ā | gatam | duroṇe || rathaḥ | ha | vām | bhūri | varpaḥ | karikrat | suta-vataḥ | niḥ-kr̥tam | ā-gamiṣṭhaḥ ||3.58.9||

IAST: mitro janān yātayati bruvāṇo mitro dādhāra pṛthivīm uta dyām
Griffith: MITRA, when speaking, stirreth men to labour: Mitra sustaineth both the earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: मित्रो जनान्यातयति ब्रुवाणो मित्रो दाधार पृथिवीमुत द्याम्
pada pāṭha: mitraḥ | janān | yātayati | bruvāṇaḥ | mitraḥ | dādhāra | pr̥thivīm | uta | dyām || mitraḥ | kr̥ṣṭīḥ | ani-miṣā | abhi | caṣṭe | mitrāya | havyam | ghr̥ta-vat | juhota ||3.59.1||

IAST: mitraḥ kṛṣṭīr animiṣābhi caṣṭe mitrāya havyaṁ ghṛtavaj juhota
Griffith: Mitra beholdeth men with eyes that close not. To Mitra bring, with holy oil, oblation.
Devanāgarī: मित्रः कृष्टीरनिमिषाभि चष्टे मित्राय हव्यं घृतवज्जुहोत
pada pāṭha: mitraḥ | janān | yātayati | bruvāṇaḥ | mitraḥ | dādhāra | pr̥thivīm | uta | dyām || mitraḥ | kr̥ṣṭīḥ | ani-miṣā | abhi | caṣṭe | mitrāya | havyam | ghr̥ta-vat | juhota ||3.59.1||

IAST: pra sa mitra marto astu prayasvān yas ta āditya śikṣati vratena
Griffith: Foremost be he who brings thee food, O Mitra, who strives to keep thy sacred Law, Aditya.
Devanāgarī: प्र स मित्र मर्तो अस्तु प्रयस्वान्यस्त आदित्य शिक्षति व्रतेन
pada pāṭha: pra | saḥ | mitra | martaḥ | astu | prayasvān | yaḥ | te | āditya | śikṣati | vratena || na | hanyate | na | jīyate | tvā-ūtaḥ | na | enam | aṁhaḥ | aśnoti | antitaḥ | na | dūrāt ||3.59.2||

IAST: na hanyate na jīyate tvoto nainam aṁho aśnoty antito na dūrāt
Griffith: He whom thou helpest ne'er is slain or conquered, on him, from near or far, falls no affliction.
Devanāgarī: न हन्यते न जीयते त्वोतो नैनमंहो अश्नोत्यन्तितो न दूरात्
pada pāṭha: pra | saḥ | mitra | martaḥ | astu | prayasvān | yaḥ | te | āditya | śikṣati | vratena || na | hanyate | na | jīyate | tvā-ūtaḥ | na | enam | aṁhaḥ | aśnoti | antitaḥ | na | dūrāt ||3.59.2||

IAST: anamīvāsa iḻayā madanto mitajñavo varimann ā pṛthivyāḥ
Griffith: joying in sacred food and free from sickness, with knees bent lowly on the earth's broad surface,
Devanāgarī: अनमीवास इळया मदन्तो मितज्ञवो वरिमन्ना पृथिव्याः
pada pāṭha: anamīvāsaḥ | iḷayā | madantaḥ | mita-jñavaḥ | variman | ā | pr̥thivyāḥ || ādityasya | vratam | upa-kṣiyantaḥ | vayam | mitrasya | su-matau | syāma ||3.59.3||

IAST: ādityasya vratam upakṣiyanto vayam mitrasya sumatau syāma
Griffith: Following closely the Aditya's statute, may we remain in Mitra's gracious favour.
Devanāgarī: आदित्यस्य व्रतमुपक्षियन्तो वयं मित्रस्य सुमतौ स्याम
pada pāṭha: anamīvāsaḥ | iḷayā | madantaḥ | mita-jñavaḥ | variman | ā | pr̥thivyāḥ || ādityasya | vratam | upa-kṣiyantaḥ | vayam | mitrasya | su-matau | syāma ||3.59.3||

IAST: ayam mitro namasyaḥ suśevo rājā sukṣatro ajaniṣṭa vedhāḥ
Griffith: Auspicious and adorable, this Mitra was born with fair dominion, King, Disposer.
Devanāgarī: अयं मित्रो नमस्यः सुशेवो राजा सुक्षत्रो अजनिष्ट वेधाः
pada pāṭha: ayam | mitraḥ | namasyaḥ | su-śevaḥ | rājā | su-kṣatraḥ | ajaniṣṭa | vedhāḥ || tasya | vayam | su-matau | yajñiyasya | api | bhadre | saumanase | syāma ||3.59.4||

IAST: tasya vayaṁ sumatau yajñiyasyāpi bhadre saumanase syāma
Griffith: May we enjoy the grace of him the Holy, yea, rest in his propitious loving-kindness.
Devanāgarī: तस्य वयं सुमतौ यज्ञियस्यापि भद्रे सौमनसे स्याम
pada pāṭha: ayam | mitraḥ | namasyaḥ | su-śevaḥ | rājā | su-kṣatraḥ | ajaniṣṭa | vedhāḥ || tasya | vayam | su-matau | yajñiyasya | api | bhadre | saumanase | syāma ||3.59.4||

IAST: mahām̐ ādityo namasopasadyo yātayajjano gṛṇate suśevaḥ
Griffith: The great Aditya, to be served with wor. ship, who stirreth men, is gracious to the singer.
Devanāgarī: महाँ आदित्यो नमसोपसद्यो यातयज्जनो गृणते सुशेवः
pada pāṭha: mahān | ādityaḥ | namasā | upa-sadyaḥ | yātayat-janaḥ | gr̥ṇate | su-śevaḥ || tasmai | etat | panya-tamāya | juṣṭam | agnau | mitrāya | haviḥ | ā | juhota ||3.59.5||

IAST: tasmā etat panyatamāya juṣṭam agnau mitrāya havir ā juhota
Griffith: To Mitra, him most highly to be lauded, offer in fire oblation that he loveth.
Devanāgarī: तस्मा एतत्पन्यतमाय जुष्टमग्नौ मित्राय हविरा जुहोत
pada pāṭha: mahān | ādityaḥ | namasā | upa-sadyaḥ | yātayat-janaḥ | gr̥ṇate | su-śevaḥ || tasmai | etat | panya-tamāya | juṣṭam | agnau | mitrāya | haviḥ | ā | juhota ||3.59.5||

IAST: mitrasya carṣaṇīdhṛto 'vo devasya sānasi
Griffith: The gainful grace of Mitra,. God, supporter of the race of man,
Devanāgarī: मित्रस्य चर्षणीधृतोऽवो देवस्य सानसि
pada pāṭha: mitrasya | carṣaṇi-dhr̥taḥ | avaḥ | devasya | sānasi || dyumnam | citraśravaḥ-tamam ||3.59.6||

IAST: dyumnaṁ citraśravastamam
Griffith: Gives splendour of most.glorious fame.
Devanāgarī: द्युम्नं चित्रश्रवस्तमम्
pada pāṭha: mitrasya | carṣaṇi-dhr̥taḥ | avaḥ | devasya | sānasi || dyumnam | citraśravaḥ-tamam ||3.59.6||

IAST: abhi yo mahinā divam mitro babhūva saprathāḥ
Griffith: Mitra whose glory spreads afar, he who in might surpasses heaven,
Devanāgarī: अभि यो महिना दिवं मित्रो बभूव सप्रथाः
pada pāṭha: abhi | yaḥ | mahinā | divam | mitraḥ | babhūva | sa-prathāḥ || abhi | śravaḥ-bhiḥ | pr̥thivīm ||3.59.7||

IAST: abhi śravobhiḥ pṛthivīm
Griffith: Surpasses earth in his renown.
Devanāgarī: अभि श्रवोभिः पृथिवीम्
pada pāṭha: abhi | yaḥ | mahinā | divam | mitraḥ | babhūva | sa-prathāḥ || abhi | śravaḥ-bhiḥ | pr̥thivīm ||3.59.7||

IAST: mitrāya pañca yemire janā abhiṣṭiśavase
Griffith: All the Five Races have repaired to Mitra, ever strong to aid,
Devanāgarī: मित्राय पञ्च येमिरे जना अभिष्टिशवसे
pada pāṭha: mitrāya | pañca | yemire | janāḥ | abhiṣṭi-śavase || saḥ | devān | viśvān | bibharti ||3.59.8||

IAST: sa devān viśvān bibharti
Griffith: For he sustaineth all the Gods.
Devanāgarī: स देवान्विश्वान्बिभर्ति
pada pāṭha: mitrāya | pañca | yemire | janāḥ | abhiṣṭi-śavase || saḥ | devān | viśvān | bibharti ||3.59.8||

IAST: mitro deveṣv āyuṣu janāya vṛktabarhiṣe
Griffith: Mitra to Gods, to living men, to him who strews the holy grass,
Devanāgarī: मित्रो देवेष्वायुषु जनाय वृक्तबर्हिषे
pada pāṭha: mitraḥ | deveṣu | āyuṣu | janāya | vr̥kta-barhiṣe || iṣaḥ | iṣṭa-vratāḥ | akarityakaḥ ||3.59.9||

IAST: iṣa iṣṭavratā akaḥ
Griffith: Gives food fulfilling sacred Law.
Devanāgarī: इष इष्टव्रता अकः
pada pāṭha: mitraḥ | deveṣu | āyuṣu | janāya | vr̥kta-barhiṣe || iṣaḥ | iṣṭa-vratāḥ | akarityakaḥ ||3.59.9||

IAST: iheha vo manasā bandhutā nara uśijo jagmur abhi tāni vedasā
Griffith: HERE is your ghostly kinship, here, O Men: they came desirous to these holy rites with store of wealth,
Devanāgarī: इहेह वो मनसा बन्धुता नर उशिजो जग्मुरभि तानि वेदसा
pada pāṭha: iha-iha | vaḥ | manasā | bandhutā | naraḥ | uśijaḥ | jagmuḥ | abhi | tāni | vedasā || yābhiḥ | māyābhiḥ | pratijūti-varpasaḥ | saudhanvanāḥ | yajñiyam | bhāgam | ānaśa ||3.60.1||

IAST: yābhir māyābhiḥ pratijūtivarpasaḥ saudhanvanā yajñiyam bhāgam ānaśa
Griffith: With wondrous arts, whereby, with schemes to meet each need, Ye gained, Sudhanvan's Sons! your share in sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: याभिर्मायाभिः प्रतिजूतिवर्पसः सौधन्वना यज्ञियं भागमानश
pada pāṭha: iha-iha | vaḥ | manasā | bandhutā | naraḥ | uśijaḥ | jagmuḥ | abhi | tāni | vedasā || yābhiḥ | māyābhiḥ | pratijūti-varpasaḥ | saudhanvanāḥ | yajñiyam | bhāgam | ānaśa ||3.60.1||

IAST: yābhiḥ śacībhiś camasām̐ apiṁśata yayā dhiyā gām ariṇīta carmaṇaḥ
Griffith: The mighty powers wherewith. ye formed the chalices, the thought by which ye drew the cow from out the hide,
Devanāgarī: याभिः शचीभिश्चमसाँ अपिंशत यया धिया गामरिणीत चर्मणः
pada pāṭha: yābhiḥ | śacībhiḥ | camasān | apiṁśata | yayā | dhiyā | gām | ariṇīta | carmaṇaḥ || yena | harī iti | manasā | niḥ-atakṣata | tena | deva-tvam | r̥bhavaḥ | sam | ānaśa ||3.60.2||

IAST: yena harī manasā niratakṣata tena devatvam ṛbhavaḥ sam ānaśa
Griffith: The intellect wherewith ye wrought the two Bay Steeds,-through these, O Rbhus, ye attained divinity.
Devanāgarī: येन हरी मनसा निरतक्षत तेन देवत्वमृभवः समानश
pada pāṭha: yābhiḥ | śacībhiḥ | camasān | apiṁśata | yayā | dhiyā | gām | ariṇīta | carmaṇaḥ || yena | harī iti | manasā | niḥ-atakṣata | tena | deva-tvam | r̥bhavaḥ | sam | ānaśa ||3.60.2||

IAST: indrasya sakhyam ṛbhavaḥ sam ānaśur manor napāto apaso dadhanvire
Griffith: Friendship with Indra have the Rbhus, fully gained: grandsons of Manu, they skilfully urged the work.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रस्य सख्यमृभवः समानशुर्मनोर्नपातो अपसो दधन्विरे
pada pāṭha: indrasya | sakhyam | r̥bhavaḥ | sam | ānaśuḥ | manoḥ | napātaḥ | apasaḥ | dadhanvire || saudhanvanāsaḥ | amr̥ta-tvam | ā | īrire | viṣṭvī | śamībhiḥ | su-kr̥taḥ | su-kr̥tyayā ||3.60.3||

IAST: saudhanvanāso amṛtatvam erire viṣṭvī śamībhiḥ sukṛtaḥ sukṛtyayā
Griffith: Sudhanvan's Children won them everlasting life, serving with holy rites, pious with noble acts.
Devanāgarī: सौधन्वनासो अमृतत्वमेरिरे विष्ट्वी शमीभिः सुकृतः सुकृत्यया
pada pāṭha: indrasya | sakhyam | r̥bhavaḥ | sam | ānaśuḥ | manoḥ | napātaḥ | apasaḥ | dadhanvire || saudhanvanāsaḥ | amr̥ta-tvam | ā | īrire | viṣṭvī | śamībhiḥ | su-kr̥taḥ | su-kr̥tyayā ||3.60.3||

IAST: indreṇa yātha sarathaṁ sute sacām̐ atho vaśānām bhavathā saha śriyā
Griffith: In company with Indra come ye to the juice, then gloriously shall your wishes be fulfilled.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रेण याथ सरथं सुते सचाँ अथो वशानां भवथा सह श्रिया
pada pāṭha: indreṇa | yātha | sa-ratham | sute | sacā | atho iti | vaśānām | bhavatha | saha | śriyā || na | vaḥ | prati-mai | su-kr̥tāni | vāghataḥ | saudhanvanāḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | vīryāṇi | ca ||3.60.4||

IAST: na vaḥ pratimai sukṛtāni vāghataḥ saudhanvanā ṛbhavo vīryāṇi ca
Griffith: Not to be paragoned, ye Priests, are your good deeds, nor your heroic acts, Rbhus, Sudhanvan's Sons.
Devanāgarī: न वः प्रतिमै सुकृतानि वाघतः सौधन्वना ऋभवो वीर्याणि च
pada pāṭha: indreṇa | yātha | sa-ratham | sute | sacā | atho iti | vaśānām | bhavatha | saha | śriyā || na | vaḥ | prati-mai | su-kr̥tāni | vāghataḥ | saudhanvanāḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | vīryāṇi | ca ||3.60.4||

IAST: indra ṛbhubhir vājavadbhiḥ samukṣitaṁ sutaṁ somam ā vṛṣasvā gabhastyoḥ
Griffith: O Indra, with the Rbhus, Mighty Ones, pour down the Soma juice effused, well-blent, from both thy hands.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र ऋभुभिर्वाजवद्भिः समुक्षितं सुतं सोममा वृषस्वा गभस्त्योः
pada pāṭha: indra | r̥bhu-bhiḥ | vājavat-bhiḥ | sam-ukṣitam | sutam | somam | ā | vr̥ṣasva | gabhastyoḥ || dhiyā | iṣitaḥ | magha-van | dāśuṣaḥ | gr̥he | saudhanvanebhiḥ | saha | matsva | nr̥-bhiḥ ||3.60.5||

IAST: dhiyeṣito maghavan dāśuṣo gṛhe saudhanvanebhiḥ saha matsvā nṛbhiḥ
Griffith: Maghalan, urged by song, in the drink-offerer's house rejoice thee with the Heroes, with Sudhanvan's Sons.
Devanāgarī: धियेषितो मघवन्दाशुषो गृहे सौधन्वनेभिः सह मत्स्वा नृभिः
pada pāṭha: indra | r̥bhu-bhiḥ | vājavat-bhiḥ | sam-ukṣitam | sutam | somam | ā | vr̥ṣasva | gabhastyoḥ || dhiyā | iṣitaḥ | magha-van | dāśuṣaḥ | gr̥he | saudhanvanebhiḥ | saha | matsva | nr̥-bhiḥ ||3.60.5||

IAST: indra ṛbhumān vājavān matsveha no 'smin savane śacyā puruṣṭuta
Griffith: With Rbhu near, and Vaja, Indra, here exult, with Saci, praised of many, in the juice we pour.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र ऋभुमान्वाजवान्मत्स्वेह नोऽस्मिन्सवने शच्या पुरुष्टुत
pada pāṭha: indra | r̥bhu-mān | vāja-vān | matsva | iha | naḥ | asmin | savane | śacyā | puru-stuta || imāni | tubhyam | svasarāṇi | yemire | vratā | devānām | manuṣaḥ | ca | dharma-bhiḥ ||3.60.6||

IAST: imāni tubhyaṁ svasarāṇi yemire vratā devānām manuṣaś ca dharmabhiḥ
Griffith: These homes wherein we dwell have turned themselves to thee, -devotions to the Gods, as laws of men ordain.
Devanāgarī: इमानि तुभ्यं स्वसराणि येमिरे व्रता देवानां मनुषश्च धर्मभिः
pada pāṭha: indra | r̥bhu-mān | vāja-vān | matsva | iha | naḥ | asmin | savane | śacyā | puru-stuta || imāni | tubhyam | svasarāṇi | yemire | vratā | devānām | manuṣaḥ | ca | dharma-bhiḥ ||3.60.6||

IAST: indra ṛbhubhir vājibhir vājayann iha stomaṁ jaritur upa yāhi yajñiyam
Griffith: Come with the mighty Rbhus, Indra, come to us, strengthening with thy help the singer's holy praise;
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र ऋभुभिर्वाजिभिर्वाजयन्निह स्तोमं जरितुरुप याहि यज्ञियम्
pada pāṭha: indra | r̥bhu-bhiḥ | vāji-bhiḥ | vājayan | iha | stomam | jarituḥ | upa | yāhi | yajñiyam || śatam | ketebhiḥ | iṣirebhiḥ | āyave | sahasra-nīthaḥ | adhvarasya | homani ||3.60.7||

IAST: śataṁ ketebhir iṣirebhir āyave sahasraṇītho adhvarasya homani
Griffith: At hundred eager calls come to the living man, with thousand arts attend the act of sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: शतं केतेभिरिषिरेभिरायवे सहस्रणीथो अध्वरस्य होमनि
pada pāṭha: indra | r̥bhu-bhiḥ | vāji-bhiḥ | vājayan | iha | stomam | jarituḥ | upa | yāhi | yajñiyam || śatam | ketebhiḥ | iṣirebhiḥ | āyave | sahasra-nīthaḥ | adhvarasya | homani ||3.60.7||

IAST: uṣo vājena vājini pracetāḥ stomaṁ juṣasva gṛṇato maghoni
Griffith: O Usas, strong with strength, endowed witli knowledge, accept the singer's praise, O wealthy Lady.
Devanāgarī: उषो वाजेन वाजिनि प्रचेताः स्तोमं जुषस्व गृणतो मघोनि
pada pāṭha: uṣaḥ | vājena | vājini | pra-cetāḥ | stomam | juṣasva | gr̥ṇataḥ | maghoni || purāṇī | devi | yuvatiḥ | puram-dhiḥ | anu | vratam | carasi | viśva-vāre ||3.61.1||

IAST: purāṇī devi yuvatiḥ puraṁdhir anu vrataṁ carasi viśvavāre
Griffith: Thou, Goddess, ancient, young, and full of wisdom, movest, all-bounteous! as the Law ordaineth.
Devanāgarī: पुराणी देवि युवतिः पुरंधिरनु व्रतं चरसि विश्ववारे
pada pāṭha: uṣaḥ | vājena | vājini | pra-cetāḥ | stomam | juṣasva | gr̥ṇataḥ | maghoni || purāṇī | devi | yuvatiḥ | puram-dhiḥ | anu | vratam | carasi | viśva-vāre ||3.61.1||

IAST: uṣo devy amartyā vi bhāhi candrarathā sūnṛtā īrayantī
Griffith: Shine forth, O Morning, thou auspicious Goddess, on thy bright car awaking pleasant voices.
Devanāgarī: उषो देव्यमर्त्या वि भाहि चन्द्ररथा सूनृता ईरयन्ती
pada pāṭha: uṣaḥ | devi | amartyā | vi | bhāhi | candra-rathā | sūnr̥tāḥ | īrayantī || ā | tvā | vahantu | su-yamāsaḥ | aśvāḥ | hiraṇya-varṇām | pr̥thu-pājasaḥ | ye ||3.61.2||

IAST: ā tvā vahantu suyamāso aśvā hiraṇyavarṇām pṛthupājaso ye
Griffith: Let docile horses of far-reaching splendour convey thee hitherward, the goldencoloured.
Devanāgarī: आ त्वा वहन्तु सुयमासो अश्वा हिरण्यवर्णां पृथुपाजसो ये
pada pāṭha: uṣaḥ | devi | amartyā | vi | bhāhi | candra-rathā | sūnr̥tāḥ | īrayantī || ā | tvā | vahantu | su-yamāsaḥ | aśvāḥ | hiraṇya-varṇām | pr̥thu-pājasaḥ | ye ||3.61.2||

IAST: uṣaḥ pratīcī bhuvanāni viśvordhvā tiṣṭhasy amṛtasya ketuḥ
Griffith: Thou, Morning, turning thee to every creature, standest on high as ensign of the Immortal,
Devanāgarī: उषः प्रतीची भुवनानि विश्वोर्ध्वा तिष्ठस्यमृतस्य केतुः
pada pāṭha: uṣaḥ | pratīcī | bhuvanāni | viśvā | ūrdhvā | tiṣṭhasi | amr̥tasya | ketuḥ || samānam | artham | caraṇīyamānā | cakram-iva | navyasi | ā | vavr̥tsva ||3.61.3||

IAST: samānam arthaṁ caraṇīyamānā cakram iva navyasy ā vavṛtsva
Griffith: To one same goal ever and ever wending now, like a wheel, O newly-born, roll hi ther.
Devanāgarī: समानमर्थं चरणीयमाना चक्रमिव नव्यस्या ववृत्स्व
pada pāṭha: uṣaḥ | pratīcī | bhuvanāni | viśvā | ūrdhvā | tiṣṭhasi | amr̥tasya | ketuḥ || samānam | artham | caraṇīyamānā | cakram-iva | navyasi | ā | vavr̥tsva ||3.61.3||

IAST: ava syūmeva cinvatī maghony uṣā yāti svasarasya patnī
Griffith: Letting her reins drop downward, Morning cometh, the wealthy Dame, the Lady of the dwelling;
Devanāgarī: अव स्यूमेव चिन्वती मघोन्युषा याति स्वसरस्य पत्नी
pada pāṭha: ava | syūma-iva | cinvatī | maghonī | uṣāḥ | yāti | svasarasya | patnī || svaḥ | janantī | su-bhagā | su-daṁsāḥ | ā | antāt | divaḥ | paprathe | ā | pr̥thivyāḥ ||3.61.4||

IAST: svar janantī subhagā sudaṁsā āntād divaḥ papratha ā pṛthivyāḥ
Griffith: Bringing forth light, the Wonderful, the Blessed hath spread her from the bounds of earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: स्वर्जनन्ती सुभगा सुदंसा आन्ताद्दिवः पप्रथ आ पृथिव्याः
pada pāṭha: ava | syūma-iva | cinvatī | maghonī | uṣāḥ | yāti | svasarasya | patnī || svaḥ | janantī | su-bhagā | su-daṁsāḥ | ā | antāt | divaḥ | paprathe | ā | pr̥thivyāḥ ||3.61.4||

IAST: acchā vo devīm uṣasaṁ vibhātīm pra vo bharadhvaṁ namasā suvṛktim
Griffith: Hither invoke the radiant Goddess Morning, and bring with reverence your hymn to praise her.
Devanāgarī: अच्छा वो देवीमुषसं विभातीं प्र वो भरध्वं नमसा सुवृक्तिम्
pada pāṭha: accha | vaḥ | devīm | uṣasam | vi-bhātīm | pra | vaḥ | bharadhvam | namasā | su-vr̥ktim || ūrdhvam | madhudhā | divi | pājaḥ | aśret | pra | rocanā | ruruce | raṇva-saṁdr̥k ||3.61.5||

IAST: ūrdhvam madhudhā divi pājo aśret pra rocanā ruruce raṇvasaṁdṛk
Griffith: She, dropping sweets, hath set in heaven her brightness, and, fair to look on, hath beamed forth her splendour.
Devanāgarī: ऊर्ध्वं मधुधा दिवि पाजो अश्रेत्प्र रोचना रुरुचे रण्वसंदृक्
pada pāṭha: accha | vaḥ | devīm | uṣasam | vi-bhātīm | pra | vaḥ | bharadhvam | namasā | su-vr̥ktim || ūrdhvam | madhudhā | divi | pājaḥ | aśret | pra | rocanā | ruruce | raṇva-saṁdr̥k ||3.61.5||

IAST: ṛtāvarī divo arkair abodhy ā revatī rodasī citram asthāt
Griffith: From heaven, with hymns, the Holy One was wakened: brightly to both worlds came the wealthy Lady.
Devanāgarī: ऋतावरी दिवो अर्कैरबोध्या रेवती रोदसी चित्रमस्थात्
pada pāṭha: r̥ta-varī | divaḥ | arkaiḥ | abodhi | ā | revatī | rodasī iti | citram | āsthāt || ā-yatīm | agne | uṣasam | vi-bhātīm | vāmam | eṣi | draviṇam | bhikṣamāṇaḥ ||3.61.6||

IAST: āyatīm agna uṣasaṁ vibhātīṁ vāmam eṣi draviṇam bhikṣamāṇaḥ
Griffith: To Morning, Agni, when she comes refulgent, thou goest forth soliciting fair riches.
Devanāgarī: आयतीमग्न उषसं विभातीं वाममेषि द्रविणं भिक्षमाणः
pada pāṭha: r̥ta-varī | divaḥ | arkaiḥ | abodhi | ā | revatī | rodasī iti | citram | āsthāt || ā-yatīm | agne | uṣasam | vi-bhātīm | vāmam | eṣi | draviṇam | bhikṣamāṇaḥ ||3.61.6||

IAST: ṛtasya budhna uṣasām iṣaṇyan vṛṣā mahī rodasī ā viveśa
Griffith: On Law's firm base the speeder of the Mornings, the Bull, hath entered mighty earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य बुध्न उषसामिषण्यन्वृषा मही रोदसी आ विवेश
pada pāṭha: r̥tasya | budhne | uṣasām | iṣaṇyan | vr̥ṣā | mahī iti | rodasī iti | ā | viveśa || mahī | mitrasya | varuṇasya | māyā | candrā-iva | bhānum | vi | dadhe | puru-trā ||3.61.7||

IAST: mahī mitrasya varuṇasya māyā candreva bhānuṁ vi dadhe purutrā
Griffith: Great is the power of Varuna and Mitra, which, bright, hath spread in every place its splendour.
Devanāgarī: मही मित्रस्य वरुणस्य माया चन्द्रेव भानुं वि दधे पुरुत्रा
pada pāṭha: r̥tasya | budhne | uṣasām | iṣaṇyan | vr̥ṣā | mahī iti | rodasī iti | ā | viveśa || mahī | mitrasya | varuṇasya | māyā | candrā-iva | bhānum | vi | dadhe | puru-trā ||3.61.7||

IAST: imā u vām bhṛmayo manyamānā yuvāvate na tujyā abhūvan
Griffith: YOUR well-known prompt activities aforetime needed no impulse from your faithful servant.
Devanāgarī: इमा उ वां भृमयो मन्यमाना युवावते न तुज्या अभूवन्
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | ūm̐ iti | vām | bhr̥mayaḥ | manyamānāḥ | yuvā-vate | na | tujyāḥ | abhūvan || kva | tyat | indrāvaruṇā | yaśaḥ | vām | yena | sma | sinam | bharathaḥ | sakhi-bhyaḥ ||3.62.1||

IAST: kva tyad indrāvaruṇā yaśo vāṁ yena smā sinam bharathaḥ sakhibhyaḥ
Griffith: Where, Indra-Varuna, is now that glory wherewith ye brought support to those who loved you?
Devanāgarī: क्व त्यदिन्द्रावरुणा यशो वां येन स्मा सिनं भरथः सखिभ्यः
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | ūm̐ iti | vām | bhr̥mayaḥ | manyamānāḥ | yuvā-vate | na | tujyāḥ | abhūvan || kva | tyat | indrāvaruṇā | yaśaḥ | vām | yena | sma | sinam | bharathaḥ | sakhi-bhyaḥ ||3.62.1||

IAST: ayam u vām purutamo rayīyañ chaśvattamam avase johavīti
Griffith: This man, most diligent, seeking after riches, incessantly invokes you for your favour.
Devanāgarī: अयमु वां पुरुतमो रयीयञ्छश्वत्तममवसे जोहवीति
pada pāṭha: ayam | ūm̐ iti | vām | puru-tamaḥ | rayi-yan | śaśvat-tamam | avase | johavīti || sa-joṣau | indrāvaruṇā | marut-bhiḥ | divā | pr̥thivyā | śr̥ṇutam | havam | me ||3.62.2||

IAST: sajoṣāv indrāvaruṇā marudbhir divā pṛthivyā śṛṇutaṁ havam me
Griffith: Accordant, Indra-Varuna, with Maruts, with Heaven and Earth, hear ye mine invocation.
Devanāgarī: सजोषाविन्द्रावरुणा मरुद्भिर्दिवा पृथिव्या शृणुतं हवं मे
pada pāṭha: ayam | ūm̐ iti | vām | puru-tamaḥ | rayi-yan | śaśvat-tamam | avase | johavīti || sa-joṣau | indrāvaruṇā | marut-bhiḥ | divā | pr̥thivyā | śr̥ṇutam | havam | me ||3.62.2||

IAST: asme tad indrāvaruṇā vasu ṣyād asme rayir marutaḥ sarvavīraḥ
Griffith: O Indra-Varuna, ours be this treasure ours be wealth, Maruts, with full store of heroes.
Devanāgarī: अस्मे तदिन्द्रावरुणा वसु ष्यादस्मे रयिर्मरुतः सर्ववीरः
pada pāṭha: asme iti | tat | indrāvaruṇā | vasu | syāt | asme iti | rayiḥ | marutaḥ | sarva-vīraḥ || asmān | varūtrīḥ | śaraṇaiḥ | avantu | asmān | hotrā | bhāratī | dakṣiṇābhiḥ ||3.62.3||

IAST: asmān varūtrīḥ śaraṇair avantv asmān hotrā bhāratī dakṣiṇābhiḥ
Griffith: May the Varutris with their shelter aid us, and Bharati and Hotri with the Mornings.
Devanāgarī: अस्मान्वरूत्रीः शरणैरवन्त्वस्मान्होत्रा भारती दक्षिणाभिः
pada pāṭha: asme iti | tat | indrāvaruṇā | vasu | syāt | asme iti | rayiḥ | marutaḥ | sarva-vīraḥ || asmān | varūtrīḥ | śaraṇaiḥ | avantu | asmān | hotrā | bhāratī | dakṣiṇābhiḥ ||3.62.3||

IAST: bṛhaspate juṣasva no havyāni viśvadevya
Griffith: Be pleased! with our oblations, thou loved of all Gods, Brhaspati:
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पते जुषस्व नो हव्यानि विश्वदेव्य
pada pāṭha: br̥haspate | juṣasva | naḥ | havyāni | viśva-devya || rāsva | ratnāni | dāśuṣe ||3.62.4||

IAST: rāsva ratnāni dāśuṣe
Griffith: Give wealth to him who brings thee gifts.
Devanāgarī: रास्व रत्नानि दाशुषे
pada pāṭha: br̥haspate | juṣasva | naḥ | havyāni | viśva-devya || rāsva | ratnāni | dāśuṣe ||3.62.4||

IAST: śucim arkair bṛhaspatim adhvareṣu namasyata
Griffith: At sacrifices, with your hymns worship the pure Brhaspati-
Devanāgarī: शुचिमर्कैर्बृहस्पतिमध्वरेषु नमस्यत
pada pāṭha: śucim | arkaiḥ | br̥haspatim | adhvareṣu | namasyata || anāmi | ojaḥ | ā | cake ||3.62.5||

IAST: anāmy oja ā cake
Griffith: I pray for power which none may bend-
Devanāgarī: अनाम्योज आ चके
pada pāṭha: śucim | arkaiḥ | br̥haspatim | adhvareṣu | namasyata || anāmi | ojaḥ | ā | cake ||3.62.5||

IAST: vṛṣabhaṁ carṣaṇīnāṁ viśvarūpam adābhyam
Griffith: The Bull of men, whom none deceive, the wearer of each shape at will,
Devanāgarī: वृषभं चर्षणीनां विश्वरूपमदाभ्यम्
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣabham | carṣaṇīnām | viśva-rūpam | adābhyam || br̥haspatim | vareṇyam ||3.62.6||

IAST: bṛhaspatiṁ vareṇyam
Griffith: Brhaspati Most Excellent.
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पतिं वरेण्यम्
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣabham | carṣaṇīnām | viśva-rūpam | adābhyam || br̥haspatim | vareṇyam ||3.62.6||

IAST: iyaṁ te pūṣann āghṛṇe suṣṭutir deva navyasī
Griffith: Divine, resplendent Pusan, this our newest hymn of eulogy,
Devanāgarī: इयं ते पूषन्नाघृणे सुष्टुतिर्देव नव्यसी
pada pāṭha: iyam | te | pūṣan | āghr̥ṇe | su-stutiḥ | deva | navyasī || asmābhiḥ | tubhyam | śasyate ||3.62.7||

IAST: asmābhis tubhyaṁ śasyate
Griffith: By us is chanted forth to thee.
Devanāgarī: अस्माभिस्तुभ्यं शस्यते
pada pāṭha: iyam | te | pūṣan | āghr̥ṇe | su-stutiḥ | deva | navyasī || asmābhiḥ | tubhyam | śasyate ||3.62.7||

IAST: tāṁ juṣasva giram mama vājayantīm avā dhiyam
Griffith: Accept with favour this my song, be gracious to the earnest thought,
Devanāgarī: तां जुषस्व गिरं मम वाजयन्तीमवा धियम्
pada pāṭha: tām | juṣasva | giram | mama | vāja-yantīm | ava | dhiyam || vadhūyuḥ-iva | yoṣaṇām ||3.62.8||

IAST: vadhūyur iva yoṣaṇām
Griffith: Even as a bridegroom to his bride.
Devanāgarī: वधूयुरिव योषणाम्
pada pāṭha: tām | juṣasva | giram | mama | vāja-yantīm | ava | dhiyam || vadhūyuḥ-iva | yoṣaṇām ||3.62.8||

IAST: yo viśvābhi vipaśyati bhuvanā saṁ ca paśyati
Griffith: May he who sees all living things, see, them together at a glancc,-
Devanāgarī: यो विश्वाभि विपश्यति भुवना सं च पश्यति
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | viśvā | abhi | vi-paśyati | bhuvanā | sam | ca | paśyati || saḥ | naḥ | pūṣā | avitā | bhuvat ||3.62.9||

IAST: sa naḥ pūṣāvitā bhuvat
Griffith: May lie, may Pusan be our help.
Devanāgarī: स नः पूषाविता भुवत्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | viśvā | abhi | vi-paśyati | bhuvanā | sam | ca | paśyati || saḥ | naḥ | pūṣā | avitā | bhuvat ||3.62.9||

IAST: tat savitur vareṇyam bhargo devasya dhīmahi
Griffith: May we attain that excellent glory of Savitar the God:
Devanāgarī: तत्सवितुर्वरेण्यं भर्गो देवस्य धीमहि
pada pāṭha: tat | savituḥ | vareṇyam | bhargaḥ | devasya | dhīmahi || dhiyaḥ | yaḥ | naḥ | pra-codayāt ||3.62.10||

IAST: dhiyo yo naḥ pracodayāt
Griffith: So May he stimulate our prayers.
Devanāgarī: धियो यो नः प्रचोदयात्
pada pāṭha: tat | savituḥ | vareṇyam | bhargaḥ | devasya | dhīmahi || dhiyaḥ | yaḥ | naḥ | pra-codayāt ||3.62.10||

IAST: devasya savitur vayaṁ vājayantaḥ puraṁdhyā
Griffith: With understanding, earnestly, of Savitar the God we crave
Devanāgarī: देवस्य सवितुर्वयं वाजयन्तः पुरंध्या
pada pāṭha: devasya | savituḥ | vayam | vāja-yantaḥ | puram-dhyā || bhagasya | rātim | īmahe ||3.62.11||

IAST: bhagasya rātim īmahe
Griffith: Our portion of prosperity.
Devanāgarī: भगस्य रातिमीमहे
pada pāṭha: devasya | savituḥ | vayam | vāja-yantaḥ | puram-dhyā || bhagasya | rātim | īmahe ||3.62.11||

IAST: devaṁ naraḥ savitāraṁ viprā yajñaiḥ suvṛktibhiḥ
Griffith: Men, singers worship Savitar the God with hymn and holy rites,
Devanāgarī: देवं नरः सवितारं विप्रा यज्ञैः सुवृक्तिभिः
pada pāṭha: devam | naraḥ | savitāram | viprāḥ | yajñaiḥ | suvr̥kti-bhiḥ || namasyanti | dhiyā | iṣitāḥ ||3.62.12||

IAST: namasyanti dhiyeṣitāḥ
Griffith: Urged by the impulse of their thoughts.
Devanāgarī: नमस्यन्ति धियेषिताः
pada pāṭha: devam | naraḥ | savitāram | viprāḥ | yajñaiḥ | suvr̥kti-bhiḥ || namasyanti | dhiyā | iṣitāḥ ||3.62.12||

IAST: somo jigāti gātuvid devānām eti niṣkṛtam
Griffith: Soma who gives success goes forth, goes to the gathering place of Gods,
Devanāgarī: सोमो जिगाति गातुविद्देवानामेति निष्कृतम्
pada pāṭha: somaḥ | jigāti | gātu-vit | devānām | eti | niḥ-kr̥tam || r̥tasya | yonim | ā-sadam ||3.62.13||

IAST: ṛtasya yonim āsadam
Griffith: To seat him at the seat of Law.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य योनिमासदम्
pada pāṭha: somaḥ | jigāti | gātu-vit | devānām | eti | niḥ-kr̥tam || r̥tasya | yonim | ā-sadam ||3.62.13||

IAST: somo asmabhyaṁ dvipade catuṣpade ca paśave
Griffith: To us and to our cattle may Soma give salutary food,
Devanāgarī: सोमो अस्मभ्यं द्विपदे चतुष्पदे च पशवे
pada pāṭha: somaḥ | asmabhyam | dvi-pade | catuḥ-pade | ca | paśave || anamīvāḥ | iṣaḥ | karat ||3.62.14||

IAST: anamīvā iṣas karat
Griffith: To biped and to quadruped.
Devanāgarī: अनमीवा इषस्करत्
pada pāṭha: somaḥ | asmabhyam | dvi-pade | catuḥ-pade | ca | paśave || anamīvāḥ | iṣaḥ | karat ||3.62.14||

IAST: asmākam āyur vardhayann abhimātīḥ sahamānaḥ
Griffith: May Soma, strengthening our power of life, and conquering our foes,
Devanāgarī: अस्माकमायुर्वर्धयन्नभिमातीः सहमानः
pada pāṭha: asmākam | āyuḥ | vardhayan | abhi-mātīḥ | sahamānaḥ || somaḥ | sadha-stham | ā | asadat ||3.62.15||

IAST: somaḥ sadhastham āsadat
Griffith: In our assembly take his seat.
Devanāgarī: सोमः सधस्थमासदत्
pada pāṭha: asmākam | āyuḥ | vardhayan | abhi-mātīḥ | sahamānaḥ || somaḥ | sadha-stham | ā | asadat ||3.62.15||

IAST: ā no mitrāvaruṇā ghṛtair gavyūtim ukṣatam
Griffith: May Mitra-Varuna, sapient Pair, bedew our pasturage with oil,
Devanāgarī: आ नो मित्रावरुणा घृतैर्गव्यूतिमुक्षतम्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | ghr̥taiḥ | gavyūtim | ukṣatam || madhvā | rajāṁsi | sukratū iti su-kratū ||3.62.16||

IAST: madhvā rajāṁsi sukratū
Griffith: With meatb the regions of the air.
Devanāgarī: मध्वा रजांसि सुक्रतू
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | ghr̥taiḥ | gavyūtim | ukṣatam || madhvā | rajāṁsi | sukratū iti su-kratū ||3.62.16||

IAST: uruśaṁsā namovṛdhā mahnā dakṣasya rājathaḥ
Griffith: Far-ruling, joyful when adored, ye reign through majesty of might,
Devanāgarī: उरुशंसा नमोवृधा मह्ना दक्षस्य राजथः
pada pāṭha: uru-śaṁsā | namaḥ-vr̥dhā | mahnā | dakṣasya | rājathaḥ || drāghiṣṭhābhiḥ | śuci-vratā ||3.62.17||

IAST: drāghiṣṭhābhiḥ śucivratā
Griffith: With pure laws everlastingly.
Devanāgarī: द्राघिष्ठाभिः शुचिव्रता
pada pāṭha: uru-śaṁsā | namaḥ-vr̥dhā | mahnā | dakṣasya | rājathaḥ || drāghiṣṭhābhiḥ | śuci-vratā ||3.62.17||

IAST: gṛṇānā jamadagninā yonāv ṛtasya sīdatam
Griffith: Lauded by Jamadagni's song, sit in the place of holy Law:
Devanāgarī: गृणाना जमदग्निना योनावृतस्य सीदतम्
pada pāṭha: gr̥ṇānā | jamat-agninā | yonau | r̥tasya | sīdatam || pātam | somam | r̥ta-vr̥dhā ||3.62.18||

IAST: pātaṁ somam ṛtāvṛdhā
Griffith: Drink Soma, ye who strengthen Law.
Devanāgarī: पातं सोममृतावृधा
pada pāṭha: gr̥ṇānā | jamat-agninā | yonau | r̥tasya | sīdatam || pātam | somam | r̥ta-vr̥dhā ||3.62.18||
